Name: Cataratas do Iguaçu Produtos Orgânicos LTDA - Fazenda Santa Barbara
1_1_criteria: The producer demonstrates knowledge of applicable laws and remains up to date through external consultancy from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with applicable laws was verified in most of the farms audited, such as, for example, Receipt of the Rural Environmental Registry, Well Grant, among others.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through registrations duly registered and lease contracts in all audited areas.
1_3_criteria: The manager carried out a social, environmental and agricultural assessment of the groups members.
2_1_criteria: In none of the audited farms was there evidence of forced, imposed, forced, trafficked or involuntary labor, with no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on farms are not forced to work and when they did work, it was found that they were given an opportunity. There are no children under 15 working on the farms. All hired employees are over 18 years old. Children residing on audited farms attend school. Interviews and information collected demonstrate that there is no discrimination of any kind and all workers receive equal treatment.
2_2_criteria: All employees on the audited farms are registered, having an Individual Employment Contract and Employee Registration, describing the main information relevant. The audited farm demonstrated that it provides specific training in occupational health and safety to employees.
2_3_criteria: The audited farm has a PGR, where health and safety risks are identified, as well as mitigation and control measures. Owners of audited farms, as well as employees, demonstrate knowledge of occupational health and safety issues, such as carrying out the required medical examinations. In addition, the audited farms have a First Aid and Emergency Procedures document, with the aim of establishing actions to be taken in response to environmental or occupational health and safety emergencies, as well as the associated environmental impacts. There are emergency signs and first aid kits in all audited areas.
2_4_criteria: According to reports obtained through interviews and on-site viewing at the audited farm, employees have complete freedom to join union organizations.
2_5_criteria: Verified from interviews, information collected and documents verified on the audited farms that the salaries paid are higher than the national minimum, being paid monthly via deposit into employees accounts. Verified proof of payment demonstrates that only deductions provided for by law such as INSS and IPRF are made. The working hours on the audited farms are 44 hours per week, with overtime being compensated or paid in two periods of the year, as stated in the Collective Agreement (for the three farms that follow the Convention). For farms that do not follow the established Convention, overtime is paid alongside their monthly salaries. There were no cases of pregnant women on the farms, however, those responsible are aware of the applicable law. Verified that the residences and accommodation for employees on the audited farms are adequate and have satisfactory sanitary conditions.
3_1_criteria: The farms have e-mail and telephone numbers and an identification plate at their headquarters. In addition, a suggestion/complaint box is kept on each farm. The Complaint/Suggestion Procedure document and Complaint/Suggestion Form are implemented and describe the procedure for handling complaints and the form for recording them. There were no complaints or suggestions at the time of the audit.
3_2_criteria: Verified that there are no cases of disputes regarding the rights to use the properties lands, as well as there is no evidence of the existence of traditional users of the properties lands.
3_3_criteria: The farms have suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters. Employees can make complaints or grievances through the box and the community can communicate with the farm via telephone and email. Any complaints are recorded in the Complaint/Suggestion Form document. If complaints are received, they will be analyzed and subsequently dealt with, as provided for in the Complaint/Suggestion Procedure. At the time of the audit, there were no complaints or complaints received.
3_4_criteria: Verified that job opportunities are filled through referrals from current employees and other farms, or searches made directly on the audited farms. The farms acquire products from the region in which they are located.
4_1_criteria: All audited farms carry out social, environmental and agricultural assessment of them.
4_2_criteria: Verified that no fires are carried out on any of the audited farms.
4_3_criteria: All audited farms record the use of fossil fuels. They monitor the organic matter content by carrying out soil analyses.
4_4_criteria: All audited farms record the use of fossil fuels. They monitor the organic matter content by carrying out soil analyses. Furthermore, properties adopt practices that contribute to increasing soil carbon sequestration, such as: adopting direct planting systems, cultivating soil cover species, maintaining native vegetation and planting eucalyptus for use in the dryer.
4_5_criteria: They were developed by Gebana presenting satellite images of the property areas in 2008, 2016 and 2022. The 2008 images were generated with the Landsat 5 TM, Collection 1 Tier 2 TOA Reflectance satellite, 30 meter resolution . The 2016 and 2022 images were generated with the Sentinel-2 MSI satellite: MultiSpectral Instrument, Level-1C, 10 meter resolution. It was verified that there was no opening of vegetation areas after 2008 on the farms.
5_1_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as direct planting and maintenance of cover of the soil through the planting of brachiaria. On all audited farms, analyzes are carried out to monitor water quality, however, two of the analyzes presented results that disagree.
5_2_criteria: The farms have complete maps with the location of cultivated areas delimited by plot, vegetation areas and water courses. Verified that there is no removal of riparian areas of native vegetation on the four farms audited; and there are no natural wetlands or wetland areas.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality is preserved on all audited farms through the adoption of practices such as adoption of the organic farming system and use of fertilizers in accordance with technical recommendations. The agricultural areas have flat relief. Direct planting is adopted on the four properties, as well as maintaining soil cover through the planting of cover species. Planning is carried out to define planting areas, following crop rotation and succession techniques in all areas.
5_4_criteria: The four farms do not have a documented Integrated Crop Management plan. At group level, the manager developed the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a plan to reduce potentially harmful phytosanitary products over time. As verified on the four farms, only original and genuine agrochemicals are used that meet local registration requirements for soybean cultivation. It was verified that the audited property uses a low amount of pesticides due to the fact that it is organic using mainly biological control products and copper. Empty packaging is punctured and triple-washed on the farms and stored in an empty packaging warehouse. All audited farms have a pesticide deposit in their own location, separate from other structures and identified, where pesticides are stored in accordance with legislation.
5_5_criteria: It was verified that the audited property uses a low quantity of pesticides due to the fact that it is organic, using mainly biological control products and copper. Empty containers are punctured and triple-washed on the farms and stored in an empty container depot. All the farms audited have a pesticide deposit in their own premises, separate from the other structures and identified, where the pesticides are stored in accordance with the legislation.
5_6_criteria: The farms do not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm Conventions and Rotterdam.
5_7_criteria: Products for biological control are used in the audited properties, in accordance with legislation. The farm that does not use it demonstrated knowledge about its use.
5_8_criteria: It was verified that if an outbreak of new pests occurred, the audited farms would inform EMBRAPA and Agrodefesa.
5_9_criteria: The farms follow the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a reduction plan and measures to avoid drift in agrochemical applications. There is no application of pesticides near populated areas or watercourses.
5_10_criteria: Neighboring areas have the same type of production, cultivation and management used in the audited properties.
5_11_criteria: It was verified that the Seeds acquired by farms are from legally known sources, with respective seed compliance terms. None of the farms produce their own seeds.

Organization: Fundação de Apoio à Pesquisa do Corredor de Exportação Norte ?Irineu Alcides Bays
Name: Fundação de Apoio à Pesquisa do Corredor de Exportação Norte “Irineu Alcides Bays” - Fapcen Grupo 4
1_1_criteria: Producers demonstrated knowledge of applicable laws and remain up to date by relying on external consultancies and technical professionals. Fazenda CondomÃ­nio Mila has environmental consultancy, Occupational Safety Consultancy, Legal and Agronomic consultancy. At Condominio Mila and Boa EsperanÃ§a farm, fertilizers and foliar fertilizers are being stored together with chemical products, without proper separation. Fazenda Condomino Mlia, evidence of the storage of expired chemical products without proper separation and identification. Fazenda Boa EsperanÃ§a does not have a gas station license. Fazenda Boa EsperanÃ§a does not have a permit to capture groundwater for the two wells on the property. It was verified that the Boa EsperanÃ§a farm has a protective cage to inflate tires (own construction) in the mechanical workshop, but it does not meet the specifications according to NR 31.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through the contracts of leasing of farms, such as: Fazenda CondomÃ­nio Milla Agricultural Partnership Agreement for exploration purposes. Fazenda Boa EsperanÃ§a, Agricultural Partnership contract for exploration purposes.
1_3_criteria: The group manager carried out a socio-environmental assessment of the farm before it was included in the group, and from this the aspects to be improved were identified and defined deadlines for implementation. Based on the assessments, indicators were defined for monitoring at Fazendas CondomÃ­nio Milla and Fazenda Boa EsperanÃ§a, and these are monitored and evaluated in internal audits and performance over the years
2_1_criteria: Through interviews with permanent and temporary employees , it was demonstrated that there is no evidence of forced, imposed, forced, trafficked or involuntary labor on the farm. Verified through interviews carried out with workers on the CondomÃ­nio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a farms that there is no form of forced, compulsory or similar labor. All workers report receiving friendly treatment on the farms. as well as being free to leave after completing their working hours. A consultation was carried out on the dirty list of slave labor and it was verified that there is no presence of any of the farms that are part of the group. Through interviews, it was found that workers on the three audited farms keep their personal documents and other belongings with them. Employees work cards are collected for registration and then returned to employees. Minors under 18 or older people hired by the company, working in production and/or in dangerous conditions were not evidenced during the evaluation of HR documentation and interviews with employees. Minors under 18 are not hired for activities at the CondomÃ­nio Milla e Boa EsperanÃ§a property. It was evidenced through visits to the two audited properties, which all have good working conditions, as well as through interviews carried out, that workers do not suffer any type of punishment, oppression or mental or physical coercion.
2_2_criteria: All workers have employment contracts signed with the farms, as evidenced by the Employment Contract Experience of the following employees. In both cases, information such as working hours, payment schemes, etc. is covered. Details about payment schemes, employment conditions and working hours are contained in farm staff employment contracts. During integrations, this information is properly explained to workers. Furthermore, these conditions are discussed with the Union of rural salaried workers, from Baixa Grande do Ribeiro/PI and UruÃ§ui/PI, representatives of farm workers, during the negotiation of the Collective Agreement. As demonstrated during the audits, workers are guided on how to carry out their activities during their integration. This statement is confirmed by conducting interviews and checking training records. Currently, the farms have an Emergency Plan for Responding to Work Accidents, which is available at various points on the properties.
2_3_criteria: The workers demonstrated in interviews their knowledge and understanding of issues related to health and safety. The workers interviewed at the CondomÃ­nio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a farms receive health and safety training, according to the tasks they perform. In the case of workers who handle agricultural pesticides, training is provided in accordance with NR 31.7 on the two farms audited. For employees responsible for carrying out operations in the propertys grain storage structures, specific training is provided, as follows: Certificate, Periodic training course for entry supervisor for work in confined spaces (silos and warehouses). Furthermore, other examples were also verified, such as courses on operating loaders and agricultural machinery, for the three farms. Non-Compliance: Fazenda CondÃ´mino Mila - Employee in the role of warehouseman at the Mila condominium is responsible for the pesticide deposit, having contact with the products, in the PGRTR (rural worker risk management program) it does not include chemical risk, which this role is exposed to. At the CondomÃ­nio Mila farm and Boa EsperanÃ§a farm, the health of employees is not being adequately monitored and there were functions where exams to be carried out in accordance with the respective PCMSO were missing.
2_4_criteria: Through interviews with permanent and temporary employees, it was evidenced that there is complete freedom to join trade union organizations, with some interviewees confirming that they are union members, while others reveal that they do not participate. The CondomÃ­nio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a farms participate in the same collective bargaining agreement 2022/2022. Terminations of employment contracts are approved by the unions
2_5_criteria: Salaries are paid monthly, according to reports in interviews and records of employees pay slips at the CondomÃ­nio Milla and Fazenda Boa EsperanÃ§a farms. Proof of worker payments were also provided, including: CondomÃ­nio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a. The minimum wages paid on farms are above the national minimum wage. Verified proof of payment demonstrates that only deductions provided for by law are applied, such as INSS, union contributions, duly agreed between the parties. The working day is 44 hours per week, with occasional overtime, especially during harvest times. Workers on the three audited farms have access to drinking water through drinking fountains installed at the properties. Water is obtained through wells, and its potability is tested at different distribution points. Water analysis highlighted, there are drinking fountains located in different locations. Verified through interviews, that workers receive at least one day off for every six days worked. The farm complies with the law in the case of maternity leave. Checked records of a worker on maternity leave at the time of the audit. Housing for farm employees is adequate and has adequate sanitary conditions. The workers reported that overtime is voluntary and duly paid, as evidenced in the payment slips.
3_1_criteria: Sign verified on the propertys entrance road containing the telephone contacts of the farms, CondomÃ­nio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a. On the audited farms, internal communication channels were checked, such as suggestion and complaint boxes, in addition to the availability of external communication channels such as the FAPCEN website, which includes email and telephone. The CondomÃ­nio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a farms have a form for receiving complaints and complaints. Those responsible for the farms informed that complaints, when received, will be analyzed and dealt with. The CondomÃ­nio Milla farm has a website: www.condominiomilla. The farms provide signs at the entrance of the properties with telephone contact.
3_2_criteria: The audited properties CondomÃ­nio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a have been under the administration of the tenants for a long time. There are no cases of disputes regarding land use rights on the property, nor are there any adjacent indigenous peoples, nor are there permanent conservation areas. Verified that there are no areas of cultural or ecological importance close to the farms. Through Land Sat satellite maps on 19/10/2022, CondomÃ­nio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a.
3_3_criteria: There are signs distributed on the properties displaying telephone numbers so that complaints can be made directly. There are also suggestion/complaint boxes in various locations on the audited properties. The farms have document Procedure No. 2 Communication Management Plan, January 2022, item F - Resolution, pertinent complaints must be evaluated within a maximum period of 15 business days on the CondÃ´mino Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a farms. There is also a form to fill out, the Complaint Registration and Handling Form document, which deals with all issues pertinent to complaints and complaints.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised through social networks, published internally and indication on farms. As verified through reports from workers, the majority come from nearby communities. Checked on the CondomÃ­nio Milla farm, when possible, the property holds open field days for visitors of the entire local community. The CondomÃ­nio Milla farm assists, School Council of the Cerrado State Center for Professional Education (agricultural school), donation of food for the manufacture of feed, date September 1, 2022, according to the photographic record presented. The properties purchase products and services from companies in the region.
4_1_criteria: The farms underwent a Socio-Environmental Assessment Plan from the RTRS Certifications group before being included in the Fapcen group. A Socio-Environmental Diagnosis was carried out, which has qualified people for such an assessment. The diagnosis is comprehensive and transparent, considering the impacts related to the farms.
4_2_criteria: As reported by those responsible for the CondomÃ­nio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a farms, and through visits, no fires are carried out on the properties. On the CondomÃ­nio Milla farm, eucalyptus is used to supply the silos furnaces. Used batteries are delivered in exchange for new ones. Old tires are separated and disposed of. The collection of lubricating oils is carried out regularly. The houses have septic tanks. Organic waste is buried in a suitable location. The fuel tanks have a containment dam and a fueling lane with floor, channels and containment box. The two farms audited have an area for washing machines, cement floors, gutters and a separator box. Oil changes are carried out in a location with a floor, channels and containment box. Recycling is carried out whenever possible. Plastic waste is also collected.
4_3_criteria: Fuel use controls are carried out manually at each supply, at the end of each day they are entered into the system on the two audited farms. For each fueling operation, the date, vehicle, quantity and operator who carried out the fueling are recorded, as shown in the record. The properties have an annual soil sample collection and analysis program. Among the parameters evaluated is the organic matter content of the soil. Fazenda CondÃ´mino Milla presented a grid report (variable rate), where soil collections are made every semester and application is carried out at a variable rate according to the need for each nutrient. Fazenda Boa EsperanÃ§a - It is clear that soil analyzes are carried out and the organic matter content is being analyzed. Soil carbon is increased through practices such as: Direct planting, crop rotation of soybeans, corn, cotton, in the weakest areas millet is planted, green manure with brachiaria carried out concomitantly with corn planting.
4_4_criteria: No area expansion was made after June 2016. Between 2008 and 2013, the scope areas had openings in non-priority or protected areas. Demonstrated by LandSat 5TM satellite images, 10/12/2008 and current, Land Viewer.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms do not have vegetation areas, as they are only leased productive areas. The properties prohibit any hunting activity within them. Checked warning signs present in the areas. Extractive practices such as collecting native wood or other natural products are also prohibited.
5_1_criteria: Farms adopt good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as: adopting the direct seeding system; straw management for soil cover; use of correctors and fertilizers in accordance with technical recommendations; ground cover with brachiaria. Procedures were presented to identify social and environmental aspects and impacts, demonstrating monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption through analysis, which is within potability standards. According to reports from those responsible for the audited farms, through an on-site visit, irrigation systems are not used on the properties.
5_2_criteria: As demonstrated through contracts, the CondomÃ­nio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a farms are leased only the arable areas . The total areas that have APP, Legal Reserve are not part of the current contract.
5_3_criteria: Soil analyzes are carried out to monitor organic matter and fertility analysis, as described in indicator 4.3.3. It is verified that among the parameters evaluated there is the content of soil organic matter, aluminum, nitrogen, phosphorus. Those responsible for the audited farms demonstrate knowledge of techniques to preserve soil quality, such as crop rotation between soybeans, corn and cotton, implementing 80% direct planting in arable areas, covering soil with brachiaria. Use of agricultural pesticides in accordance with technical recommendations. Erosive processes are prevented through the construction of contour lines, adoption of the direct planting system and maintenance of soil cover. The properties cultivation regime uses soybeans only in the main harvest (first crop), followed by corn or cotton. The period of sanitary emptiness in the state of PiauÃ­ is respected, from July 1st to September 30th. In other words, soybeans are not grown on soybeans on the property in the same agricultural year.
5_4_criteria: The farms do not have documented MIC Â– Integrated Crop Management, guidelines on the use and advantages of biological control. However, crop monitoring and the use of biological products are frequently carried out on the property. Although the indicator is not being met, compliance with this indicator will only be required from the first year of certification monitoring onwards. During the audits, it was demonstrated through invoices that the products used on the CondomÃ­nio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a farms are purchased with the appropriate invoices and agronomic prescriptions registered for soybean cultivation. The properties keep records of these monitorings through the systems. Agricultural pesticide applications follow the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. The person responsible for each farm checked the application records and service orders.
5_5_criteria: The farm planning sector purchases the products. Service orders are opened for the application of agricultural pesticides by technical teams in accordance with field monitoring and a record of the products applied is carried out, containing all the information requested in the indicator on all audited farms. Empty packaging is washed at the time of application and then stored in the warehouse, presenting proof of return of empty pesticide packaging to INPEV - National Institute for the Processing of Empty Packaging. Agricultural pesticides are delivered to the farm by the multinationals that sell them, and the syrup is prepared using specific equipment for this purpose. Next to the pesticide deposit there is an emergency shower. Used PPE is decontaminated in a laundry dedicated to this purpose. Properties mark newly sprayed areas with signs. Evidenced by visiting the properties, signs installed on crops indicating the area treated with pesticides. The place for storing pesticides is covered, locked, closed, marked, has aeration and the packaging is placed on wooden pallets.
5_6_criteria: The farms do not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The audited farms reported that applications are not carried out near bodies of water, areas of permanent preservation. Whenever possible, use selective products. Demonstrated by the spreadsheet Products Used Soya harvest 22/23, from the Condominio Milla and Boa EsperanÃ§a farms.
5_7_criteria: Verified on the audited farms that the use of biological control agents follows the same guidelines as agricultural pesticides following the Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr Eng. Responsible for the farm and recorded in the adopted systems (Work Order or software notes).
5_8_criteria: According to reports from those responsible for the farms, there were no pest outbreaks on the audited farms. However, if this occurs, those responsible reported that they would contact ADAP - Agricultural Defense Agency of PiauÃ­, INEMA - Institute of the Environment and Resources.
5_9_criteria: The audited farms have a documented procedure called "Application Plan" revised in January 2022, where there are instructions on application regulation, types of drops, environmental care, drift control and weather conditions. According to aerial maps presented during the audits, the plots where aerial applications would be carried out are located at distances greater than 500m from houses and bodies of water on the three audited farms. Furthermore, when aerial applications occur, employees are notified via bulletin boards and also through farm managers. At the Boa EsperanÃ§a farm, they reported that up until the time of the audit there had been no aerial applications. Verified through maps that applications occur at least 120m away from houses on the farm CondomÃ­nio Milla is 100 meters from populated areas, Fazenda Boa EsperanÃ§a is 90 meters away.
5_10_criteria: The production system adopted by the farms is similar to neighbor systems. There are no adjacent areas with sensitive crops, such as organic or conventional agriculture. There are no cases of damage caused by drift to neighboring areas originating on the farm.
5_11_criteria: Verified that all seeds used on the farms are acquired from qualified suppliers. Seed purchase invoice presented.

Name: Fazenda Santa Cruz
1_1_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation and interviews with managers, that the farm has a control system based on a table which contains the Â“applicable legislation and applicable laws Santa Cruz FarmÂ”, containing Norms, Decrees , Laws and other legislation pertinent to the operation of the farm and maintains a service provision contract with third-party companies, responsible for maintaining licenses and other mandatory regulatory documents in accordance with applicable legislation. The farm has implemented an anti-corruption policy and it is disseminated among all employees in key sectors.
1_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation of CAR documents, Grants and registration certificates. According to documentary evaluation, the evaluated unit complies with applicable legislation.
1_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the report with indicators extracted for evaluation and monitoring, from Health and Safety, Agricultural and Environment, including monitoring requirements for 2023, and containing the actions defined for the new selected indicators.
2_1_criteria: According to visual assessment of signs fixed on the property and through interviews with employees, it was declared that no form of forced or compulsory labor is used , slave, trafficked or involuntary at any stage of production. It was stated that no worker is required to leave their identity documents with other people and no part of their salary, benefits or belongings is withheld by owners or third parties. According to an interview with farm employees, spouses and children of workers are not obliged to work on the property, there are no families, nor children living on the farm, just 1 caretaker. Through interviews with employees, it was clear that there are no children or minors (under 18 years of age) performing dangerous work or any work that could put their moral, physical or mental well-being at risk. In the Integration Manual, item 3. Code of Conduct provides guidance to employees on this item. Evidenced through documentary evaluation of the Integration Manual (Code of Conduct), in the Santa Cruz Farm Code of Ethics and Conduct procedure and in interviews with employees that discrimination of any nature is not tolerated and that it does not occur on the farm. It was possible to demonstrate through documentary evaluation that all farm salaries follow those established in the CLT, with no distinction between functions. Through interviews with employees, it was possible to demonstrate that they are not subject to corporal punishment, oppression, mental or physical coercion, physical or verbal abuse, sexual harassment or any other type of intimidation. All employees have a confidential communication channel so that if necessary, they can report any type of abuse, they can do so with complete freedom and support.
2_2_criteria: According to documentary evaluation, it was verified that all sampled employees have contracts signed, on the dates of contracting. Through document evaluation, it was found that labor laws are detailed to employees through the code of conduct and the Integration Manual, at the time of hiring together with the employment contract, as evidenced by the duly signed document. Regarding training, it is offered to employees according to the role they perform. All contractors undergo Integration training.
2_3_criteria: By demonstrating the delivery of PPE and health and safety training to employees in an interview with the employee, it was possible to demonstrate that they have knowledge and understanding of health and safety issues. Signs with instructions for the use of Mandatory PPE are displayed in easily visible locations in risk areas. The PGRTR Â– Rural Work Risk Management Program was highlighted, including the survey of relevant health and safety risks and providing treatment methods to mitigate such risks. According to the evaluation of the documentation, it was possible to verify that tasks with potential risk are carried out by people with proven training, as evidenced by training records. It is evident that all employees receive PPE for protection and are guided regarding their use, through the PPE delivery form, signs encouraging the use of PPE and training records. It is clear that the company has procedures in case of possible accidents at work and the instructions are clear and understood by all employees. This information could be confirmed through interviews with employees. The company also has rescue and first aid kits available for employees.
2_4_criteria: According to interviews with managers and employees, free access to membership is given, however the local union does not have a strong presence in the properties and they are not approved to make a union agreement. There are signs in the employee common area reinforcing the right and freedom of free union association.
2_5_criteria: According to the documentary evaluation of the pay slips, all salary records are above the national minimum for all employees in accordance with the role performed and working time, according to payment slips, everyone is paid until the last day of the month and all employees are entitled to 1 day off after receiving payment. Checking salary payment slips and through interviews with employees, it was evident that only legal deductions or those authorized by employees are made. All legal and optional salary deductions are explained to employees. Everyone has access to paychecks in physical form. Payslips were all signed. It is clear that all employees have access to drinking water on the farm, a suitable place for meals and good infrastructure. Employees do not use the propertys accommodation.
3_1_criteria: According to visual assessment, it was evident that the farms provide an information board at their entrance containing identification, telephone number, websites and contact emails. Fazenda Santa Cruz has a system for receiving and recording various complaints/communications received, analyzing the cause and recording the return of the treatment to the complainant, and such communication channels adequately allow communication between the farm and the community.
3_2_criteria: Not applicable, as there are no indigenous communities around the property or in the region.
3_3_criteria: According to visual assessment, it is clear that the farms provide at their entrance an information sign containing identification, telephone , websites and contact emails. The farm records and maintains files on complaints received and they are duly dealt with. Both internal and external communication/complaint demands have a processing flow until they are completed.
3_4_criteria: It was evidenced through documentary evaluation that job vacancies are advertised internally on the propertys bulletin board and also on local employment agencies ACIAP and CDL for advertising and forwarding job candidates. Evidenced through documentary evaluation that Fazenda Santa Cruz provides the local community with the possibility of training, as well as giving preference to regional companies to provide services.
4_1_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the company carries out an evaluation social and environmental, and the assessment is carried out by qualified and trained people. The assessment is carried out comprehensively, including all sectors of the farm and business partners. Measures to mitigate or minimize the impacts identified by the assessment are taken appropriately. The company has archived the social and environmental assessment report and it was presented, which contains information about the actions and initiatives taken by Fazenda Santa Cruz in relation to socio-environmental issues.
4_2_criteria: According to visual assessment of the areas of production of the property, no areas with traces of fire were identified. It was evident through visual assessment that there are signs indicating the prohibition of the use of fire. Fazenda Santa Cruz has suitable places for storing fuel and also has waste deposits suitable for storing different types of materials, such as batteries, used tires, burnt oil and other materials. Several points were identified on the farm with material collectors separated by type (paper, plastic, metal, organic), which are subsequently sent to selective collection units for recycling. The company has a documented waste management plan.
4_3_criteria: It is evident that Fazenda Santa Cruz is in the phase of implementing records and monitoring the use of fossil fuels, with monitoring starting in October 2021 (first harvest soy). The company carries out soil analysis, including monitoring of OM in the soil. Greenhouse gas emissions inventory highlighted, as well as reduction planning for the coming years.
4_4_criteria: According to documentary evaluation, Fazenda Santa Cruz is in compliance with soybean expansion requirements.
4_5_criteria: According to visual and documentary evaluation, maps of the properties were presented, counting the legal reserve areas, Permanent Protection Areas and production areas of the property, and indication of water courses. According to visual assessment, it was observed that the farm has several points with signs prohibiting hunting and fishing within the property. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that the production units have the appropriate registrations in the CAR and comply with more than the provisions of the RTRS protocol, having more than 10% of native vegetation. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, document evaluation report on the Santa Cruz Farm Environmental Conservation Program, issued by a specialized company, containing: Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Introduction Objectives Identification of the enterprise Technical responsible Activities developed. Characterization of the region. Climate and relief. Geology and pedology. Hydrographic basin. Fauna Mastofauna Avifauna Herpetofauna. Legal forest reserve. Permanent preservation areas. How to restore Methods for recovering vegetation in permanent preservation areas. Methods for recovering vegetation in legal reserve areas Planting hedges Fires and burning Soil Management Methods for containing erosion Know about erosion Find out more about it Understand what makes erosion worse Know the risk of erosion of your land Checking for erosion on your land Check the site frequently Look for signs of erosion Go out when its raining and other topics.
5_1_criteria: Evidenced through visual assessment that the property adopts practices to maintain water in the soil, such as preventing erosion with conservation practices, use of terraces, contour lines, water containment boxes, direct planting, crop rotation, and also has management reports that have specific sections in relation to erosion control, as evidenced through document evaluation, documentary evaluation report the Environmental Conservation Program, issued by a specialized company, containing: Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Soil Management Methods to contain erosion Get to know erosion Find out more about she Understand what makes erosion worse Know the risk of erosion on your land Checking your land for erosion Check the site frequently Look for signs of erosion Go out when its raining and other topics. The farm has mapping of all water consuming sources on the farm, both for soybeans and coffee activities.
5_2_criteria: At Fazenda Santa Cruz, there is no use of irrigation. All watercourses were identified and mapped.
5_3_criteria: Solid analysis carried out in 2021, issued by the specialized laboratory, and all production areas were sampled, with macro and micronutrient levels being analyzed. Evidenced through visual assessment that the property adopts practices to maintain water in the soil, such as erosion prevention with conservation practices, use of terraces, contour lines, water containment boxes, direct planting, crop rotation, and also counts with management reports that have specific sections in relation to erosion control.
5_4_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the document Rational Management of Soy Pests and Diseases 2021/2022, prepared by the agronomist, created in October of 2021, which includes: Introduction, Understanding the importance of IPM, Soybean Pests, Soybean Diseases, Integrated Pest Management, Pest Level, Monitoring, Cloth Beating, Use of traps, control methods: Cultural control, Control Behavioral, Biological Control, Varietal Control, Chemical Control, and the conclusion.
5_5_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation that all applications are carried out in accordance with the recommendation made by the propertys agronomist. According to visual observation, it was possible to visually demonstrate that the farm carries out triple washing and also renders the packaging unusable, which in turn is sent to a warehouse for storing empty packaging with restricted access and several information signs regarding non-reuse of packaging. same. Proof of return of empty packaging is evidenced through documentary evaluation. According to visual assessment, it was identified that the transport of agrochemical products occurs in properly appropriate vehicles. Storage is carried out in a suitable warehouse, duly identified.
5_6_criteria: It was evidenced through a documentary evaluation of the list of soybean pesticides, that there is no evidence of products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions, as well as no evidence of their presence in the propertys warehouses. Evidenced through documentary evaluation of the list of soybean crop pesticides, that there is no evidence of Paraquat and Carbofuran, as well as no evidence of their presence in the propertys warehouses.
5_7_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation Standard Operating Procedure Â– Reduction in the Use of Phytosanitary Products, and the measures that will be adopted by the farm are: Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• 1 Â– Soil cover; 2 Â– Crop rotation; 3 Â– Periodic Maintenance of Sprayers; 4 Â– Dosage of phytosanitary products and technical recommendations for the use of agrochemicals by a qualified professional. 5 Â– MIP and use of biological products; 6 Â– Monitoring of water quality from spraying; 7 Â– Use of seeds with controlled origin.
5_8_criteria: There is no evidence of pest outbreaks in the farm regions, however the farm relies on the work of IMA which whenever there are outbreaks in the region, they pass it on to the producers how to proceed.
5_9_criteria: The Standard Operating Procedure - Care with Agrochemicals: Chapter 6 - Drift Â• Choose the coolest hours of the day to spray Do not apply the product in the presence of strong winds , avoid drifting Do not apply against the direction of the wind; Do not spray trees while standing beneath them; Avoid contamination of neighboring crops, pastures, homes, etc.; Do not apply pesticides in places where there are unprotected people or animals; Do not apply pesticides near water sources; There is no aerial spraying on the property.
5_10_criteria: Although it is evidenced through documentary evaluation that meteorological conditions are monitored in all applications, as evidenced through the Application Orders. In addition, they strictly follow the provisions of the Standard Operating Procedure - Care with Agrochemicals: Chapter 6 - Drift Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Â• Choose the coolest hours of the day to carry out spraying Do not apply the product in the presence of strong winds, avoid drifting Do not apply against the direction of the wind; Do not spray trees while standing beneath them; Avoid contamination of neighboring crops, pastures, homes, etc.; Do not apply pesticides in places where there are unprotected people or animals; Do not apply pesticides near water sources; There is no aerial spraying on the property.
5_11_criteria: According to evidence presented, all seeds purchased come from legally known sources, registered with Renasem.

Name: Serra da Pintura
1_1_criteria: The farm remains up to date with applicable laws through contact between sectors and legal bodies, as well as through consultancies.
1_2_criteria: The property only has its own areas with registrations showing the right of land use.
1_3_criteria: First year of certification, progress will be assessed in the next cycle.
2_1_criteria: Employees are free to leave the farm and have adequate working and housing conditions. At the farm office, only copies of employee documents are retained, obtained shortly after hiring and attached to the files. There are no children under 18 working on the property. During the interviews, employees reported not experiencing corporal punishment, any coercive methods or types of abuse and intimidation.
2_2_criteria: Employees have signed employment contracts attached to their files. Labor rights, as well as appropriate forms of conduct, are communicated to employees through integration training immediately after hiring. The farm provides vocational training to employees. Topics relating to the execution of functions, procedures and work instructions are covered.
2_3_criteria: Those responsible for the farm demonstrated knowledge and understanding of occupational health and safety issues. The farms PGR/PGSSMATR and PCMSO are updated annually. For potentially dangerous tasks, employees undergo health monitoring examinations, as well as occupational safety training. Upon receiving the PPE, employees sign a delivery form, which describes the PPE received, as well as a liability and obligation statement. The use of PPE is checked by the occupational safety technician. Emergency procedures are transmitted to employees through training. The farm has first aid kits on the farm facilities, as well as a vehicle available for transport.
2_4_criteria: No local union maintains contact with the employees, but they are free to contribute or not. Although it has been verified that employees are not prevented from carrying out collective bargaining in conjunction with local unions, there are no collective agreements or conventions in force at the moment.
2_5_criteria: Although there is no collective agreement or convention, the lowest salary -base paid at the unit is higher than the national minimum wage of R$1,302.00. Copies of payment receipts are retained by the unit. As verified in the payment statements, no deductions are made that are not provided for by law, such as INSS and IRRF. 44 normal working hours and 12 overtime hours per week are not exceeded. The hours worked are recorded automatically according to the time worked by employees. The harvest period normally occurs between September and April.
3_1_criteria: The local community can contact the farm via telephone and email, available on the propertys entrance sign.
3_2_criteria: The farm manager/group manager has maps identifying the regions where there are institutional areas, consisting of Conservation Units for Sustainable Use and Integral Protection and Indigenous Lands. There are no indigenous areas close to the property.
3_3_criteria: Workers can make complaints and complaints through WhatsApp, the complaints box or directly at the farm office. Such complaints may be made anonymously or not. Employees have knowledge of the mechanisms, as verified during the interviews.
3_4_criteria: Indicator not applicable for the initial certification audit.
4_1_criteria: The property included in the certification undergoes a social and environmental assessment before of its inclusion. The topics of the RTRS Production Standard are fully covered during the assessment, as well as all activities carried out on the farm.
4_2_criteria: It was verified through maps with the history of the heat source in the areas of the farm, which No fires are carried out in the unit. The farm separates hazardous waste and stores it in a suitable location. Hazardous waste is sent to specialized companies. Both hazardous and non-hazardous waste are stored and disposed of, as described in the Solid Waste Management Plan Â– PGRS.
4_3_criteria: Maintenance of organic matter and reduction of the use of fossil fuels.
4_4_criteria: Comparison of maps between the years 2008 and 2023 was carried out, using the Landsat 4-5 TM L2 and Sentinel-2 L2A satellites, respectively. No cleaning or conversion areas were found.
4_5_criteria: The farm has a map of the property containing consolidated open areas, native vegetation, permanent preservation areas and watercourses. Hunting and fishing are prohibited on the farm. There are signs warning about this prohibition in areas of the property.
5_1_criteria: The units monitor the quality and quantity of water resources, such as the underground collection well. Good agricultural practices are adopted in various situations, such as direct planting, soil cover, prevention of erosion and application of fertilizers according to the dosage recommended by experts.
5_2_criteria: Verified during visits and on maps that forests are present in the rivers. No points for removing natural vegetation were identified in riparian areas. There are no wetlands that have been drained on the properties.
5_3_criteria: Soil analyzes are carried out with precision agriculture. The results and monitoring are carried out by agronomists. Several practices are applied to preserve the soil, such as direct planting, crop rotation, fertilizer dosage based on soil analysis, road maintenance and soil cover. There is no land with a steep slope on the farm. Erosion is controlled through contour lines, cover plants and maintenance of property roads. The period of sanitary emptiness in the region occurs between 06/27/22 and 09/24/22, where there is no soybean cultivation.
5_4_criteria: Indicator not applicable for the initial certification audit.
5_5_criteria: Records on the use of agrochemicals are made using agronomic prescriptions and kept at the farm office. Agrochemical suppliers transport them to the units. Empty agrochemical packaging is triple-washed after use, punctured and stored in a dedicated warehouse. After storage, they are taken to authorized collection points.
5_6_criteria: The farm does not use products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. Land application spreadsheets are highlighted, showing all the agrochemicals used by the farm.
5_7_criteria: Indicator not applicable for the initial certification audit.
5_8_criteria: Indicator not applicable for the initial certification audit.
5_9_criteria: Records of meteorological conditions and application times are made. Drift is controlled by the farm based on each product applied and the current weather conditions. No aerial application is carried out on the property. Pesticides are not applied within a 30m radius of populated areas or bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: Farm integrates agriculture and livestock.
5_11_criteria: Indicator not applicable for the initial certification audit.

Name: Tecnosol Consultoria Rural LTDA
1_1_criteria: Producers demonstrate knowledge of applicable laws and remain up to date through external consultancy from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with applicable laws was verified in most of the farms audited, such as Receipt of the Rural Environmental Registry, Well Grant, among others. One of the farms presented non-compliance in the water potability item.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through duly registered registrations and lease contracts on all audited farms.
1_3_criteria: The manager carried out a social, environmental and agricultural assessment of the groups members. Non-conformity was identified and later resolved regarding the reduction in the use of pesticides.
2_1_criteria: In none of the audited farms was there evidence of forced, imposed, obligated, trafficked or involuntary labor, and there was also no retention of documents, wages or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on farms are not forced to work and when they did work, it was found that they were given an opportunity. There are no children under 15 working on the farms. All hired employees are over 18 years old. Children residing on audited farms attend school. Interviews and information collected demonstrate that there is no discrimination of any kind and all workers receive equal treatment.
2_2_criteria: All employees on the audited farms are registered, having an Individual Employment Contract and Employee Registration, describing the main information relevant. The farms audited demonstrated that they provide specific training in occupational health and safety to employees. A non-conformity was raised regarding the maintenance of contractual documents on the property.
2_3_criteria: All audited farms have a PGR, where health and safety risks are identified, as well as mitigation and control measures. Owners of audited farms, as well as employees, demonstrate knowledge of occupational health and safety issues, such as carrying out the required medical examinations. In addition, the audited farms have a First Aid and Emergency Procedures document, with the aim of establishing actions to be taken in response to environmental or occupational health and safety emergencies, as well as the associated environmental impacts. There are emergency signs and first aid kits on all audited farms. Non-conformity regarding item 2.3.1 was evidenced at the waterfall farm.
2_4_criteria: According to reports obtained through interviews and on-site viewing at the four audited farms, employees have complete freedom to join union organizations.
2_5_criteria: Verified from interviews, information collected and documents verified on the audited farms that the salaries paid are higher than the national minimum, being paid monthly via deposit into employees accounts. Verified proof of payment demonstrates that only deductions provided for by law such as INSS and IPRF are made. The working hours on the audited farms are 44 hours per week, with overtime being compensated or paid in two periods of the year, as stated in the Collective Agreement (for the three farms that follow the Convention). For farms that do not follow the established Convention, overtime is paid alongside their monthly salaries. Two farms audited record the hours worked and overtime and the other two do not register the employer. Despite not complying with indicator 2.5.5, compliance with it will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards. There were no cases of pregnant women on the farms, however, those responsible are aware of the applicable law. Verified that the residences and accommodation for employees on the audited farms are adequate and have satisfactory sanitary conditions. Raise non-compliance in items 2.5.1 and 2.5.2 at the Cascade Farm.
3_1_criteria: The farms have e-mail and telephone numbers and an identification plate at their headquarters. In addition, a suggestion/complaint box is kept on each farm. The Complaint/Suggestion Procedure document and Complaint/Suggestion Form are implemented and describe the procedure for handling complaints and the form for recording them. There were no complaints or suggestions at the time of the audit. Verified that there are no cases of disputes regarding the rights of use of the properties lands, as well as there is no evidence of the existence of traditional users of the properties lands.
3_2_criteria: Verified that there are no cases of disputes regarding the rights of use of the properties lands, as well as there is no evidence of the existence of traditional users of the properties lands.
3_3_criteria: The farms have suggestion/complaint boxes at the headquarters. Employees can make complaints or grievances through the box and the community can communicate with the farm via telephone and email. Any complaints are recorded in the Complaint/Suggestion Form document. If complaints are received, they will be analyzed and subsequently dealt with, as provided for in the Complaint/Suggestion Procedure. At the time of the audit, there were no complaints or complaints received.
3_4_criteria: Verified that job opportunities are filled through referrals from current employees and other farms, or searches made directly on the audited farms. The farms acquire products from the region in which they are located.
4_1_criteria: All audited farms carry out social, environmental and agricultural assessment of them.
4_2_criteria: Verified that no fires are carried out on any of the audited farms. Most of the waste is properly disposed of by the farms, however the Cachoeira farm had non-compliance in indicator 4.2.2 due to not correctly disposing of its waste and the old mill regarding the location of supplying sprayers.
4_3_criteria: All audited farms record the use of fossil fuels. They monitor the organic matter content by carrying out soil analyses. Furthermore, properties adopt practices that contribute to increasing soil carbon sequestration, such as: adopting direct planting systems, cultivating soil cover species, maintaining native vegetation and planting eucalyptus for use in the dryer. For the Cachoeira farm, no fossil fuel reduction plan was verified.
4_4_criteria: Land Use and Comparative Maps were developed presenting satellite images of the property areas in 2008, 2016 and 2022. The 2008 images were generated with the Landsat 5 TM, Collection 1 Tier 2 TOA Reflectance satellite, 30 meter resolution. The 2016 and 2022 images were generated with the Sentinel-2 MSI satellite: MultiSpectral Instrument, Level-1C, 10 meter resolution. It was verified that there was no opening of vegetation areas after 2008 on the farms.
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation has been maintained on all farms. Hunting and collecting protected species is prohibited on all audited farms. The manager developed the document Plan to Ensure the Preservation of Native Vegetation and Wildlife.
5_1_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as direct planting and maintaining soil cover through planting brachiaria. Water analysis older than 12 months on the Santa Rita farm, non-compliance raised in item 5.1.2
5_2_criteria: The farms have complete maps with the location of cultivated areas delimited by plot, vegetation areas and water courses\ x92water. A non-conformity was found regarding item 5.2.1 at the SÃ£o Miguel farm. Verified that there is no removal of riparian areas of native vegetation on the four farms audited; and there are no natural wetlands or wetland areas.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality is preserved on all audited farms through the adoption of practices such as the adoption of the direct planting system and the use of fertilizers in accordance with technical recommendations. The agricultural areas have flat relief. Direct planting is adopted on the four properties, as well as maintaining soil cover through the planting of cover species. Planning is carried out to define planting areas, following crop rotation and succession techniques on all farms.
5_4_criteria: The four farms do not have a documented Integrated Crop Management plan. At group level, the manager developed the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a plan to reduce potentially harmful phytosanitary products over time. As verified on the four farms, only original and genuine agrochemicals are used that meet local registration requirements for soybean cultivation. The Santa Rita and Engenho Velho farms had non-compliance regarding item 5.4.2;
5_5_criteria: It was verified that the four audited properties do not have records of dosers and applicators, equipment used and weather conditions during application. Although these items are not being complied with, compliance with them will be charged from the next year of certification onwards, and records of meteorological conditions will be charged from the third year of certification. Empty packaging is punctured and triple-washed on the farms and stored in an empty packaging warehouse. All audited farms have a pesticide deposit in their own location, separate from other structures and identified, where pesticides are stored in accordance with legislation
5_6_criteria: The farms do not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions .
5_7_criteria: Products for biological control are used in the audited properties, in accordance with legislation. The farm that does not use it demonstrated knowledge about its use.
5_8_criteria: It was verified that if an outbreak of new pests occurred, the audited farms would inform EMBRAPA and Agrodefesa.
5_9_criteria: The farms follow the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a reduction plan and measures to avoid drift in agrochemical applications. Pesticides are not applied near populated areas or watercourses. Non-compliance raised for the Engenho Velho farm in item 5.9.2
5_10_criteria: The neighboring areas have the same type of production, cultivation and management used in the audited properties.
5_11_criteria: Verified that the seeds acquired by farms are from legally known sources, with the respective terms of seed compliance. None of the farms produce their own seeds. Non-compliance was identified for item 5.11.1 for the waterfall farm.

Name: Agropecuaria Andrade
1_1_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation and interviews with managers, that the farm has a contract with service providers in compliance with legislation, both on the environmental side, to remain in good standing with the bodies: Secretariat of State of the Environment, Water Resources, Infrastructure, Cities, and Metropolitan Affairs Â– SECIMA and Brazilian Institute of the Environment and Renewable Natural Resources Â– IBAMA, a specific consultancy for the fiscal part and finally, a specific consultancy for legislation ( labor and health and safety).
1_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation of lease contracts, Provisional Rural Operating Authorization, CAR, Grants and registration certificates. According to documentary evaluation, the evaluated unit complies with applicable legislation.
1_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the report with indicators extracted for evaluation and monitoring, from Health and Safety, Agricultural and Environment.
2_1_criteria: According to an interview with employees and documentary analysis of the properties Code of Ethics and Conduct Integration and Procedure Manual, it was possible to demonstrate that the farm disseminates and informs its employees that any form of forced, compulsory, slave or trafficked labor is prohibited. or involuntary at any stage of production. According to interviews with employees and the person in charge and through documentary analysis of payslips and delivery of documents, it was possible to demonstrate that no worker is obliged to leave their identity documents with other people and no part of their salary, benefits or belongings is withheld by owners or third parties. According to an interview with employees, they informed that spouses and children are free to choose to work or not on the properties. According to observation in several locations on the property and near their homes and in interviews with employees, no children under 18 years of age were declared or observed performing work. In the list of employees provided by the farms, which included the name, position, age and date of admission of employees, there was no evidence of anyone under 18 years of age. According to observation in several locations on the property and near their homes and in interviews with employees, no children under 15 years of age were declared or observed performing work. In the list of employees provided by the farms, which included the name, position, age and date of admission of employees, there was no evidence of anyone under 15 years of age. Evidenced through the Integration Manual and Code of Ethics and Conduct Procedure of AGROPECUÃRIA ANDRADE and through interviews with employees that discrimination of any nature does not occur on the farm, in addition to being not tolerated. As evidenced through document evaluation, workers receive equal pay, equal access to training, benefits and equal opportunities for promotion. In an interview with employees and document evaluation, it was stated that he had never experienced corporal punishment, oppression, mental or physical coercion, physical or verbal abuse, sexual harassment or any other type of intimidation within the work environment.
2_2_criteria: On all sampled farms, employment contracts dated upon admission and duly signed by all sampled employees were evident. Evidenced through document evaluation, interviews with employees and managers and visual observations that the organization complies with labor laws. It is evidenced through documentary evaluation that the organization provides workers with training, courses and DDS on topics related to worker health and safety, machine operation, handling of pesticides and others. Regarding the training of the sampled employees, the courses were highlighted.
2_3_criteria: According to the interview carried out with the employees, everyone demonstrated that they were aware of health and safety standards, used PPE and the delivery list for them was highlighted in accordance with the EPIS listed in the service order. In an interview with employees and through documentary analysis of the list of employees of both properties, using the date of birth it was possible to identify that there are no employees over 60 and under 18 years old. Plaque with emergency telephone numbers with main telephone numbers to be called in case of emergency, telephone number of the security technician, and those responsible for the sectors with emergency guidelines are included on the plaque. Evidence of training records for employees to act in cases of first aid, and also in other topics such as organization of the workplace, any activity carried out inside the pesticide deposit requires the use of PPE, as well as guided by safety signs, prohibiting reuse of packaging, correct use of PPE according to the activity carried out, maintenance of the workplace and other topics. According to interviews with employees, in cases of accidents, the guidance is immediate communication via extension or radio to the nearest coordinators, who will be responsible for calling the next assistance and guidance.
2_4_criteria: According to interviews with managers and employees it was possible to demonstrate that free access is given to join unions and participate in collective negotiations. It was possible to demonstrate this through the groups collective agreement minutes. According to interviews with managers and employees, employees are given free access to interact with external parties outside of working hours
2_5_criteria: It was evidenced through documentary evaluations of employees pay slips that salary payments are made in accordance with the national legislation, including health or hazardous hazard premiums where relevant, showing that only legal deductions or those authorized by employees are made. All legal and optional salary deductions are explained to employees during Integration (theme is highlighted in the training material). According to an interview with employees and those responsible for Human Resources, the property allows employees to work overtime during the harvest season (harvesting and planting), but they occur within the limits permitted by law. Communication to employees is carried out by coordinators in advance to plan. Evidenced through document analysis (slips) and interviews that employees are entitled to at least one day off for every six consecutive days of work. Employees are registered under a monthly CLT regime. The farm provides employees with: Accommodation with bunk beds, closet, fan, bathroom with shower, respecting the capacities established in the standard. The employees who live on the farm are provided with masonry houses, with running water, electricity and internet provided by the property at no cost. For families of employees who live on the property and have school-age children, the city hall bus comes to the property every day to take the children to the nearest district school. Three meals a day are available (breakfast, lunch and dinner). Evidenced in various parts of the farm, drinking fountains with drinking, chilled and natural water, disposable cups on the support next to them, available to employees. Evidenced through photographic assessment, sign displayed at the entrance of the property, containing the communication channels
3_1_criteria: According to visual assessment, evidenced that the farms provide at their entrance, an information sign containing identification, telephone, websites and e-mails for contact. The AGROPECUÃRIA ANDRADE group has a system for receiving and recording complaints/various communications received, analyzing the cause and recording feedback on the treatment for the complainant, and such communication channels adequately allow communication between the farm and the community.
3_2_criteria: Not applicable, as there are no indigenous communities around the property or in the region.
3_3_criteria: According to visual assessment, it is clear that the farms provide at their entrance an information sign containing identification, telephone , websites and contact emails. The farm has a system for receiving complaints received and providing appropriate treatment. Both internal and external communication/complaint demands have a process flow until they are completed.
3_4_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that job vacancies are advertised locally. Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the farms provide the local community with the possibility of training, as well as giving preference to regional companies to provide services.
4_1_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the company carries out a social and environmental assessment based on the RTRS Checklist itself, and the assessment is carried out by qualified and trained people. The assessment is carried out comprehensively, including all sectors of the farm and business partners. The aspects that lead to improvements/improvements were identified according to the evaluation carried out and a plan was drawn up to make this improvement possible.
4_2_criteria: According to the visual assessment of the propertys production areas, no areas with remnants were identified. of fires. It was evident through visual assessment that there are signs indicating the prohibition of the use of fire. The farms have suitable places for fuel storage, have waste deposits suitable for storing different types of materials, such as batteries, used tires, burnt oil and other materials. Several points were identified on the farm with material collectors separated by type (paper, plastic, metal, organic), which are subsequently sent to selective collection units for recycling. The company has a documented waste management plan.
4_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, record of fossil fuel use on farms participating in the RTRS group. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that the farm carries out soil analysis. In all AgropecuÃ¡ria Andrade, RTRS and Non-RTRS properties, there are RL areas in excess of what is necessary according to Brazilian legislation, either by their own area or by Reserve compensation system.
4_4_criteria: According to documentary evaluation, the Alvorada, Savana, Etaner and Santo Antonio farms are in compliance with soy expansion requirements.
4_5_criteria: According to visual and documentary evaluation, maps of the properties were presented, counting the legal reserve areas, Areas of Permanent Protection and production areas of the property, and the indication of watercourses. According to visual assessment, it was observed that the farm has several points with signs prohibiting hunting and fishing within the property, in addition, information regarding this prohibition is also included in the Integration Training, although they have not yet implemented the maintenance plan native vegetation and wild species. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that the production units have the appropriate registrations in the CAR and meet more than the provisions of the RTRS protocol, having more than 10% of native vegetation.
5_1_criteria: According to interview with the Engineer agronomist, conservation techniques are used such as cover planting with crotalaria, brachiaria, millet, rotated with soybeans, corn and cotton, direct planting, contour lines and terraces in areas with greater slopes. There were no situations of contamination of water courses, precisely because the farm was concerned with reducing the speed of runoff and adopting conservation techniques. Dry farming on both farms.
5_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentary and visual evaluation, the maps containing the identification of plots, RL areas and watercourses. There are no open PRADÂ’s on the properties. There is no water collection in watercourses or in naturally humid areas. The only sources of water are artesian wells.
5_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that the farm carries out soil analysis, makes fertilization recommendations according to the needs of the crop and considering what already exists in the soil. Conservation techniques are used, such as cover planting with crotalaria, brachiaria, millet, rotated with soybeans, corn and cotton, direct planting, contour lines and terraces in areas with greater slopes, to avoid surface erosion and visually such practices were observed.
5_4_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation that only genuine phytosanitary products purchased with agronomic prescriptions are used. It is clear that all pesticides are in their original packaging, with labels and leaflets, and are applied as set out in the agronomic recipe. It was evidenced through documentary evaluation that monitoring of pests, diseases, weeds and natural predators is carried out on the audited farms, and records are kept, despite the fact that a plan for Integrated Crop Management (MIC) has not yet been documented on the properties, where phytosanitary reduction targets are included. Recommendations for the application of pesticides are made according to the results of MIP monitoring.
5_5_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that records are kept of the applications carried out on the properties, however in relation to the climatic conditions during the applications are measured, but not recorded. Evidence of training records regarding the importance of correctly disposing of packaging. It was evident through visual assessment that both properties have appropriate vehicles for transporting pesticides. It was evident through visual assessment that the areas of the crop containing treatments were identified with re-entry signs for both farms. Fertilization recommendations are made by the agronomist and considering the results obtained in soil analyses.
5_6_criteria: It was evidenced through documentary evaluation that the farms have knowledge and the product prohibition lists of the Stockholm and Conventions are available. Rotterdam. The list of pesticides present on the properties is also evidenced, and there is no prohibited pesticide in stock.
5_7_criteria: It was evidenced through documentary evaluation that the farm uses biological products whenever possible and records are kept on the property.
5_8_criteria: There is no evidence of pest outbreaks in the farm regions, however the farm relies on the work of Indea, which whenever there are outbreaks in the region, they inform producers how to proceed.
5_9_criteria: Evidenced through visual assessment, that there is no application of agrochemicals within a 30 meter radius of populated areas and bodies of water, as per the guidance expressed in the service orders. There is no aerial application on properties. Evidenced through documentary evaluation that in the application orders there is an indication of ideal application parameters, but the climatic condition during the application operation is not recorded.
5_10_criteria: According to an interview with the Agricultural Engineer, the farm seeks to control application flows, establish parameters for applications, with better wind conditions, RH. Evidenced through documentary evaluation that in the application orders there is an indication of ideal application parameters, but the climatic condition during the application operation is not recorded
5_11_criteria: According to evidence presented, all seeds purchased come from sources legally known, registered with Renasem.

Name: GGF Agro LTDA
1_1_criteria: The applicable legislation is being complied with, evidenced through a field visit (audit 2019), documentation evaluation and interviews with employees that labor, environmental, health and safety and agricultural laws are respected in almost all cases totality. Remote audit 2020. The information presented during the audit demonstrates that the auditee is knowledgeable about the applicable legal requirements. The company has a legal department that provides input on applicable legislation, as well as those responsible for each area in the company.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: In the document Survey of Environmental and Agricultural Social Aspects and Monitoring Plan to ensure that native vegetation and wildlife are maintained, the points analyzed and the proposed control and mitigation actions are set out, as well as the assessment of their efficiency. A monitoring protocol was created for different environmental, social and agricultural aspects to see how they evolve over the years. Document created and monitoring protocol (SOCIAL RISK MITIGATION - TURNOVER - Training hours per employee; ENVIRONMENTAL RISK MITIGATION - Collection of contaminated material; AGRICULTURAL RISK MITIGATION - Organic matter).
2_1_criteria: No evidence found of forced, compulsory, slave, trafficking or other involuntary labor during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees in the groups production units. (2020) A declaration was signed to meet some criteria for being a remote audit. There are no children under 18 working on the farms visited in the previous campaign and corroborated during this remote audit through interviews. Payments and benefits appropriate to the legislation and the positions held.
2_2_criteria: The registration forms, employment contracts and payslips relating to employees of the production unit were available in easy-to-understand language in the HR department for consultation by workers. Documents relating to labor aspects available to all workers. Evidence that work and safety standards are passed on to workers was found.
2_3_criteria: Information on health and safety is documented and is transmitted to employees during Integration or during training, and all records were evidenced. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each role and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations. Also an analysis of health and safety risks present. Have a safety technician recommended by law, who talks to people weekly.
2_4_criteria: There is no impediment to freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment regarding their presence on the farm, membership being at the expense of the employee.
2_5_criteria: Salary paid adequately compatible with national legislation and collective agreements. Have weekly rest, vacations and no undue deductions from employees.
