There are no irregular and/or disciplinary deductions. There is a supply of water with potability standards in accordance with current legislation, as well as structures and food. The working day complies with what is established by the CLT. Extra working hours per worker are voluntary, communicated and paid.
3_1_criteria: Communication with the community is established, since the GGF Group is known in the community and the media meets the demand, as well as signs available outside the farm, with communication channels. GGF also publishes a magazine with all the social, productive activities and safety instructions carried out in the field.
3_2_criteria: The company has an identification of production areas that does not identify the presence of indigenous peoples close to the farm, as well as places of cultural, ecological, economic or religious importance, environments protected by law
3_3_criteria: The company has an identification of production areas that does not identify the presence of indigenous peoples close to the farm, as well as places of cultural importance , ecological, economic or religious, environments protected by law.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised internally and local collaboration programs are being carried out by the company GGF. Employment opportunity publicized for local communities. Farms prioritize the hiring of local labor, influencing consumption in nearby communities, in addition to donations.
4_1_criteria: The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were comprehensively identified for the farm included in the scope of certification . (2020) they create a spreadsheet with the risks associated with production.
4_2_criteria: There is a Waste Management plan which describes the actions that the property takes in relation to the waste generated. There is no burning of crop residues, vegetation and waste. (This is all prohibited) Everything was evidenced during the 2019 audit. During the current 2020 audit, it was evidenced by images and videos, and by the signing of a self-declaration of conformity.
4_3_criteria: The farm controls the fuel spent in production through electronic system. The monitoring carried out allows us to assess when there is an increase in the intensity of fossil fuel use. Soil organic matter monitored and improvement measures implemented. GGF a Identified opportunities to increase carbon sequestration.
4_4_criteria: Compliance with the deforestation policy of the standard met by the farm. There was no land conversion after 2009. There is no evidence of area conversions before June 3, 2016.
4_5_criteria: Environmental areas follow what is established by the Brazilian Forest Code and are described in the CAR. Pau da OnÃ§a Farm has a map available. The farm has more than 10% native vegetation. (They have 24% vegetation) and another part 57% native vegetation.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices are carried out daily, protecting soil and water from contamination. No evidence of water contamination observed. They have a Guerino Protocol - Well Water Grants
5_2_criteria: The areas of interest are being protected according to the Brazilian forestry code. Natural wetlands in the production unit intact.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, the use of contour lines and soil analyzes are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the production units. unit production.
5_4_criteria: Registered products are used and applied at the recommended dose. An integrated harvest management plan called - GGF Biological Protocol - and MIP was created to verify the limits of the economic year for pests to reduce the number of applications
5_5_criteria: Product storage location is suitable. Product application record is complete. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas and the use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the production units. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the unit.
5_8_criteria: In case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact MAPA and FundaÃ§Ã£o Matogrosso. Communication is mandatory in Brazil.
5_9_criteria: Applications are carried out at the correct distance from populated areas and protected areas. There are no production areas within 30 meters of populated areas and bodies of water. An integrated crop management plan called - GGF Biological Protocol was created, they also have a Drift Reduction protocol.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of unit production system. The minimum distance for application is respected.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through purchase from well-known companies that issue proof of origin and through own production with RENASEM.

Name: ADM do Brasil -Grupo Mato Grosso do Sul
1_1_criteria: Verified that there is knowledge of the applicable laws. All farms have consultancies in the agronomic, safety, occupational and environmental medicine areas. During the audit, it was evidenced through the sampling process with the analysis of documents, field verification, interviews with employees and those responsible for the areas of agronomy, human resources, work safety, compliance with applicable laws. Documents demonstrating land ownership, CAR, payment receipt, admission exams were verified. The infrastructures of the audited farms (accommodation, cafeteria, pesticide storage deposit, empty packaging deposit) are in accordance with what is determined by NR 31. Non-Compliance: However, the Zilmar, Flamboyant and Cachoeira farms did not present the authorization to capture water, Fazenda Zilmar did not present licensing for a supply tank above 15 thousand liters. Fazenda Cachoeira did not have a protective cage to inflate tires, according to NR 12.
1_2_criteria: Documentation relating to ownership was presented during the audit. The Zilmar and Flamboyant farms have land ownership registrations (registrations 14,634, 14,631, 14,632, 18,205). The Cachoeira farm does not have its own areas. The right to use the land is demonstrated through the Partnership Agreement, Private Agricultural, registration 17090, 17091 and 17412.
1_3_criteria: During the conduct of the audits, the initial internal audits of Zilmar, Flamboyant and Cachoeira Farms were presented, containing the identification of social, environmental and agricultural aspects, on and off the farm, the points that should be improved and monitored were presented, with data on the indicators that will be monitored.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced labor, imposed, trafficked and/or involuntary presented in work environments or heard during interviews with farm workers. The Ministry of Labors Slave Labor List updated on July 29, 2022 was consulted and no farm in scope was identified in this list.
2_2_criteria: Verified that workers receive training and pertinent information about each function to be performed. The direct and indirect workers hired are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about Health and safety are documented and transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units. At the Flamboyant and Cachoeira farm, the employees responsible for supply do not have NR 20 training.
2_4_criteria: No worker was found to be active in a union organization, however, the workers know the workers union. The interviewed employees declare that there are no restrictions on establishing or joining organizations, such as unions, by choice they decided not to join.
2_5_criteria: The payslips presented describe the salaries paid and salary deductions. There are only tax deductions, IRRPF, on the Zilmar farm there is a deduction for food worth R$ 75.00 per month. Verified that there is hazard pay for employees who carry out agricultural implement supply activities. On the Zilmar, Flamboyant and Cachoeira farms, working hours are not being recorded by the worker, and it is not possible to show whether the extra hours do not exceed 12 hours and whether they only occur in limited periods of time (harvest peak) during planting and harvesting. It was also not possible to demonstrate whether workers have one day off for every six consecutive days of work.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as e-mails, telephones, postal addresses and on farm roads with advertising signs containing the telephone number; internally on the farms in scope, communication occurs through Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”.
3_2_criteria: No evidence of traditional communities bordering the audited farms. Document of land ownership such as registrations and CAR and contracts of lease. Interviews were carried out with resident employees and those responsible for the farms and no dispute situations were reported. No traditional populations were reported near the farms that could be affected by their operations.
3_3_criteria: The audited farms Zilmar, Flamboyant and Cachoeira have the name of the properties and contact channels at the farm entrances.
3_4_criteria: Verified on the audited farms through interviews that some of the employees are residents of the farm or the city of SÃ£o Gabriel do Oeste and go to their homes every day. Vacancies are advertised through word of mouth and publicity in employees WhatsApp groups. The Zilmar, Flamboyant and Cachoeira farms hold a technical round day where their employees and external parties exchange experiences on the techniques adopted by the property.
4_1_criteria: Social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified for each farm within the scope of certification. Studies are available upon request.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and pesticide packaging is done appropriately. There is an Environmental Management Plan presented during the audit and covers waste management including all areas of the property. Although various wastes are being disposed of correctly on the Zilmar, Flamboyant and Cachoeira farms, waste such as contaminated tow, used filters are being disposed of incorrectly in the landfill in the city of SÃ£o Gabriel do Oeste.
4_3_criteria: On farms audited, there is a person responsible for carrying out the supplies and the procedure requires recording the date, machine and volume supplied on a specific spreadsheet. The consumption of fossil fuels over time and the volume per hectare is recorded in the system or in consumption spreadsheets.
4_4_criteria: Land conversion maps presented between the years 2009 to 2022. According to documentary evaluation, the areas of the Brazilian ADM group are in compliance with soy expansion requirements. Maps, satellite images and temporal analysis were made available and evaluated by CUC and it was verified that the cultivation areas were already anthropized before May 2009, with no conversion of areas considered as AAVC on all the groups farms.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling preservation and reserve areas legal, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.)
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed and the farms presented maps indicating the riparian vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farms' CAR.
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analyses, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion and rotation control techniques of culture are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: According to the documentary evaluation, the Integrated Farm Crop Planning was presented. Also evidenced through documentary evaluation, the record referring to the applications, which directs the application of the product directly in the area where the economic damage was identified. Thus, reducing field machine hours, lower product expenditure, less soil stress due to reduced machinery traffic, and still, controlling the imbalance identified in the crop. The farms monitor pests and diseases.
5_5_criteria: The audited farms Zilmar, Flamboyant and Cachoeira carry out pesticide applications through the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. responsible. A land application plan, product and quantity to be applied for different types of possible infestations is drawn up. Pest surveys are carried out through notes on a specific form (Soybean Pest Survey Spreadsheet) and applications are carried out based on this survey. Verified during an on-site visit that storage on farms takes place in an appropriate location, exclusively for this purpose, with an internal containment system, with a collection box, duly marked and with restricted access, with inert material to contain small leaks, MSDS of the stored products, eyewash and emergency shower. On the audited farms, there was no evidence of expired products stored in the pesticide warehouse. However, on the Flamboyant farm, the MSDS for some products were not available, and there was also no eye wash or emergency shower.
5_6_criteria: The application records and invoices for the purchase and storage of products were checked. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of Paraquat or Carbofuran was not evidenced on farms within the scope of certification.
5_7_criteria: Evidenced through evaluation of documents that are used on biological control farms, to replace synthetic products and also combined with application technologies . It is clear that records are kept of all use of biological control agents.
5_8_criteria: On the audited farms there were no incidences of new pests that have not been identified, however, producers know how to report that in cases of new pests or outbreaks , research institutions such as Embrapa will be communicated and consultants will be consulted in order to seek efficient control methodologies.
5_9_criteria: Drift control procedures were presented. Applications respect the minimum distance from populated areas and bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources , as evidenced in the seed purchase invoices presented in the audit.

Organization: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação
Name: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação LTDA - Grupo IV
1_1_criteria: Farms comply with applicable laws. Employees demonstrated knowledge of legislation and relevant documents were available. The information presented during the audit demonstrates that the auditee is knowledgeable about the applicable legal requirements. The company has a legal department that provides information on applicable legislation. During the audit, documentation in employees folders, verification of farm infrastructure, field visits, interviews with those responsible for the areas of human resources, agronomics, environmental and occupational safety were verified and knowledge of applicable laws was demonstrated. Documents demonstrating land ownership, a list of pesticides used and dosages applied, agronomic prescriptions, good agricultural practices, and employee training were verified. Employment contracts, employee records, time cards, pay slips (payments and discounts) and medical examinations were checked and compared with the Occupational Health Medical Control Program. The collective work agreement, environmental licenses, Rural Environmental Registry (CAR), grants and potability analysis.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land is documented and accessible, documents such as property registration certificates were presented, proving the rights to use owned and leased land within the scope of certification.
1_3_criteria: There is an Environmental study called "Environmental and Social Risk Assessment'' which includes the assessment and monitoring of social and environmental aspects and agricultural operation prepared by the Environmental Engineering Specialist in 2021. The internal audit on the farms was carried out at Fazenda Santana on 25/8/21, Fazenda Santa AntÃ´nio Kohn on 6/7/22, Fazenda Santo AntÃ´nio - August 2021 ; Fazenta Santa Isabel - August 2021 and Fazenda SapucaÃ­ - August 2021 The monitoring results were analyzed during the internal audit, where items, in which the mitigation and control measures were not effective, were taken as NC and corrective actions were requested.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, imposed, trafficked and/or involuntary labor was seen through visits to work environments or heard during interview with farm workers. Identity documents are returned to employees in accordance with legislation. Employees wives and children can work on farms under a normal contracting regime, if there is interest on the part of the workers and vacancies on the part of the employer. There are no children under 18 working on the sampled farms. Payments are in accordance with the activities carried out and established in a collective agreement, in addition to benefits relating to food, health plan, dental, housing, among others, described in pay slips and contractual documentation. There is the document "Internal Policies and Code of Conduct" given to all employees, addressing the issue of discrimination
2_2_criteria: All workers have a registration form, contract, as well as a collective bargaining agreement, which specify their conditions of work. During the audit on the sampled farms, several methodologies were highlighted that convey such matters to workers, such as integration training, courses and training and field days. Contracts are available in easy-to-understand language. The farms do not have a collective agreement, as there is no workers union active in the region, however, the specifications of the state collective agreement are followed.
2_3_criteria: The workers and those responsible for the operation demonstrated knowledge about health and safety in the work through verbal explanations addressing issues related to the application of agricultural pesticides, use of machinery and equipment and use of PPE. There is integration training and a code of conduct covering these topics, which were explained to workers. Presentation of health and safety documents and occupational health medical control, identifying risks and control procedures. The farms have mechanisms for verifying the use of PPE, such as warning systems for employees, described in the code of conduct, delivered when the employee is onboarded. Attendance list and training certificates for workers were evidenced, such as: NR 05 Accident prevention, Dangerous conduct, NR 06 EPI, NR-31.12 Machines and Equipment, NR-31.8 Application of Pesticides, NR-23 Fire Fighting, NR 20 - Flammable liquids, First Aid; for employees who perform risky functions on both farms.
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization. Through interviews with employees, it was identified that there is no type of discrimination or action that prevents or hinders the actions of organizations on the Farms. Right to collective bargaining guaranteed and integration with external parties guaranteed.
2_5_criteria: Remuneration is compatible with national legislation and collective agreements, salary information and deductions are detailed in payslips, which describe salary deductions that are related to tax deductions and a % of benefits granted as an agreement in contractual documentation. The working day complies with what is established in the Collective Labor Agreement. Workday records are made by workers in compliance with legal requirements. Checked through the dot mirror. Water Potability Analyzes of water collection wells for human consumption were presented and all results meet the potability standards established in the Ministry of Health Ordinance. There is accommodation for farm employees who live free of charge and all locations are verified. The houses were in good condition, they also provided adequate food, at no cost to employees.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as website containing emails telephones, postal address on farm roads with advertising signs written Â“talk to usÂ” containing Cerqualitys telephone number and website and internally on the farms in scope through the Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the workers time control and/or bulletin boards on the farm. It was evidenced through interviews with employees of the audited farms that the communication channels were widely publicized.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Land ownership documents and registration documents were presented. Interviews were carried out with employees residing in neighboring communities and with farm managers and no dispute situations were reported or found.
3_3_criteria: A mechanism for complaints, suggestions and grievances is made available, which establishes a registration and treatment procedure of complaints, through a complaints and complaints form, available at the production units, information about this mechanism is made available to all interested parties.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the farms and vacancies are disseminated through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fills out the job application, I have their resume on file. There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the farms in the scope, carried out by the farms and monitored by Cerquality.
4_1_criteria: The group manager has reports containing all social and environmental indicators, the report is sent and made available through the solicitation. The aspects are identified in the document "Environmental and Social Risk Assessment and Mitigation Measures" of September 2021, containing the identification of social, environmental and agricultural aspects, inside and outside the farm, the points that must be improved and monitored were presented . The assessment was carried out by the Group Manager. The assessments are in accordance with the reality of the operations carried out by the farms. All information was treated openly and all aspects found were reported to assess the need to mitigate environmental and social impacts.
4_2_criteria: There is no burning of crop residues, they are reused for direct planting. There is an Environmental Management Plan presented during the audit that covers waste management including all areas of the property. There is management and final disposal of batteries, used lubricating oil, lamps, tires, washing water from agricultural pesticide applicators are stored in adequate infrastructure with waterproofing, containment, ventilation, protected and disposed of correctly. For the waste mentioned above, proof of destination was presented to accredited companies, guaranteeing the correct destination.
4_3_criteria: The farms monitor the use of diesel through the system and OS for each supply, by date and equipment. It is possible to check usage per day, per month, per harvest and compare with soybean production. Monitoring carried out in conjunction with the agricultural schedule and cultural practices makes it possible to justify when there is a significant increase in diesel consumption, an item monitored by the group manager and informed during the audit. Soil organic matter levels are monitored through annual soil analyses, and direct planting practices are also used, which promote the maintenance of organic matter in the soil. Opportunities to increase carbon sequestration such as conservation of native forest in a reserve area, as well as APP areas, remaining isolated forests and use of techniques such as crop rotation and direct planting
4_4_criteria: Evidenced through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas are already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation. The group manager presented all maps of the farms participating in the "Comparison map with satellite images (2009, 2016 and current)" group. The maps were compared with the RTRS map, demonstrating that the areas are suitable.
4_5_criteria: There are detailed maps of all the farms indicating the native vegetation, production areas and watercourses. The farms audited areas with their own areas have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation. Periodic monitoring of areas with native vegetation (APP and RL) is carried out in the farms, where there are warning signs prohibiting hunting in these locations and in the socio-environmental plans of the farms, flora and fauna conservation measures were included.
5_1_criteria: The farms audited demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and underground water. There is periodic monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption. The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were evaluated, being present in the document Socio-environmental Assessment for Agricultural Production RTRS_Version 1.0 and Assessment of Aspects and Hazards by Process_Version 1.0. The concessions for irrigation of the SapucaÃ­ Farm were highlighted and it was verified that the conditions are being met, in compliance with current legislation.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, Cerquality presented detailed maps of all farms with indication of riparian vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farms' CAR. Evidence of the presence of natural wetlands present in the production area. The unit only emerges during the rainy season. areas remain intact.
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analysis, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. The farms take actions to control erosion such as direct planting, promoting the maintenance of plant residues on the soil, in addition to the fact that the relief is flat, which helps to avoid surface runoff, promoting the infiltration of rainwater.
5_4_criteria: Farms use appropriate products to control pests and diseases. IPMs and plans to reduce the use of chemical products are implemented. Pest monitoring is reported in forms called ''Monitoring of Pests in Soybean Culture - MIP Soja'' . The forms analyzed contained the pests found, date, cultivar and batch
5_5_criteria: Storage and transport of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. Empty packaging of agricultural pesticides is washed, unused and discarded correctly, after triple washing and returned to companies duly accredited for this purpose. Delivery certificates for empty pesticide containers were presented. There are signs with product information and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. Pesticide application records are made manually and subsequently recorded in the system. In the farms harvest plan, which defines agricultural planning, fertilization recommendations follow recommendations from Agricultural Engineers. according to soil analyzes of the areas.
5_6_criteria: Retroactive application records, invoices for purchase and storage of products were checked. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of Paraquat was not evidenced on the farms within the scope of certification.
5_7_criteria: On the Santo Antonio, Santa Isabel and Sapucai farms, biological control agents are applied at an experimental level that follow the recommendations made by Agr. Responsible for the farm, the same person responsible for applying agricultural pesticide recommendations At Santana and Santo Antonio Kohn Farms No applications of biological control agents were verified.
5_8_criteria: The methodology is described in the MIC Plan item 5.3 of the sampled farms , where it describes that in cases of new pests or outbreaks, research institutions such as Embrapa and consultants will be consulted in order to seek efficient control methodologies.
5_9_criteria: Records of the use of agrochemicals were presented, including the products purchased and applied , identification of the area applied, name of the operator, equipment, and meteorological conditions during application. Verified POP 13- Integrated Crop Management. During the interviews and verification of the sampled application records, it was observed that aerial application is carried out respecting distance limits. There is no applied area within 500 meters of populated areas and watercourses. There are no production areas that are less than 30 meters from populated areas and bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of GM soy production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources. The purchase of seeds from legal sources is evidenced through Invoices and the Seed Compliance Terms.

Name: GMS Agronegócio Ltda
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to the evaluation of documentation at the farm office, verification of infrastructure and field visits, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety laws and agricultural rights are respected and fulfilled.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land registrations and title deeds.
1_3_criteria: The aspects were identified and improvement continuous will be monitored, showing the farms commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: Adequate working conditions, payment receipts in accordance with the activity carried out with farm employees, training for functions, in addition to adequate benefits and evidence of the absence of discounts on payslips that are not in the legislation. No evidence of aggression or disrespect was seen on site, or heard during the interview with workers on the propertys work fronts and work structures. No children under the age of 18 were identified working on the farm.
2_2_criteria: Registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees of the production unit were presented, and were available in easy-to-understand language at the accounting office. The company and its employees do not follow any union at the moment, as there is no active union in the region. Due and appropriate training has been carried out.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety issues are communicated to employees. The document Rural Work Safety, Health and Environmental Management Program (PGSSMATR) contains the safety and the PCMSO where the examinations and precautions that employees must follow are described. Employees with specific functions are trained. The appropriate protective equipment for each function is used correctly. Emergency procedures available
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization, however, there is no active union in the region.
2_5_criteria: Remunerations are compatible with national legislation, on pay slips salary and deductions are detailed, there were no irregular deductions. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. Hours worked are being recorded and overtime occurs within the limit permitted by legislation.
3_1_criteria: There are channels of communication and dialogue, publicized through signs on the farm.
3_2_criteria: There are no indigenous peoples and places with cultural importance in the areas of influence of the audited farm.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and grievances are checked monthly and responses are passed on to DDS for employees in general. At the entrance to the farm there are signs (Ombudsman GMS) with telephone numbers available for community contact and complaints.
3_4_criteria: Job opportunities are advertised locally by employees and also by the external company Promove, which has a portal that recruits and selects employees. The farm contributes financial aid to adapt a municipal school in the region and social actions through the cooperative. Offers of goods and services are offered
4_1_criteria: Evaluation carried out in a comprehensive manner, through the report presented, carried out by the environmental and safety department of the GMS group, where points for improvements were identified, covering social and environmental aspects of the farm in a comprehensive and clear manner.
4_2_criteria: Storage locations for fuel, lubricants, among others, are located in areas with waterproof floors and containment for protection in case of accidental leaks. Soil organic matter is monitored and measures are taken for improvement, in addition the producer uses crops: millet, corn, wheat, oats and carries out everything such as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_3_criteria: Fuel recording is done manually at the pump and then passed on to the Administrative Manager. Information on the volume per hectare and per unit of product monitored in all activities related to soybean production can be obtained. Several mechanisms and opportunities for carbon sequestration are implemented.
4_4_criteria: As of May 2009, there has been no cleaning or conversion of areas included in Category 1 of maps 3 and there has been no land conversion after 2016, it was presented report with satellite images that demonstrates a comparison between the years 2016 and 2020 and shows that there was no area conversion after 2016.
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained in accordance with federal law, evidenced through the data from registrations and data in the CAR that the properties contain the amount of forest recommended in the forestry code, which is 20% for the Atlantic forest biome, where the farm is located. There is also an Environmental Diagnosis carried out by the cooperative, which excludes areas that are APP areas, evidenced during the verification of maps, field visits and images of the farm. Hunting and fishing are not permitted.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices implemented, crop rotation practices, direct planting in straw, fertilization and correction according to technical calculation, containment areas for storing chemical products and carrying out water analysis as monitoring. Erosion prevention measures are carried out, such as contour lines and always keeping the soil covered, as well as appropriate structures used to contain chemicals. Contamination of groundwater was not verified, according to monitoring analysis reports presented. Irrigation management procedures and systems are implemented through the ICROP program that performs calculations using data entered from monitoring meteorological data and soil moisture for irrigation application. A grant of abstraction water for irrigation, issued by the Secretariat of Environment and Water Resources, was also presented.
5_2_criteria: The watercourses and APPs are mapped. The socio-environmental diagnosis document demonstrates that the APP areas are being recovered throughout the property through natural regeneration. There is also an Environmental Diagnosis carried out by the cooperative, which includes APP areas, evidenced by checking maps, field visits and images of the farm.
5_3_criteria: The organic matter of the monitored soil, was evidenced through an interview with the technical manager and document from the company that carries out the samples and analyzes of soil analysis data for management through graphs and implementation of precision agriculture. Practices are carried out to improve soil quality such as: Crop rotation, soil analysis with fertilization through precision agriculture, maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting. The farm uses level planting, contour lines and direct planting to prevent erosion
5_4_criteria: The farm has a document "Procedure for Good Agricultural Practices and Integrated Crop Management" and there are records of pest monitoring in the standard document called "Monitoring of pests in soybean cultivation", in addition, the farm uses other control methods, in addition to chemical ones, which are: varietal, chemical, physiological and biological - BT. Pest monitoring records are carried out by the farm.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical use records contain the requested data. Properly carried out storage and disposal location, all empty agrochemical packaging is triple washed, perforated at the bottom and stored until sent to destination. The storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. The use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the farm.
5_8_criteria: The owners of the farm informed that the agency SIDAGO - Agrodefesa carries out a visit to the property.
5_9_criteria: Procedure "Good Agricultural Practices" and the ANDEF manual Good agricultural practices in field were available. Meteorological records are carried out. Aerial applications are not carried out.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds are purchased from reputable sources, as per verification of seed purchase invoices and terms of compliance.

Name: Produzindo Certo – Grupo Castrolanda II
1_1_criteria: The farm remains up to date with applicable laws through contact between sectors and legal bodies, as well as through consultancies.
1_2_criteria: The property only has its own areas with registrations showing the right of land use.
1_3_criteria: The unit defined indicators to be improved, covering at least one topic from each principle of the RTRS Standard. The indicators are described in the Socio-Environmental Diagnosis document.
2_1_criteria: Employees are free to leave the farm and have adequate working and housing conditions. At the farm office, only copies of employee documents are retained, obtained shortly after hiring and attached to the files. There are no children under 18 working or residing on the property. Employees with the same functions receive the same base salaries. During the interviews, employees reported not suffering corporal punishment, any coercive methods or types of abuse and intimidation.
2_2_criteria: Employees have signed employment contracts attached to their files. Labor rights, as well as appropriate forms of conduct, are communicated to employees through integration training immediately after hiring. The farm provides vocational training to employees. Topics relating to the execution of functions, procedures and work instructions are covered.
2_3_criteria: Those responsible for the farm demonstrated knowledge and understanding of occupational health and safety issues. The farms PPRA and PCMSO are updated annually. For potentially dangerous tasks, employees undergo health monitoring examinations, as well as occupational safety training. Upon receiving the PPE, employees sign a delivery form, which describes the PPE received, as well as a liability and obligation statement. The use of PPE is checked by the occupational safety technician and in monthly 5S checks. Emergency procedures are transmitted to employees through training. The farm has first aid kits on the farms premises, as well as a vehicle available for transport.
2_4_criteria: Although the local union does not maintain frequent contact with employees, they are free to contribute or not. Although it has been verified that employees are not prevented from carrying out collective bargaining in conjunction with local unions, there are no collective agreements or conventions in force at the moment.
2_5_criteria: Although there is no collective agreement or convention, the lowest salary -base paid at the unit is higher than the national minimum wage of R$1,100.00. Copies of payment receipts are retained by the unit. As verified in the payment statements, no deductions are made that are not provided for by law, such as INSS and IRRF. 44 normal working hours and 12 overtime hours per week are not exceeded. The hours worked are recorded automatically according to the time worked by employees. The harvest period normally occurs between September and April.
3_1_criteria: The local community can contact the farm via email, available on the propertys entrance sign, or via the Cooperativa Castrolanda website. Furthermore, it has communication procedures that standardize the treatment of complaints and suggestions received from both the local community and employees.
3_2_criteria: The group manager has maps identifying the regions where there are institutional areas, constituted by the Units of Conservation of Sustainable Use and Integral Protection and Indigenous Lands. There are no indigenous areas close to the property.
3_3_criteria: Workers can make complaints and complaints through WhatsApp, the complaints box or directly at the farm office. Such complaints may be made anonymously or not. Employees are aware of the mechanisms, as verified during the interviews.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised through local recommendations, and are advertised among residents of the region. Currently, the majority of farm employees are residents of the region. Inputs and services are mostly obtained from the region. The farm participates in social projects and donations in the city.
4_1_criteria: Properties included in the certification group undergo a social and environmental assessment before their inclusion. The topics of the RTRS Production Standard are fully covered during the assessment, as well as all activities carried out on the farm.
4_2_criteria: It was verified through maps with the history of the heat source in the areas of the farm, which No fires are carried out in the unit. The farm separates hazardous waste and stores it in a suitable location. Hazardous waste is sent to specialized companies. Both hazardous and non-hazardous waste are stored and disposed of, as described in the Solid Waste Management PlanÂ– PGRS. Machine washing is carried out in a washing lane.
4_3_criteria: Measurements of fuel use are carried out in the farms workshop by employees and recorded in a spreadsheet. Soil organic matter is monitored through soil analysis and precision agriculture. Good agricultural practices are used to maintain the soil and cover crops are used. Permanent preservation areas are maintained on the property, increasing carbon sequestration.
4_4_criteria: The comparative maps developed by the group manager demonstrate that there were no openings of areas after May 2009.
4_5_criteria: The farm has a map of the property containing the consolidated open area, native vegetation, permanent preservation area and watercourses. The unit has the Ecosystem and Wildlife Conservation Program, which aims to identify native vegetation and wildlife, in addition to establishing measures for the conservation, protection and recovery of natural ecosystems on the farm. Hunting and fishing are prohibited on the farmâ€™s territories. The property has signs warning about the prohibition at several points.
5_1_criteria: The farm does not carry out irrigation on the property. There is no water collection from rivers, only from wells for employee consumption. The unit monitors the quality of water resources, such as the underground collection well. Good agricultural practices are adopted in various situations, such as direct planting, soil cover, prevention of erosion and application of fertilizers according to the dosage recommended by experts.
5_2_criteria: Verified during visits and on maps that forests are present in the rivers. No points for removing natural vegetation were identified in riparian areas. There are no wetlands that have been drained on the property.
5_3_criteria: Soil analyzes are carried out with precision agriculture. The results and monitoring are carried out by agronomists. Several practices are applied to preserve the soil, such as direct planting, crop rotation, fertilizer dosage based on soil analysis, road maintenance and soil coverage with oats, corn, wheat and barley. There is no land with a steep slope on the farm. Erosion is controlled through contour lines, cover plants and maintenance of property roads. The period of sanitary emptiness in the region occurs between 06/15 and 09/15, where there is no soybean cultivation.
5_4_criteria: The unit controls applications and has annual reduction targets, as a way of reducing costs , this plan is described in the document Integrated Crop Management (MIC) and is put into practice through monitoring by the Group Manager. There is planning to reduce chemicals, through increased use of biologicals.
5_5_criteria: Records on the use of agrochemicals are made through agronomic prescriptions and retained in the farm office. Agrochemical suppliers transport them to the cooperatives general warehouse. Empty agrochemical packaging is triple-washed after use, punctured and stored in a dedicated warehouse. After storage, they are taken to the Castrolanda cooperative warehouse and sent to authorized collection points. The property works with precision agriculture, technical recommendations are made by agronomists and follow the reports of soil analyzes carried out.
5_6_criteria: The farm does not use products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The land applications spreadsheet is highlighted, which contains all the agrochemicals used by the farm.
5_7_criteria: The requirements for the use of biological control agents are available in the agricultural system. Biological control agents are used on the property to combat pests. When such products are used, records similar to the use of chemical products are made and recorded.
5_8_criteria: There are no cases of new pests or diseases. The farm has communication with the ABC Foundation, which contacts the responsible organizations, such as Embrapa. In case of new pests or diseases, monitoring and communication are carried out.
5_9_criteria: Records of weather conditions and application times are made. Drift is controlled by the farm based on each product applied and the current weather conditions. Pesticides are not applied within a 30m radius of populated areas or bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: There is no evidence of interference in the systems of neighboring production, the forms of cultivation and crops are consolidated and similar to those of the farm, such as soybeans and corn.
5_11_criteria: The seeds are acquired from Cooperativa Castrolanda.

Name: Produzindo Certo–Grupo Castrolanda
1_1_criteria: The farm remains up to date with applicable laws through contact between the sectors and legal bodies, as well as through consultancies. Although the farm complies with legal requirements, cases of non-compliance with the Consolidation of Labor Laws were identified, exceeding the maximum limit of 2 overtime hours per day. NC 01: The limit of 2 daily overtime hours of work provided for by the Consolidation of Labor Laws is not being met
1_2_criteria: The property only has its own areas with registrations showing the right to use the land.
1_3_criteria: The unit defined indicators to be improved, covering at least one topic from each principle of the RTRS Standard. 2_3_criteria: Those responsible for the farm demonstrated knowledge and understanding of occupational health and safety issues. The farms PPRA and PCMSO are updated annually. 2_4_criteria: Although the local union does not maintain frequent contact with employees, they are free to contribute or not. Although it has been verified that employees are not prevented from carrying out collective bargaining in conjunction with local unions, there are no collective agreements or conventions in force at the moment.
2_5_criteria: Although there is no collective agreement or convention, the lowest salary -base paid at the unit is higher than the national minimum wage of R$1,100.00. Copies of payment receipts are retained by the unit. As verified in the payment statements, no deductions are made that are not provided for by law, such as INSS and IRRF. 44 normal working hours and 12 overtime hours per week are not exceeded. The hours worked are recorded according to the point performed by employees manually. The harvest period normally occurs between September and April. The month with the highest labor demand is March. In such periods, time records were recorded where workers did not take a day off after 6 consecutive days of work. NC 02: Workers do not take a day off for every six consecutive days of work.
3_1_criteria: The local community can contact the farm via email, available on the propertys entrance sign , or on the Cooperativa Castrolanda website. Furthermore, it has communication procedures that standardize the treatment of complaints and suggestions received from both the local community and employees.
3_2_criteria: The group manager has maps identifying the regions where there are institutional areas, constituted by the Units of Conservation of Sustainable Use and Integral Protection and Indigenous Lands. There are no indigenous areas close to the property. The nearest settlement, PA da Ranch Alegre, is 33 km from the farm and the PiraÃ­ do Sul National Forest is 14 km from the property.
3_3_criteria: Workers can make complaints and complaints via WhatsApp, complaints box or directly at the farm office. Such complaints may be made anonymously or not. Employees are aware of the mechanisms, as verified during the interviews.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised through local recommendations, and are advertised among residents of the region. Currently, the majority of farm employees are residents of the region. The majority of inputs and services are obtained from the Castro/PR region. The farm participates in social projects and donations in the city, however there are no records that show such activities. Despite not being met, compliance with indicator 3.4.2 will only be required from the second surveillance audit onwards.
4_1_criteria: Properties included in the certification group undergo a social and environmental assessment before its inclusion. The topics of the RTRS Production Standard are fully covered during the assessment, as well as all activities carried out on the farm. Although the farm has established measures to minimize the identified impacts, there is no evidence of monitoring for all of these measures. Although it is not being met, compliance with indicator 4.1.4 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards.
4_2_criteria: It was verified through maps with the history of the heat source in the areas of the farm that are not burned at the unit. The farm separates hazardous waste and stores it in a suitable location. Hazardous waste is sent to specialized companies. Both hazardous and non-hazardous waste are stored and disposed of, as described in the Solid Waste Management PlanÂ– PGRS. The machines are washed in a washing lane, but a water and oil separator box has not yet been installed. Although not being met, compliance with indicator 4.2.3 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards.
4_3_criteria: Measurements of fuel use are carried out in the farm workshop by employees and recorded in an Excel spreadsheet. Although there is control over the use of fuels, a mechanism has not yet been established to demonstrate the analysis of consumption trends over time. Although it is not being complied with, compliance with indicator 4.3.2 will only be required from the second surveillance audit onwards. Soil organic matter is monitored through soil analysis and precision agriculture. Good agricultural practices are used to maintain the soil and cover crops are used. Permanent preservation areas are maintained on the property, increasing carbon sequestration.
4_4_criteria: The comparative maps developed by the group manager demonstrate that there were no openings of areas after May 2009.
4_5_criteria: The farm has a map of the property containing the consolidated open area, native vegetation, permanent preservation area and watercourses. The unit has the Ecosystem and Wildlife Conservation Program, which aims to identify native vegetation and wildlife, in addition to establishing measures for the conservation, protection and recovery of natural ecosystems on the farm. 5_3_criteria: Soil analyzes are carried out with precision agriculture. The results and monitoring are carried out by agronomists. Several practices are applied to preserve the soil, such as direct planting, crop rotation, fertilizer dosage based on soil analysis, road maintenance and soil coverage with oats and ryegrass. There is no land with a steep slope on the farm. Erosion is controlled through contour lines, cover plants and maintenance of the propertys roads. The period of sanitary emptiness in the region occurs between 25/05 and 10/09, where there is no soybean cultivation.
5_4_criteria: They use biological pest controls to treat seeds such as Rizoliq Top and ACC Max. Also there is production of biological controls on the farm. Bedbugs and caterpillars are controlled. Although there is crop management and the use of biological pest controls, there is no documented plan where such actions are described. Furthermore, there are no targets for reducing these products over time. Although not being complied with, compliance with indicators 5.4.1 and 5.4.2 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards. Both pesticides and fertilizers are original and purchased from licensed companies, and are accompanied by invoices and agronomic prescriptions. Monitoring records of pests and natural predators are carried out and maintained. Although the technical team reports that it monitors diseases and weeds, there are no records that demonstrate such practices. Although it is not being met, compliance with indicator 5.4.5 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards.

Pest monitoring records are carried out by the farm.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical use records contain the requested data. Properly carried out storage and disposal location, all empty agrochemical packaging is triple washed, perforated at the bottom and stored until sent to destination. The storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. The use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the unit.
5_8_criteria: Those responsible for the farm informed that the agency SIDAGO - Agrodefesa carried out the visit to the property.
5_9_criteria: Procedure "Good Agricultural Practices" and the ANDEF manual Good agricultural practices in field were available. Meteorological records are carried out. Aerial applications are not carried out.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds are purchased from reputable sources, as per verification of seed purchase invoices and terms of compliance.

Name: Fazenda Modelo (Eswalter Zanetti e Outros)
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to documentation evaluation, on-site verification, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety and agricultural laws are respected and complied with.

No children under the age of 18 were identified working on the farm.
2_2_criteria: Registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees of the production unit were presented, and were available in easy-to-understand language at the accounting office. 2_3_criteria: Health and safety issues are communicated to employees. The document Rural Work Safety, Health and Environmental Management Program (PGSSMATR) contains the safety risks and the PCMSO which describes the examinations and precautions that employees must follow. Employees with specific functions are trained. The appropriate protective equipment for each function is used correctly. Emergency procedures available and understood by employees.
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization, however, there is no active union in the region.
2_5_criteria: Remunerations are compatible with the national legislation, salary and deductions are detailed in the payslips, there were no irregular deductions. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. Hours worked are recorded using a time clock, overtime occurs within the limit permitted by legislation.
3_1_criteria: There are channels of communication and dialogue, publicized through signs on the farm.
3_2_criteria: There are no indigenous peoples and places with cultural importance in the areas of influence of the audited farm.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and grievances are checked monthly and responses are passed on to DDS for employees in general. At the entrance to the farm there are signs with telephone numbers available for community contact and complaints.
3_4_criteria: Job opportunities are advertised locally by employees and also by the external company Promove, which has a portal that recruits and selects employees. employees. The farm contributes financial aid to adapt a municipal school in the region and social actions through the cooperative. Offers of goods and services are offered.
4_1_criteria: Evaluation carried out in a comprehensive manner, through the report presented, carried out by the farms environmental department, where points for improvements were identified, covering the farms social and environmental points in a comprehensive and clear.
4_2_criteria: Storage locations for fuel, lubricants, among others, are located in areas with waterproof floors and containment for protection in case of accidental leaks. Soil organic matter is monitored and measures are taken for improvement, in addition the producer uses crops: millet, corn, wheat, oats and carries out everything such as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_3_criteria: Fuel recording is done manually at the pump and then passed on to the Administrative Manager. Information on the volume per hectare and per unit of product monitored in all activities related to soybean production can be obtained. Several mechanisms and opportunities for carbon sequestration are implemented.
4_4_criteria: As of May 2009, there has been no cleaning or conversion of areas included in Category 1 of maps 3 and there has been no land conversion after 2016, it was presented report with satellite images that demonstrates a comparison between the years 2016 and 2020 and shows that there was no area conversion after 2016.
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained in accordance with federal law, evidenced through the data from registrations and data in the CAR that the properties contain the amount of forest recommended in the forestry code, which is 20% for the Atlantic forest biome, where the farm is located. There is also an Environmental Diagnosis carried out by the farm, which excludes areas that are APP areas, evidenced during the verification of maps, field visits and images of the farm. Hunting and fishing are not permitted.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices implemented, crop rotation practices, direct planting in straw, fertilization and correction according to technical calculation, containment areas for storing chemical products and carrying out water analysis as monitoring. Erosion prevention measures are carried out, such as contour lines and always keeping the soil covered, as well as appropriate structures used to contain chemicals. Contamination of groundwater was not verified, according to monitoring analysis reports presented. Irrigation management procedures and systems are implemented through the ICROP program that performs calculations using data entered from monitoring meteorological data and soil moisture for irrigation application. A grant of abstraction water for irrigation, issued by the Secretariat of Environment and Water Resources, was also presented.
5_2_criteria: The watercourses and APPs are mapped. The socio-environmental diagnosis document demonstrates that the APP areas are being recovered throughout the property through natural regeneration. There is also an Environmental Diagnosis carried out by the farm, which includes APP areas, evidenced by checking maps, field visits and images of the farm.
5_3_criteria: The organic matter of the monitored soil, was evidenced through an interview with the technical manager and document from the company that carries out the samples and analyzes of soil analysis data for management through graphs and implementation of precision agriculture. Practices are carried out to improve soil quality such as: Crop rotation, soil analysis with fertilization through precision agriculture, maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting. The farm uses level planting, contour lines and direct planting to prevent erosion.
5_4_criteria: The farm has a document "Procedure for Good Agricultural Practices and Integrated Crop Management" and there are records of pest monitoring in the document standard called "Monitoring of pests in soybean cultivation", in addition, the farm uses other control methods, in addition to chemical ones, which are: varietal, chemical, physiological and biological - BT. Pest monitoring records are carried out by the farm.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical use records contain the requested data. The storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. The use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the farm.
5_8_criteria: The owners of the farm informed that the agency SIDAGO - Agrodefesa carries out a visit to the property.
5_9_criteria: Procedure "Good Agricultural Practices" and the ANDEF manual Good agricultural practices in field were available. Meteorological records are carried out. Aerial applications are not carried out.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds are purchased from reputable sources, as per verification of seed purchase invoices and terms of compliance.

Name: Amaggi Exp Imp Ltda–Grupo III
1_1_criteria: Producers stay up to date with applicable laws through internet research, WhatsApp groups with professionals in the field and newspapers on agricultural websites. Companies that trade with farms provide professionals, such as agronomists, to assist with agricultural management and verify legal compliance. The farms also receive assistance from accounting offices. The farms comply with most applicable laws, but all showed non-compliance in the indicator
1_2_criteria: The properties demonstrate the right to use the land through deeds and/or lease contracts.
1_3_criteria: The socio-environmental aspects that must be improved on all farms are identified. Based on these aspects, indicators are defined and these are aligned with the goals established per year.
2_1_criteria: There is no evidence of forced labor, slavery or their equivalents on the audited farms. Workers keep their belongings with them, there is no retention of personal documents of employees by the farms. In cases where a husband and wife work on the property, both work voluntarily. All workers are of legal age, there are no employees working as minor apprentices. The workers interviewed reported receiving friendly treatment on the farms, as well as being unaware of any discriminatory act that had occurred. Everyone reports receiving friendly treatment and being free to leave the farm after completing their workdays. Workers in the same functions receive equal remuneration.
2_2_criteria: All employees have a written employment contract with the properties, as well as having their employment documents signed. Employment contracts include information such as salary, function, working hours, rights and duties of workers. At the time of integration, employees receive general instructions on health and safety, as well as receiving periodic training on health and safety that is more specific to their activities.
2_3_criteria: Workers receive training on health and safety, depending on the tasks they perform and demonstrate knowledge on the subject. The Siriema and Reunidas do Papagaio farms have health and safety programs covering the risks involved and mitigation and control measures. They also control that dangerous tasks are carried out only by trained and qualified people. The PÃ©rola farm does not have the programs developed, which led to the NC in indicator 2.3.2, and does not carry out training for dangerous tasks, leading to the NC in indicator 2.3.3. All farms provide adequate PPE. The farms have procedures for emergencies and first aid.
2_4_criteria: Although there is no collective agreement with local unions, it was verified through interviews that workers are free to join organizations of their choice. Although local unions do not maintain contact with farms, their representatives are not prevented from interacting with farm employees.
2_5_criteria: The lowest wage paid on farms is the national minimum wage, as verified on payslips. There are no salary deductions of a disciplinary nature. The regular working hours are 44 hours per week and a maximum of 12 overtime hours per week (Monday to Friday). In exceptional harvest periods, some farms exceed the overtime limit, and on PÃ©rola and Reunidas do Papagaio farms the average over a 2-month period exceeded 60 hours per week, leading to a NC in indicator 2.5.4. In all audited farms there are also some cases of working hours without a day off after 6 consecutive days of work and 50% of overtime is not fully paid, being compensated in a time bank without the presence of a collective agreement, leading to to an NC in indicator 2.5.6. All farms record their journey on a time card. The right to maternity leave is provided for on all audited farms. The farms provide houses or accommodation, all in adequate conditions. The water made available is collected from an artesian well and potability analyzes are carried out, however at PÃ©rola farm the analysis does not include microbiological parameters for E. coli, leading to a NC in the indicator.
3_1_criteria: The available communication channels are telephone, email and suggestion boxes present at the farm offices. Signs at the entrance to the farms identify their location and telephone numbers. Communication channels are known and allow adequate communication with local communities.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes over the right to use land on properties, nor is there evidence of the existence of traditional users of land on properties . Some farms are close to indigenous areas, but are not bordering them. The rights of such traditional users are respected by the farms.
3_3_criteria: The properties have suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters, as well as a written procedure providing for registration and treatment.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies They are preferably offered to local communities, normally through advertisements in local agencies, or through farm employees who bring recommendations. As far as possible, there is collaboration with training programs for the local community and/or participation in training offered by SENAR or equivalent entities, contributing to the formation of groups to provide training. The acquisition of inputs and services is preferably done through local companies.
4_1_criteria: A socio-environmental assessment was carried out by the group manager on all members, in a comprehensive and clear manner. From this assessment, points for improvement were identified. All members receive a copy of the assessment of their property and it is available from the manager, if requested.
4_2_criteria: No fires are practiced on the audited farms. The properties have the appropriate structures to prevent oil spills, at the gas station, mechanical workshop and machinery wash. The farms have a waste management plan, although it is not 100% implemented on all farms, but compliance with such aspects will only be applicable in the next years of certification.
4_3_criteria: The farms record fuel consumption fossils. Soil organic matter is monitored by all farms through soil analysis. Carbon sequestration is increased through crop succession, direct planting and maintenance of native vegetation present on all properties.
4_4_criteria: There were no conversions of vegetation areas on the farms audited in the period from 2008 to currently, as verified by satellite image maps.
4_5_criteria: Current satellite image maps of farms indicate native vegetation, production areas, watercourses and springs. Hunting and fishing are prohibited on the properties. All farms have more than 10% native vegetation.
5_1_criteria: There is no irrigation on the audited properties. The farms use good agricultural practices in all their processes, such as direct planting, maintenance and preservation of roads, monitoring of crops, preservation of native vegetation, among other practices. In conjunction with good practices, water quality is monitored by Amaggi, which carries out water analysis using rapid kits. There is no evidence of cases of contamination of water sources on the audited farms.
5_2_criteria: The maps with satellite images identified identify the water courses and riparian vegetation on the farms. No drainage was identified in natural wetlands on any property.
5_3_criteria: Farms apply soil improvers at a variable rate, through precision agriculture. Every year soil analyzes are carried out and Agronomists make fertilizer and fertilizer recommendations. Practices are adopted to preserve soil quality, such as cover crops and direct planting systems. The cultivation regime of the audited properties is soybeans in the harvest season and corn or cotton in the off-season, respecting the Sanitary Vacuum established in the State of Mato Grosso.
5_4_criteria: The farms have procedures on Integrated Crop Management. All agrochemicals used are registered for soybean cultivation, are purchased with Agronomic Prescriptions and recommended by qualified professionals.
5_5_criteria: The audited farms register agricultural pesticide applications. The pesticides are stored in specific deposits, properly locked and with a containment system in case of leaks. At the end of use, the pesticide packaging is triple washed and perforated on all audited farms. They are subsequently stored in a covered, closed and properly locked empty packaging warehouse. Farms mark recently sprayed areas. The use of agrochemicals follows professional recommendations on all properties.
5_6_criteria: Verified through application records, invoices and purchase orders, that the farms do not use products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The farms no longer use Paraquat in their production processes.
5_7_criteria: From interviews it was verified that those responsible for the farms are aware of the importance of using biological control. In properties that use such products, the uses are recorded on application forms.
5_8_criteria: Owners and those responsible for farms demonstrate knowledge regarding the appearance of new pests and invasive species and reported that they would contact MAPA, EMBRAPA or APROSOJA.
5_9_criteria: The farms have documented procedures detailing good practices in the application of agrochemicals.
5_10_criteria: Areas neighboring the properties are occupied with similar production systems, and there are no production systems that require care, such as organic production. No evidence of damage to neighboring areas was found on any audited farm.
5_11_criteria: On all audited farms it is possible to guarantee the legal use of the origin of the seeds, whether purchased from duly qualified resellers or seeds self-propagated on the farm itself.

Name: Aliança da Terra Grupo IV
1_1_criteria: The farms are advised by external companies on topics such as health and safety, labor and environmental legislation, keeping up to date with applicable legal requirements. Those responsible for properties are aware of the laws applicable to the Standard. However, two farms had non-conformities in indicator 1.1.2. The non-conformities were due to excessive daily overtime and the lack of control over the volumes of water used through artesian wells and dam catchments.
1_2_criteria: The properties audited demonstrate the right to use land through of area registrations and lease contracts.
1_3_criteria: Improvement points are identified through the Socio-environmental Diagnoses developed by AlianÃ§a da Terra. After the Diagnosis, the owners sign the CAS (Socio-Environmental Adequacy Commitment), committing to improve the identified points.
2_1_criteria: There is no evidence of forced labor, slavery or their equivalents on the audited farms. Verified that there is no retention of personal documents or any workers assets by the employer. There is no work obligation imposed on spouses or children of employees and there are no children under the age of 15 working on the properties. In the case of family members of employees working on the property, there is no imposition by the farm. Employees report that they are unaware of any episode of discrimination of any kind. Salary schemes are defined according to the role and experience of employees. Employees are free to look for another job if they wish and report receiving cordial treatment.
2_2_criteria: Contracts and employee work cards are signed during their admission, describing salaries, working hours, rights and duties. Employees receive integration, covering topics such as health and safety and internal farm standards. The health and safety training programs provided to employees include specific requirements in the activities they carry out.
2_3_criteria: During interviews, workers knowledge and understanding of issues related to health and safety were verified. , producers or those responsible for farms. The audited farms have PPRA, PCMSO or similar programs, containing health and safety risks, as well as measures to mitigate and control them. However, two properties received a non-compliance in indicator 2.3.2, due to their health risk monitoring being in disagreement with the programs. Records of employee training programs and correct provision of PPE were presented during the audit. Health and safety policies, including the use of PPE and possible sanctions for non-compliance, are imposed through DDS and monitored during inspections conducted by occupational health and safety advisors or by the managers or owners themselves. Safety procedures, emergency plans and visible signs are maintained, containing useful telephone numbers in cases of accidents and emergencies. Some audited farms have a risk map, in places visible to all workers. There are also first aid kits and vehicles available on the properties for use in cases of emergencies.
2_4_criteria: Through interviews, it was demonstrated that employees are free to join unions, with no impediment to the right to negotiate collective imposed by the employer. However, there was no Collective Agreement or Convention in force on the farms audited.
2_5_criteria: The salary floors on the farms are higher than the national minimum. There are no payments for production, everyone receives monthly salaries. Verified through payment receipts that in some cases, there are symbolic charges for housing, in addition to legal discounts. The working hours on the audited farms are duly recorded, with the exception of one farm, where it was not possible to show the total hours worked during exceptional periods, generating a non-conformity in indicator 2.5.4. Totals worked are limited to 8 hours per day, with a maximum of two overtime hours, except on one of the farms, where the cook works more than two overtime hours per day, resulting in the non-compliance described in 1.1. Employees receive time off at least every six days worked, except on a farm, where it was found that during the harvest, employees work more than six days in a row, without a day of rest, generating non-conformity in indicator 2.5.6. Verified that farms are aware of and comply with maternity and paternity leave requirements. Employees who live on the properties receive housing in good condition, with running water and electricity. The accommodations are also in good condition, with beds, closets, fans, windows and adequate sanitary conditions. The farms have a canteen where meals are provided to employees. Despite water potability analyzes being carried out, only one of the farms performs analyzes in an external laboratory, at an adequate frequency and demonstrates potability results in compliance with the Parameters of the Ministry of Health. All the other four farms received non-compliance in the indicator 2.5.9, for not evaluating the potability of water intended for human consumption through an external laboratory.
3_1_criteria: The properties maintain identification signs at the entrance and suggestion boxes at their headquarters.
