Communications can be made in person on farms, in offices in cities or even by telephone. Verified that the communication channels are known and allow adequate communication with local communities.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes over the right to use land on the audited properties. Verified through land use right documents, and maps identifying settlements, indigenous and quilombola areas close to the properties.
3_3_criteria: The mechanisms for complaints and grievances are known to the communities, who can express themselves in person or by telephone . The audited farms have suggestion boxes at their headquarters, as well as a written procedure providing for registration and processing. However, two audited farms, belonging to the same owner, received non-conformities in indicators 3.3.2 and 3.3.3, due to complaints not being fully registered.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are preferably offered to communities local, normally through advertisements on the Internet or by employees themselves. Suppliers of goods and services are local. Normally, properties participate in training programs for the local community offered by SENAR or equivalent entities, contributing to the formation of groups.
4_1_criteria: The group manager develops a socio-environmental assessment of each member through its monitoring and socio-environmental and sustainability assessment. Aspects related to the environmental, labor and work safety areas are raised in a comprehensive and clear manner. Next, the Socio-Environmental Diagnoses of the farms are developed. On an annual basis, farms are monitored and evaluated. Members receive copies of the assessments of their properties and, if necessary, the manager makes extra copies available.
4_2_criteria: Verified through maps of heat sources and interviews that fires are not carried out on farms. Waste is segregated and there is final disposal/destination. Except in the case of one farm, where current proof of used oil collection was not available. Structures are maintained to prevent spills, such as dikes around fuel tanks, lanes for washing machines and structures for storing used oil. Recyclable materials are sent to municipal landfills or sold, when possible. Waste management is covered by a Management Plan prepared by AlianÃ§a da Terra.
4_3_criteria: The audited properties control the use of fossil fuels during soybean cultivation, with monitoring. However, on one of the audited farms, it was not possible to demonstrate the amount of fossil fuel used in soybean cultivation, as well as to state whether there was an increase or not, resulting in non-compliance in indicators 4.3.1 and 4.3.2. All farms monitor the organic matter content through soil analyzes carried out annually. Practices are adopted to contribute to the increase in soil carbon sequestration, such as direct planting, cultivation of cover species, preservation and maintenance of native vegetation and permanent preservation areas.
4_4_criteria: There were no expansions for cultivation of soybeans after May 2009. Maps of properties were verified with comparisons of areas in 2009, 2016 (when applicable) and 2021, describing the dynamics of land use and coverage.
4_5_criteria: Maps of farms are maintained indicating watercourses, areas of native vegetation and production areas. The audited properties prohibit any hunting activities, with prohibition signs installed on the properties being checked. The fauna and flora on the farms are monitored through the RTRS Reports developed by AlianÃ§a da Terra.
5_1_criteria: The properties use good practices such as precision agriculture, direct planting, crop succession, use of agrochemicals in compliance with technical recommendations and maintenance of permanent preservation areas and legal reserve. On properties that use irrigation systems, the climatic conditions and water demand of the crop are respected. However, on one of the farms it was not possible to demonstrate the monitoring of captured volumes, generating non-conformity in indicators 1.1.2/5.1.1.
5_2_criteria: The group manager prepares location maps identifying all courses of water, including the situation of the riparian vegetation on the farms. On all audited farms, riparian vegetation is preserved or in an advanced state of regeneration. Drainage of natural wetland areas was observed on no farm.
5_3_criteria: Good soil conservation practices are adopted, such as direct planting and maintenance of residual straw from the harvest of cover species. Corrective agents and fertilizers are applied in accordance with technical recommendations and soil analysis results. On farms, practices such as contour lines and maintenance of native vegetation are used, facilitating the infiltration of water into the soil and controlling erosion. The properties respect the periods of sanitary emptiness in the states of GoiÃ¡s and Minas Gerais.
5_4_criteria: Documented MIC plans are maintained on the audited farms, with chemical and non-chemical control methods, as well as foreseeing the reduction of potentially harmful products. harmful. Integrated crop management is carried out on properties. The agrochemicals used are registered for soybean cultivation and are purchased with their Agronomic Prescriptions. Agrochemical applications follow the results of field monitoring, with written records being maintained in spreadsheets or electronically through proprietary systems.
5_5_criteria: Controls of products purchased are maintained through their acquisition invoices and applicable stock controls . During applications, details are recorded on manual or electronic forms. The properties have closed agrochemical deposits, with signs, covered and with structures to contain spills. Only one property does not yet have a spill prevention structure. Furthermore, proof of return of empty packaging was not available, generating a non-conformity in indicator 5.5.2. At the time of application, empty packaging is washed and returned to the empty packaging deposits, which are closed, covered and locked. They are then returned to the reception centers, according to the receipts presented. All audited farms follow technical recommendations and soil analysis results when applying correctives and fertilizers.
5_6_criteria: Verified through application records and list of products used that farms do not use products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. There is no evidence of the use of Paraquat on the audited properties.
5_7_criteria: Those responsible for the farms demonstrate knowledge and commitment to the use of biological control. Records of the use of biological products by the properties were verified.
5_8_criteria: Owners and those responsible for the audited farms inform that in the case of outbreaks or incidence of new pests, entities such as MAPA, Embrapa, Coopercitrus or Aprosoja GoiÃ¡s would be contacted.
5_9_criteria: The manager provides procedures containing good practices in the application of pesticides adopted in agricultural management. On properties where aerial applications are used, more than 500 meters away from residences, communities and water bodies are normally respected. However, in two properties it was found that products belonging to WHO class II are used, at distances less than 500 meters from homes and bodies of water, resulting in non-conformities in indicator 5.9.4.
5_10_criteria: In the surroundings of the audited properties there are only similar production systems, using conservation systems and good agricultural practices, and there are no more sensitive production systems, such as organic production. No signs of damage caused to neighboring systems were observed.
5_11_criteria: The audited properties guarantee the legal use of seeds, either through purchase receipts or through declared self-propagated seeds.

Name: Grupo Hervalense
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to the evaluation of documentation at the groups office, verification of structures on the farms, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety and agricultural laws are respected and fulfilled. The company has a legal department that provides input on applicable legislation.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land registrations and title deeds.
1_3_criteria: It was a plan has been carried out to identify the aspects as requested by this item, these being social, environmental and agricultural aspects of the operation (on and off the farm) that must be improved.
2_1_criteria: Adequate working conditions, payment receipts according to the activity carried out with farm employees, training for the functions, in addition to adequate benefits and evidence of the absence of discounts on pay slips that are not in the legislation. No evidence of aggression or disrespect was seen in the work environments, or heard during the interview with workers on the propertys work fronts and work structures. No children under the age of 18 were identified working on the farm.
2_2_criteria: Registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees of the production unit were presented, and are available in easy-to-understand language in the HR department for consultation of the workers. The company and its employees do not follow any union at the moment, as there is no active union in the region. Due and appropriate training has been carried out.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety issues are communicated to employees. The document Rural Work Safety, Health and Environmental Management Program (PGSSMATR) contains the safety risks and describes the examinations and precautions that employees must follow, the risks relating to health and safety issues have been identified. Employees with specific functions are trained. Appropriate protective equipment for each role is provided. Emergency procedures available and understood by employees.
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization, however, there is no active union in the region.
2_5_criteria: Remunerations are compatible with the national legislation, salary and deductions are detailed in the payslips, there were no irregular deductions. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. The hours worked are recorded using a time clock, it was identified that the normal working day exceeds 48 hours per week, as well as overtime exceeds 12 hours per week, at Fazendas Hervalense and Lagoa do Cervo.
3_1_criteria: There are communication and dialogue channels, publicized through signs on the farms.
3_2_criteria: There are no indigenous peoples and places with cultural importance in the areas of influence of the audited farms.
3_3_criteria: Communication channels These are suggestion boxes available internally at the properties and externally through signs with the telephone number, email address Ouviria@hervalesnse@gmail.com, and mailing address. Suggestions and complaints received are handled in a timely manner and documentary evidence is maintained. Interviews were carried out with farm employees, verifying the correct functioning of the grievance and complaints mechanism.
3_4_criteria: Opportunities relating to job offers are offered to the local population through word of mouth among employees and are announced on the SINE. The group collaborates with training programs aimed at the local community, by making the site available on the Hervalense property and employees from other properties can participate.
4_1_criteria: A plan was drawn up to identify and assess social and environmental risks
4_2_criteria: Actions to minimize impacts are being taken, such as reuse and recycling of materials, through selective collection and all hazardous waste in the groups production units are stored appropriately for environmentally correct disposal.
4_3_criteria: Fuel registration is in accordance with the agricultural activities carried out. The use of fertilizer is done according to soil analyses, where organic matter is also monitored. Areas of environmental interest are maintained and preserved in the groups production units.
4_4_criteria: Through maps and satellite photos, it was verified that the soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of areas considered as AAVC.
4_5_criteria: Areas of environmental interest are respected and conserved by the administration of the groups production units. Native vegetation on the farm is above 20%, in accordance with federal legislation with the New Forest Code.
5_1_criteria: Monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption is done through water analysis , presented during the audit and contamination of soil and water in the groups production units is verified.
5_2_criteria: Permanent Preservation Areas are defined in maps of the groups production units, with no evidence that the vegetation was removed or altered.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation and soil analysis are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the groups production units.
5_4_criteria: The monitoring record of pests and weeds found in the areas is done through a visit report, present in the agrarian cooperatives field notebook. Control snows are established in accordance with the EMBRAPA SOJA methodology.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical applications contain information such as purchased products, applied dose, installments, application dates and weather conditions. Storage follows the recommendations of NR 31.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the groups production units.
5_7_criteria: Biological agents are used in the groups production units.
5_8_criteria: To identify and monitor new invasive species and pests in the area, the group has a described procedure, citing research institutions such as Embrapa and Universities.
5_9_criteria: The conditions Atmospheric conditions such as wind, humidity and temperature before application are recorded in the pesticide application forms in the groups production units.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the production units of the group.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds are from reliable sources, according to the purchase invoices and Terms of Compliance presented.

Name: Grupo de Produtores CJ Selecta
1_1_criteria: The farm remains up to date with applicable laws through contact between the sectors and legal bodies, as well as through consultancies. Although most of the farms comply with legal requirements, cases of non-compliance with the Consolidation of Labor Laws were identified, exceeding the maximum limit of 2 daily overtime hours and disagreement with intra- and inter-shift payments. Although water analyzes had already been carried out at sources of human consumption, non-conformities were identified due to the lack of evidence proving the potability of the water, since the reports had not been issued at the time of the audit. Non-Compliance: During harvest periods, employees work more than two hours of overtime per day without the presence of a convention or collective agreement. Non-Compliance: The working time is less than 1 hour without the presence of a collective agreement or convention (item III of article 611-A of the CLT). The working time is less than 11 hours between two working days (article 66 of the CLT). In such cases, intra-day and inter-day hours are not paid to employees. Non-Compliance: There are no analysis reports ensuring the potability of the water consumed by employees.
1_2_criteria: The properties have their own and leased areas with registrations and lease contracts evidencing the right to use the land.
1_3_criteria: The units defined indicators to be improved, covering at least one topic from each principle of the RTRS Standard. The indicators are described in the Socio-Environmental Diagnosis document.
2_1_criteria: Employees are free to leave the farm and have adequate working and housing conditions. At the farm office, only copies of employee documents are retained, obtained shortly after hiring and attached to the files. There are no children under 18 working on the properties. During the interviews, employees reported not suffering corporal punishment, any coercive methods or types of abuse and intimidation.
2_2_criteria: Employees have signed employment contracts attached to their files. Labor rights, as well as appropriate forms of conduct, are communicated to employees through integration training immediately after hiring. However, there are no records demonstrating that these trainings were carried out. Despite not being fulfilled, compliance with indicator 2.2.2 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards. The farm provides vocational training to employees. Topics relating to the execution of functions, procedures and work instructions are covered.
2_3_criteria: Those responsible for the farm demonstrated knowledge and understanding of occupational health and safety issues. The farms PGR/PGSSMATR and PCMSO are updated annually. For potentially dangerous tasks, employees undergo health monitoring examinations, as well as occupational safety training. Upon receiving the PPE, employees sign a delivery form, which describes the PPE received, as well as a liability and obligation statement. The use of PPE is checked by the occupational safety technician. Emergency procedures are transmitted to employees through training. The farm has first aid kits on the farm facilities, as well as a vehicle available for transport.
2_4_criteria: Although the local union does not maintain frequent contact with employees, they are free to contribute or not. Although it has been verified that employees are not prevented from carrying out collective bargaining in conjunction with local unions, there are no collective agreements or conventions in force at the moment.
2_5_criteria: Although there is no collective agreement or convention, the lowest salary -base paid in the unit is higher than the national minimum wage. Copies of payment receipts are retained by the unit. As verified in the payment statements, no deductions are made that are not provided for by law, such as INSS and IRRF. Hours worked are recorded according to the number of hours worked by employees. Cases were found in which 12 hours of overtime per week and the average of 60 total hours per week were exceeded during the harvest. During visits, the lack of MSDS in the pesticide deposit on a farm was also identified. Non-Compliance: During harvest periods, more than 12 hours of overtime are worked per week, with the average number of hours worked in the two-month period after the start of the harvest exceeding 60 total hours. Non-Compliance: There is no MSDS for the products in the pesticide deposit.
3_1_criteria: The local community can contact the farm via email or telephone, available on the property entrance sign. Furthermore, they have communication procedures that standardize the treatment of complaints and suggestions received from both the local community and employees.
3_2_criteria: The group manager has maps identifying the regions where there are institutional areas, constituted by the Units of Conservation of Sustainable Use and Integral Protection and Indigenous Lands. There are no indigenous areas close to the property.
3_3_criteria: Workers can make complaints and complaints through WhatsApp, the complaints box or directly at the farm office. Such complaints may be made anonymously or not. Employees are aware of the mechanisms, as verified during the interviews.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised through local recommendations, and are advertised among residents of the region. Furthermore, they have communication procedures that standardize the handling of complaints and suggestions received from both the local community and employees. Currently, the majority of farm employees are residents of the region. Inputs and services are mostly obtained from the region. The farm participates in social projects and donations in the city, however there are no records that show such activities. Despite not being met, compliance with indicator 3.4.2 will only be required from the second surveillance audit onwards.
4_1_criteria: Properties included in the certification group undergo a social and environmental assessment before its inclusion. The topics of the RTRS Production Standard are fully covered during the assessment, as well as all activities carried out on the farm. Although the farm has established measures to minimize the identified impacts, there is no evidence of monitoring for all of these measures. Although it is not being met, compliance with indicator 4.1.4 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards.
4_2_criteria: It was verified through maps with the history of the heat source in the areas of the farm that are not burned at the unit. The topics of the RTRS Production Standard are fully covered during the assessment, as well as all activities carried out on the farm. The farm separates hazardous waste and stores it in a suitable location. Hazardous waste is sent to specialized companies. Both hazardous and non-hazardous waste are stored and disposed of, as described in the Solid Waste Management Plan Â– PGRS.
4_3_criteria: Measurements of fuel use are carried out in the farms workshop by employees and recorded in an Excel spreadsheet. Soil organic matter is monitored through soil analysis. Good agricultural practices are used to maintain the soil and cover crops are used. Permanent preservation areas are maintained on the property, increasing carbon sequestration
4_4_criteria: The comparative maps developed by the group manager demonstrate that there were no openings of areas after May 2009.
4_5_criteria: The farms have a map of properties containing consolidated open areas, native vegetation, permanent preservation areas and watercourses. The unit has the Ecosystem and Wildlife Conservation Program, which aims to identify native vegetation and wildlife, in addition to establishing measures for the conservation, protection and recovery of natural ecosystems on the farm. Hunting and fishing are prohibited on the farmâ€™s territories. The property has prohibition warning signs at several points.
5_1_criteria: The units monitor the quality and quantity of water resources, such as the underground collection well. Good agricultural practices are adopted in various situations, such as direct planting, soil cover, prevention of erosion and application of fertilizers according to the dosage recommended by experts.
5_2_criteria: Verified during visits and on maps that forests are present in the rivers. No points for removing natural vegetation were identified in riparian areas. There are no wetlands that have been drained on the properties.
5_3_criteria: Soil analyzes are carried out and the results and monitoring are carried out by agronomists. Several practices are applied to preserve the soil, such as direct planting, crop rotation, fertilizer dosage based on soil analysis, road maintenance and soil cover. There is no land with a steep slope on the farms. Erosion is controlled through contour lines, cover plants and maintenance of property roads.
5_4_criteria: Biological controls are used as an alternative way to reduce of pesticides and MIC. Both pesticides and fertilizers are original and purchased from licensed companies, and are accompanied by invoices and agronomic prescriptions. Monitoring records for pests, natural predators, diseases and weeds are carried out and maintained.
5_5_criteria: Records on the use of agrochemicals are made using agronomic prescriptions and kept at the farm office. Agrochemical suppliers transport them to the units. Empty agrochemical packaging is triple-washed after use, punctured and stored in a dedicated warehouse. After storage, they are taken to authorized collection points.
5_6_criteria: The farms do not use products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. Land application spreadsheets are highlighted, which contain all the agrochemicals used by the farms.
5_7_criteria: The requirements for the use of biological control agents are available in the agricultural system. Biological control agents are used on the property to combat pests. When such products are used, records similar to the use of chemical products are made and recorded.
5_8_criteria: There are no cases of new pests or diseases. The farms have communication with responsible bodies in the region. In case of new pests or diseases, monitoring and communication are carried out.
5_9_criteria: Records of weather conditions and application times are made. Drift is controlled by the farm based on each product applied and the current weather conditions. Pesticides are not applied within a 30m radius of populated areas or bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: There is no evidence of interference in neighboring production systems, the forms of cultivation and cultures are consolidated and similar to that of the farm , such as soybeans and corn.
5_11_criteria: Seeds are purchased from licensed seedbeds. Part of the seeds are saved by some farms that presented RENASEM. The saved seeds are used only for own production, without commercialization.

Name: Wellington Pereira Lima - Gebana Goias
1_1_criteria: The applicable legislation is known to the companys employees. Interviews were carried out with the Manager and owner of the farm. During the audit, the documentation of the farms, CAR, deeds with the appropriate registrations, lease contract, Environmental License, employee training in the activities carried out, PPE (Personal Protection Equipment) delivery form, signage in risk areas and danger, emergency procedures described in the work fronts. Verification of infrastructure, interviews with those responsible for the areas (Farm Manager and Administrative Manager) and knowledge of applicable laws was demonstrated. The cultivated areas are organic, so they do not use pesticides. A total of 09 records were checked on the audited farm, of field employees (Machine Operators, Multipurpose Workers, among others) and farm employees (Mechanic, Driver, Warehouse, among others) with - employment contracts, employee records, card point, pay slips (payments and discounts) and medical examinations that were compared with the Occupational Health Medical Control Program - PCMSO and PGRTR. Environmental licenses, rural environmental registry (CAR), grants, potability analysis, among other documents.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and land ownership deeds. During the audit, the registrations of the areas of the audited farm were checked and it was found that the productive areas are owned areas that have registrations and the leased areas have land use contracts.
1_3_criteria: The farm presented external audit reports , covering social, environmental and agricultural requirements. The aspects to be improved were identified and continuous improvement is being carried out through monitoring, showing the farms commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, imposed, trafficked labor and/or involuntary. The work environments were checked and during the audit interviews were carried out with farm workers. There were also no reports of infractions by employees. The Ministry of Labors Slave Labor List updated on October 6, 2021; was consulted and no farms in scope were identified on this list. https://www.gov.br/trabalho-e-previdencia/pt- br/composicao/orgaos-especificos/secretaria-de-trabalho/inspecao/areas- de-atuacao/cadastro_de_emplo- res.pdf. Adequate working conditions. Payment receipts according to the activity carried out by each farm employee. Training for the roles, in addition to adequate benefits. The absence of discounts on payslips that are not permitted by law was highlighted. No evidence of aggression or disrespect was seen in the records presented, or heard during the interview with workers on the propertys work fronts and work structures. No children under 18 were identified working on the farm. No discrimination regarding race, sex, religion, etc. was evidenced during the evaluation of HR documentation, pay stubs and interviews with farm employees.
2_2_criteria: The language used in hiring documents and pay stubs is easy to understand and available at the accounting office for access. The activities relating to each activity and job position are described in the contract and employees are aware of their duties. Training regarding occupational health and safety standards is carried out and attendance lists, certificates and presentations made are recorded to control qualification. Training of machine operators, application of pesticides and first responders. Meetings held by the producer on issues of discrimination, labor rights, Occupational Safety, Health and hygiene evidenced.
2_3_criteria: Employees are knowledgeable about health and safety issues. Presentation of the PGRTR (Rural Work Risk Management Program) prepared by the Safety Technician, valid for 3 years, identifying the risks and control procedures and the PCMSO prepared by the occupational physician. The ASOs were also presented with the examinations of the 6 employees and no irregularities were found. Employees with specific functions are trained. The appropriate protective equipment for each function is used correctly. Emergency procedures available and understood by employees. Employees who perform risky functions receive specific training. This conduct was evidenced through attendance lists and training certificates, such as: NR-35 Work at Height, NR-33 Confined Space, NR 31.12 Machines and Equipment, NR-23 Fire Fighting in 2019. NR 20 - Flammable liquids, First Aid, among others. All records checked by sampling have training records and are in compliance with legislation. The farm has a verification mechanism such as warning systems for employees, described in the PGRTR, informed in the work order. There is training in first aid, fire brigade, first aid kits and vehicles intended for transport, signposts with telephone numbers for the nearest hospital/emergency room.
2_4_criteria: The workers are not affiliated with any organization, as does not exist in the region. However, they are free to join any organization they wish. Workers right to collective bargaining is not denied. During the interviews with the employees and the owner, it was possible to identify the absence of impediments to the interaction of employees with external parties outside working hours.
2_5_criteria: The remunerations are compatible with national legislation, the lowest salary on the farm is R$1,744.00 and the minimum wage is R$1,212.00. The payslips detail salaries and deductions, there were no irregular deductions. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. Hours worked are recorded using a time clock, overtime occurs within the limit permitted by legislation. Evidenced absence of potability analysis at the time of the audit. The request protocol was verified on 5/9/22 under process no. 1899-2/2022.
3_1_criteria: The Wellington producer has established communication with the community, as he is known in the region. Signs with information about communication channels are available outside the farm. The farms phone number and email address are on the signs. Anyone has the right to question activities. Suggestions and/or complaints are analyzed by the owner and appropriate measures are taken for possible corrections.
3_2_criteria: No disputes over land use were identified. The farm presents registration documents and deeds that prove the right to use it. There are no indigenous peoples and places with cultural importance in the areas of influence of the audited farm. All areas can be identified through Google Earth.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and grievances are checked monthly and responses are passed on to DDS for employees in general. At the entrance to the farm there are signs with telephone numbers available for contact and complaints from the community that the farm owner can evaluate.
3_4_criteria: Job opportunities are advertised locally by employees. It is evident through interviews and registration sheets that the hired workers come from communities close to the farms. The farm helps local communities with social projects such as: University of the State of GoiÃ¡s, where it contributes to student visits to experience agriculture in practice.
4_1_criteria: Social, environmental and agricultural assessment is carried out through an external audit, which occurs in an impartial manner. From the report, points for improvement are identified and the appropriate measures and corrections are taken to minimize impacts. The items to be improved, as well as the summary of the report, are available upon request.
4_2_criteria: The farm does not burn crop residues or residues. Direct planting and crop rotation practices (organic sugarcane) are used as a soil preservation measure. The farm presents a Waste management plan that includes the actions taken in relation to the waste generated by the farm, including the selective collection of recyclable materials initiative. Proper management and final disposal of batteries and tires demonstrated. For the waste mentioned, proof of disposal was presented by accredited companies, guaranteeing the correct destination. Fuel oil is not stored properly. Sawdust and shovels are used to collect small leaks. The Waste Management Plan document is highlighted, which describes the actions and goals (achieving 100% recycling, reducing possible sources of contamination and recycling education program) with the aim of training employees on actions related to waste generated on the property.
4_3_criteria: Fuel recording is carried out daily and at the end of the harvest the annual consumption is obtained. Fuel consumption is recorded manually at the pump and then passed on to administrative management. Information on the volume per hectare and per unit of product is monitored in all activities related to soybean production. Soil monitoring is carried out through annual analyzes by a third-party company. Measures such as crop rotation, direct planting and preservation of native forest are implemented to improve and conserve the soil.
4_4_criteria: As of May 2009, there has been no cleaning or conversion of preserved areas. Evidenced through satellite images (Google Earth) and maps of deforestation dynamics from the years 2000, 2008, 2016 and 2022 were presented and the absence of land conversion after 2009 was evident.
4_5_criteria: There are maps with native vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Production maps and satellite images demonstrated that native vegetation is maintained in accordance with federal law. The farm has an Environmental Diagnosis, which addresses the APP areas. Hunting and fishing activities are not permitted on the propertys areas. Evidenced through signposts, interviews with employees and instructions to employees through DDS.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices are implemented to preserve and recharge the aquifer. Effluents are not disposed of in waterways. The farm does not use pesticides or fertilizers, so there is no chemical residue from pesticides and fertilizers. Water samples are collected to analyze its quality. Verified through field visits and interviews that there is no irrigation on the farm.
5_2_criteria: The water courses and APPs are mapped. The socio-environmental diagnosis document, carried out by an external company, demonstrates that the APP areas are being recovered throughout the property through natural regeneration. The farm carries out an internal Environmental Diagnosis, which includes APP areas. The Environmental Check-list document which demonstrates the APPs that are being recovered throughout the property through natural regeneration, including wetlands and rivers, maps of production areas and satellite images presented during the audit.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality monitoring is carried out through analyzes of organic matter, carried out by an external company. Erosion control activities are carried out through direct planting, crop rotation and soil cover. Soil analyzes are carried out to monitor organic matter and managed in the farms Excel spreadsheet. The farm uses level planting to minimize the chances of erosion.
5_4_criteria: The farm adopts Integrated Pest and Disease Management monitoring, where they manage soybeans through various activities, such as the use of Non-GMO seeds , biological control, cultural practices. All farm activities are recorded. Pest monitoring is carried out. The farm is certified Organic, does not use pesticides and fertilizers. Biological applications, when necessary, follow the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Farm manager. Application records (caterpillar control) and work orders were checked. All application follows the agronomic and manufacturers recommendation for its application.
5_5_criteria: The farm does not use fertilizers and pesticides. The records made are of biological products. Properly carried out storage and disposal location. There are signs indicating the application of biological products. Evidenced document "Input application record" and records in the system, which has the history of climatic conditions" which contains all data on meteorological conditions. The unit only uses biological materials when necessary. Evidenced during interviews, visits to the property that areas recently treated with biological products are identified.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions. Paraquat is not used. evidenced by the list of products used for soybeans in the farm, list of pesticides, application records and visits to the location of stored products.
5_7_criteria: Use of biological control is made through the recommendation of the Agricultural Engineer and the applications are recorded. The farm does not use agrochemicals for have organic production. The products used have a purchase receipt and the packaging is disposed of properly even if they are organic. It was evidenced through an interview with the technical manager that, when necessary, products based on Bacillus thuringiensis are used. The document "Input application record" is presented, which contains the products purchased and applied, quantity, date and area.
5_8_criteria: The farm owner informed that the Agrodefesa agency carries out a visit to the property through EMATER. Procedures are highlighted so that if new pests occur, Agrodefesa is notified.
5_9_criteria: Climatic conditions are monitored and applications are carried out when conditions are favorable. The neighboring areas produce soybeans and aerial applications are not carried out. Procedure "Good Agricultural Practices" are adopted. Evidenced through maps that production areas are more than 30 meters from populated areas and bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: Measures are taken to avoid interference in the production system. It was evidenced through an interview with an agricultural manager that the management is organic and there are no interferences in neighboring areas.
5_11_criteria: The seeds used by the farm are from a suitable source and present Invoices and the respective Terms of Compliance. The farm does not have its own seed production. Seed purchase invoices were presented, health certificate was verified.

Name: Saag Comercial Exportadora Ltda – No-GMO
1_1_criteria: The company has access to applicable legislation and is complied with. Collaborators demonstrated knowledge and relevant documents were available.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations, lease contracts and CCIR Â– INCRA
1_3_criteria: The aspects were identified and continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, showing the companys commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and pertinent information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units. At the Flamboyant and Cachoeira farm, the employees responsible for supply do not have NR 20 training.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the agricultural unit.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as the SAAG website, group manager (https://scisaag.wordpress.com/reclamacoes/), containing emails telephone numbers , postal address on roads between the community and farms with advertising signs
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements. The places of importanceÃ¢
3_3_criteria: A complaints and complaints mechanism is available, described in the groups operational procedures. The mechanism establishes a procedure for recording and handling complaints, through a complaints and complaints form, available at un
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the production unit and internal vacancies on the farms and disseminated through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fills out the request for
4_1_criteria: Socio-environmental assessment available, in the document called Monitoring Schedules and Programs, there are identified points and measures to minimize or mitigate the identified impacts. There is also a schedule for implementing the prop actions
4_2_criteria: Storing waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging appropriately. The Environmental Control Plan presented during the audit includes waste management including all areas of the property.
4_3_criteria: The unit promotes actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and monitored organic matter in the soil.
4_4_criteria: It has been shown through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling the areas of
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and assist in the quality of surface and groundwater.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, however, in the Environmental Control Plan, which shows the actions proposed by the farms to adapt to the new forest code, there is schedule for the restoration of some areas. There are no nat wetlands
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analysis, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion control and crop rotation techniques are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: The integrated crop management plan and targets for reducing phytosanitary products were presented. List and invoices for the purchase of products were available, demonstrating that they use products that comply with Brazilian legislation.
5_5_criteria: Records of pesticide application on farms in the scope are made manually and recorded in spreadsheets, covering the indicator information. Storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements.
5_6_criteria: During field verification on agrochemical application fronts, retroactive application records and storage. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of
5_7_criteria: No evidence of the use of biological control agents was found.
5_8_criteria: There were no incidences of new pests that have not been identified, according to the records presented. "Control of New Pests and Diseases" procedure available, in the case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact you
5_9_criteria: Standard Operating Procedure - Pesticide Care - Deriva, addressing the precautions, was presented. mainly wind in agricultural pesticide applications. There is no aerial application on farms within the scope.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources. The purchase of seeds from legal sources is evidenced through Invoices and the Seed Compliance Terms.

Name: SLC Agrícola S.A.
1_1_criteria: It was evidenced through documentary evaluation that SLC AgrÃ­cola has standardized PRO.015 - Identification of Legal Requirements and Other Requirements for all farms in the group, which contains the systematics used to identify and have access to legislation, regulations, documents, policies, codes and other subscribed requirements applicable to environmental and social aspects and occupational hazards of activities, products and services. Compliance with all legislation is controlled through the Digital Platform, which displays in indicators the quantification of all applicable laws, as well as the quantification of how many are currently complied with and how many are in progress.
1_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentary assessment, the supporting documents of the Farms in relation to land use, being in compliance.
1_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary assessment, the report with indicators extracted for assessment and monitoring, Health and Safety, Social Responsibility and Environment, being in compliance with legislation. The POL document was presented. 032 see 04, which contains the following information: Â“This management takes place through indicators related to social, environmental and health and safety issues that are related to day-to-day activities, strategic planning and other routines relevant to carrying out of such management. Monitored annually through the systems (management of the Integrated Management System) and also the system (management of Strategic Planning objectives and goals)Â”.
2_1_criteria: According to interviews with employees, employees are free to leave the farm when their shifts end. They informed that the farm provides buses to take them to the municipality, for those who do not live on the farms. According to an interview with employees and the person in charge and through documentary analysis of payslips and delivery of documents, they reported that the farm pays regularly on the correct day or even in advance via deposit into a current account. It was possible to demonstrate that no worker is obliged to leave their identity documents with other people and no part of their salary, benefits or belongings is retained by owners or third parties. Evidenced through the interview that some employees live on the farm, they reported that their spouses and children are free to choose to work or not on the properties. As observed in various locations on the property and near their homes and in interviews with employees, there are children on the farm aged 0 to 16, all of whom are enrolled in schools. It is visually evident that children do not have access to the operational area of the farm, as it is divided by bars separating the Operational Area from the Social Area and to enter the Operational Area they have to go through the guardhouse and identify. The SLC group makes its employees aware of the importance of childrens literacy and provides school transport to send children to school in the nearest districts. It was evident in the list of employees provided by the farms, which included the name, position, age, date of admission of employees, that there are no children in the production areas and no minors (under 18 years old) performing dangerous work or any work that may put your moral, physical or mental well-being at risk. As evidenced through documentary evaluation, workers remuneration according to job and salary plan, ownership follows the collective agreement. Through documentary analysis of training records and interviews with employees, it was evidenced that workers have equal access to training, benefits and equal promotion opportunities, and the disclosure of internal and external vacancies. In an interview with employees and document evaluation in the Code of Ethics and Conduct procedure, it was stated that he had never experienced corporal punishment, oppression, mental or physical coercion, physical or verbal abuse, sexual harassment or any other type of intimidation within the environment. of work.
2_2_criteria: Evidenced the employment contracts dated upon admission and duly signed by all sampled employees, containing in the contract: value corresponding to salaries, working hours and entry and exit times, activities to be carried out by the employee, authorized discounts, care for the companys assets, responsibility for the use of PPE and sanctions for non-use, confidentiality agreement, prohibitions, benefits, trial period. Evidenced through an interview, at the time of hiring, the employee is integrated following all the topics in the Integration Manual and at the end of the training the employee can clarify all doubts and an Integration Term is signed making them aware of all the farms rules. Through interviews with employees: it was possible to demonstrate that they understand the procedures to be followed, disseminated throughout the company. It is evidenced through documentary evaluation that the organization provides workers with training, courses and DDS with topics related to worker health and safety, machine operation, handling of pesticides, EPIS delivery forms, all EPIS indicated in the PGRTR and others. Regarding the training of the sampled employees, certificates and courses were highlighted.
2_3_criteria: It was evident visually and through interviews that employees receive information to provide assistance when an emergency occurs, first they have to inform the guardhouse then the guardhouse transmits to the OSH coordinator and the Nursing Technician who carry out the first procedures, the Farms provide an ambulance for more urgent care. Evidenced through visual assessment, the Farm has emergency signs at Â‘Â’LargadaÂ’Â’ (central place where everyone gathers to carry out the DDS before leaving for work) and emergency signs with name and telephone number in case of illnesses or accidents that require assistance. Evidenced visually and through interviews, there are key points on the property with rescue and first aid kits available, only minor injuries or minor accidents are treated. The entire Cipa team is trained in first aid, in addition to this, employees who are not members of the CIPA team are also shown, with certificates from the teams training courses. It was evidenced through the interviews that the employees, all demonstrated to be aware of health and safety standards, used PPE and the delivery list of the same was evidenced in accordance with the PPE listed in the service order and signs with instructions for the use of Mandatory PPE in easy-to-view places in risk areas, this information is received through the Integration carried out at admission, in the DDS (Weekly Daily Dialogue), in First Aid training, in SIPATR. They reported that each sector has scheduled days to carry out changes, but if something happens to the PPE it can be exchanged at any time, just ask for authorization from the sector coordinator and that anyone who is not using the PPE is charged by the work team themselves. .
2_4_criteria: It was evident through the interviews that the farm allows everyone to join the Union and that everyone has the free will to deduct the union contribution or not. It was evidenced through visual assessment and interviews that the farm allows the union to hold meetings with workers, and that the dates of these meetings are made available on the bulletin boards in each sector and the DDS is carried out with the Field Coordinators and for other functions the notices are carried out through the specific DDS, the farm has a WhatsApp Group where all the days notices are sent, it was possible to demonstrate that all workers have the right to participate in collective negotiations when there is interest. According to interviews with managers and employees, employees are given free access to interact with external parties outside of working hours.
2_5_criteria: It was evidenced through the documentary evaluation of employees pay slips that the workers gross salaries are in accordance with national legislation and sectoral agreements and are paid at least monthly. In interviews with employees, it was evident that only legal deductions or those authorized by employees are made. All legal and optional salary deductions are explained to employees and optional ones are explained to employees during Integration (theme is highlighted in the training material). Everyone has access to paychecks in physical form. Evidenced through an evaluation of employees time sheets, that overtime worked within the limits permitted by law, up to 2 overtime hours and during the harvest season (harvesting and planting) up to 4 overtime hours as per convention, as long as approved by the supervisor, is communicated employees in advance to plan ahead. Evidenced through document analysis (slips) and interviews that employees are entitled to at least one day off for every six consecutive days of work. Evidenced visually and through interviews that each sector has an Electronic clock point, the farm provides employees with a system to record hours worked directly on their cell phones, employees download the application and record hours worked, for employees who do not have access by phone, the employee goes to the coordinator who provides the cell phone for registration. According to an interview with the HR coordinators, documents evaluated, it was evidenced that the group follows the national law regarding maternity, salaried workers enjoy all the rights and protections provided in practice and have the right to return to their jobs under the same terms and conditions in force prior to the license. Employees are registered under a monthly CLT regime. For families of employees who live on the property and have school-age children, the city hall bus comes to the property every day to take the children to the nearest district school. When employees are on the farm, food is taken through a marmibox and employees have lunch in mobile or fixed cafeterias depending on the field. Evidenced in various parts of the farm, drinking fountains that have a supply point for thermos bottles in these places there was a sign informing drinking, chilled and natural water, disposable cups on the support next to them, available to employees, evidenced by the record sheet Â“Exchange of drinking water filterÂ” and Control and Maintenance Water tanksÂ”. The accommodation is made of masonry, is in good condition, has a bathroom in each room with hot water, air conditioning, two bunk beds in each room, two closets in each room, the electrical installations do not pose any risks. It is visually evident that the farm has a Social Club that is outsourced, providing snacks, savory snacks, pizzas and drinks, the owner is the same person who provides the meals, open from Tuesday to Sunday. Evidenced through photographic evaluation, a sign displayed at the entrance of the property, containing the communication channels. According to visual assessment, it was found that at the farm headquarters there is an identification plate for the areas that have been and will be applied, and this is available to all workers, in addition, on the margins of the applied plots, there are identification plates, thus marking areas whose re-entry is prohibited without the appropriate use of EPIS.
3_1_criteria: According to visual assessment, it was evident that the farms provide an information sign containing identification, telephone number, websites and e-mails for contact at their entrance. In an interview that the guardhouse has an internal and external communication form, the person responsible for the guardhouse informs the communication channels (telephone, website and e-mail) for the appropriate complaints and/or suggestions, available to all employees, contractors and visitors. The information is transmitted at the time of Integration (employees, contractors and visitors). Evidenced through visual evaluation and through the records presented, the farms have a system for receiving and recording complaints/various communications received, analyzing the cause and recording the return of the treatment to the complainant, and such communication channels adequately allow communication between the farm and the community. Evidenced through document evaluation, integration training is carried out, as well as visitors, in which everyone is informed about the Â“LOSS PREVENTION PROGRAMÂ”, this being a channel that everyone can use to report various situations occurring on the property, in addition Furthermore, it is carried out as described in PRO.031 - Customer Satisfaction rev. 01, every 2 years a satisfaction survey is carried out, and if complaints are reported about SLCs services and activities, they are registered using FORM 285 Â– Customer Complaint Record Rev .00. For complaints that require corrective action, as described in the procedure, it is necessary to complete the Action Plan with the actions that will be carried out to resolve the problem and the deadline for returning to the interested party is 2 days.
3_2_criteria: Not applicable, as there are no places of cultural, ecological, economic or religious importance and fundamental resources to satisfy the basic needs of local communities and indigenous peoples in the vicinity of the properties.
3_3_criteria: According to visual assessment, evidenced that The farms provide an information board at their entrance containing identification, telephone number, websites and contact emails. The farm records and maintains files on complaints received and they are duly dealt with. Both internal and external communication/complaint demands have a processing flow until they are completed. A management report from the Contact channel was presented with the complaint rates (quantity, sectors involved, investigation and response time, nature of the complaint and others). ).
3_4_criteria: Evidenced through document evaluation, that job vacancies are advertised locally and via the SLC Agricola website. Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the farms provide the local community with the possibility of training, as well as giving preference to regional companies to provide services.
4_1_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the company carries out a social and environmental, and the assessment is carried out by qualified and trained people, Identification of Environmental Aspects and Impacts, which sets out the procedures for identifying and reassessing the environmental aspects and impacts of activities, products and services related to the companys activities. The company has archived the social and environmental assessment report and it was presented, which contains a summary of the actions implemented in the environmental, social and agricultural areas, exposing the improvements implemented during the year taken by the farms in relation to socio-environmental themes. In relation to social responsibility, POL.024_Social Responsibility Policy was presented, in which the main objective is to establish the positioning of the SLC Group for the management of social responsibility related to the activities of its companies, this survey being carried out through the LAIS - Survey of Social Aspects and Impacts
4_2_criteria: According to visual assessment of the Farms production areas, no areas with signs of fire were identified. It was evident through visual assessment that there are signs indicating the prohibition of the use of fire, with suitable places for storing fuel. It was evidenced visually and through interviews that the batteries are stored in a safe and secure location (Contaminated Waste Center), on pallets, separated from other contaminated materials, such as: burlap, PPEÂ’s, lamps, air filter, hoses all separated from each other. of others and identified and also have waste deposits suitable for storing different types of materials, such as used tires, burnt oil and other materials, places with appropriate containment kits duly identified, and containing collectors, sawdust and shovels. Several points were identified on the farm with material collectors separated by type (paper, plastic, metal, organic), which are subsequently sent to selective collection units for recycling. The burned oil storage location has containment walls, separator boxes, channels, signage, adequate flooring and the containment materials are the same as those used for gas stations. The company has a documented waste management plan. It was evident visually and through interviews that the farm has a Sewage Treatment Station, the company contracted to carry out all preventive maintenance once a month. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, outgoing invoices referring to waste disposal, disposal of recyclable plastic waste and disposal of recyclable metal. It is visually evident that the washing ramp has an impermeable floor, signage signs, a Washing Center risk map plate, fire extinguishers, oil and water separator boxes. The washing of tractors and cars and the water flows through the channels to the tank and the hose pulls the water to the containment box and the mud mixed with oil is collected and deposited in the contaminated container and is stored in the Contaminated deposit for disposal.
4_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that fossil fuel consumption is monitored in all activities related to soybean and corn production, several units of the group demonstrated a reduction in the use of fossil fuels. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that the farms carry out soil analysis, containing the monitoring of macro and micronutrients. The SLC AgrÃ­cola Group, as a group, encourages projects related to the reduction of greenhouse gases, as stated in the Integrated Report, promotes the Forest Enrichment project, which aims to expand carbon sequestration in vegetation areas maintained by farms, such as Reserve Legal and permanent preservation areas, among others.
4_4_criteria: According to documentary evaluation, the PaiaguÃ¡s, Palmares, Pamplona, Panorama, ParnaÃ­ba, Perdizes, Pioneira, Planalto, Planeste and Planorte farms are in compliance with the requirements of soybean expansion.
4_5_criteria: According to visual and documentary evaluation, maps of the properties were presented, counting the legal reserve areas, Permanent Protection Areas and production areas of the property, and the indication of watercourses . According to a visual assessment, it was observed that the farm has several points with signs prohibiting hunting and fishing within the property, in addition, information regarding this prohibition is also included in the Integration Training. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that the units of production have the appropriate registrations in the CAR and meet more than the provisions of the RTRS protocol, having more than 10% of native vegetation. Confirmed through documentary evaluation, that the PaiaguÃ¡s farm, in a highlighted initiative of the SLC corporate, started a partnership, aiming at a Diagnosis project of Flora (shrubs and trees) and Fauna (Ictiofauna, Herpetofauna, Avifauna and Mastofauna).
5_1_criteria: According to an interview with the agronomist, conservation techniques are used such as crop rotation, livestock crop integration (millet and brachiaria), green manure, direct planting, terracing preventing the runoff of surface rainwater, performs soil, chemical and physical analysis annually. It is evident through visual assessment that the farm carries out crop rotation, integration of crops, livestock, green manure, direct planting and terracing to raise the level curve, preventing the runoff of surface rainwater. There were no situations of contamination of water courses, precisely because the farms were concerned about reducing the speed of runoff and adopting conservation techniques. Dry farming on Pioneira, Perdizes and PaiaguÃ¡s Farms. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the planning report for sustainable use of water and energy in the production areas of the Palmares farm.
5_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentary and visual evaluation, the maps containing the identification of plots, RL areas and water courses. There are no open PRADÂ’s on the properties and evidenced through documentary evaluation report of the GREENHOUSE GAS MANAGEMENT PROJECT - GHG GAS REDUCTION AND MITIGATION PLAN, reforestation project of unproductive "clearances" areas. There is no water collection in watercourses or in naturally humid areas. According to documentary evaluation, of the 16 properties of the agricultural SLC, only 2 are irrigated crops, the rest being rainfed crops.
5_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that the farm carries out soil analysis, Agricultural Planning - Indicators of soil fertility, containing the monitoring of macro and micronutrients and OM, making fertilization recommendations according to the crops needs and considering what already exists in the soil. Conservation techniques are used, such as crop rotation, crop-livestock integration (millet and brachiaria), green manure, direct planting, terracing, preventing the runoff of surface rainwater, and annual soil, chemical and physical analysis. Evidenced through visual assessment on the Farms, that the conservation techniques mentioned by agronomists are implemented on the properties.
5_4_criteria: Also evidenced through documentary assessment, the record referring to localized applications, which directs the application of the product directly in the area where the economic damage was identified. Thus reducing machine time in the field, less product expenditure, less soil stress due to reduced machinery traffic, and still, controlling the imbalance identified in the crop. Evidenced through document evaluation that the Farms have documented procedures regarding Integrated Pest and Disease Management, input purchase invoices and agronomic prescriptions. It is clear that all pesticides are in their original packaging, with labels and leaflets, and are applied as set out in the agronomic recipe. Evidenced through interviews, monitoring is carried out through a Digital Platform, which has a monitoring resource, heat map.
5_5_criteria: Evidenced through documentation, application orders containing the products applied, quantities and dates , names of the people who applied and prepared the mixture, identification of the equipment, and weather conditions at the time of application. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, proof of packaging destination and proof of return of empty pesticide packaging. It was evidenced through visual assessment and interviews that the deposit of empty pesticide packaging has an eye wash shower, signage signs, has a screen in the ventilation openings, restricted access, the farm carries out triple washing and also renders the packaging useless, which in turn, they are directed to a warehouse for storing empty packaging with restricted access and several signs informing them about not reusing them. Storage is carried out in a suitable warehouse, properly identified, with ventilation screens to prevent access by birds, products stored on wooden pallets, away from walls, separated by type of product, all products with original labels and leaflets. The grout preparation site is in good condition, waterproof concrete floor, channels in good condition, separator boxes and ozonator. According to visual assessment, it was identified that the transport of agrochemical products takes place in properly adapted vehicles, these being in trucks duly adapted for preparing syrup. It was evident through visual assessment that the areas of the crop containing treatments were identified with re-entry plates. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the recommendations are made based on the results of the soil analysis by the Agronomist, with variable rate application in some areas and fixed rate application in other areas, and this procedure is carried out in the same way. form in units. According to visual assessment, it was found that at the farm headquarters there is an identification plate for the areas that have been and will be applied, and this is available to all workers, in addition, on the margins of the applied plots, there are identification plates, thus marking areas whose re-entry is prohibited without the appropriate use of PPE.
5_6_criteria: It was evidenced through documentary evaluation that the farms are aware and the product prohibition lists of the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions are available. The list of pesticides present on the properties is also highlighted, with no prohibited pesticides in stock. Evidenced through documentary evaluation POL 010 Â– Agricultural Planning, revision 01, that it is prohibited to include in agricultural planning any type of product that is not registered with the Ministry of Agriculture.
5_7_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation and interview , that the farm uses biological products whenever possible and records are kept on the property, service orders are presented, input purchase invoices and agronomic prescriptions for the applications carried out.
5_8_criteria: The MO was evidenced through documentary evaluation. 072 - Integrated Monitoring of Pests and Diseases, which establishes the routine for periodic assessment of the levels of pests, diseases, weeds, plant growth, nutritional deficiencies and other technical notes in crops of cotton, corn, soybeans, wheat, barley, seed corn, sunflower, sorghum, sugarcane, pointing out the species and phase (when applicable), their damage and the incidence and severity in crops, which are applicable to all properties of the SLC Agricola group. There is no evidence of an outbreak of new pests in the farm regions, however the farm relies on the work of Indea, which whenever there are outbreaks in the region, they inform producers how to proceed.
5_9_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation , the application Â“Depending on atmospheric conditions, the applicationÂ” begins, being a corporate document, and aiming to minimize drift. The sampled units use a system, which in turn triggers an audible alarm on the machine when spraying parameters are above established limits. Evidence of compliance, application orders must contain products applied, quantities and dates, names of the people who applied and prepared the mixture, identification of the equipment, and meteorological conditions at the time of application. Evidenced by comparing the aerial application list with the comparison of plots bordering water courses and populated areas, with their toxicological classification, none of the products applied are in toxicological category I and II. Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the system used to generate application service orders was duly updated and among the pre-programmed guidelines, there is the prohibition of aerial spraying in areas in comparison with the map of plots and crossing of water courses via Google Earth, that no aerial pesticide spraying occurs within 500 meters of watercourses. Evidenced through visual assessment that there is no aerial or ground spraying of pesticides in less than 30m from populated areas (accommodation, residential houses, in general in the social area of the farm) or bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: Evidenced through document evaluation, the application Â“Depending on atmospheric conditions, the applicationÂ” begins, being a corporate document, and aiming to minimize drift. The sampled units use a system, which in turn triggers an audible alarm on the machine when spraying parameters are above established limits. The application orders contain the product to be applied, the dose, the field, the crop and the applications are linked to the monitoring system.
5_11_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, presented the invoices for purchasing seeds from soy.

Name: ADM do Brasil - Fazenda Perdigão
1_1_criteria: The farm has access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of legislation and relevant documents were available. The audited farm also has external consultancy in the area of work safety, health and environment.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use the land are defined and have been demonstrated in documents such as registrations of ownership of land use. They were the registrations of the areas that make up the farm and the CARs of the farm areas have been verified, which prove ownership and/or the right to use.
1_3_criteria: Continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, internal audits , defined indicators and monitoring, showing the farms commitment to meeting all the criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard. according to the assessment required in 4.1.1. The CAS - Socio-Environmental Adequacy Commitment and the Internal Audit Report were presented, carried out on March 14, 2022, by the company Produzindo Certo. The documents contain all the indicators of the RTRS Production Standard and the social, environmental and agricultural aspects that must be improved are identified. The farm selected indicators such as fuel consumption (l/ha); Herbicide/Pesticide (Kg/ha), Organic Matter Content in the soil, for monitoring continuous improvements.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor was found during the audit process in the environments work or heard during interviews with farm employees. The Ministry of Labors Slave Labor List, updated on May 25, 2022, was consulted and the farm in scope was not identified in this list https://www.gov.br/trabalho-e-previdencia/pt-br/comspiraÃ§Ã£o /orgaos- especicos/secretaria-de-labor/inspecÃ§Ã£o/areas-de-operation/cadastro_de_employers.pdf. Proof of document returns and payment receipts were checked. The employees demonstrated during the interviews that they were in possession of documents and belongings. There were no reports of complaints regarding the return of documents or salary withholding. As verified in workers records (employment contracts, pay slips, among others) and in interviews with employees and managers, no evidence of dangerous work carried out by children under 15 years of age was identified.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and relevant information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work. Presented during the audit, course certificates (NR 31), training on NR-20 Flammable Liquids, NR 33 Confined Space, NR 35 Work at Height, First Aid, Integration, DDS Records (Daily Safety Dialogues) among others. A registration form, employment contract and payslips for farm workers were presented. Contracts are available in easy-to-understand language. The farm does not have a collective agreement, as there is no workers union active in the region
2_3_criteria: Information on health and safety is documented and is transmitted to employees during Integration and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each role and an action plan is available for emergency situations. The risks of the work environment are identified in the risk management programs - PGRTR and in the PCMSO - Occupational Health Medical Control Program, evidenced during the audit. The following documents PGRTR - Rural Work Risk Management Program and PCMSO were presented, addressing the risks and mitigation and control measures for each function/activity. The health aspects of workers are monitored through Occupational Health Certificates, with all employees sampled being fit for the role, according to the occupational health certificate and medical certificate. The farm has people trained in first aid with means of communication available to deal with an emergency situation, in addition to signs with emergency telephone numbers displayed at service stations
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization . There is no Collective Agreement with workers unions as there is no active union in the region. The regime applied is by the CLT. In an interview it was identified that there is no type of discrimination or action that prevents or hinders the action of organizations on the farm.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that the salaries paid in the company are higher than the minimum wage nationwide, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing, food and drinking water are provided to workers according to documentation and interviews carried out. It is evidenced through interviews, contracts, time cards and pay slips that overtime is agreed, voluntary and adequately remunerated. Overtime payments of 50% and 100% were identified. Weekly Rest is provided in accordance with the law.
3_1_criteria: The farm has complaint and suggestion boxes available by phone (67) 99991-08381 and by email (fazenda@grupoboenig.com.br) . Communication occurs through communication channels such as the Code of Ethics manual, complaint and suggestion boxes. The farm promoted the channels to groups of local producers. The email is available on the farm entrance sign and on bulletin boards inside the property.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area.
