Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements. The farm has an identification of production areas that does not identify the presence of indigenous peoples close to the farm, as well as places of cultural, ecological, economic or religious importance, environments protected by law.
3_3_criteria: The water channels Complaints are available and accessible. It is evident through photos and interviews with employees that the channels were publicized and are communicated to workers and the community in internal meetings and producer groups via WhatsApp and social networks. Complaints and grievances received are checked and responded to and are recorded in the "Complaints Spreadsheet". There were no records of complaints and complaints at the time of the audit.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the farm and vacancies are advertised through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fills out the job application, has your resume on file. Through an interview and verification on the farm, it was found that there is no collaboration with training programs aimed at the local population.
4_1_criteria: The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified for each farm within the scope of certification. Studies are available upon request. Presented the CAS - Socio-Environmental Adequacy Commitment and the Internal Audit Report carried out on March 14, 2022, by the company Produzindo Certo. The aspects and impacts raised by the farm consultancy are being mitigated and controlled, as evidenced in internal audits. The company has reports containing all social and environmental indicators. The report is forwarded and made available upon request.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging is done appropriately. The farm has a suitable location for storing used oil and contaminated waste. During the audit, the burning of crop residues, vegetation and waste was not evidenced. The farm uses techniques to take advantage of the waste generated, such as direct planting and crop rotation, it also uses composting and manages solid waste appropriately, according to the documentation presented. The waste management plan was presented, which described all waste generated, its classification, origin, storage, and destination
4_3_criteria: Fuel recording is done manually at the pump and then passed into spreadsheets where the volumes The volume information per hectare and per unit of product is compiled and monitored in all activities related to soybean production. The farm records the use of fuels and fertilizers, which are applied according to soil analyses. Organic matter in the soil is monitored and the producer uses millet crops as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_4_criteria: It is evident through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas are already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation.
4_5_criteria: The audited farm has more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, and also carries out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation. During the audit, it was possible to identify signs signaling preservation and legal reserve areas, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas. A production map was presented, with all the native vegetation present, watercourses and production areas, the farms CAR was also presented.
5_1_criteria: A audited farm demonstrates good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface water and underground. Water potability analyzes carried out by the municipalitys sanitation company were presented. The results demonstrate that there is no evidence of water contamination.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, the farm presented maps indicating the riparian vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farm's CAR.
5_3_criteria: The farm adopts good agricultural practices, carries out soil analysis, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion control and crop rotation techniques are implemented appropriately. Evidenced through an interview with the managers of the agronomic area, that the soil analyzes carried out by BioTec - LaboratÃ³rio Agroindustrial and there is a 2021/2022 harvest plan which demonstrates that the quality of the soil, including the organic matter content is monitored and monitored throughout of the weather.
5_4_criteria: The farm uses suitable products to control pests and diseases. The MIPs are implemented, however there is no plan to reduce the use of chemical products. Evidenced through interviews, visits to the storage location, product purchase invoices and list of products used, that the farm only uses original products from reputable sources. Presented the document "Integrated Management of Pests and Diseases" referring to the 21/22 Harvest prepared by the responsible agronomist.
5_5_criteria: Storage follows the recommendations of NR 31. Record of agrochemical application presented, including names of those responsible and application operators, as well as the equipment, flow rates used and meteorological conditions during application. During a visit to the empty packaging deposit, it was found that empty agricultural pesticide packaging is washed, unused and discarded correctly, after triple washing and returned to duly accredited companies, as evidenced in the empty packaging return reports presented during the audit. . Internally, there is only transport of products to the field for application and externally the product comes from resellers to the farm, as reported by managers and employees in the interviews. In storage, restricted access, good ventilation, security identification, emergency number, product MSDS, identification of stored products, available PPE and available environmental emergency kits were verified.
5_6_criteria: Retroactive application records were checked , invoices for the purchase and storage of products. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of Paraquat on the farm within the scope of certification was not evidenced. The use of this product is prohibited in Brazil.
5_7_criteria: Fazenda PerdigÃ£o does not use organic products. Evidenced through interviews with those responsible for the farm.
5_8_criteria: Presented methodology aimed at identifying and monitoring new pests and introduced invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. There were no incidences of new pests that were not identified, according to the records presented. It was evidenced through an interview with farm managers that in cases of identification of new pests, bodies such as Embrapa are notified.
5_9_criteria: Drift control procedures were presented for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water. water, as well as other precautions when applying pesticides. There is no aerial application on the farm. Verified the Application Records of spraying operations with the weather conditions during application and the records in the weather stations Icrop system.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system. It was evidenced through an interview with those responsible for the farm that the sprayers are equipped with anti-drift nozzles (with air induction), adjuvants are used, the wind direction is observed at the time of application and applications are made in the coolest hours of the day .
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources. The Invoices and the respective Terms of Compliance were presented.

Name: Louis Dreyfus Company – Bom Futuro Agrícola LTDA
1_1_criteria: Producers demonstrate knowledge of applicable laws and remain up to date through external consultancy from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with applicable laws was verified in most of the farms audited, such as Receipt of the Rural Environmental Registry, Well Grant, among others. Only one of the farms presented non-compliance in item 1.1.2 due to the occurrence of excessive overtime.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through duly registered registrations and lease contracts on all audited farms .
1_3_criteria: The manager carried out a social, environmental and agricultural assessment of the group members. Indicators 1.3.1 and 1.3.3 are also being met, however compliance with them will only be required from the second year of certification onwards.
2_1_criteria: None of the audited farms found signs of forced labor, imposed , forced, trafficked or involuntary, and there is also no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on farms are not forced to work and when they did work, it was found that they were given an opportunity. There are no children under 15 working on the farms. All hired employees are over 18 years old. Children residing on audited farms attend school. Interviews and information collected demonstrate that there is no discrimination of any kind and all workers receive equal treatment.
2_2_criteria: All employees on the audited farms are registered, having an Individual Employment Contract and Employee Registration, describing the main information relevant. The audited farms demonstrated that they provide specific training in occupational health and safety to employees.
2_3_criteria: All audited farms have a PGR, where health and safety risks are identified, as well as mitigation and control measures. Owners of audited farms, as well as employees, demonstrate knowledge of occupational health and safety issues, such as carrying out the required medical examinations. In addition, the audited farms have a First Aid and Emergency Procedures document, with the aim of establishing actions to be taken in response to environmental or occupational health and safety emergencies, as well as the associated environmental impacts. There are emergency signs and first aid kits on all audited farms. Only at Fazenda SÃ£o Miguel and Itaipu was there evidence of non-compliance regarding item 2.3.4.
2_4_criteria: According to reports obtained through interviews and on-site viewing at the four farms audited, employees have complete freedom to join trade union organizations. The entire group has a Collective Labor Agreement 2017/19, MTE Registration number: MT000731/2017.
2_5_criteria: Verified from interviews, information collected and documents verified on the audited farms that the wages paid are higher than the national minimum, being paid monthly via deposit into employees accounts. Verified proof of payment demonstrates that only deductions provided for by law such as INSS and IPRF are made. The working hours on the audited farms are 44 hours per week, with overtime being compensated or paid in two periods of the year, as stated in the Collective Agreement (for the three farms that follow the Convention). For farms that do not follow the established Convention, overtime is paid alongside their monthly salaries. Two farms audited record the hours worked and overtime and the other two do not register the employer. Despite not complying with indicator 2.5.5, compliance with it will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards. There were no cases of pregnant women on the farms, however, those responsible are aware of the applicable law. Verified that the residences and accommodation for employees on the audited farms are adequate and have satisfactory sanitary conditions.
3_1_criteria: The farms have e-mail and telephone numbers and an identification plate at their headquarters. In addition, a suggestion/complaint box is kept on each farm. The Complaint/Suggestion Procedure document and Complaint/Suggestion Form are implemented and describe the procedure for handling complaints and the form for recording them. There were no complaints or suggestions at the time of the audit.
3_2_criteria: Verified that there are no cases of disputes regarding the rights to use the properties lands, as well as there is no evidence of the existence of traditional users of the properties lands.
3_3_criteria: The farms have suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters. Employees can make complaints or grievances through the box and the community can communicate with the farm via telephone and email. Any complaints are recorded in the Complaint/Suggestion Form document. If complaints are received, they will be analyzed and subsequently dealt with, as provided for in the Complaint/Suggestion Procedure. At the time of the audit, there were no complaints or complaints received.
3_4_criteria: Verified that job opportunities are filled through referrals from current employees and other farms, or searches made directly on the audited farms. The farms acquire products from the region in which they are located.
4_1_criteria: All audited farms carry out social, environmental and agricultural assessment of them.
4_2_criteria: Verified that no fires are carried out on any of the audited farms. Most of the waste is properly disposed of by the farms, however the VovÃ´ Ernesto farm had non-compliance in indicator 4.2.2 due to not correctly disposing of its waste. All farms have a documented Waste Management Plan, developed by the group manager
4_3_criteria: All audited farms record the use of fossil fuels. They monitor the organic matter content by carrying out soil analyses. Furthermore, properties adopt practices that contribute to increasing soil carbon sequestration, such as: adopting direct planting systems, cultivating soil cover species, maintaining native vegetation and planting eucalyptus for use in the dryer.
4_4_criteria: Land Use and Comparative Maps were developed by LDC, presenting satellite images of property areas in 2008, 2016 and 2022. The 2008 images were generated with the Landsat 5 TM, Collection 1 Tier 2 satellite TOA Reflectance, 30 meter resolution. The 2016 and 2022 images were generated with the Sentinel-2 MSI satellite: MultiSpectral Instrument, Level-1C, 10 meter resolution. It was verified that there was no opening of vegetation areas after 2008 on the farms.
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation has been maintained on all farms. Hunting and collecting protected species is prohibited on all audited farms. The manager developed the document Plan to Ensure the Preservation of Native Vegetation and Wildlife...
5_1_criteria: Farms adopt good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as direct planting practices and maintaining soil cover through planting brachiaria. On all audited farms, analyzes are carried out to monitor water quality, however, two of the analyzes presented results that disagree.
5_2_criteria: The farms have complete maps with the location of cultivated areas delimited by plot, vegetation areas and water courses. A non-conformity was found regarding item 5.2.1 at the SÃ£o Miguel farm. Verified that there is no removal of riparian areas of native vegetation on the four farms audited; and there are no natural wetlands or wetland areas.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality is preserved on all audited farms through the adoption of practices such as the adoption of the direct planting system and the use of fertilizers in accordance with technical recommendations. The agricultural areas have flat relief. Direct planting is adopted on the four properties, as well as maintaining soil cover through the planting of cover species. Planning is carried out to define planting areas, following crop rotation and succession techniques on all farms.
5_4_criteria: The four farms do not have a documented Integrated Crop Management plan. At group level, the manager developed the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a plan to reduce potentially harmful phytosanitary products over time. As verified on the four farms, only original and genuine agrochemicals are used that meet local registration requirements for soybean cultivation. The SÃ£o Miguel farm had non-compliance regarding item 5.4.4 and VovÃ´ Ernesto regarding item 5.4.5;
5_5_criteria: Verified that the four audited properties do not have records of dosers and applicators, equipment used and conditions weather conditions during application. Although these items are not being complied with, compliance with them will be charged from the next year of certification onwards, and records of meteorological conditions will be charged from the third year of certification. Empty packaging is punctured and triple-washed on farms and stored in empty packaging deposit. All audited farms have a pesticide deposit in their own location, separate from other structures and identified, where pesticides are stored in accordance with legislation. The SÃ£o Miguel and Itaipu farms had non-compliance relating to item 5.5.2 and the SÃ£o Miguel, Serra Azul and VovÃ´ Ernesto Farms had non-compliance relating to item 5.5.3.
5_6_criteria: The farms do not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions.
5_7_criteria: Products for biological control are used in the audited properties, in accordance with legislation. The farm that does not use it demonstrated knowledge about its use.
5_8_criteria: It was verified that if an outbreak of new pests occurred, the audited farms would inform EMBRAPA and Agrodefesa.
5_9_criteria: The farms follow the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a reduction plan and measures to avoid drift in agrochemical applications. There is no application of pesticides near populated areas or watercourses.
5_10_criteria: Neighboring areas have the same type of production, cultivation and management used in the audited properties.
5_11_criteria: It was verified that the Seeds acquired by farms are from legally known sources, with respective seed compliance terms. None of the farms produce their own seeds.

Name: Associação Clube Amigos da Terra – CAT Sorriso
1_1_criteria: Farms stay up to date with applicable laws through consultancies in various sectors. The areas are registered in the CAR and agronomic prescriptions are issued by the technical managers. The four farms received non-conformities in item 1.1.2, related to working hours and payments during harvest periods, work safety, environmental licensing, accommodation structures and compliance with water potability standards.
1_2_criteria: The farms have registrations and lease contracts for all areas of their farms.
1_3_criteria: The group manager is responsible for the socio-environmental assessment of all members. Although there is a Social and Environmental Impact Assessment, the four farms received non-conformities in items 1.3.2 and 1.3.3 because they did not have defined indicators and targets for monitoring and analyzing actions related to the assessment.
2_1_criteria: As verified in interviews and farm records, employees are free to leave the property and there is no evidence of forced or slave-like labor. Only copies of employee documents are kept by the farms. Family members who live on the properties are not forced to work, and opportunities are offered. There are no children under 18 working on the farms. On one of the farms there was a non-compliance with item 2.1.4 due to the hiring of emancipated minors under 18 who carried out dangerous activities. There were no signs of discrimination during the interview reports. Employees have the same rights, benefits, opportunities and remuneration, without the presence of any type of punishment, oppression or mental or physical coercion.
2_2_criteria: Farm employees have signed employment contracts, written in the Portuguese language . At the time of hiring, employment rights are communicated to employees. Qualification training is carried out with SENAR. A farm received a non-conformity in item 2.2.3 for not showing recent occupational safety records.
2_3_criteria: There are occupational health and safety programs such as PPRA, PCMSO, PGRTR or PGSSMATR on farms. One of the farms received a non-conformity in item 2.3.2 for not carrying out all the tests described in its program. Training regarding occupational safety NRs is carried out with SENAR, however two farms received non-conformities in indicator 2.3.3 due to the lack of this training and exams. Farms provide PPE for their employees. Compliance with health and safety requirements is monitored through inspections carried out in the areas. There are emergency procedures, medical kits and vehicles available in case of accidents.
2_4_criteria: Employees are not prevented from joining local unions and are invited to attend union meetings. It was evidenced through interviews that there is no distinction in the treatment of union representatives. The Collective Labor Agreement 2019/2021, signed with the Rural Workers Union of Sorriso is highlighted.
2_5_criteria: Workers receive payments higher than the national minimum wage and salary floor for the category, when there is a collective labor agreement in force, and payment receipts demonstrate that the deductions made are only those provided for by law, such as INSS and income tax. Only on 1 farm did employees who had already been laid off receive the minimum wage established for their category. Housing and accommodation are available to employees, all of which are adequate, with running water, electricity and septic tanks. However, in only 1 of the farms audited, the water tanks are sanitized to guarantee potability, in accordance with current legislation, the other farms do not do so. On one of the farms it was evident that lockers are not provided in the accommodation. The normal working day on farms is 44 hours a week, with occasional overtime, especially during harvest times. Overtime is voluntary, as reported by workers in interviews. Hours worked are recorded on most farms, with only one property not recording it, making it impossible to highlight normal working hours, extra working hours and weekly rest, generating non-compliance in indicators 2.5.3, 2.5.4, 2.5.5 , 2.5.6. One of the farms records overtime worked, but does not pay them as determined by the collective labor agreement. Furthermore, on two of the farms audited, the weekly rest day was not respected during the harvest period, leading to non-compliance in indicator 2.5.6. Verified that the farms are aware of and comply with maternity and paternity leave requirements.
3_1_criteria: The communication channels available with the audited farms are telephone, e-mail and suggestion boxes present at the headquarters and also in the group managers office. CAT Sorriso, as manager of the group, publishes the groups members on its website and has a suggestion box and individual notebook for each farm in its office for recording complaints. Signs at the entrance to the farms identify the location and contact numbers. The communication channels are known and allow adequate communication between local communities and the properties.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes over the right to use land on the properties, as well as there is no evidence of the existence of traditional users of the properties. property lands. There are no indigenous areas close to the audited farms. The rights of such traditional users are respected by the farms.
3_3_criteria: The properties have suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters, as well as a written procedure providing for registration and treatment. In the group managers office, there is also a suggestion box available, as well as a place to archive received communications. To date, there has been no communication received.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies available on farms are preferably offered to local communities, generally through advertisements for current employees. As far as possible, there is collaboration with training programs for the local community and/or participation in training offered by SENAR-MT or equivalent entities, contributing to the formation of groups to provide training. The acquisition of goods and services is preferably done through companies in the community where the farms are located.
4_1_criteria: An assessment was carried out by the group manager on all members upon joining the group, in a comprehensive and clear manner , including all topics from the RTRS Production Standard as well as all activities carried out on the farm. Controls are carried out by the manager using Excel spreadsheets and the group manager and the producer keep copies with the summary of the socio-environmental assessment, which are available in case of requests.
4_2_criteria: No fires are practiced on the audited farms. All audited farms have a documented Waste Management Plan, prepared by the group manager, describing the main waste generated and its final destination. The properties have the appropriate structures to prevent oil spills, at the gas station, mechanical workshop and machinery wash. Non-biological waste is disposed of correctly and all residences and accommodation on the audited farms have a septic tank.
4_3_criteria: The consumption of fossil fuels is recorded and the audited farms carry out trend analysis. Soil organic matter is monitored by all farms through soil analysis. Carbon sequestration is increased through practices such as crop succession, cultivation of cover species such as sunn hemp, direct planting and maintenance of native vegetation present on all properties.
4_4_criteria: Verified through comparative maps of the years of 2009, 2016 and 2021, that there was no expansion for soybean cultivation.
4_5_criteria: All group members have maps drawn up by the group manager, indicating production areas, native vegetation and watercourses . Through comparative maps and Receipts from the Rural Environmental Registry (CAR), it was verified that the farms preserve the native vegetation existing in the area. Hunting and fishing are prohibited on all audited farms, through signposts or internal regulations. The audited farms have a properly implemented monitoring plan and monitor native vegetation and wildlife.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices are adopted on the audited properties, such as, for example, use of direct planting, crop succession, construction of contour lines and maintenance of permanent preservation and legal reserve areas. Two of the audited farms use irrigation, but one of them does not have control over the volumes captured, which generated non-compliance in indicator 5.1.1 and the other does not have a documented irrigation procedure, which generated non-compliance in indicator 5.1.4. Water quality is monitored through annual analyzes carried out in contracted external laboratories.
5_2_criteria: The farms have location maps identifying springs, rivers and bodies of water, in addition to the permanent preservation area and legal reserve. The ciliary areas are maintained. Drainage was identified in natural wetlands on no property.
5_3_criteria: Based on the results obtained in the soil analysis reports, the farms follow technical recommendations from engineers agronomists for the use of correctives and fertilizers. Practices are adopted to preserve soil quality, such as cover cropping and direct planting systems throughout the agricultural area. The cultivation regime of the audited properties are soybeans in the harvest season and corn, cotton or beans in the off-season, respecting the Health Vacuum established in the State of Mato Grosso.
5_4_criteria: There are documented plans for Integrated Pest Management on the audited farms , containing the chemical and non-chemical methods used, such as the use of biological control. However, the four farms had non-compliance in indicator 5.4.2, due to the lack of a plan to reduce phytosanitary products with clear reduction targets over time. All pesticides used on the properties are registered for soybean cultivation, are purchased with Agricultural Prescriptions and recommended by qualified professionals. All farms record the monitoring of pests, diseases, weeds and natural enemies.
5_5_criteria: The audited farms record the applications of agricultural pesticides. The pesticides are stored in specific deposits, properly locked and with a containment system in case of leaks. The pesticide packaging is triple washed and perforated on all audited farms and temporarily stored in the empty packaging warehouse covered, closed and properly locked. All audited farms mark newly sprayed areas with signposts.
5_6_criteria: The audited farms do not use products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions and also no longer use Paraquat in their production processes.
5_7_criteria: Three of the 4 farms audited use biological control agents. Producers and those responsible for farms are aware of the importance of using biological control. On properties that use biological control-based products, the uses are recorded together with all inputs applied to the crop.
5_8_criteria: Producers and those responsible for the audited farms demonstrate knowledge regarding the appearance of new pests and invasive species and reported that in these situations, they would contact institutional systems designed to identify and monitor new pests and invasive species, such as Embrapa or Aprosoja.
5_9_criteria: The properties have documented procedures detailing good practices in handling and application of pesticides. The four farms audited record weather conditions during applications. On audited farms that carry out aerial application, the 500 meters distance from populated areas is respected. Land applications respect at least 90 meters from populated areas and bodies of water, as determined by state legislation, except one of them does not respect this limit, which caused NC in indicator 5.9.5
5_10_criteria: Properties neighboring farms they are occupied with similar production systems, and there are no production systems that require care, such as organic production. No audited farm found records of damage to neighboring areas.
5_11_criteria: On all audited farms it is possible to guarantee the legal use of the origin of the seeds, where they are acquired from duly qualified companies.

Name: SLC Agricola S.A. - Group II Terra Santa
1_1_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation and interviews with managers, that the farm has a Â“Control of Regulatory NormsÂ” system, containing Norms, Decrees, Laws and other legislation pertinent to the operation of the farm and maintains a contract provision of services with outsourced companies, responsible for maintaining licenses and other mandatory regulatory documents in accordance with applicable legislation.
1_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation of lease contracts, Provisional Authorization for Rural Operations, CAR, Grants and registration certificates. According to documentary evaluation, the evaluated unit complies with applicable legislation.
1_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the report with indicators extracted for evaluation and monitoring, from Health and Safety, Agricultural and Environment.
2_1_criteria: According to an interview with employees and documentary analysis of the DDS, Integration Manual and Code of Ethics and Conduct Procedure for the properties, it was possible to demonstrate that the farm disseminates and informs its employees that any form of forced or compulsory slave labor is prohibited. , trafficked or involuntary at any stage of production. According to interviews with employees and the person in charge and through documentary analysis of payslips and delivery of documents, it was possible to demonstrate that no worker is obliged to leave their identity documents with other people and no part of their salary, benefits or belongings is withheld by owners or third parties. According to an interview with employees, they informed that spouses and children are free to choose to work or not on the properties. According to observation in several locations on the property and near their homes and in interviews with employees, no children under 18 years of age were declared or observed performing work. In the list of employees provided by the farms, which included the name, position, age and date of admission of employees, there was no evidence of anyone under 18 years of age. According to observation in several locations on the property and near their homes and in interviews with employees, no children under 15 years of age were declared or observed performing work. In the list of employees provided by the farms, which included the name, position, age and date of admission of employees, there was no evidence of anyone under 15 years of age. For school-age children, the municipalitys school transport bus transports them. It is evidenced through the SLC Code of Ethics and Conduct and through interviews with employees that discrimination of any nature does not occur on the farm, and is not tolerated. There are channels for anonymous reporting, should this occur, and employees are aware of these channels. As evidenced through document evaluation, workers receive equal pay, equal access to training, benefits and equal opportunities for promotion. In an interview with employees and document evaluation, it was stated that he had never experienced corporal punishment, oppression, mental or physical coercion, physical or verbal abuse, sexual harassment or any other type of intimidation within the work environment.
2_2_criteria: For both farms, the employment contracts dated upon admission and duly signed by all sampled employees were evidenced. Evidenced through document evaluation, interviews with employees and managers and visual observations that the organization complies with labor laws. It is evidenced through documentary evaluation that the organization provides workers with training, courses and DDS on topics related to worker health and safety, machine operation, handling of pesticides and others. Regarding the training of the sampled employees, the following courses were highlighted:
2_3_criteria: According to the interview carried out with the employees, everyone demonstrated that they were aware of health and safety standards, used PPE and the delivery list for them was highlighted in accordance with the EPIS listed in the service order. In an interview with employees and through documentary analysis of the list of employees of both properties, using the date of birth it was possible to identify that there are no employees over 60 and under 18 years old. For both farms, it was possible to demonstrate that the PPE delivered was compatible with the PGRTR. Plaque with emergency telephone numbers with main telephone numbers to be called in case of emergency, telephone number of the security technician, and those responsible for the sectors with emergency guidelines are included on the plaque. The entire Cipa team is trained in first aid, in addition to this, employees who are not part of the CIPA team are also trained in first aid. Visually evidenced ambulance on the property, for more urgent care. According to an interview with employees, in cases of accidents, the guidance is immediate communication via extension or radio to them and/or the nearest coordinators, who will be responsible for calling the next help and guidance.
2_4_criteria: According to an interview with managers and employees it was possible to demonstrate that they are given free access to join unions and participate in collective negotiations. It was possible to demonstrate this through the groups collective agreement minutes. According to interviews with managers and employees, employees are given free access to interact with external parties outside of working hours.
2_5_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation of the Unhealthiness Reports. Checking salary payment slips and through interviews with employees, it was evident that only legal deductions or those authorized by employees are made. All legal and optional salary deductions are explained to employees during Integration (theme is highlighted in the training material). Everyone has access to paychecks in physical form. Payslips were all signed. According to an interview with employees and those responsible for Human Resources, the property allows employees to work overtime during the harvest season (harvesting and planting), according to a collective agreement. Communication to employees is carried out by coordinators in advance to plan. Evidenced through document analysis (slips) and interviews that employees are entitled to at least one day off for every six consecutive days of work. Employees are registered under a monthly CLT regime. The farm provides employees with: Accommodation with bunk beds, closet, fan, bathroom with shower, respecting the capacities established in the standard. The employees who live on the farm are provided with masonry houses, with running water, electricity and internet provided by the property at no cost. For families of employees who live on the property and have school-age children, the city hall bus comes to the property every day to take the children to the nearest district school. Three meals a day are available (breakfast, lunch and dinner). When employees are on the farm, food is taken through a marmibox and employees have lunch in mobile or fixed cafeterias depending on the field. Evidenced in various parts of the farm, drinking fountains with drinking, chilled and natural water, disposable cups on the support next to them, available to employees. Evidenced through photographic assessment, sign displayed at the entrance of the property, containing the communication channels
3_1_criteria: According to visual assessment, evidenced that the farms provide at their entrance, an information sign containing identification, telephone, websites and e-mails for contact. The SLC Agricola group has a system for receiving and recording various complaints/communications received, analyzing the cause and recording feedback for the treatment to the complainant, and such communication channels adequately allow communication between the farm and the community.
3_2_criteria: Not applicable, as there are no indigenous communities around the property or in the region.
3_3_criteria: According to visual assessment, it is clear that the farms provide at their entrance an information sign containing identification, telephone , websites and contact emails. The farm records and maintains files on complaints received and they are duly dealt with. Both internal and external communication/complaint demands have a processing flow until they are completed.
3_4_criteria: It was evidenced through documentary evaluation that job vacancies are advertised locally. Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the farms provide the local community with the possibility of training, as well as giving preference to regional companies to provide services.
4_1_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the company carries out a social and environment, and the assessment is carried out by qualified and trained people. The assessment is carried out comprehensively, including all sectors of the farm and business partners. Measures to mitigate or minimize the impacts identified by the assessment are taken appropriately. The company has archived the social and environmental assessment report and it was presented, which contains information about the actions and initiatives taken by the farms in relation to socio-environmental issues.
4_2_criteria: According to visual assessment of the production areas of the property, no areas with remains were identified of fires. It was evident through visual assessment that there are signs indicating the prohibition of the use of fire. The farms have suitable places for storing fuel and also have waste deposits suitable for storing different types of materials, such as batteries, used tires, burnt oil and other materials. Several points were identified on the farm with material collectors separated by type (paper, plastic, metal, organic), which are subsequently sent to selective collection units for recycling. The company has a documented waste management plan.
4_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, record of fossil fuel use on the sampled Farms. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that the farm carries out soil analysis. The SLC AgrÃ­cola Group has a Â“Enrichment Project for areas with native essencesÂ” issued in April 2021, which has as its principle the reversion of arable areas or reserve areas with gaps into reforested areas. This project is ready for implementation on farms in Terra Santa.
4_4_criteria: According to documentary evaluation, the Piracema, Pirapora, Prospera and Pampeira farms are in compliance with soy expansion requirements.
4_5_criteria: According to visual and documentary evaluation, maps of the properties were presented, counting the legal reserve areas, Permanent Protection Areas and production areas of the property, and the indication of watercourses. According to a visual assessment, it was observed that the farm has several points with signs prohibiting hunting and fishing within the property, in addition, information regarding this prohibition is also included in the Integration Training. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that the production units have the appropriate registrations in the CAR and meet more than the provisions of the RTRS protocol, having more than 10% of native vegetation.
5_1_criteria: According to interview with the Engineer agronomist, conservation techniques are used, such as rotation, direct planting, contour lines, terraces in areas with slopes ranging from 5 to 8%, to prevent surface erosion. There were no situations of contamination of water courses, precisely because the farm was concerned with reducing the speed of runoff and adopting conservation techniques. Dry farming on both farms.
5_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentary and visual evaluation, the maps containing the identification of plots, RL areas and watercourses. There are no open PRADÂ’s on the properties. There is no water collection in watercourses or in naturally humid areas. The only sources of water are artesian wells.
5_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that the farm carries out soil analysis, makes fertilization recommendations according to the needs of the crop and considering what already exists in the soil. Conservation techniques are used, such as rotation, direct planting, contour lines, terraces in areas with slopes ranging from 5 to 8%, to prevent surface erosion. Evidenced through visual assessment on both properties, that the conservation techniques mentioned by agronomists are implemented on the properties.
5_4_criteria: According to an interview with the Agricultural Engineer, the farm is working with the so-called localized application, in which the Drone flies over infestation areas, monitoring the areas and then localized application begins with specific machinery only in places where there is infestation. Evidenced through document evaluation that the company has a documented procedure for Integrated Pest and Disease Management. It is clear that all pesticides are in their original packaging, with labels and leaflets, and are applied as set out in the agronomic recipe. It was evidenced through an interview with the agronomist, that the movement in the farming areas is carried out through the computerized system. And monitoring reports are generated, as shown. Based on this monitoring, a treatment recommendation is made.
5_5_criteria: It was evidenced through an interview that there are 4 meteorological stations on the property, for monitoring climatic conditions, and all conditions are recorded via the Solinftec system, in which is possible to retrieve past spraying information, containing monitoring of Relative Humidity, Wind Speed, temperature) and it is also possible to know which machine was used and who was the operator responsible for the operation. Application orders contain the product to be applied, the dose, the field, the crop and the applications are linked to the monitoring system. DDS highlighted regarding the importance of correctly disposing of packaging. It was evident through visual assessment that both properties have appropriate vehicles for transporting pesticides. It was evidenced through a visual assessment of photos sent via email, that the areas of the crop that contain treatments were identified with re-entry signs, for both farms. Fertilization recommendations are made by the agricultural engineer, and they are entered into the GATEC system, and accessed by the farm so that the operation can be carried out. Productive Resource Planning Module.
5_6_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the farms have knowledge and the product prohibition lists of the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions are available. The list of pesticides present on the properties is also evidenced, and there is no prohibited pesticide in stock.
5_7_criteria: It was evidenced through documentary evaluation that the farm uses biological products whenever possible and records are kept on the property.
5_8_criteria: There is no evidence of pest outbreaks in the farm regions, however the farm relies on the work of Indea, which whenever there are outbreaks in the region, they inform producers how to proceed.
5_9_criteria: It was evidenced through an interview that there are 4 meteorological stations on the property, for monitoring climatic conditions, with all conditions being recorded via a computerized system, in which it is possible to retrieve past spraying information, containing monitoring of relative humidity, wind speed , temperature) and it is also possible to know which machine was used and who was the operator responsible for the operation. Evidenced through visual assessment, that there is no application of agrochemicals within a radius of 30 meters from populated areas and bodies of water, as per the guidance expressed in the service orders.
5_10_criteria: According to an interview with the Agricultural Engineer, the farm seeks control application flows, establish parameters for applications, with better wind conditions, RH. There are also 4 meteorological stations on the property, for monitoring climatic conditions, and all conditions are recorded via a computerized system, in which it is possible to retrieve past spraying information, containing monitoring of relative humidity, wind speed, temperature), being It is also possible to know which machine was used and who was the operator responsible for the operation. Application orders contain the product to be applied, the dose, the plot, the crop and the applications are linked to the monitoring system.
5_11_criteria: According to the evidence presented, all seeds purchased come from legally known sources , registered with Renasem.

Name: Grupo Reinhofer
1_1_criteria: The groups production and management units demonstrated knowledge of the legislation applicable to their core activity during the audit. However, some applicable laws are being partially complied with.
1_2_criteria: Legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: Environmental aspects and impacts have been identified. The corrective actions arising from internal audits show the companys continuous improvement, commitment and evolution in relation to the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: Practices of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other involuntary work were not found during the audit process, as well as in work environments or heard during interviews with employees in the groups production units.
2_2_criteria: Training and work instructions are available for each function to be performed and the rights and Duties of both parties are defined in the employment contracts and code of conduct at the groups production units
2_3_criteria: Health and safety information is documented and transmitted to employees during Onboarding or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations in the groups production units.
2_4_criteria: There is no evidence that prevents workers to have freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment of their presence in the groups production units.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that the salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees of the same category in the groups production units. Adequate housing is provided by the company to employees.
3_1_criteria: Communication channels are available internally through suggestion boxes in the production units and externally on the website and publicity via signs available at the entrance to the production units, made by the Group Manager.
3_2_criteria: Presence of quilombola heirs in an area neighboring the groups Campo Bonito Farm. The farm is in the licensing phase with the ParanÃ¡ environmental agency (IAP) to implement a Hydroelectric Plant on the river that divides the land. No conflict has been observed over the use of water resources and nothing has been built to date. Both sides are in the negotiation phase to approve the project and release the LO for the activity.
3_3_criteria: The company has a procedure for Communication and Complaints in the Group Management Manual. The communication channels are suggestion boxes available internally on the properties and externally through signs on company trucks such as the Reinhofer groups telephone and website, where there is another communication channel, in addition to telephone directories available in communities close to the farms. Interviews were carried out with farm employees, confirming the correct functioning of the grievance mechanism.
3_4_criteria: Collaboration with the training program implemented and job vacancies are opened on the companys website and local vacancies are advertised" word of mouth" among employees.
4_1_criteria: A socio-environmental assessment was carried out and shows mitigation and control measures for processes related to soybean production.
4_2_criteria: Actions to minimize pollution are being done as reuse and recycling of materials, through selective collection and all hazardous waste in the groups production units.
4_3_criteria: Fuel registration is in accordance with the agricultural activities carried out. The use of fertilizer is done according to soil analyses, where organic matter is also monitored. Areas of environmental interest are maintained and preserved in the groups production units.
4_4_criteria: Through maps and satellite photos, it was verified that the soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of areas considered as AAVC.
4_5_criteria: Areas of environmental interest are respected and conserved by the administration of the groups production units. Native vegetation on the farm is above 20%, in accordance with federal legislation with the New Forest Code of 2012.
5_1_criteria: Monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption is done through analyzes of water, where soil contamination is verified in the groups production units.
5_2_criteria: Permanent Preservation Areas are defined on maps of the groups production units, with no evidence that vegetation has been removed, nor changed.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation and soil analysis are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the groups production units.
5_4_criteria: The record monitoring of pests and weeds found in the areas is done through a visit report, present in the agrarian cooperatives field notebook. Control levels are established in accordance with the EMBRAPA SOJA methodology.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical applications contain information such as purchased products, applied dose, installments, application dates and climatic conditions. Storage follows the recommendations of NR 31.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the groups production units.
5_7_criteria: No biological agents are used in the groups production units
5_8_criteria: To identify and monitor new invasive species and pests in the area, the group has a described procedure, citing research institutions such as Embrapa and Universities.
5_9_criteria: The conditions Atmospheric conditions such as wind, humidity and temperature before application are recorded in the pesticide application forms in the groups production units.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the production units of the group.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds is through the cooperative, in which the group cooperates, where the groups production units are producing in accordance with RENASEM

Organization: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação
Name: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação LTDA - Grupo IV
1_1_criteria: The farms comply with applicable laws. Employees demonstrated knowledge of legislation and relevant documents were available. The information presented during the audit demonstrates that the auditee is knowledgeable about the applicable legal requirements. The company has a legal department that provides information on applicable legislation. During the audit, documentation in employees folders, verification of farm infrastructure, field visits, interviews with those responsible for the areas of human resources, agronomics, environmental and occupational safety were verified and knowledge of applicable laws was demonstrated. Documents demonstrating land ownership, a list of pesticides used and dosages applied, agronomic prescriptions, good agricultural practices, and employee training were verified. Employment contracts, employee records, time cards, pay slips (payments and discounts) and medical examinations were checked and compared with the Occupational Health Medical Control Program. The collective work agreement, environmental licenses, Rural Environmental Registry (CAR), grants and potability analysis.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land is documented and accessible, documents such as property registration certificates were presented, proving the rights to use owned and leased land within the scope of certification.
1_3_criteria: There is an Environmental study called "Environmental and Social Risk Assessment'' which includes the assessment and monitoring of social and environmental aspects and agricultural operation prepared by the Environmental Engineering Specialist in 2021. The internal audit on the farms was carried out, at Fazenda Santana on 25/8/21, Fazenda Santa AntÃ´nio Kohn on 6/7/22, Fazenda Santo AntÃ´nio - August 2021 ; Fazenta Santa Isabel - August 2021 and Fazenda SapucaÃ­ - August 2021 The monitoring results were analyzed during the internal audit, where items, in which the mitigation and control measures were not effective, were taken as NC and corrective actions were requested.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, imposed, trafficked and/or involuntary labor was seen through visits to work environments or heard during interview with farm workers. Identity documents are returned to employees in accordance with legislation. Employees wives and children can work on farms under a normal contracting regime, if there is interest on the part of the workers and vacancies on the part of the employer. There are no children under 18 working on the sampled farms. Payments are in accordance with the activities carried out and established in a collective agreement, in addition to benefits relating to food, health plan, dental, housing, among others, described in pay slips and contractual documentation. There is the document "Internal Policies and Code of Conduct" given to all employees, addressing the issue of discrimination
2_2_criteria: All workers have a registration form, contract, as well as a collective bargaining agreement, which specify their conditions of work. During the audit on the sampled farms, several methodologies were highlighted that convey such matters to workers, such as integration training, courses and training and field days. Contracts are available in easy-to-understand language. The farms do not have a collective agreement, as there is no workers union active in the region, however, the specifications of the state collective agreement are followed.
2_3_criteria: The workers and those responsible for the operation demonstrated knowledge about health and safety in the work through verbal explanations addressing issues related to the application of agricultural pesticides, use of machinery and equipment and use of PPE. There is integration training and a code of conduct covering these topics, which were explained to workers. Presentation of health and safety documents and occupational health medical control, identifying risks and control procedures. The farms have mechanisms for verifying the use of PPE, such as warning systems for employees, described in the code of conduct, delivered when the employee is onboarded. Attendance list and training certificates for workers were evidenced, such as: NR 05 Accident prevention, Dangerous conduct, NR 06 EPI, NR-31.12 Machines and Equipment, NR-31.8 Application of Pesticides, NR-23 Fire Fighting, NR 20 - Flammable liquids, First Aid; for employees who perform risky functions on both farms.
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization. Through interviews with employees, it was identified that there is no type of discrimination or action that prevents or hinders the actions of organizations on the Farms. Right to collective bargaining guaranteed and integration with external parties guaranteed.
2_5_criteria: Remuneration is compatible with national legislation and collective agreements, salary information and deductions are detailed in payslips, which describe salary deductions that are related to tax deductions and a % of benefits granted as an agreement in contractual documentation. The working day complies with what is established in the Collective Labor Agreement. Workday records are made by workers in compliance with legal requirements. Checked through the dot mirror. Water Potability Analyzes of water collection wells for human consumption were presented and all results meet the potability standards established in the Ministry of Health Ordinance. There is accommodation for farm employees who live free of charge and all locations are verified. The houses were in good condition, they also provided adequate food, at no cost to employees.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as website containing emails telephones, postal address on farm roads with advertising signs written Â“talk to usÂ” containing Cerqualitys telephone number and website and internally on the farms in scope through the Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the workers time control and/or bulletin boards on the farm. It was evidenced through interviews with employees of the audited farms that the communication channels were widely publicized.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Land ownership documents and registration documents were presented. Interviews were carried out with employees residing in neighboring communities and with farm managers and no dispute situations were reported or found.
3_3_criteria: A mechanism for complaints, suggestions and grievances is made available, which establishes a registration and treatment procedure of complaints, through a complaints and complaints form, available at the production units, information about this mechanism is made available to all interested parties.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the farms and vacancies are disseminated through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fills out the job application, I have their resume on file. There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the farms in the scope, carried out by the farms and monitored by Cerquality.
4_1_criteria: The group manager has reports containing all social and environmental indicators, the report is sent and made available through the solicitation. The aspects are identified in the document "Environmental and Social Risk Assessment and Mitigation Measures" of September 2021, containing the identification of social, environmental and agricultural aspects, inside and outside the farm, the points that must be improved and monitored were presented . The assessment was carried out by the Group Manager. The assessments are in accordance with the reality of the operations carried out by the farms. All information was treated openly and all aspects found were reported to assess the need to mitigate environmental and social impacts.
4_2_criteria: There is no burning of crop residues, they are reused for direct planting. There is an Environmental Management Plan presented during the audit that covers waste management including all areas of the property. There is management and final disposal of batteries, used lubricating oil, lamps, tires, washing water from agricultural pesticide applicators are stored in adequate infrastructure with waterproofing, containment, ventilation, protected and disposed of correctly. For the waste mentioned above, proof of destination was presented to accredited companies, guaranteeing the correct destination.
4_3_criteria: The farms monitor the use of diesel through the system and OS for each supply, by date and equipment. It is possible to check usage per day, per month, per harvest and compare with soybean production. Monitoring carried out in conjunction with the agricultural schedule and cultural practices makes it possible to justify when there is a significant increase in diesel consumption, an item monitored by the group manager and informed during the audit. Soil organic matter levels are monitored through annual soil analyses, and direct planting practices are also used, which promote the maintenance of organic matter in the soil. Opportunities to increase carbon sequestration such as conservation of native forest in a reserve area, as well as APP areas, remaining isolated forests and use of techniques such as crop rotation and direct planting
4_4_criteria: Evidenced through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas are already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation. The group manager presented all maps of the farms participating in the "Comparison map with satellite images (2009, 2016 and current)" group. The maps were compared with the RTRS map, demonstrating that the areas are suitable.
4_5_criteria: There are detailed maps of all the farms indicating the native vegetation, production areas and watercourses. The farms audited areas with their own areas have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation. Periodic monitoring of areas with native vegetation (APP and RL) is carried out in the farms, where there are warning signs prohibiting hunting in these locations and in the socio-environmental plans of the farms, flora and fauna conservation measures were included.
5_1_criteria: The farms audited demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and underground water. There is periodic monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption. The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were evaluated, being present in the document Socio-environmental Assessment for Agricultural Production RTRS_Version 1.0 and Assessment of Aspects and Hazards by Process_Version 1.0. The concessions for irrigation of the SapucaÃ­ Farm were highlighted and it was verified that the conditions are being met, in compliance with current legislation.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, Cerquality presented detailed maps of all farms with indication of riparian vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farms' CAR. Evidence of the presence of natural wetlands present in the production area. The unit only emerges during the rainy season. areas remain intact.
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analysis, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. The farms take actions to control erosion such as direct planting, promoting the maintenance of plant residues on the soil, in addition to the fact that the relief is flat, which helps to prevent surface runoff, promoting the infiltration of rainwater.
5_4_criteria: Farms use appropriate products to control pests and diseases. IPMs and plans to reduce the use of chemical products are implemented. Pest monitoring is reported in forms called ''Monitoring of Pests in Soybean Culture - MIP Soja'' . The forms analyzed contained the pests found, date, cultivar and batch
5_5_criteria: Storage and transport of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. Empty packaging of agricultural pesticides is washed, unused and discarded correctly, after triple washing and returned to companies duly accredited for this purpose. Delivery certificates for empty pesticide containers were presented. There are signs with product information and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. Pesticide application records are made manually and subsequently recorded in the system. In the farms harvest plan, which defines agricultural planning, fertilization recommendations follow recommendations from Agricultural Engineers. according to soil analyzes of the areas.
5_6_criteria: Retroactive application records, invoices for purchase and storage of products were checked. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of Paraquat was not evidenced on the farms within the scope of certification.
5_7_criteria: On the Santo Antonio, Santa Isabel and Sapucai farms, biological control agents are applied at an experimental level that follow the recommendations made by Agr. Responsible for the farm, the same person responsible for applying agricultural pesticide recommendations At Santana and Santo Antonio Kohn Farms No applications of biological control agents were verified.
5_8_criteria: The methodology is described in the MIC Plan item 5.3 of the sampled farms , where it describes that in cases of new pests or outbreaks, research institutions such as Embrapa and consultants will be consulted in order to seek efficient control methodologies.
5_9_criteria: Records of the use of agrochemicals were presented, including the products purchased and applied , identification of the area applied, name of the operator, equipment, and meteorological conditions during application. Verified POP 13- Integrated Crop Management. During the interviews and verification of the sampled application records, it was observed that aerial application is carried out respecting distance limits. There is no applied area within 500 meters of populated areas and watercourses. There are no production areas that are less than 30 meters from populated areas and bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of GM soy production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources. The purchase of seeds from legal sources is evidenced through Invoices and the Seed Compliance Terms.

Name: Fazenda Pau Furado
1_1_criteria: It was evidenced through an interview that updates in relation to compliance with legislation are the responsibility of the cooperatives advisory sector that advises producers, and all members, including Pau Furado, keep their documentation regularized with to the Â“registrationÂ” sector. CAR evidenced, registration date 04/28/2015, referring to both registrations. Regarding the gas station, the tank has a capacity of less than 15,000 liters, therefore it does not require an ANP license. Evidence of registration with INCRA. Presented grant together.
1_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, with the Property Registry Office in the district of Teixeira Soares regarding registrations NÂ° 6634 and 6635, dated 02/05/2021.
1_3_criteria: The Environmental Diagnosis issued by the Cooperative in relation to Fazenda Pau Furado was evidenced through documentary evaluation, containing: Location, Land Status, History, legal status, farm restrictions, occupation maps, sketch, negative certificates, surrounding situation. Also highlighted: Vegetation Monitoring Report, which explains the methodology applied for the diagnosis of vegetation monitoring between 2016 and 2020. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the Sustainable Agro Monitoring reports, which provides various monitoring parameters, where they are evaluated year by year, and among the topics covered are: Deposit of agricultural pesticides, Deposit of empty packaging, Diesel Tank, Washing ramp, Oil Deposit, Solid Waste, Environmental Aspects, Agricultural, Human Resources and Health and Safety at work. It was possible to highlight the actions implemented in relation to the last 2 years, demonstrating the continuous improvement in these items.
2_1_criteria: According to interviews with employees, it was stated that no form of forced, compulsory slave, trafficked or involuntary labor is used at any stage of production. According to an interview with employees, it was stated that no worker is obliged to leave their identity documents with other people and no part of their salary, benefits or belongings is retained by owners or third parties. According to an interview carried out with employees, 5 of them live on the property with their families, and reported that they are free to choose to work or not on the properties. As observed in several locations on the property and near their homes and in interviews with employees, it was not stated or observed that spouses and children of hired workers are required to work on the farm. Through interviews with employees and managers, no minors were found working on the farm. A city school transport bus was seen picking up the children (4 children of varying ages) to take them to school in the district of GuaraÃºna. For families who live on the farm and have children, a bus is available to transport the children to school daily to the municipality or districts closest to the farms. It is evidenced through the Conduct Manual of 01/06/2022 and through interviews with employees that discrimination of any nature does not occur on the farm, in addition to being not tolerated. There are channels for anonymous reporting, should this occur, and employees are aware of these channels. As evidenced by pay stubs and employment contracts, workers receive equal pay, equal access to training, benefits and equal opportunities for advancement. In interviews with employees, they stated that they had never experienced corporal punishment, oppression, mental or physical coercion, physical or verbal abuse, sexual harassment or any other type of intimidation within the work environment. The Conduct Manual includes guidelines in this regard.
2_2_criteria: The property has 7 permanent CLT employees, 1 day laborer with a service provision contract. During the harvest, providers are outsourced to transport soybeans and earthworks. Empresa Una provides training, preparing PPRA and PCMSO. According to an interview with the manager, they do not hire third parties during the harvest. The property uses the CLT, the declaration issued by the company GAR Medicina Integrada e SeguranÃ§a do Trabalho Ltda was presented, in which it states that the Reports of PGRTR, LTCAT, PCMSO, Health Report, Danger Report and pertinent training of FAZENDA PAU FURADO . Duly signed employment contract for all employees; According to an interview carried out with the employees, everyone demonstrated that they were aware of health and safety standards, used PPE and their delivery list was highlighted.
2_3_criteria: Signs with instructions for the use of Mandatory PPE were displayed in easily accessible locations. visualization in risk locations. Evidenced PPE delivery form. PCMSO and PPRA evidenced. According to documentary evaluation and interviews, it was identified that risky and dangerous activities are carried out by people with proven training, as evidenced by training records. There is a sign with emergency telephone numbers with main telephone numbers to be called in the event of an emergency, and the managers telephone numbers are included on the sign. According to interviews with managers and employees in the event of an emergency (which has not occurred on the farm for a long time), the instruction is to notify the manager and call the emergency numbers
2_4_criteria: According to interviews with managers and employees it was stated that free access to membership is given, however the local union does not have a strong presence on the properties and they are not approved to enter into a union agreement, it was stated that employees are given free access to interact with external parties outside of working hours.
2_5_criteria: Evidenced through employee employment contracts and payslips that wages above the national minimum wage are paid. Checking salary payment slips and through interviews with employees, it was evident that only legal deductions or those authorized by employees are made. All legal and optional salary deductions are explained to employees. Everyone has access to paychecks in physical form. Payslips were all signed. If the payment corresponding to 220 hours is evidenced in the employees employment contract and pay slip, according to article 74 of the CLT, paragraph two, it is not mandatory to control the time card record. According to an interview with employees and manager, the property allows employees to work only 2 hours of overtime during the harvest season (harvesting and planting), employees are notified in advance to plan their plans, outside of the harvest, employees are allowed to leave to resolve private matters and the manager controls outputs in an Excel spreadsheet. During the harvest season when employees work on Saturday and Sunday and are given one day off during the week. Overtime is shown in employee payslips for March and April, as permitted by law. It is clear that the property controls hours worked by employees through control spreadsheets. There are no female employees on the propertys staff. It is clear that all employees have access to drinking water on the farm. Potability analysis of the artesian well is carried out once a year in an external laboratory.
3_1_criteria: It was evident through visual assessment that in front of the property, there is a sign exposing the communication channels, including via WhatsApp.
3_2_criteria: There are no disputes over land use. The land has always been owned by the family of the current producers. There are no indigenous communities in the region. There are no sites of cultural, ecological, economic or religious importance nor indigenous communities in the region.
3_3_criteria: It was evident through visual assessment that in front of the property, there is a sign exposing the communication channels. There are no records of complaints. The farm has a good relationship with the neighboring community.
3_4_criteria: Evidenced through an interview with the farm manager, that vacancies are advertised on the farm and the employees themselves advertise them among friends, family and local communities. All employees have been on the farm for a few years and there is no major employee turnover. Evidenced that the farm hires regional companies to provide services on the property.
4_1_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation the Environmental Diagnosis issued by the Cooperative in relation to Fazenda Pau Furado, containing: Location, Land Situation, History, legal status , farm restrictions, occupation maps, sketch, negative certificates, surrounding situation. Also highlighted: Vegetation Monitoring Report, which explains the methodology applied for the vegetation monitoring diagnosis. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the Sustainable Agro Monitoring reports, which contain several monitoring parameters, which are evaluated year by year, and among the topics covered are: Deposit of agricultural pesticides, Deposit of empty packaging, Tank of Diesel, Washing ramp, Oil Deposit, Solid Waste, Environmental Aspects, Agricultural, Human Resources and Occupational Health and Safety. Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the person responsible is qualified. It was possible to highlight the actions implemented in relation to the last 2 years, demonstrating continuous improvement. Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the property has a Biodiversity Policy.
4_2_criteria: Evidenced through interviews with the property managers, that the farm adopts a policy against burning of any type. Evidenced through visual assessment that the farm has a suitable place for waste disposal. It was evident through visual assessment that at the gas station, at the machine washing site and at the syrup preparation point, there are containment channels and collection boxes, to prevent contaminating liquids from coming into contact with the soil. According to an interview with the farms managers, the farm encourages residents to collect materials for recycling, and the amount raised from the sale of recyclable materials is converted into a celebration for employees and their families.
4_3_criteria: It was evidenced through documentary evaluation that diesel oil volumes are monitored throughout the harvest. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, soil analyzes carried out by the IBRA laboratory. Evidenced by comparing the 2006 map with the 2022 map, with no signs of opening areas.
4_4_criteria: Shown by comparing the 2006 map with the 2022 map, with no signs of opening areas.
4_5_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, map of the farm, indicating watercourses, arable plots, APP and RL. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the Sustainability Policy signed by the Unit Manager, containing commitments made which also provides for the protection of vegetation and wildlife. Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the legal reserve of the property corresponds to 21.17%, 170.68 hectares preserved as set out in the CAR document.
