5_1_criteria: Evidenced through visual evaluation that the farm uses crop rotation, direct planting, level planting, use of terraces, recovery of areas with reforestation and legal reserve surplus. All of these actions aim to protect the soil and consequently preserve the maintenance of water in aquifers. To date, no environmental liabilities have been identified, including contamination of water sources on the property. There are only rainfed crops on the farm.
5_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, map of the farm, indicating watercourses, arable plots, APP and RL. There is no water extraction on the property. There is only well capture.
5_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, harvest planning with the definition of the crop rotation system, with the summer harvest changing between soybeans, corn and wheat and in the winter harvest Black oats, White oats, wheat and barley. It is evident through visual assessment that the farm uses crop rotation, direct planting, level planting, use of terraces, recovery of areas with reforestation and legal reserve surplus. All these actions aim to protect the soil and consequently preserve the maintenance of water in the aquifers
5_4_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation of the Input Programming document. Evidence of commitment document to reduce the use of chemicals. It is evident through visual assessment that the pesticides are all in their original packaging, with labels properly attached, and all Fispqs are available in the pesticide deposit. Evidenced through an interview with the farm manager and documentary evaluation, that pest monitoring is carried out by him and is satisfactory.
5_5_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation of the Crop Control Booklet, which appears separated by plot, control of all management. It was evident through visual assessment that within the pesticide warehouse itself, there is a room reserved for empty packaging. There is no transport of agrochemicals to the farming areas. The syrup is prepared in a suitable location in front of the pesticide warehouse and the PU is supplied with the syrup prepared in this location just before going to the field. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that in the harvest planning carried out by the agronomist, fertilization recommendations are made based on soil analyses.
5_6_criteria: Evidenced through visual assessment of the propertys agrochemical stock, and through of documentary evaluation of the 2020/2021 and 2021/2022 Harvest Input Programming document, which do not use pesticides listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions.
5_7_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the farm has records of recommendations of application of biological products and records of purchases of such products
5_8_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that there is the ABC foundation, in which one of the responsibilities is to monitor the pests with the highest incidence in the region and propose through of institutional materials the measures that farms must adopt to keep such outbreaks under control.
5_9_criteria: It was evidenced through an interview with the farm manager that the practices that the farm uses to minimize drift are through monitoring Humidity relative, winds and temperature. The measurement was demonstrated during the audit. Information from the SIGMA system about the weather conditions at the time of application is carried out. It was evidenced through interviews with farm residents that spraying is notified before it occurs. There is no aerial application on the property
5_10_criteria: It was evidenced through an interview with the farm manager that the practices that the farm uses to minimize drift are through monitoring relative humidity, winds and temperature. The measurement was demonstrated during the audit:
5_11_criteria: There are no seed production fields on the property. Evidenced through documentary evaluation NF of seed acquisition.

Organization: Fundação de Apoio à Pesquisa do Corredor de Exportação Norte ?Irineu Alcides Bays
Name: FAPCEN
1_1_criteria: The farms have access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of legislation and relevant documents were available. During the audit, it was found that the applicable laws are being complied with.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and have been demonstrated in documents such as land ownership registrations, Rural Amebiental Registry - CAR of properties and /or lease contracts.
1_3_criteria: The aspects were identified and continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, showing the companys commitment to meeting all the criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard. a spreadsheet "Risk Assessment and Environmental Aspect and Impact Spreadsheet" was presented with the identification of all social and environmental aspects and impacts, inside and outside the farm and shows the controls and procedures carried out. During internal audits, indicators are evaluated in parallel.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor was found during the audit process in the work environments or heard during interviews with employees of the audited farms . Relevant payments and benefits.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and relevant information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units. Risks relating to health and safety issues have been identified.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to the presence of the union on the farm.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. It was evidenced through interviews that workers on maternity leave have the right to return to their jobs under the same terms and conditions in force before the leave, without any type of discrimination or rejection due to the situation. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as website containing emails telephones, postal address on farm roads with advertising signs written Â“contact usÂ” and via FAPCEN and internally on the scope farms through Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the workers point control.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements. Places of importance are identified, maintained and preserved.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels are available and accessible. Complaints and complaints received are checked and responded to. There were no records of complaints and complaints at the time of the audit.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the farms and vacancies are advertised through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fill out the job application, I have your resume on file. There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the scope farms, carried out by the farms and by the Fapcen office.
4_1_criteria: The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified for each farm within the certification scope. Studies are available upon request. Presented the CAS - Socio-Environmental Adequacy Commitment and the Internal Audit Report carried out on March 14, 2022, by the company Produzindo Certo. The aspects and impacts raised by the farm consultancy are being mitigated and controlled, as evidenced in internal audits. The company has reports containing all social and environmental indicators. The report is forwarded and made available upon request.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging appropriately. There is an Environmental Management Plan presented during the audit that covers waste management including all areas of the property.
4_3_criteria: The farms promote actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and monitored organic matter in the soil.
4_4_criteria: After checking maps and satellite images extracted from Google Earth of the areas of the sampled farms, it was possible to identify that there were no new soybean planting areas, these being within the indicator requirements.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling preservation and legal reserve areas, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater , drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and underground waters.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, Fapcen presented detailed maps of all farms with indication of riparian vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farms' CAR.
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analyses, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion and rotation control techniques of crops are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: Farms use suitable products to control pests and diseases. IPMs and chemical use reduction plans are implemented.
5_5_criteria: Storage and transport of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. Pesticide application records are made manually and subsequently recorded in the system.
5_6_criteria: The records were checked retroactive application, invoices for purchase and storage of products. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. There was no evidence of the use of Paraquat on farms within the scope of certification.
5_7_criteria: There is the use of biological control agents on the groups farms. The applications of biological control agents at an experimental level follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Responsible.
5_8_criteria: Presented methodology designed to identify and monitor new pests and introduced invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. There were no incidences of new pests that were not identified, according to the records presented.
5_9_criteria: Drift control procedures were presented for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water, as well as other precautions in application of pesticides.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: Bunge Alimentos - Grupo de Productores Bunge
1_1_criteria: Producers demonstrate knowledge of applicable laws and remain up to date through external consultancy from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with applicable laws was verified in most of the farms audited. Four properties had non-compliance in indicator 1.1.2, two of which were due to it not being possible to demonstrate whether the applicable laws were being complied with; and two by employees working more than 7 consecutive days, without due weekly rest.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through duly registered registrations and lease contracts on most of the farms audited. Two properties received non-conformities in indicator 1.2.1, as it was not possible to demonstrate whether land use rights are defined.
1_3_criteria: Two properties had non-compliance in indicator 1.3.2, due to the monitored indicators do not include an indicator for each Principle of the RTRS Production Standard. Indicators 1.3.1 and 1.3.3 are also not being met, however compliance with them will only be required from the second year of certification onwards.
2_1_criteria: None of the audited farms found signs of forced labor, tax, forced, trafficked or involuntary, with no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on farms are not forced to work and when they did work, it was found that they were given an opportunity. There are no children under 15 working on the farms. All employees hired are over 18 years old. Children residing on audited farms attend school. Interviews and information collected demonstrate that there is no discrimination of any kind and all workers receive equal treatment.
2_2_criteria: Employees on the audited farms are registered. The Individual Employment Contract and Employee Registration were highlighted, describing the main pertinent information, from most farms. However, two farms did not disclose employees employment contracts, generating non-compliance in indicator 2.2.1. Two farms audited did not provide specific training in occupational health and safety and vocational training for employees. Despite indicator 2.2.3 not being met, these farms did not receive non-compliance, as this indicator will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
2_3_criteria: Some audited farms have PPRA/PCMSO or PGSSMATR, where health and safety risks are identified, as well as mitigation and control measures. Two farms audited did not show that employees health is monitored in accordance with PPRA. Despite not being met, this indicator will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards. Owners of audited farms, as well as employees, demonstrate knowledge of occupational health and safety issues, such as carrying out the required medical examinations. The audited farms have First Aid and Emergency Procedures, with the aim of establishing actions to be taken in responding to emergencies. First aid training is also available to employees. An audited farm received non-compliance in indicator 2.3.4, as PPE Delivery Forms were not available.
2_4_criteria: According to reports obtained through interviews and on-site viewing at the audited farms, employees have complete freedom to join trade union organizations.
2_5_criteria: Verified from interviews, information collected and documents verified on the audited farms that the wages paid are higher than the national minimum, being paid monthly. Verified payment receipts demonstrate deductions provided for by law such as INSS and IPRF and symbolic amounts for housing and food. An audited farm did not show whether workers enjoy the right to maternity leave and stability after returning to work, receiving a non-compliance in indicator 2.5.7. Workers on four audited farms do not take time off every six consecutive days of work, generating non-compliance in indicator 2.5.6 Two properties did not show that the water for human consumption is drinkable, receiving non-compliance in indicator 2.5.9. Verified that the residences and accommodation for employees on the audited farms are adequate and have satisfactory sanitary conditions.
3_1_criteria: Some audited farms have signs advertising telephone channels at the entrance to the property. There are no procedures governing the communication process with the five audited farms. Despite not complying with indicators 3.1.1, 3.1.2 and 3.1.3, these will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
3_2_criteria: Verified that there are no cases of disputes regarding rights of use of the properties lands, as well as there is no evidence of the existence of traditional users of the properties lands.
3_3_criteria: All audited farms received non-conformities in indicators 3.3.1, 3.3.2, 3.3.3 , due to the complaints and complaints mechanism not being properly implemented.
3_4_criteria: Verified that job opportunities are filled through referrals from current employees and other farms, or through SINE and publicity on local radio. The farms acquire products from the region in which they are located.
4_1_criteria: A socio-environmental assessment was carried out by the group manager on all members, in a comprehensive and clear manner. From this assessment, points for improvement were identified. All members receive a copy of the assessment of their property and it is available from the manager, if requested.
4_2_criteria: Verified that no fires are carried out on any of the audited farms. Most of the waste is properly disposed of by the farms, however all audited farms had non-compliance in indicator 4.2.2 due to the following situations: not having correct disposal of contaminated waste and incorrect storage of used oil.
4_3_criteria: The majority of audited farms do not record the use of fossil fuels. Even though indicator 4.3.1 and 4.3.2 are not in compliance, both will be required from the third year of certification. Organic matter content is monitored by carrying out soil analyses. Furthermore, properties adopt practices that contribute to increasing soil carbon sequestration, such as: adopting direct planting systems, cultivating soil cover species, maintaining native vegetation and planting eucalyptus for use in the dryer.
4_4_criteria: Land Use and Comparative Maps were developed by the group manager, presenting satellite images of the property areas in 2009, 2016 and 2021/2022. The images were generated using a Landsat satellite. The land use of all the groups farms was analyzed, from 2009 to 2022, through the KMLs made available by the group manager. It was verified that there was no opening of area after 2009 on the farms that remain in the group.
4_5_criteria: The current satellite image maps of the farms indicate the native vegetation, production areas, watercourses and springs, on most farms audited. However, three audited farms received non-conformities in the indicators for not showing the appropriate maps. It was not possible to demonstrate whether the species present in three audited properties are protected, as well as whether hunting and collecting them is permitted, resulting in non-compliance with indicator 4.5.3. Two audited farms were able to demonstrate that they have more than 10% native vegetation. Even if indicator 4.5.4 is not met, this item will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
5_1_criteria: There is no irrigation on the audited properties. The farms use good agricultural practices in all their processes, such as direct planting, maintenance and preservation of roads, monitoring of crops, preservation of native vegetation, among other practices. In conjunction with good practices, water quality is monitored. There is no evidence of cases of contamination of the water sources of the audited farms.
5_2_criteria: It was not possible to highlight the map of three of the audited farms, with the due identification of watercourses, native vegetation, areas of production, generating non-conformity in indicator 5.2.3. It was not possible to demonstrate whether natural wetlands and native vegetation are maintained on three audited farms. Even if indicator 5.2.2 is not met, the item will only be checked from the second year onwards.
5_3_criteria: Farms apply soil improvers at a variable rate, through precision agriculture. Soil analyzes are carried out every year, however on two properties it was not possible to demonstrate soil analyses. Even though it is not in accordance with indicator 5.3.1, this item will only be charged from the third year onwards. Practices are adopted to preserve soil quality, such as cover crops and direct planting systems. The cultivation regime of the audited properties are soybeans in the harvest season and corn or cotton in the off-season.
5_4_criteria: It was not possible to highlight the agrochemicals used in three properties, resulting in non-compliance in indicator 5.4.3.
5_5_criteria: Three audited farms do not register agricultural pesticide applications, receiving non-compliance in the indicator 5.5.1, letters Â‘Â’aÂ’Â’ and Â‘Â’bÂ’Â’. Pesticides are stored in specific warehouses. However, three farms received non-compliance in indicator 5.5.3 due to the location not being fully suitable. Two farms did not disclose the final destination of the agrochemical packaging, resulting in non-compliance in indicator 5.5.2. Three farms do not indicate recently sprayed areas, generating non-compliance in indicator 5.5.4. The use of agrochemicals follows professional recommendations on all properties.
5_6_criteria: It was not possible to determine whether the agrochemicals used on three properties are listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions, generating non-conformity in indicator 5.6.1. It was also not possible to verify whether there was the use of products prohibited by national legislation, generating non-compliance in indicator 5.6.2. The scope of the groups certification does not include the Non-Paraquat module.
5_7_criteria: In two audited properties, biological control products are used, in accordance with legislation. The farms that do not use it demonstrated knowledge about its use.
5_8_criteria: It was verified that if an outbreak of new pests occurred, the audited farms would inform EMBRAPA, ADAB, IMA-MT or Aprosoja.
5_9_criteria: There are no notes regarding climatic conditions on all audited farms. Although indicator 5.9.2 is not being complied with, this will only be charged from the third year onwards. Two audited farms carry out aerial applications only in plots specific areas, which are far from populated areas, legal reserves and permanent preservation areas, as well as water courses. Three farms receive non-compliance in indicator 5.9.3, 5.9.4 and 5.9.5, as it was not possible to demonstrate which agrochemicals are used, whether in aerial or terrestrial applications, as well as the distances of applications from populated areas or bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: Neighboring areas have the same type of production, crops and management used in the audited properties .
5_11_criteria: Verified that the seeds acquired by the farms are from legally known sources, with the respective terms of seed compliance. Three farms did not disclose the origin of the seeds used, generating non-conformities in indicators 5.11.1 and 5.11.2.

Name: Inacio Carlos Urban e outros - (Fazenda Pirulito)
1_1_criteria: The farm has access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of legislation and relevant documents were available. The information presented during the audit, the documentation verified, the interviews carried out, the farm structure verified and the conditions in the field (Corn Harvest) demonstrate that the auditee has knowledge of the applicable legal requirements. The Farroupilha Group, of which Fazenda Pirulito is part, has a well-structured SGI (Integrated Management System) department for the areas of Occupational and Environmental Safety, HR, Legal Department, among other sectors, which provide support for all applicable legislation. . The group carries out internal audits annually (at least) in addition to external audits for cotton and coffee production. The group and the farm rely on technical consultancy from the company Agrocert for all issues relating to certifications.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use the land are defined and have been demonstrated in documents such as land ownership registrations. During the audit, the registrations of the audited farm areas were verified and it was found that the productive areas are owned areas that have registrations and the leased areas have land use contracts
1_3_criteria: Continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, internal audits, defined indicators and monitoring, showing the farms commitment to meeting all the criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard. according to the assessment required in 4.1.1.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor was found during the audit process in the work environments or heard during interviews with farm employees.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and relevant information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and safety are documented in the PGRTR - Rural Work Risk Management Program, signed by the Occupational Safety Engineer, and are transmitted by the Integration Booklet for Employees, DDS and the PCMSO for employees. The health aspects of workers are monitored through Occupational Health Certificates, with all employees sampled being fit for the role, according to the occupational health certificate and medical certificate. The risks of the work environment have been identified and are known. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each role and an action plan is available for emergency situations. The farm has a nurse available, an occupational doctor and people trained in first aid with means of communication available to deal with an emergency situation. The first aid kits were verified in the records presented and the leaders of each sector are authorized to transport the injured or sick person to the medical service in the nearest city.
2_4_criteria: There is no collective agreement with the workers unions due to no have an active union in the region, so the regime applied is by the CLT. In an interview it was identified that there is no type of discrimination or action that prevents or hinders the action of organizations on the farm. Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as their presence in the agricultural unit.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records show that the wages paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees, food and drinking water as per documentation and interviews carried out. The weekly working day does not exceed 48 hours, if worked, they are counted as overtime (50 and 100% with work carried out on Sundays and holidays). Overtime is within 2 hours per day for common functions. Workers on maternity leave have the right to return to their jobs under the same terms and conditions in force before the leave, without any type of discrimination or rejection due to the situation.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through the channels of communication such as the Code of Ethics manual, complaint and suggestion boxes (Fala Farroupilha), available telephone numbers and the website contains contact us (http://www.grupofarroupilha.com/contato). The farm has an Environmental Education program where the areas of direct and indirect influence of the farm were mapped for the dissemination of channels.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the evaluated area. Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements. Places of importance are identified, maintained and preserved.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels are available and accessible. All complaints and/or grievances are managed and recorded by the HR Department, according to the document "Complaints, Suggestions and Complaints Worksheet" presented during the audit, with the dates of receipt, processing and closing dates and those responsible, however, To date, there have been no complaints and/or complaints reported on the channels. .
3_4_criteria: The workers hired come from communities close to the farm and vacancies are advertised through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fills out the job application, I have your CV on file. There are several programs, including training aimed at local schools, local agriculture, with environmental, agronomic and training topics for the local population.
4_1_criteria: Presented the Internal Audit Report "RTRS Certified Soy" of Fazenda Pirulito carried out in March 24th and 25th, 2022, considering all indicators of the RTRS Production Standard. The farm also has other certifications such as Rainforest Alliance, Better Cotton Initiative (BCI), Responsible Brazilian Cotton (ABR) and Regenagri, which are standards that evaluate environmental and social issues among other principles. The aspects and impacts raised by the groups management are being mitigated and controlled, as evidenced in internal audits.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging appropriately. The farm has a suitable location for storing used oil and contaminated waste.
4_3_criteria: Fuel recording is done manually at the pump and then entered into spreadsheets where the volumes are compiled. Information on the volume per hectare and per unit of product monitored in all activities related to soybean production can be obtained. Soil analysis data is available. To improve the organic matter of the soil, the producer uses the following crops: millet and carries out everything as direct planting and crop rotation. Direct planting and crop rotation are also carried out on the property, in addition to preserving environmental areas, which increases carbon sequestration.
4_4_criteria: Evidenced through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas are already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation. A production map was presented, with all the native vegetation present, watercourses and production areas, the farms CAR was also presented.
4_5_criteria: The audited farm has more than 10% of the vegetation area However, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation. During the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling preservation and legal reserve areas, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farm demonstrates good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and groundwater. Water potability analyzes were presented and there is no evidence of contamination. The farm carries out irrigation (it has 7 pivots) and only two were used for soybeans. There are procedures - Irrigation Management Report and software (Icrop) implemented on the farm, for best practices and compliance with grants.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, the farm presented maps indicating the riparian vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farm's CAR.
5_3_criteria: Appropriate techniques (direct planting, crop rotation, straw coverage) are used to improve soil quality and soil analysis to check soil quality and deficiencies and correct them when necessary.
5_4_criteria: The farm uses suitable products to control pests and diseases. MIPs and chemical use reduction plans are implemented. Everything is documented in the documents "Integrated Management of Pests and Diseases" and "Phytosanitary Management of Plants" Applications of agricultural pesticides follow the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Eng. Agr. Farm manager - ElisÃ¢ngela Pereira de Jesus - CREA -MG 141227/D.
5_5_criteria: The storage of chemical products follows the recommendations of NR 31, being washed and sent to accredited institutions. Agrochemical application record presented, including names of those responsible and operators of the application, as well as the equipment and flow rates used. Weather conditions during application are also checked
5_6_criteria: Retroactive application records, invoices for purchase and storage of products were checked. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of Paraquat was not evidenced on farms within the scope of certification, a plan to reduce the use of Paraquat was also presented.
5_7_criteria: Biological products are used on the Pirulito farm and information on usage requirements is included. There is the Application Record with information on the use of Cristal biological control agents; Quality, Onix and Rizos
5_8_criteria: Presented methodology designed to identify and monitor new pests and introduced invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. The agricultural managers who visit the property and the farm work together with Embrapa and EPAMIG, which carry out monitoring work for new pests. There were no incidences of new pests that were not identified, according to the records presented.
5_9_criteria: Drift control procedures were presented for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water, as well as other precautions in application of pesticides. The procedures are in the document "Management of Phytosanitary Products" prepared by the responsible Agricultural Engineer, there are the Application Records of spraying operations with climatic conditions and records in the Icrop system of the meteorological station. Aerial application is carried out on the farm and precautions are taken to ensure that the ITO - Operational Work Instruction - Operational Work Instruction does not impact populated areas, including prior communication; however, the procedure prohibits aerial application within a radius of 500 meters close to populated areas. . Production areas are more than 30 meters from populated areas and bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system. The sprayers are equipped with anti-drift nozzles (with air induction), adjuvants are used and the wind direction is observed at the time of application and applications are made in the coolest hours of the day to avoid interference with the neighboring production system
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources, as proven by invoices and purchase records.

Name: Fazenda São João Batista
1_1_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation and interviews with managers, that the farm has a Â“Control of Regulatory NormsÂ” system, containing Norms, Decrees, Laws and other legislation pertinent to the operation of the farm and maintains a contract provision of services with outsourced companies, responsible for maintaining licenses and other mandatory regulatory documents in accordance with applicable legislation.
1_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation of lease contracts, Provisional Authorization for Rural Operations, CAR, Grants and registration certificates. According to documentary evaluation, the evaluated unit complies with applicable legislation.
1_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the report with indicators extracted for evaluation and monitoring, from Health and Safety, Agricultural and Environment.
2_1_criteria: According to a visual assessment of signs fixed to the property and through interviews with employees, it was declared that no form of forced, compulsory, slave, trafficked or involuntary labor is used at any stage of production. It was stated that no worker is required to leave their identity documents with other people and no part of their salary, benefits or belongings is withheld by owners or third parties. According to an interview carried out with farm employees, they reported living on the property with their families, and reported that their spouses and/or children are free to choose to work or not on the properties. Information also reported by the HR coordinators of the sampled farms. Through interviews with employees, managers and observation on the property during field interviews, no minors were found working on the farm. There is 1 family with just 1 child who is not of school age. Evidenced through documentary analysis and interviews with employees that discrimination of any nature does not occur on the farm, and is not tolerated. There are channels for anonymous reporting, should this occur, and employees are aware of these channels. It was possible to demonstrate through documentary evaluation that all farm salaries follow those established in the CLT, with no distinction between functions. Through interviews with employees, it was possible to demonstrate that they are not subject to corporal punishment, oppression, mental or physical coercion, physical or verbal abuse, sexual harassment or any other type of intimidation.
2_2_criteria: According to documentary evaluation, it was verified that all sampled employees had signed contracts on the dates of hiring. Through document evaluation, it was found that labor laws are detailed to employees through the code of conduct and the Integration Manual, at the time of hiring together with the employment contract, as evidenced by the duly signed document. Regarding training, it is offered to employees according to the role they perform. All contractors undergo Integration training.

Name: Cataratas do Iguaçu Produtos Orgânicos- Ltda – Gebana Brasil (Grupo Filipini)
1_1_criteria: The farm has access to applicable legislation through the hiring of accounting consultancy and guidance provided by the groups management through visits by field technicians to the property, the legislation is being complied with. Owners demonstrated knowledge of the legislation and relevant documents were available.
1_2_criteria: There is documentary evidence of land use rights. The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as property registration, CAR and lease contract.
1_3_criteria: The assessment of social, environmental and agricultural aspects is carried out, where aspects that should be improved, such as monitoring organic matter and diesel consumption. These are presented in the audit through the RTRS socio-environmental analysis carried out through field surveys of the propertys conditions. Mitigation measures were established for the identified aspects. The data obtained from the diesel consumption survey demonstrate a consumption of 35.7 liters per hectare at Fazenda Santo AntÃ®onio and 58.8 liters at Fazenda Umbu.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory or slave labor was found or involuntary during the audit process in work environments. No worker is required to leave their identity documents and undue deductions are not made on employee pay slips. Children and minors do not carry out dangerous work or any work
2_2_criteria: The courses carried out by the owner were verified during the audit. Verified training certificate of the son of producer Carlos Eduardo Dambros Fillipini, carried out by SENAR on 04/01/2022 - Training on tractors and agricultural implements - Operation and Maintenance, SENAR Certificate Operation and Maintenance of Automotive Harvester carried out in Capinzal between days from 01/11/2016 to 01/12/2016. There is no written employment contract that specifies the duties and rights of workers. All workers are registered with the CTPS.
2_3_criteria: The producer has demonstrated knowledge of health and safety issues, appropriate clothing and equipment is provided. The risks relating to health and safety issues have not yet been identified. The group manager plans to hold a first aid course. There is no written procedure for emergency cases.
2_4_criteria: There is freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining for all workers.
2_5_criteria: Verified during the audit that the wages paid comply with the value determined in the collective agreement. The working hours are recorded by the employer and do not exceed 48 hours per week
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as the website https://blog.gebana.com.br/ouvidoria-gebana-brasil/ containing telephone: (46) 3552 1614 and email atendimento@gebana.com.br. There are communication signs in the rural union, offices and at the entrance to the property. The group manager is responsible for managing such communication channels.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation such as land ownership registrations and property registration were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements. Places of importance are identified, maintained and preserved.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels are available and accessible. Complaints and complaints received are checked and responded to. There were no records of complaints and complaints at the time of the audit. The procedure for accessing the complaint channel is published through an explanatory poster at the rural union in the city of CapinÃ³polis- SC. There is a procedure for receiving complaints and complaints and there is responsibility for the procedure for handling complaints. The complaint can be directed to the producers or group manager. The complaint must be registered, investigated, monitored and the complaint closed. After documenting the complaint, the procedure establishes that feedback must be given to the complainant.
3_4_criteria: Verified during the audit that employment opportunities and the supply of goods and services to the local community are provided. Gebana, group manager, promotes field days aimed at producers and the local community, offering, among other things, courses and technical support. Goods and services are purchased in the local community.
4_1_criteria: The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified in the ''RTRS Socio-Environmental Analysis" for each farm in the scope of certification. The studies are available through the request. This document contains the identified points and the measures to minimize or mitigate the identified impacts.
4_2_criteria: The audited farm does not carry out operations involving oil handling on the property. There is no storage of waste on the property. maintenance and/or machinery is carried out in workshops in the city of Capinzal - SC. The waste generated is stored correctly and has adequate final disposal. The farm, in its activities, has a small generation of waste. It was verified through an interview that the reuse and recycling occur whenever possible. The property does not have a Waste Management Plan.
4_3_criteria: The farms promote actions such as fuel registration, green manure and maintenance of soil cover. It was verified during the audit that the property does not perform soil analysis to quantify soil organic matter. Opportunities to increase carbon sequestration were identified with the permanent practice of conservation of Legal Reserves, implementation of plant barriers and the use of crop rotation techniques.
4_4_criteria: Evidenced through maps and satellite photos that Soy areas are already used for agriculture before May 2009. Comparative maps from 2009 to 2022 of the Umbu and Santo AntÃ´nio farms were verified.
4_5_criteria: The farms in the scope have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, in addition Furthermore, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation. During the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling preservation and legal reserve areas, as well as the prohibition of hunting on the audited farm.
5_1_criteria: The audited farm demonstrates good agricultural practices such as erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels and use of green manure, which help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and underground water. There is no use of agrochemicals due to the cultivation being done organically.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed. The group manager presented detailed maps of all farms indicating the riparian vegetation, the areas of production and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farms' CAR.
5_3_criteria: The farm adopts good agricultural practices. There are applicable techniques for preserving soil quality, such as direct planting, crop rotation (soy, corn, wheat and cover crops), organic fertilization and planting green cover. Erosion control and crop rotation techniques are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: The farm uses suitable biological products to control pests and diseases. Checking for pests and diseases is done. There is no use of chemicals on the audited farms as they are organic farming. The Integrated Crop Management Plan was presented, prepared by Gebana, which serves as the basis for carrying out field inspections and the best control methodology for the farms within the scope.
5_5_criteria: There is no use of agrochemical products as they are treated with organic production. There are records of biological products used, storage and disposal of waste are properly carried out. Proof of disposal of empty product packaging was presented to receiving companies in the region duly licensed to receive this waste. Vegetation barriers are adopted to prevent contamination by drift. Records of biological and fertilizer applications are recorded in a specific field notebook provided by the group manager. No pesticide spraying is carried out
5_6_criteria: Retroactive application records and invoices for purchase and storage of products were checked. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of Paraquat on farms within the scope of certification was not evidenced. It is clear that the production is organic and occurs without the use of agrochemicals.
5_7_criteria: There is the use of biological control agents on the property. Verified field notebook with application records, which contains the record of spraying xentare and Dipel multiplied 2.5 liters.
5_8_criteria: Presented methodology aimed at identifying and monitoring new pests and introduced invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. There were no incidences of new pests that have not been identified. If this appears, the EPAGRI institution would be the institution to be informed.
5_9_criteria: The lists and certificates of the courses carried out on the farms were presented, good practices to be implemented are described in the field notebook provided by Gebana to the producer. It was also found that the procedures are implemented and registered. Property has organic production and barriers established to prevent drift from neighboring areas from affecting its production system. Property does not apply agrochemicals.
5_10_criteria: The neighboring areas have an agricultural production system and there are procedures to avoid interference with the production systems of neighboring areas. Guidance is constantly given to employees, weather conditions are respected and no interference has been identified in neighboring productions and there are green barriers that separate neighboring productions.
5_11_criteria: The group manager checks the seeds to be planted, whether through the supply of the seed to be planted to the producer or, in the case of the producers own fields, through tests that guarantee the non-transgenic nature of the seeds.

Name: AgroSB Agropecuária S.A.
1_1_criteria: The farm has access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of legislation and relevant documents were available. The audited farm also has external consultancy in terms of occupational safety, health and environment.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use the land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land ownership registrations. All cultivated areas are owned areas. Documents demonstrating land ownership, list of pesticides used and dosages applied, agronomic prescriptions, good agricultural practices, employee training (NRs), employment contracts, employee records, time cards, pay slips, medical examinations, payments were verified. and discounts, collective work agreement, environmental licenses, rural environmental registry (CAR), grants, potability analysis, among other documents.
1_3_criteria: During the audit, the initial internal audits were presented, containing the identification of aspects social, environmental and agricultural, on and off the farm, the points that must be improved and monitored were presented in the spreadsheet "AgroSB Impact Assessment" containing tables with data on the indicators that are being monitored. For each continuous improvement indicator, deadlines and responsible parties were defined as verified in the internal audit reports and in the aspect/impact spreadsheet during the audit. In an interview with those responsible, they informed that, if necessary, actions are taken to ensure continuous improvement.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor was found during the audit process in the environments work or heard during interviews with farm employees. Document return receipts and payment slips were checked.
2_2_criteria: All workers have contracts that specify their working conditions, as well as service providers as evidenced during the audit. Contracts stipulate working conditions, schedules, payments, overtime and vacations in simple, easy-to-understand language. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work. All necessary training according to each role has been carried out.
2_3_criteria: Information on health and safety is documented and transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. AGROSB created the PPRA to identify the risks and procedures to address these issues. And each risk was identified for the execution of the function. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan for emergency situations is available. Employees and managers were interviewed and everyone was able to explain the risks and prevention measures for their safety at work. Course certificates and attendance lists related to occupational safety were presented.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the agricultural unit However, there is no active union in the region. The participation of NGOs during the audit process was not evidenced, nor was their impediment.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that the salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Water Potability Analyzes of water collection wells for human consumption, carried out by the Laboratory, were presented and all results meet the potability standards established in Consolidation Ordinance number 5 of the Ministry of Health. There is accommodation for farm employees who live at no cost and all locations were in good condition according to the records presented and in the interviews it was informed that the farm also provides adequate food, at no cost to employees
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as the Code manual of Ethics at Agro Santa BÃ¡rbara, which has the confidential channel via telephone at 0800-750-5528 and the email canalconfidencial.agrosb@audit.com.br, publicized during integration with employees, on posters on bulletin boards and at the farm entrance and in meetings with collaborators and the community.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements. Places of importance are identified, maintained and preserved.
3_3_criteria: Disclosure of communication channels are available on posters at the farm entrance and on the website. We were also informed that these communication channels are disclosed in meetings with employees. It was evidenced through interviews with residents and producers residing in neighboring communities that the communication channels were publicized and the workers reported in the interviews that they know the communication channels. Complaints and complaints channel that is managed by a third-party company (Iaudit) and manages complaints, all complaints are handled appropriately. For the audited farm, there were no complaints registered since the last audit carried out.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the farm and vacancies are advertised through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fill out the job application, I have your resume on file. There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the farm, such as training programs aimed at local schools, local agriculture, with environmental, agronomic and training themes for the local population.
4_1_criteria: In the Spreadsheet "Impact Assessment_AgroSB " are the social and environmental aspects and impacts of the farm and the Internal Audit Reports, carried out by a third party company, containing the GUT Prioritization Matrix (Severity, Urgency and Trend) with the identification of safety and environmental items. The identified points are evaluated and monitored. The assessment was carried out by the companys Coordinator and Sustainability Manager who has experience and carried out the assessment appropriately, which is in accordance with the reality of the operations carried out by the farm. All information was treated openly and all aspects found were reported to assess the need to mitigate environmental and social impacts. The aspects and impacts raised by the groups management are being mitigated and controlled, as evidenced in internal audits...
4_2_criteria: Culture remains, vegetation and waste are not burned. The farm uses techniques to take advantage of the waste generated, such as direct planting and crop rotation, it also uses composting and manages solid waste appropriately, according to the documentation presented. The Farm Waste Management Plan document describes the actions that the property takes in relation to waste generated on the property. The storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging is carried out properly. The farm has a suitable location for storing used oil and contaminated waste. Proof of Receipt from ACREDIPAAR Association of Traders, Resellers and Distributors of Agricultural Products and Pesticides of Redemption and Invoices of Transfer to the SÃ£o Roberto farm (packaging returns are made by this farm) were presented for empty pesticide packaging, proof of disposal of Contaminated Waste (Class I) was also presented with the company AmbientalLix SoluÃ§Ãµes Ambientais, carried out in December 2021. There is also segregation of recyclable waste (collectors for segregation and adequate storage) and sales/donation notes of the recyclable.
4_3_criteria: The record of fossil fuel consumption was presented, information on the volume per hectare and per unit of product monitored in all activities related to soybean production can be obtained. The farm strives to use as little fuel as possible and, as shown in the spreadsheet, there was a reduction in the consumption of fuel used. Soil organic matter levels are monitored through annual soil analyses, and direct planting practices are also used, which promote the maintenance of organic matter in the soil.
4_4_criteria: Soybean areas have already been used for agriculture before May 2009, and there was no incorporation of new planting areas after June 2016. This was evidenced through interviews, maps and satellite images extracted from Google Earth and Landsat Image 8OLI | 08/21/2008 and 08/25/2021 SIRGAS 2000 22 Sul
4_5_criteria: The audited farm has more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, in addition to carrying out all actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation. There are signs indicating preservation and legal reserve areas, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas. Evidenced by registration data, data in the CAR, maps and satellite images that the properties contain the amount of forest recommended in the forestry code. there are signs prohibiting hunting and fishing, as well as instructions to employees through DDS.
5_1_criteria: The audited farm demonstrates good agricultural practices such as direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, which help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and underground water. In addition, erosion prevention practices are carried out, such as contour lines and always keeping the soil covered, as well as appropriate structures used to contain chemicals. Through interviews with farm managers and employees and verification of the water analysis report, it was found that there was no contamination on the farm. The water potability analysis did not present results that demonstrate contamination.
5_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentation sent to the environmental agency called CAR (Rural Environmental Registry) of the property where APP, legal reserve and agricultural area are delimited, maps of production areas and satellite images presented during the audit. The presence of natural wetlands present in the production area was not evidenced during the inspection and through maps and satellite images.
5_3_criteria: The farm adopts good agricultural practices, where practices are used to improve soil quality. of: Crop rotation, soil analysis with balanced fertilization and maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting. In addition to erosion control actions such as direct planting, promoting the maintenance of plant residues on the soil, in addition to the flat relief, which helps prevent surface runoff, promoting the infiltration of rainwater.
5_4_criteria: Integrated Pest Control Plan was presented, implemented in production areas, which addresses the use of prevention and other biological, non-chemical or select chemical controls, as well as a record of pest monitoring in order to justify or not an application, according to level of economic damage. Agricultural pesticide applications follow the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Farm manager. Application records and work orders were checked. Only original and registered products for soybean cultivation were shown in the pesticide application reports, there is a list of products in stock and photos of the product warehouse were checked. Pest Monitoring in Soybean Culture - MIP Soja. The forms analyzed contained the pests found, date, cultivar and batch.
5_5_criteria: Internally there is only transport of products to the field for application and externally the product comes from resellers to the farm, as reported by managers and employees in the interviews. Storage follows the recommendations of NR 31, according to the video presented. Records of climatic conditions are being carried out during the application of agricultural pesticides. Areas recently treated with pesticides are marked to prevent people from re-entering. Empty packaging of agricultural pesticides are washed and discarded correctly, after triple washing they are delivered to companies duly accredited for this purpose.
5_6_criteria: Retroactive application records, invoices for purchase and storage of products were checked . No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of the active ingredient Carbofuran in soybean cultivation areas was not evidenced, through verification of application records, photos of products stored in the pesticide deposit and interviews with the person responsible for agricultural recommendations. The use of Paraquat has been eliminated.
5_7_criteria: There is the use of biological control agents on the farm. The applications of biological control agents at an experimental level follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Responsible for the farm.
5_8_criteria: There have been no incidences of new unidentified pests, however, there are procedures designed to identify and monitor new pests and introduced invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. The methodology is described in the MIC Plan of the sampled farm, which describes that in cases of new pests or outbreaks, research institutions such as Embrapa and consultants will be consulted in order to seek efficient control methodologies.
5_9_criteria: Procedures are documented and deployed. Records of the use of agrochemicals were presented, including products purchased and applied, identification of the area applied, name of the operator, equipment, and meteorological conditions during application. There are also drift control procedures, indication of the minimum conditions required for application, and the actual conditions at the time of application, there are no production areas within a 30 meter radius of populated areas and bodies of water. There is no aerial application on the farm.
5_10_criteria: No interference in the production systems of neighboring areas was found during the verification of the records and maps presented and through interviews with employees responsible for carrying out work, such as the application of agricultural pesticides. It is worth noting that all neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources. The purchase of seeds from legal sources is evidenced through Invoices and the Seed Compliance Terms.

Name: Amaggi Commodities EU RED
1_1_criteria: The producer demonstrated knowledge of applicable laws and remains up to date with external advice from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with the laws was verified.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through the registrations of the farm areas.
1_3_criteria: The group manager carried out a socio-environmental assessment of the farm before itself be included in the group, and from this the aspects to be improved were identified and deadlines for implementation were defined. Improvements are monitored in annual internal audits.
2_1_criteria: Through interviews with permanent and temporary employees, it was evidenced that there is no evidence of forced, imposed, forced, trafficked or involuntary labor on the farm. Employees reported that they are free to leave the property after hours, as well as terminate the employment relationship if they wish. There is no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on the farm are not required to work on the property. There are no children under 15 working on the farm. There is a Minor Apprentice employee in the role of administrative assistant. Through interviews with employees, it was evident that there was no evidence of discrimination of any kind. The company has different levels for the same functions, with each employee placed in a level according to their level of education. There is also a differentiation by length of service. There is no differentiation between workers of the same level or length of service. Training, benefits and promotion opportunities are provided equally among employees. There is also no evidence of punishment, coercion or aggression of any kind.
2_2_criteria: All workers are registered. There is an Employment Contract binding the company to the employees, with all pertinent information, in writing. Employment contracts include all relevant information and, in addition, workers are informed of working conditions at the time of hiring, as verified in interviews with permanent and temporary employees.
2_3_criteria: Workers demonstrated in interviews the knowledge and understanding of issues related to health and safety. Workers health is monitored through periodic medical examinations. There is health and safety training, including specific training on standards NR 6, NR 11, NR 12, NR 20, NR 23, NR 33, NR 35, as well as other training in the area of occupational health and safety and other relevant training. Those responsible for potentially dangerous tasks are properly trained, such as pesticide application, carried out by qualified staff. Health and safety risks are identified and procedures are in place to control them. The Masutti Group has a complete SESMT and has an Occupational Safety Technician and occupational nurse stationed in each unit, and has documentation relevant to occupational health and safety (PGSSTR and LTCAT). The farm provides PPE and the supply is duly recorded using specific forms. The company has a complete and structured SESMT department, with an occupational safety technician and occupational nurse in each unit, responsible for applying and carrying out all surveys relevant to worker safety requirements. The company is implementing the PAE (Emergency Plan) procedure in case of accidents and emergencies. It currently has an Emergency Plan for Responding to Accidents at Work, which is available in announcements at various points on the property. The property has an outpatient clinic, an ambulance and a 24-hour nurse.
2_4_criteria: Through interviews with permanent and temporary employees, it was evidenced that there is complete freedom to join trade union organizations, with some interviewees confirming that they are union members, while others reveal that they did not participate. Terminations of employment contracts are approved by the unions.
2_5_criteria: The minimum remuneration paid on the farm is above the national minimum wage. Verified proof of payment demonstrates that only deductions provided for by law are applied, such as INSS, union contributions and food and health plan deductions, duly agreed between the parties. The working day is 44 hours per week, with occasional overtime, especially during harvest times, which does not exceed 10 hours per week. Hours worked are recorded on a biometric time clock. Workers reported that overtime is voluntary and duly paid, as evidenced by payment slips. Verified through interviews, that workers receive at least one day off for every six days worked. The farm complies with the law in the case of maternity leave. Checked records of a worker on maternity leave at the time of the audit. Housing for farm employees is adequate and has adequate sanitary conditions. Access to drinking water is guaranteed by farms. There are drinking fountains located in several locations. The property has a cafeteria, guided by a nutritionist, serving the 3 main meals of the day to all employees.
3_1_criteria: Sign verified at the entrance to the property containing the telephone contact details. The Masutti Group maintains a page on a social network, as well as having a telephone number available in the regions telephone guides and on the internet. The communication channels are public knowledge
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes regarding land use rights on the property, as well as there are no adjacent indigenous peoples, nor are there permanent conservation areas, nor schools or any areas of high cultural value close to the farm.
3_3_criteria: There are signs distributed on the property displaying their telephone numbers so that complaints can be made directly. There are also suggestion/complaint boxes in various locations on the property. The farm has the document Procedure for Receiving and Handling Complaints, which determines all procedures in case of receiving complaints. There is also a form to fill out, document Registration and Complaint Handling Form, which deals with all issues pertinent to complaints and complaints
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised through SINE, on the company wall and internal referrals, always looking for workers in the region. The property participates in events and field days. Those responsible participate in lectures and training from the Rural Union, SENAR and companies in the region, as verified in certificates and reports from those responsible. The property purchases products and services from companies in the region.
4_1_criteria: The farm underwent a socio-environmental assessment before being included in the group. A Socio-Environmental Diagnosis was carried out by AlianÃ§a da Terra, which has qualified personnel for such an assessment. The diagnosis is comprehensive and transparent, considering impacts related to the farm.
4_2_criteria: The propertys waste management is governed by the Fazenda Saudades/PaixÃ£o Waste Management Plan. Used batteries are returned in exchange for new ones. Old tires are separated and later collected on the property. The collection of used lubricating oils is carried out by the company Lwart Lubrificantes. Lamps and batteries are stored in a box provided in the propertys workshop and later collected. The houses have septic tanks. Organic waste is buried in a suitable location. A non-conformity was identified in item 4.2.3 as used lubricating oils are stored in suspended tanks without a containment basin. Despite this, the fuel tanks have a containment dam and a fueling lane with a floor, channels and containment box. The machine washing area has a cement floor, gutters and separation box. Oil changes are carried out in a location with a floor, channels and containment box. Recycling is carried out whenever possible. Plastic waste is collected by the company Amazonekos, as well as cans and drums.
4_3_criteria: The use of fossil fuels is recorded when the machines are filled. No increases in fuel use were recorded in the last harvest. The soil matter content is monitored through soil analysis. Soil carbon is increased through practices such as: maintaining straw as ground cover
4_4_criteria: No area expansion was made, as evidenced by satellite image maps comparing the propertys areas in 2008 and 2017.
4_5_criteria: The property map indicates native vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Annual internal audits are carried out to monitor native vegetation. Verified that the farm is restoring degraded areas. The property prohibits any hunting activity within it. Checked warning signs present in the areas. Extractive practices such as collecting native wood or other natural products are also prohibited. The farm has over 10% native vegetation area.
5_1_criteria: The farm adopts good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as: adopting the direct seeding system; straw management for soil cover; use of correctors and fertilizers in accordance with technical recommendations; maintenance of APP and legal reserve areas. A non-compliance was identified in indicator 5.1.2 as analyzes are not carried out to monitor water quality. The farm does not use irrigation.
5_2_criteria: The farm identifies the location of watercourses on the map, as well as the status of riparian vegetation. The farm has an area of natural vegetation in the process of regeneration and measures are being taken to recover other degraded areas.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality monitoring is done through soil analysis. Soil quality is preserved through the adoption of practices such as: adoption of the direct planting system; maintenance of straw as soil cover; use of fertilizers and correctives in accordance with technical recommendations; maintenance of APP and legal reserve areas. Erosive processes are prevented through the construction of contour lines, adoption of the direct planting system and maintenance of soil cover. The farm carries out succession of crops. There is no cultivation of soybeans on soybeans, the sanitary void period is respected.
5_4_criteria: The farm has a MIC Â– Integrated Crop Management plan, addressing the use of preventive and control methods that cause less environmental impact . The farm envisages the reduction of potentially harmful agrochemicals in a documented plan. The farm only uses agrochemicals permitted for soybean cultivation and in the dosages prescribed by those responsible, as evidenced in the deposits and records of agrochemical use. A non-conformity was identified in indicator 5.4.5 due to no monitoring records of pests, diseases, weeds and natural enemies.
5_5_criteria: The companys planning sector carries out product purchases. Service orders are opened for the application of pesticides by the technical team in accordance with field monitoring, where the product, quantity, dose, area, plot, weather conditions and team responsible for execution are recorded. Empty packaging is washed at the time of application and then stored in the warehouse. The deposit is covered, closed, locked and marked, but it does not have channels or a containment box, which led to non-compliance in indicator 5.5.2. Empty packaging is delivered to a local receiving center. Pesticides are delivered to the farm by the multinationals that sell them. The place for storing pesticides is covered, locked, closed, marked, has aeration and the packaging is arranged on wooden pallets, but there are no channels or containment box, which led to non-conformity in item 5.5.3. There is an area for preparing pesticides, equipped with a small temporary pesticide deposit, flooring and an ozonizer for equipment decontamination. The preparation of syrup is done using specific equipment for this purpose. Next to the pesticide deposit there is an emergency shower. Used PPE is decontaminated in a laundry dedicated to this purpose. Areas treated with pesticides are demarcated with signposts. Recommendations for the use of improvers and fertilizers are made by agronomists based on the results of soil analyses.
5_6_criteria: The farm does not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The herbicide Paraquat is used, but it is already planned to gradually reduce its use by 2020.
5_7_criteria: Verified that there is knowledge about the use of biological control agents. There is an intention to use biological nematicides and control agents for defoliating pests, but they have not yet been used
5_8_criteria: If an outbreak of new pests occurs, farms turn to institutions such as INDEA, MAPA or FundaÃ§Ã£o MT .
5_9_criteria: Measures implemented by the farm to prevent drift include adjusting application equipment, monitoring weather conditions during applications, and maintaining zones free from pesticide application. Aerial applications are carried out at least 1,200 meters from homes and bodies of water. Likewise, the closest populations are notified before applications. Land applications of pesticides respect a minimum distance of 150 meters from homes.
5_10_criteria: The production system adopted by farms is similar to neighboring systems. There are no adjacent areas with sensitive crops, such as organic or conventional agriculture. There are no cases of damage caused by drift to neighboring areas originating from the farm.
5_11_criteria: The farm acquires seeds from legally known sources and also produces seeds, both for its own use and for commercialization. Own seed production is duly approved by APROSMAT, as a way of complying with the intellectual properties of such materials.

Name: Louis Dreyfus Company - LDC Sorriso
1_1_criteria: Producers demonstrate knowledge of applicable laws and remain up to date through external consultancy from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with applicable laws was verified in most of the farms audited, such as Receipt of the Rural Environmental Registry, Well Grant, among others. Only one of the farms presented non-compliance in item 1.1.2 due to the occurrence of excessive overtime.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through duly registered registrations and lease contracts on all audited farms .
1_3_criteria: The manager did not carry out a social, environmental and agricultural assessment of the groups members, which generated non-compliance in the four farms audited in indicator 1.3.2. Indicators 1.3.1 and 1.3.3 are also not being met, however compliance with them will only be required from the second year of certification onwards
2_1_criteria: None of the audited farms found signs of forced labor, imposed , forced, trafficked or involuntary, and there is also no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on farms are not forced to work and when they did work, it was found that they were given an opportunity. There are no children under 15 working on the farms. All hired employees are over 18 years old. Children residing on audited farms attend school. Interviews and information collected demonstrate that there is no discrimination of any kind and all workers receive equal treatment.
2_2_criteria: All employees on the audited farms are registered, having an Individual Employment Contract and Employee Registration, describing the main information relevant. Two audited farms did not provide evidence of providing specific training in occupational health and safety to employees. Despite indicator 2.2.3 not being met, these farms did not receive non-compliance, as this indicator will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
2_3_criteria: All farms audited have PPRA/ PCMSO or PGSSMATR, where health and safety risks are identified, as well as mitigation and control measures. Owners of audited farms, as well as employees, demonstrate knowledge of occupational health and safety issues, such as carrying out the required medical examinations. In addition, the audited farms have a First Aid and Emergency Procedures document, with the aim of establishing actions to be taken in response to environmental or occupational health and safety emergencies, as well as the associated environmental impacts. There are emergency signs and first aid kits on all audited farms. Three of the audited farms received non-compliance in indicator 2.3.3, due to the employees who perform potentially dangerous tasks not having the training or qualifications to perform them. Furthermore, one of the audited farms does not provide Personal Protective Equipment to employees, generating a non-compliance in indicator 2.3.4.
