2_4_criteria: According to reports obtained through interviews and on-site viewing on the four audited farms, Employees have complete freedom to join trade unions. Three of the four audited farms follow Collective Labor Convention 2017/19, MTE Registration number: MT000731/2017
2_5_criteria: Verified from interviews, information collected and documents verified on the audited farms that the wages paid are higher to the national minimum, being paid monthly via deposit into employees accounts. Verified proof of payment demonstrates that only deductions provided for by law such as INSS and IPRF are made. The working hours on the audited farms are 44 hours per week, with overtime being compensated or paid in two periods of the year, as stated in the Collective Agreement (for the three farms that follow the Convention). For farms that do not follow the established Convention, overtime is paid alongside their monthly salaries. Two farms audited record the hours worked and overtime and the other two do not register the employer. Despite not complying with indicator 2.5.5, compliance with it will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards. An audited farm received a non-compliance in indicator 2.5.4, as excessive overtime was evidenced. There were no cases of pregnant women on the farms, however, those responsible are aware of the applicable law. Verified that the residences and accommodation for employees on the audited farms are adequate and have satisfactory sanitary conditions.
3_1_criteria: The farms have e-mail and telephone numbers and an identification plate at their headquarters. In addition, a suggestion/complaint box is kept on each farm. The Complaint/Suggestion Procedure document and Complaint/Suggestion Form are implemented and describe the procedure for handling complaints and the form for recording them. There were no complaints or suggestions at the time of the audit.
3_2_criteria: Verified that there are no cases of disputes regarding the rights to use the properties lands, as well as there is no evidence of the existence of traditional users of the properties lands.
3_3_criteria: The farms have suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters. Employees can make complaints or grievances through the box and the community can communicate with the farm via telephone and email. Any complaints are recorded in the Complaint/Suggestion Form document. If complaints are received, they will be analyzed and subsequently dealt with, as provided for in the Complaint/Suggestion Procedure. At the time of the audit, there were no complaints or complaints received.
3_4_criteria: Verified that job opportunities are filled through referrals from current employees and other farms, or searches made directly on the audited farms. One farm reported that it does not provide any type of assistance to local communities. Although indicator 3.4.2 is not being met, this indicator will only be charged from the third year of certification. Farms purchase products from the region they are located in
4_1_criteria: All farms audited receive non-compliance in indicators 4.1.1; 4.1.2; 4.1.3; 4.1.4; 4.1.5, as a social, environmental and agricultural assessment was not carried out on them.
4_2_criteria: Verified that no fires are carried out on any of the audited farms. Most of the waste is properly disposed of by the farms, however three farms audited had non-compliance in indicator 4.2.2 due to the following situations: not having correct disposal of contaminated waste and incorrect storage of tires. A farm does not have selective collection bins, and the waste collected is taken to the citys municipal landfill. Despite not complying with indicator 4.2.4, this item will only be charged from the third year of certification. All farms have a documented Waste Management Plan, developed by the group manager.
4_3_criteria: The majority of audited farms record the use of fossil fuels, however on one farm it was not possible to identify the use for crop cultivation. soy. Even though indicator 4.3.1 and 4.3.2 are not in compliance, both will be required from the third year of certification. They monitor the organic matter content by carrying out soil analyses. Furthermore, properties adopt practices that contribute to increasing soil carbon sequestration, such as: adopting direct planting systems, cultivating soil cover species, maintaining native vegetation and planting eucalyptus for use in the dryer.
4_4_criteria: Land Use and Comparative Maps were developed by LDC, presenting satellite images of property areas in 2009, 2016 and 2019. The 2009 images were generated with the Landsat 5 TM, Collection 1 Tier 2 satellite TOA Reflectance, 30 meter resolution. The 2016 and 2019 images were generated with the Sentinel-2 MSI satellite: MultiSpectral Instrument, Level-1C, 10 meter resolution. It was verified that there was no opening of vegetation areas after 2009 on the farms
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation has been maintained on all farms. Hunting and collecting protected species is prohibited on all audited farms. The manager developed the document Plan to Guarantee the Preservation of Native Vegetation and Wildlife on the Farm, but no monitoring has been carried out to date. Although indicator 4.5.2 is not being met, this item will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
5_1_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies , such as, for example, the practice of direct planting and the maintenance of soil cover through the planting of brachiaria. A farm does not have a Grant of Right to Use Groundwater, referring to the artesian well. Although indicator 5.1.1 is not being met, this indicator will only be charged from the second year of certification. On all audited farms, analyzes are carried out to monitor water quality, however, two of the analyzes presented conflicting results. Despite not meeting the requirements in indicator 5.1.2, compliance will be charged from the third year of certification. Two farms audited, use an irrigation system for soybeans, having all applicable legal documentation.
5_2_criteria: The farms have complete maps with the location of cultivated areas delimited by plot, vegetation areas and watercourses. Verified that there is no removal of riparian areas of native vegetation on the four farms audited; and there are no natural wetlands or wetland areas.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality is preserved on all audited farms through the adoption of practices such as the adoption of the direct planting system and the use of fertilizers in accordance with technical recommendations. The agricultural areas have flat relief. Direct planting is adopted on the four properties, as well as maintaining soil cover through the planting of cover species. Planning is carried out to define planting areas, following crop rotation and succession techniques on all farms.
5_4_criteria: The four farms do not have a documented Integrated Crop Management plan. Although indicator 5.4.1 is not being met, it will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards. At group level, the manager developed the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a plan to reduce potentially harmful phytosanitary products over time. As verified on the four farms, only original and genuine agrochemicals are used that meet local registration requirements for soybean cultivation. An audited farm does not have a documented record regarding crop monitoring. Although indicator 5.4.5 is not being met, it will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
5_5_criteria: Verified that the four properties audited do not have records of dosers and applicators, equipment used and weather conditions during application. Although these items are not being complied with, compliance with them will be charged from the next year of certification onwards, and records of meteorological conditions will be charged from the third year of certification. Empty packaging is punctured and triple-washed on the farms and stored in an empty packaging warehouse. All audited farms have a pesticide deposit in their own location, separate from other structures and identified, where pesticides are stored in accordance with legislation.
5_6_criteria: The farms do not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm Conventions and Rotterdam. Two audited farms had non-compliance in indicator 5.6.2, due to there not being a program to progressively reduce the use of Paraquat over time
5_7_criteria: In three audited properties, products for biological control are used, in compliance with the legislation. The farm that does not use it demonstrated knowledge about its use.
5_8_criteria: It was verified that if an outbreak of new pests occurred, the audited farms would inform EMBRAPA and Agrodefesa.
5_9_criteria: The farms follow the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a reduction plan and measures to avoid drift in agrochemical applications. The four farms do not record weather conditions at the time of application. Despite not compressing item 5.9.2, it will only be charged from the third year of certification onwards. Aerial applications are not carried out in cultural management for soybean cultivation on the audited farms. There is no application of pesticides near populated areas or water courses.
5_10_criteria: Neighboring areas have the same type of production, crops and management employed on the audited properties.
5_11_criteria: Verified that the seeds acquired by the farms are from legally known sources, with the respective terms of seed compliance. None of the farms produce their own seeds.

Name: Cataratas do Iguaçu Produtos Orgânicos Ltda - Gebana Brasil
1_1_criteria: The farms have access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of the legislation and relevant documents were available. During the audit, the documentation relevant to family farming was verified, the infrastructure was checked, interviews with those responsible for the farms and agronomic and environmental issues were observed. Knowledge of applicable laws was demonstrated. Documents demonstrating land ownership, registrations, certificates, list of products used, good agricultural practices, internal training, seed purchase invoices and terms of compliance, input invoice for the purchase of inputs, environmental licenses, rural environmental registration were verified. (CAR), grants, potability analysis, among other documents.
1_2_criteria: Documents such as registrations of the audited farms, and in cases of settlements, the term of commitment, DAP and registration of the property with registration were presented.
1_3_criteria: The document called "Gebana Diagnosis - Socio-Environmental Analysis" and it was possible to verify that the assessment was carried out, however the points for improvement were not defined.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor during the audit process in work environments. There is no hiring of employees on the audited farms. It is family farming. According to information obtained in the interviews, the spouses have other work activities outside the farm and their children attend school.
2_2_criteria: Training, training and guidance on health and safety are provided to the owners through the group manager.
2_3_criteria: Producers demonstrated knowledge of health and safety issues, potentially dangerous activities are carried out only by qualified people, appropriate clothing and equipment were provided to producers by Gebana, however, the risks relating to the issues health and safety issues were not identified/mapped.
2_4_criteria: All farms audited are family farms, no employees are hired.
2_5_criteria: There are no workers hired. However, the water potability analyzes carried out by Gebana do not have a conclusive report in accordance with the Ministry of Health Ordinance.
3_1_criteria: On the farms visited, there are suggestions and complaints boxes available (managed by Gebana) and communication channels were publicized (website (https://blog.gebana.com.br/ouvidoria-Gebana-brasil) containing emails, telephones and postal addresses. and telephone) to the community. On the roads between the community and the farms with advertising signs written Â“talk to usÂ” and internally on the scope farms through Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”.
3_2_criteria: In the audit carried out, no dispute was detected relating to land use. Land ownership documents were presented as registrations and, in cases of settlements, the term of commitment, DAP and registration of the property with registration. There are no indigenous people near the farms. On all audited farms, Legal Reserve and/or Permanent Preservation areas are identified and protected. There are signs prohibiting hunting in these areas.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels are available and accessible. Complaints and complaints received are checked and responded to. There were no complaints or complaints recorded at the time of the audit.
3_4_criteria: Gebana, the group manager, organizes field days aimed at producers and the local community, offering, among other things, courses, technical support, etc.
4_1_criteria: Social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified for each farm in the certification scope. The studies are available upon request.
4_2_criteria: The Waste Management Plan was presented during the audit and it was found that the plan covers waste management including all areas of the property. On the audited farms, initiatives were highlighted to separate recyclable waste and sales notes or donations of this waste were presented.
4_3_criteria: The farms promote actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out in accordance with soil analyzes and organic matter in the soil was monitored.
4_4_criteria: There was no incorporation of new planting areas after May 2009. Checks of maps and satellite images extracted from Google Earth of the farm areas in the scope, it was possible to identify that no there were new soybean planting areas on the farms visited, which were within the indicators requirements.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage the wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling preservation and legal reserve areas, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good practices agricultural (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and underground water.
5_2_criteria: On maps and field visits, riparian vegetation was not removed. There are no humid areas on the farms visited.
5_3_criteria: The farms visited adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analysis, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. During visits to the production areas, it was possible to identify that erosion control techniques are applied appropriately.
5_4_criteria: The Integrated Crop Management Plan was presented by the farms, prepared by Gebana, which serves as a basis for carrying out the field inspections and better control methodology for farms in scope. The farms have organic certification.
5_5_criteria: There is no use of agrochemical products. Proof of disposal of empty packaging of organic products was presented to receiving companies in the region duly licensed to receive this waste. The correct handling and storage of them in a restricted and identified location was also verified. The use of fertilizers and all applications follow professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: The use of Carbofuram and Paraquat was not evidenced on farms within the scope of certification. No evidence of the use of these products was found, during the visit to the properties, list of products used by the company and application controls.
5_7_criteria: Only biological control agent is used, information on the use of biological control was available.
5_8_criteria: There were no incidences of new pests that have not been identified, according to the records presented. The Producers Field Notebook was checked, which records and monitors pests or species and does not include the incidence of new pests.
5_9_criteria: The lists and certificates of the courses held on the farms were presented, providing guidance on the application and monitoring meteorological conditions during application. It was also found that the procedures are implemented and recorded.
5_10_criteria: Neighboring areas have the same production system as evidenced in field visits, however, there are procedures to avoid interference with the production systems of neighboring areas. Guidelines are constantly given to employees, weather conditions are respected and no interference has been identified in neighboring productions and there are green barriers that separate them from neighboring crops.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: Fazenda Nossa Senhora Aparecida
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to the evaluation of documentation, verification of photos and videos, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety and agricultural laws are respected and complied with . The farm has consultancy services that provide support in various areas. AlianÃ§a da Terra and Bayer: general legal consultancy and certification guidance. Foliatti Assessoria ContÃ¡bil: accounting consultancy. JC&F: Occupational health and safety consultancy and Agile Environmental Planning: environmental consultancy.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and land ownership deeds, it was found that the productive areas are owned areas that have registrations and the leased areas have land use contracts. The CAR of the Nossa Senhora farm was also presented
1_3_criteria: The aspects were identified and continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, showing the farms commitment to meeting all the criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard. The Socio-Environmental Diagnosis and the Compliance Monitoring Report of 03/27/2019 were presented. The documents present the items to be improved and the monitoring carried out every year by the farm.
2_1_criteria: Adequate working conditions were verified, through videos, photos and interviews. Payments are made according to the activity carried out by the farm employee and receipts are maintained and made available when necessary. Personal documents are not retained and discounts that are not provided for in legislation were not highlighted. Employees receive appropriate training for their duties and the benefits provided by law. No evidence of aggression or disrespect was seen in the work environments with the videos presented, or heard during the interview with workers on the propertys work fronts. No children under 18 were identified working on the farm. No type of discrimination regarding race, sex, religion or others was evident during the audit, verification of HR documentation, pay slips and interviews with employees of the sampled farms. The complaint and reporting channels were also checked.
2_2_criteria: Registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees of the production unit were presented, and were available in easy-to-understand language in the HR department for consultation by workers. The company and its employees do not follow any union at the moment, as there is no active union in the region. The due and appropriate training was carried out.
2_3_criteria: The documents were presented: PGSSMATR of Fazenda Nossa Senhora - Signed by the Occupational Safety Technician, valid until May 2022, Integration Booklet for Employees, DDS and PCMSO - Signed by the Occupational Doctor, valid until May 2022, addressing risk mitigation and control measures. Workers health aspects are monitored through Occupational Health Certificates, with all employees sampled being fit for the role, according to their occupational space and medical certificate. The risks of the work environment have been identified and are known. The appropriate analyzes were carried out and are monitored periodically. Workers attendance lists and training certificates were also identified, such as: NR-35 Work at Height, NR-33 Confined Space, NR-31.12 Machines and Equipment, NR-31.8 Application of Pesticides, NR-23 Combating the Principle of Fire, NR 20 - Flammable liquids and First Aid. There were delivery forms for PPE Â’s suitable for the function according to environmental risks existing in the production unit and the PPE was available for use by employees. During the video checks, workers were shown using PPE when carrying out their activities. There is a visit from professionals from the company INOVA Consultoria, which carries out health and safety inspections weekly. In addition, the company has a code of ethics and social conduct from Fazenda NS Aparecida
2_4_criteria: The right to participation of workers through collective agreements and employment contracts or other organizations is permitted. Fazenda Nossa Senhora Aparecida, as well as its employees, are not affiliated with the Union of rural workers in the region.
2_5_criteria: The remunerations are compatible with national legislation, the pay slips detail the salary and deductions, there were no deductions irregular. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. Hours worked are recorded using a time clock, overtime occurs within the limit permitted by legislation.
3_1_criteria: There are channels of communication and dialogue, which are: suggestion box and posted on the door of the farm, through signs.
3_2_criteria: No traditional populations were found near the farms that could be affected by their operations. It is evident through maps, satellite images, interviews and the AlianÃ§a da Terra Sustainability Report that there are no indigenous peoples in the farms areas of influence.
3_3_criteria: The suggestion box is visible to everyone in the workshop, in the cafeteria and near the electronic point, there is also contact information on the sign at the farm entrance. Documented complaints and suggestions remain on the farm under the control of the owners. Complaints and grievances are checked monthly and responses are passed on to DDS for employees in general. However, there have been no complaints and reports since the last audit and at the present time
3_4_criteria: Job opportunities are advertised locally by employees and also by the external company Promove, which has a portal that recruits and selects employees. employees. The farm contributes financial aid to adapt a municipal school in the region and social action. Offers of goods and services are offered.
4_1_criteria: Evaluation carried out in a comprehensive manner, the Socio-Environmental Diagnosis document and Compliance Monitoring Report were carried out by a multidisciplinary team from the company AlianÃ§a da Terra, which cover social and environmental points of the farm in a comprehensive and clear manner.
4_2_criteria: The storage locations for fuel, lubricants, among others are located in areas with waterproof floors and containment for protection in case of accidental leaks, as shown in the videos and photos presented. The organic matter of the soil is monitored and measures for improvement, in addition the producer uses the following crops: millet, corn, oats and carries out everything such as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_3_criteria: The fuel record is made of manually at the pump and then entered into the Conectere Agro GestÃ£o electronic system. Information on the volume used per hectare and per unit of product is monitored in all activities related to soybean production. Crop rotation and direct planting are used as an opportunity for carbon sequestration
4_4_criteria: There was no land conversion after 2009, the Socio-environmental diagnosis made by the company AlianÃ§a da Terra, presents comparisons of satellite images of the current image and prior to the cutoff date (September 2008), which demonstrates that the property did not convert land.
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained in accordance with federal law, evidenced through registration data and data in the CAR that the properties contain the amount of forest recommended in the forestry code, which is 20% for the cerrado biome, where the farm is located. There is also the Environmental Diagnosis carried out by AlianÃ§a da Terra, which ignores areas that can be improved, such as the planting of trees in APP areas, evidenced during the verification of maps and images of the farm. Hunting and fishing are not permitted.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices are implemented, through crop rotation practices, direct planting in straw, fertilization and correction according to technical calculation, containment areas for storing chemical products and carrying out of water analysis as monitoring. Erosion prevention measures such as contour lines and always keeping the soil covered are carried out, as well as appropriate structures used to contain chemicals. No contamination of groundwater was found, according to monitoring analysis reports presented. Irrigation management procedures and systems are implemented through the ICROP program that performs calculations using data entered from monitoring meteorological data and soil moisture for irrigation application. A grant of abstraction water for irrigation, issued by the Secretariat of Environment and Water Resources, was also presented. The monitoring measures are evidenced through the AlianÃ§a da Terra Sustainability Report.
5_2_criteria: The watercourses and APPs are mapped. The socio-environmental diagnosis document shows that the APP areas are being recovered throughout the property by natural regeneration. There is also the Environmental Diagnosis carried out by AlianÃ§a da Terra, which encompasses areas that can be improved such as the planting of trees in the APP area, evidenced by checking maps and images of the farm.
5_3_criteria: A Soil organic matter is monitored through a specialized company that carries out soil analyzes for management through graphics and implementation of precision agriculture. Practices are carried out to improve soil quality such as: Crop rotation with millet, oats, corn and beans, soil analysis with fertilization through precision agriculture, maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting. The farm uses level planting, contour lines and direct planting to prevent erosion.
5_4_criteria: The farm has a document "Procedure for Good Agricultural Practices and Integrated Crop Management" and there are records of pest monitoring in the document standard called "Monitoring of pests in soybean cultivation", in addition, the farm uses other control methods, in addition to chemical ones, which are: varietal, chemical, physiological and biological - BT. Pest monitoring records are kept by the farm. In addition, the farm has agronomic consultancy from Mr. Alexandre Marquezzi and the company Agroexatas for soil analysis.
5_5_criteria: Records on the use of agrochemicals contain the requested data. Properly carried out storage and disposal location, all empty agrochemical packaging is triple washed, perforated at the bottom and stored until sent to destination. Internally there is only transport of products to the field for application and externally the product comes from resales to the farm, as reported by managers and employees in the interviews. Storage follows the recommendations of NR 31. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. The recommendations are made by the specialized company Agroexata, where it carries out analyses, calculations and interpretation of analyzes for the application of variable doses in the field.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the unit. The purchase of arbuscular mycorrhizal fungus from Ativa Biotecnologia Ltda. was identified through an invoice. There is a specific document "Input application record" which contains the products purchased and applied, quantity, date and area.
5_8_criteria: The farm owners informed that the SIDAGO - Agrodefesa agency carried out the visit to the property, and is responsible for identifying and monitoring newly identified pests and invasive species
5_9_criteria: Good Agricultural Practices procedure and the ANDEF Good Agricultural Practices manual in the field were available and demonstrate good agricultural practice procedures. Meteorological records are carried out through the "Input application record". Aerial applications are not performed. There are no production areas within a 30 meter radius of populated areas and bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: Measures are taken to avoid interference with the production systems of neighboring areas, such as: sprayers are equipped with anti- drift, adjuvants are used and the wind direction is observed at the time of applications. Neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The purchase of seeds is made from legal sources, and has been proven through Invoices and the Seed Conformity Terms.

Name: Amaggi Exp. e Imp. Ltda – Grupo Parecis II
1_1_criteria: Producers stay up to date with applicable laws through internet research, WhatsApp groups with professionals in the field and newspapers on agricultural websites. Companies that trade with farms provide professionals, such as agronomists, to assist with agricultural management and verify legal compliance. The farms also receive assistance from accounting offices. The farms comply with the majority of applicable laws, but all showed non-compliance in indicator 1.1.2 due to lack of compliance in some issues, such as water use authorization, potability analysis, lack of health and safety program, lack of time off after 6 consecutive days of work, failure to pay overtime in accordance with collective agreement. NC: indicator 1.1.2 (Minor).
1_2_criteria: The properties demonstrate the right to use the land through deeds and/or lease contracts.
1_3_criteria: The socio-environmental aspects that must be improved on all farms. Based on these aspects, indicators are defined and these are aligned with the goals established per year.
2_1_criteria: There is no evidence of forced labor, slavery or their equivalents on the audited farms. Workers keep their belongings with them, there is no retention of personal documents of employees by the farms. In cases where a husband and wife work on the property, both work voluntarily. All workers are of legal age, there are no employees working as minor apprentices. The workers interviewed reported receiving friendly treatment on the farms, as well as being unaware of any discriminatory act that had occurred. Everyone reports receiving friendly treatment and being free to leave the farm after completing their workdays. Workers in the same functions receive equal remuneration.
2_2_criteria: All employees have a written employment contract with the properties, as well as having their employment documents signed. Employment contracts include information such as salary, function, working hours, rights and duties of workers. At the time of integration, employees receive general instructions on health and safety, as well as receiving periodic training on health and safety that is more specific to their activities.
2_3_criteria: Workers receive training on health and safety, depending on the tasks they perform and demonstrate knowledge on the subject. The Siriema and Reunidas do Papagaio farms have health and safety programs covering the risks involved and mitigation and control measures. They also control that dangerous tasks are carried out only by trained and qualified people. The PÃ©rola farm does not have the programs developed, which led to the NC in indicator 2.3.2, and does not carry out training for dangerous tasks, leading to the NC in indicator 2.3.3. All farms provide adequate PPE. The farms have procedures for emergencies and first aid. N/C: indicator 2.3.2 (Minor), indicator 2.3.3 (Minor)
2_4_criteria: Although there is no collective agreement with local unions, it was verified through interviews that workers are free to join. to organizations of your choice. Although local unions do not maintain contact with farms, their representatives are not prevented from interacting with farm employees.
2_5_criteria: The lowest wage paid on farms is the national minimum wage, as verified on payslips. There are no salary deductions of a disciplinary nature. The regular working hours are 44 hours per week and a maximum of 12 overtime hours per week (Monday to Friday). In exceptional harvest periods, some farms exceed the overtime limit, and on PÃ©rola and Reunidas do Papagaio farms the average over a 2-month period exceeded 60 hours per week, leading to a NC in indicator 2.5.4. In all audited farms there are also some cases of working hours without a day off after 6 consecutive days of work and 50% of overtime is not fully paid, being compensated in a time bank without the presence of a collective agreement, leading to to an NC in indicator 2.5.6. All farms record their journey on a time card. The right to maternity leave is provided for on all audited farms. The farms provide houses or accommodation, all in adequate conditions. The water made available is collected from an artesian well and potability analyzes are carried out, however at PÃ©rola farm the analysis does not include microbiological parameters for E. coli, leading to a NC in indicator 2.5.9. N/C: indicator 2.5.4 (Minor); indicator 2.5.6 (Minor); indicator 2.5.9 (Minor).
3_1_criteria: The available communication channels are telephone, e-mail and suggestion boxes present at the farm headquarters. Signs at the entrance to the farms identify their location and telephone numbers. The communication channels are known and allow adequate communication with local communities.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes over the right to use land on the properties, as well as there is no evidence of the existence of traditional users of the properties lands . Some farms are close to indigenous areas, but are not bordering them. The rights of such traditional users are respected by the farms.
3_3_criteria: The properties have suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters, as well as a written procedure providing for registration and treatment.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies They are preferably offered to local communities, normally through advertisements in local agencies, or through farm employees who bring recommendations. As far as possible, there is collaboration with training programs for the local community and/or participation in training offered by SENAR or equivalent entities, contributing to the formation of groups to provide training. The acquisition of inputs and services is preferably done through local companies.
4_1_criteria: A socio-environmental assessment was carried out by the group manager on all members, in a comprehensive and clear manner. From this assessment, points for improvement were identified. All members receive a copy of the assessment of their property and it is available from the manager, if requested.
4_2_criteria: No fires are practiced on the audited farms. The properties have the appropriate structures to prevent oil spills, at the gas station, mechanical workshop and machinery wash. The farms have a waste management plan, although it is not 100% implemented on all farms, but compliance with such aspects will only be applicable in the next years of certification.
4_3_criteria: The farms record fuel consumption fossils. Soil organic matter is monitored by all farms through soil analysis. Carbon sequestration is increased through crop succession, direct planting and maintenance of native vegetation present on all properties.
4_4_criteria: There were no conversions of vegetation areas on the farms audited in the period from 2008 to currently, as verified by satellite image maps.
4_5_criteria: Current satellite image maps of farms indicate native vegetation, production areas, watercourses and springs. Hunting and fishing are prohibited on the properties. All farms have more than 10% native vegetation.
5_1_criteria: There is no irrigation on the audited properties. The farms use good agricultural practices in all their processes, such as direct planting, maintenance and preservation of roads, monitoring of crops, preservation of native vegetation, among other practices. In conjunction with good practices, water quality is monitored by Amaggi, which carries out water analysis using rapid kits. There is no evidence of cases of contamination of water sources on the audited farms.
5_2_criteria: The maps with satellite images identified identify the water courses and riparian vegetation on the farms. No drainage was identified in natural wetlands on any property.
5_3_criteria: Farms apply soil improvers at a variable rate, through precision agriculture. Every year soil analyzes are carried out and Agronomists make fertilizer and fertilizer recommendations. Practices are adopted to preserve soil quality, such as cover crops and direct planting systems. The cultivation regime of the audited properties is soybeans in the harvest season and corn or cotton in the off-season, respecting the Sanitary Vacuum established in the State of Mato Grosso.
5_4_criteria: The farms have procedures on Integrated Crop Management. All agrochemicals used are registered for soybean cultivation, are purchased with Agronomic Prescriptions and recommended by qualified professionals.
5_5_criteria: The audited farms register agricultural pesticide applications. The pesticides are stored in specific deposits, properly locked and with a containment system in case of leaks. At the end of use, the pesticide packaging is triple washed and perforated on all audited farms. They are subsequently stored in a covered, closed and properly locked empty packaging warehouse. Farms mark recently sprayed areas. The use of agrochemicals follows professional recommendations on all properties.
5_6_criteria: Verified through application records, invoices and purchase orders, that farms do not use products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The farms no longer use Paraquat in their production processes.
5_7_criteria: From interviews it was verified that those responsible for the farms are aware of the importance of using biological control. On properties that use such products, the uses are recorded on application forms.
5_8_criteria: Owners and those responsible for the farms demonstrate knowledge regarding the appearance of new pests and invasive species and reported that they would contact MAPA, EMBRAPA or APROSOJA.
5_9_criteria: The farms have documented procedures detailing good practices in the application of agrochemicals.
5_10_criteria: Areas neighboring the properties are occupied with similar production systems, and there are no production systems that require care, such as organic production. No evidence of damage to neighboring areas was found on any audited farm.
5_11_criteria: On all audited farms it is possible to guarantee the legal use of the origin of the seeds, whether purchased from duly qualified resellers or seeds self-propagated on the farm itself.

Name: Bom Jesus Agropecuaria LTDA - Fazenda Mirandópolis
1_1_criteria: Applicable legislation is being complied with, evidenced through field visits, documentation evaluation and interviews with employees that labor, environmental, health and safety and agricultural laws are respected in almost their entirety
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: In the Socio-Environmental Assessment, the points analyzed and the proposed control and mitigation actions are laid out, as well as the assessment of its effectiveness.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other involuntary work was found during the audit process in the work environments or heard during interviews with employees in the production units of the group.
2_2_criteria: The registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees at the production unit were available in easy-to-understand language in the HR department for workers to consult.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety information is documented and transmitted to employees during Onboarding or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each role and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations.
2_4_criteria: There is no impediment to freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, thus such as the impediment to their presence in the groups production units, with membership being at the expense of the employee.
2_5_criteria: Salary paid appropriately, with weekly rest, vacations and without undue deductions for employees on the groups farms. The records of working hours per worker are meeting legal requirements.
3_1_criteria: Communication with the community is established, since Grupo Bom Jesus is known in the community and has a website available to everyone, as well as signs available on the outside of the farm, with communication channels.
3_2_criteria: Absence of traditional users of the lands and disputes over the right to use them.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and grievances are constantly verified by the internal team through the ombudsman channel and line of conduct
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised internally and local collaboration programs are being carried out.
4_1_criteria: Socio-environmental assessment was developed by a multidisciplinary team and measures to minimize impacts are defined.
4_2_criteria: There is a Waste Management plan which describes the actions that the property takes in relation to the waste generated
4_3_criteria: The farm controls the fuel spent on production through an electronic system. Soil organic matter monitored and improvement measures implemented.
4_4_criteria: Compliance with the deforestation policy of the standard met by the farm. There was no land conversion after 2009.
4_5_criteria: Environmental areas follow what is established by the Brazilian Forest Code and are described in the CAR.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices are carried out daily, protecting the soil and water from contamination.
5_2_criteria: The areas of interest are being protected in accordance with the Brazilian forest code.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, the use of contour lines and soil analyzes are carried out to improve soil quality and erosion control in the units production units.
5_4_criteria: Registered products are used and applied at the recommended dose, as well as carrying out IPM on the farm.
5_5_criteria: Location storage of products is adequate. Product application record is complete. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas and the use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the units of production. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the unit.
5_8_criteria: In case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact MAPA and FundaÃ§Ã£o MT.
5_9_criteria: Applications are carried out at the correct distance from populated areas and protection areas.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system as the unit. The minimum distance for application is respected.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through purchase from well-known companies that issue proof of origin and through own production with RENASEM.

Name: Fazenda Lagoa Dourada
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to documentation evaluation, on-site verification, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety and agricultural laws are respected and complied with.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land registrations and title deeds.
1_3_criteria: The aspects have been identified and continuous improvement is being carried out through monitoring, showing the farms commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: Adequate working conditions, payment receipts in accordance with the activity carried out with farm employees, training for the functions, in addition to adequate benefits and evidenced the absence of discounts on payslips that are not in the legislation. No evidence of aggression or disrespect was seen on site, or heard during the interview with workers on the propertys work fronts and work structures. No children under the age of 18 were identified working on the farm.
2_2_criteria: Registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees of the production unit were presented, and were available in easy-to-understand language at the accounting office. The company and its employees do not follow any union at the moment, as there is no active union in the region. Due and appropriate training has been carried out.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety issues are communicated to employees. The document Rural Work Safety, Health and Environmental Management Program (PGSSMATR) contains the safety risks and the PCMSO which describes the examinations and precautions that employees must follow. Employees with specific functions are trained. The appropriate protective equipment for each function is used correctly. Emergency procedures available and understood by employees.
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization, however, there is no active union in the region.
2_5_criteria: Remunerations are compatible with the national legislation, salary and deductions are detailed in the payslips, there were no irregular deductions. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. Hours worked are not recorded efficiently
3_1_criteria: There are channels of communication and dialogue, publicized through signs on the farm.
3_2_criteria: There are no indigenous peoples and places with cultural importance in the areas of influence of the audited farm.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and grievances are checked monthly and the responses are passed on to DDS for employees in general. At the entrance to the farm there are signs with telephone numbers available for community contact and complaints.
3_4_criteria: Job opportunities are advertised locally by employees and also by the external company, which has a portal that recruits and selects employees . The farm contributes financial aid to adapt a municipal school in the region and social actions through the producers cooperative. Offers of goods and services are offered.
4_1_criteria: Evaluation carried out in a comprehensive manner, through the report presented, carried out by the farm, where points for improvements were identified, covering social and environmental aspects of the farm in a comprehensive and clear manner .
4_2_criteria: Storage locations for fuel, lubricants, among others, are located in areas with waterproof floors and containment for protection in case of accidental leaks. Soil organic matter is monitored and measures are taken for improvement, in addition the producer uses crops: millet, corn, wheat, oats and carries out everything such as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_3_criteria: Fuel registration is made manually at the pump and then passed on to the Administrative Manager. Information on the volume per hectare and per unit of product monitored in all activities related to soybean production can be obtained. Several mechanisms and opportunities for carbon sequestration are implemented.
4_4_criteria: As of May 2009, there has been no cleaning or conversion of areas included in Category 1 of maps 3 and there has been no land conversion after 2016, it was presented report with satellite images that demonstrates a comparison between the years 2016 and 2020 and shows that there was no area conversion after 2016.
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained in accordance with federal law, evidenced through the data from registrations and data in the CAR that the properties contain the amount of forest recommended in the forestry code of the cerrado biome, where the farm is located. There is also an Environmental Diagnosis carried out by the farm, which excludes areas that are APP areas, evidenced during the verification of maps, field visits and images of the farm. Hunting and fishing are not permitted.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices implemented, crop rotation practices, direct planting in straw, fertilization and correction according to technical calculation, containment areas for storing chemical products and carrying out water analysis as monitoring. Erosion prevention measures are carried out, such as contour lines and always keeping the soil covered, as well as appropriate structures used to contain chemicals. Contamination of groundwater was not verified, according to monitoring analysis reports presented.
5_2_criteria: The water courses and APPs are mapped. The socio-environmental Diagnosis document shows that the APP areas are being recovered throughout the property through natural regeneration. There is also an Environmental Diagnosis carried out by the farm, which encompasses areas of APP, evidenced by checking maps, field visits and images of the farm.
5_3_criteria: The organic matter of the soil monitored, was evidenced through an interview with the technical manager and document from the company that carries out the samples and analyzes of the soil analysis data for management through graphics and implementation of precision agriculture. Practices are carried out to improve soil quality such as: Crop rotation, soil analysis with fertilization through precision agriculture, maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting. The farm uses level planting, contour lines and direct planting to prevent erosion.
5_4_criteria: The farm has a document "Procedure for Good Agricultural Practices and Integrated Crop Management" and there are records of pest monitoring in the document standard called "Monitoring of pests in soybean cultivation", in addition, the farm uses other control methods, in addition to chemical ones, which are: varietal, chemical, physiological and biological - BT. Pest monitoring records are carried out by the farm.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical use records contain the requested data. Properly carried out storage and disposal location, all empty agrochemical packaging is triple washed, perforated at the bottom and stored until sent to destination. The storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. The use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the farm.
5_8_criteria: The farm owners informed that the agency SIDAGO - Agrodefesa carries out a visit to the property
5_9_criteria: Procedure "Good Agricultural Practices" and the ANDEF manual Good agricultural practices in the field were available. Meteorological records are carried out. Aerial applications are not carried out.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds are purchased from reputable sources, as per verification of seed purchase invoices and terms of compliance.

Name: CRESOL - Estrada de Ferro
1_1_criteria: The properties receive consultancy from accounting firms for the management of applicable legislation, as well as agricultural and environmental consultancy companies, and consultancy from Cresol itself. On each farm there is a folder made by Cresol, which contains various documents related to relevant guidelines and legislation. Cresol has its own technical teams, such as legal, accounting and technical teams in different areas of knowledge and provides support to members.
1_2_criteria: Property areas are duly registered through certificates, court decisions and contracts of lease.
1_3_criteria: All farms had non-conformities in this criterion, as it is related to indicator 4.1.1 on social and environmental impact assessment, which was also non-compliant in all farms. NC: 1.3.2 - There is no social and environmental assessment carried out, as well as identification of aspects to be improved.
2_1_criteria: Two of the audited farms do not have employees. In neither of the other two is there evidence of forced labor, forced labor, trafficking or involuntary labor in any way. There are no minors working on the audited farms. No evidence of discrimination of any kind was identified, nor was any evidence of punishment, coercion and aggression of any kind. On one of the farms, it was not possible to provide proof of return of the work card to the employee, despite there being no evidence of retention. NC: 2.1.2 - There is no declaration proving the return of CTPS.
2_2_criteria: On one of the farms that has workers, there are no employment contracts signed with them. On both farms that have workers, adequate and appropriate training in occupational health and safety is not carried out. The indicators of this criterion are not immediately compliant and will be verified in the next surveillance audit.
2_3_criteria: In general, owners and workers demonstrate knowledge of health and safety issues and the use of PPE. However, health and safety risks have not been identified and there are no procedures implemented to control them on farms. The farms do not have a documented health and safety program (PPRA/PCMSO, etc.) and there are no emergency procedures in place. Farms have access to first aid. On one of the farms audited, there was no evidence of training for the employee responsible for applying pesticides. PPE is available for employees, but no delivery records have been identified. NC: 2.3.3 - There is no evidence that the pesticide applicator has participated in training for this purpose. 2.3.4 - There is no record of delivery of PPE.
2_4_criteria: Through interviews with employees, it was evidenced that they are not prevented from interacting with external parties and have complete freedom to participate in collective negotiations, if any . Unions approve terminations of employment contracts.
2_5_criteria: Workers receive wages above or equal to the national minimum, proven by payslips and interviews. No worker receives payments based on results, everyone is salaried. No salary deductions are made, other than those provided for by law, such as INSS and union contributions. The farms have housing and/or accommodation for employees, and they are in good condition, including sanitary conditions. The farms do not charge any fees for housing. The normal working day on farms is 44 hours per week, and overtime is normally only worked during the harvest period. However, there is no way to prove that excessive hours are not worked as farms do not record working hours per worker. NC: 2.5.3 and 2.5.4 - There is no control over hours worked and overtime, and overtime must only be carried out for limited periods.
3_1_criteria: The audited farms are well known in local communities, and the farms publish their contact numbers.
3_2_criteria: No cases of disputes with traditional users regarding land use rights were identified. No permanent conservation areas or areas of high cultural value were identified near the farms. There are also no adjacent indigenous peoples.
3_3_criteria: There is a communication channel at group manager level, next to Cresol Estrada de Ferro in the city of Orizona/GO, but there is no mechanism for complaints and grievances within the farms. NC: 3.3.1 - There is no obvious mechanism for complaints and grievances on the property.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies on farms are advertised by word of mouth, and through referrals, always looking for workers in the region. Properties participate in events and field days. The owners participate in lectures and training by the regions Rural Union and SENAR.
4_1_criteria: The farms did not carry out a social and environmental assessment. Only one of the farms carried out an environmental assessment through an Environmental Management Plan. NC 4.1.1/4.1.2/4.1.3/4.1.5 - There is no social and environmental assessment carried out, as well as identification of the social, environmental and agricultural aspects that should be improved.
4_2_criteria: None of the audited farms burn on the property. Only one of the farms audited did not show non-compliance regarding the storage and disposal of hazardous waste such as fuel, burnt oil, batteries and light bulbs. Other waste is managed correctly. Farms in the municipality of SilvÃ¢nia separate and deliver recyclable waste to a recycling company, while farms in Orizona separate waste and deliver it to the municipal landfill. NC: 4.2.2 - Burnt oil stored incorrectly. There is no dedicated place to dispose of batteries and light bulbs. / Fuel tank not in compliance with technical standards.
4_3_criteria: The farms do not record the total and direct use of fossil fuel, however this indicator is in compliance with the 3rd year. Most farms work with precision agriculture and all carry out complete soil analysis, including organic matter content. Contributing to increased carbon sequestration, Cresol has a partnership in which it makes seedlings available to producers who need to restore native forests. All properties planted native species in some areas for plant replacement. Two of the audited farms use solar energy to supply energy to irrigation pivots. Another farm has a project to implement a biodigester on the property.
4_4_criteria: All the farms reported that the area was opened before 2009, but in none of them it was possible to provide documentary evidence. NC: 4.4.1 - There are no maps delimiting areas of native vegetation, production areas and watercourses, as well as proving the non-conversion into cultivation areas and comparing with RTRS maps.
4_5_criteria: Only One of the farms has a map showing native vegetation, production areas and water courses. One of the farms has an Environmental Management Plan that guarantees the monitoring of vegetation and wildlife. There is no type of forestry extraction, hunting or collection of protected species on the properties. All farms have a CAR where the registered legal reserve areas are described, all with 19% or more native vegetation. NC: 4.5.1 - There are no maps indicating areas of native vegetation, production areas and water courses.
5_1_criteria: The properties use different techniques that define good agricultural practices, such as: direct planting, planting on level curves with terracing, in addition to pipes on the roadsides to store rainwater. On farms that carry out irrigation, water use is controlled according to the water demand required for each crop at a given stage, following technical recommendations. No wastewater is released into watercourses. Only one of the farms audited monitors and mitigates the quality of water resources, but this indicator is in compliance with the 3rd year. Most farms carry out water analysis.
5_2_criteria: Only one of the farms has a map identifying watercourses and native vegetation. The farms preserve the riparian forest and humid areas. NC: 5.2.1 - There are no maps indicating areas of native vegetation, production areas and water courses.
5_3_criteria: The farms carry out annual soil analyzes, always after the safrinha harvest, for application purposes corrections and soil liming. Some farms use precision agriculture. Various techniques to preserve soil quality are practiced, such as: direct planting, level planting, terraced areas, crop rotation, in addition to maintaining permanent cover vegetation.
5_4_criteria: The farm owners demonstrate knowledge and already apply practices related to MIC, but on most farms there is no specific MIC plan documented and implemented. However, this indicator is not immediately compliant and will be verified in the next surveillance audit. The farms also do not have a specific plan that contains targets for reducing phytosanitary products, an indicator that will also be verified in the next surveillance audit. Only original and genuine agrochemical products that meet local registration requirements are used on all properties, as verified in the invoices and application forms. Agrochemical applications are made according to recommendations techniques.
5_5_criteria: Farms record agrochemical applications. Producers have booklets with guidance on the practice of triple washing and demonstrate knowledge about this process. All farms showed non-compliance regarding the storage of empty agrochemical packaging. The storage of agrochemicals was also a non-compliant item on all audited farms, however this indicator is not immediately compliant and will be verified in the next surveillance audit. Farms install signs in sprayed areas informing about re-entry periods. Fertilizer applications are made according to technical recommendations based on soil analysis. NC: 5.5.2 - There is no deposit of empty packaging, nor is there a certificate demonstrating the return of empty packaging. / The empty packaging deposit does not comply with technical standards and is being used to store other materials. / Empty packaging is being stored in big bags in the yard and the empty packaging deposit is being used to store other materials.
5_6_criteria: Products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions are not used on the audited farms. The use of Paraquat is being abolished respecting the date of June/2017
5_7_criteria: Two of the audited farms use biological control agents for soil and caterpillars, but only one of them keeps records of their use. However, this indicator is not immediately compliant.
5_8_criteria: The State of GoiÃ¡s has an agency called Agro Defesa that monitors and inspects properties for the purpose of controlling invasive species.
5_9_criteria: None of the farms audited have documented procedures that specify agricultural practices related to the application of agrochemicals. However, this indicator is not immediately compliant. No aerial application of agrochemicals is carried out on any of the audited farms. The areas for terrestrial application of agrochemicals are adjacent to other crops, with no residences closer than 30 m. Likewise, the watercourses are protected by APP areas.
5_10_criteria: The areas neighboring the properties have the same type of production, crops and management employed. The pivot areas are located away from the borders of properties that use irrigation, and are not bordered by other neighboring means of cultivation.
5_11_criteria: The soybean seeds used by the farms are acquired from legally known quality sources. There is no cultivation or use of own-produced seeds

Name: Grupo Hervalense
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to the evaluation of documentation at the groups office, verification of structures on the farms, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety and agricultural laws are respected and fulfilled. The company has a legal department that provides input on applicable legislation.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land registrations and title deeds.
1_3_criteria: It was a plan has been carried out to identify the aspects as requested by this item, these being social, environmental and agricultural aspects of the operation (on and off the farm) that must be improved.
2_1_criteria: Adequate working conditions, payment receipts according to the activity carried out with farm employees, training for the functions, in addition to adequate benefits and evidence of the absence of discounts on pay slips that are not in the legislation. No evidence of aggression or disrespect was seen in the work environments, or heard during the interview with workers on the propertys work fronts and work structures. No children under the age of 18 were identified working on the farm.
2_2_criteria: Registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees of the production unit were presented, and are available in easy-to-understand language in the HR department for consultation of the workers. The company and its employees do not follow any union at the moment, as there is no active union in the region. Due and appropriate training has been carried out.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety issues are communicated to employees. The document Rural Work Safety, Health and Environmental Management Program (PGSSMATR) contains the safety risks and describes the examinations and precautions that employees must follow, the risks relating to health and safety issues have been identified. Employees with specific functions are trained. Appropriate protective equipment for each role is provided. Emergency procedures available and understood by employees.
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization, however, there is no active union in the region.
2_5_criteria: Remunerations are compatible with the national legislation, salary and deductions are detailed in the payslips, there were no irregular deductions. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. The hours worked are recorded using a time clock, it was identified that the normal working day exceeds 48 hours per week, as well as overtime exceeds 12 hours per week, at Fazendas Hervalense and Lagoa do Cervo.
3_1_criteria: There are communication and dialogue channels, publicized through signs on the farms.
3_2_criteria: There are no indigenous peoples and places with cultural importance in the areas of influence of the audited farms.
3_3_criteria: Communication channels These are suggestion boxes available internally at the properties and externally through signs with the telephone number, email address Ouviria@hervalesnse@gmail.com, and mailing address. Suggestions and complaints received are handled in a timely manner and documentary evidence is maintained. Interviews were carried out with farm employees, verifying the correct functioning of the grievance and complaints mechanism.
3_4_criteria: Opportunities relating to job offers are offered to the local population through word of mouth among employees and are announced on the SINE. The group collaborates with training programs aimed at the local community, by making the site available on the Hervalense property and employees from other properties can participate.
4_1_criteria: A plan was drawn up to identify and assess social and environmental risks
4_2_criteria: Actions to minimize impacts are being taken, such as reuse and recycling of materials, through selective collection and all hazardous waste in the groups production units are stored appropriately for environmentally correct disposal.
4_3_criteria: Fuel registration is in accordance with the agricultural activities carried out. The use of fertilizer is done according to soil analyses, where organic matter is also monitored. Areas of environmental interest are maintained and preserved in the groups production units.
4_4_criteria: Through maps and satellite photos, it was verified that the soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of areas considered as AAVC.
4_5_criteria: Areas of environmental interest are respected and conserved by the administration of the groups production units. Native vegetation on the farm is above 20%, in accordance with federal legislation with the New Forest Code.
5_1_criteria: Monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption is done through water analysis , presented during the audit and contamination of soil and water in the groups production units is verified.
5_2_criteria: Permanent Preservation Areas are defined in maps of the groups production units, with no evidence that the vegetation was removed or altered.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation and soil analysis are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the groups production units.
5_4_criteria: The monitoring record of pests and weeds found in the areas is done through a visit report, present in the agrarian cooperatives field notebook. Control snows are established in accordance with the EMBRAPA SOJA methodology.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical applications contain information such as purchased products, applied dose, installments, application dates and weather conditions. Storage follows the recommendations of NR 31.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the groups production units.
5_7_criteria: Biological agents are used in the groups production units.
5_8_criteria: To identify and monitor new invasive species and pests in the area, the group has a described procedure, citing research institutions such as Embrapa and Universities.
5_9_criteria: The conditions Atmospheric conditions such as wind, humidity and temperature before application are recorded in the pesticide application forms in the groups production units.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the production units of the group.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds are from reliable sources, according to the purchase invoices and Terms of Compliance presented.

Name: GGF - Agro LTDA
1_1_criteria: Applicable legislation is being complied with, evidenced through field visits, documentation evaluation and interviews with employees that labor, environmental, health and safety and agricultural laws are respected in almost their entirety.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: In the document Survey of Social, Environmental and Agricultural Aspects and Monitoring Plan to ensure that native vegetation and wildlife are maintained, the points analyzed and the control and mitigation actions proposed are set out, as well as the assessment of their effectiveness.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other work was found involuntary during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees in the groups production units.
2_2_criteria: The registration forms, employment contracts and pay slips referring to employees in the production unit, were available in easy-to-understand language in the HR department for workers to consult.
2_3_criteria: Information on health and safety is documented and transmitted to employees during Onboarding or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each role and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations.
2_4_criteria: There is no impediment to freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, thus as the impediment to their presence on the farm, with membership being the responsibility of the employee.
2_5_criteria: Salary paid appropriately, with weekly rest, vacations and without undue deductions from employees. There is a supply of water with potability standards in accordance with current legislation, as well as structures and food.
3_1_criteria: Communication with the community is established, since the GGF Group is known in the community and the means of communication meets the demand, as well as signs available on the outside of the farm, with communication channels.
3_2_criteria: The company has an identification of production areas that does not identify the presence of indigenous peoples close to the farm, thus as places of cultural, ecological, economic or religious importance, environments protected by law.
3_3_criteria: Complaints can be made through different channels: (ouvidoria@ggfbrasil.com / by tel (65) 3549-1429, It is also available internally through signs in the production unit and through suggestion boxes and externally on signs at the entrance to the farm and on vehicles, which circulate throughout neighboring communities. These complaints or information go to the Groups legal department GGF, which filters the sectors and people responsible for the matter to which they are referred, to provide a response to what is happening together with an action plan for the calls that have been opened.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are published internally and local collaboration programs is being carried out by the company GGF.
4_1_criteria: In the document Survey of Environmental and Agricultural Social Aspects and Monitoring Plan to ensure that native vegetation and wildlife are maintained, the points analyzed and the proposed control and mitigation actions, as well as the assessment of their effectiveness.
4_2_criteria: There is a Waste Management plan which describes the actions that the property takes in relation to the waste generated.
4_3_criteria: The farm controls the fuel used in production through an electronic system. Soil organic matter monitored and improvement measures implemented.
4_4_criteria: Compliance with the deforestation policy of the standard met by the farm. There was no land conversion after 2009.
4_5_criteria: Environmental areas follow what is established by the Brazilian Forest Code and are described in the CAR.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices are carried out daily, protecting the soil and water from contamination.
5_2_criteria: The areas of interest are being protected in accordance with the Brazilian forest code.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, the use of contour lines and soil analyzes are carried out to improve soil quality and erosion control in the units production units.
5_4_criteria: Registered products are used and applied at the recommended dose.
5_5_criteria: Product storage location is suitable. Product application record is complete. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas and the use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the units of production. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the unit.
5_8_criteria: In case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact MAPA and FundaÃ§Ã£o Matogrosso.
5_9_criteria: Applications are carried out at the correct distance from populated areas and protection areas.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system as the unit. The minimum distance for application is respected.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through purchase from well-known companies that issue proof of origin and through own production with RENASEM.

Name: O Telhar Agropecuária LTDA
1_1_criteria: The units partially comply with applicable laws. The production units reuse empty agrochemical packaging and there is no adequate signage of locations demonstrating electrical risk in accordance with NR 10.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: A social and environmental assessment of the properties was not prepared.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other involuntary labor was found during the audit process in the work environments or heard during interviews with employees at the groups production units.
2_2_criteria: Workers have written agreement and training on fundamental rights.
2_3_criteria: Information on health and safety is documented and transmitted for employees during Integration or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations in the groups production units
2_4_criteria: The absence of an impediment to freedom of association is demonstrated and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the groups production units
2_5_criteria: Salary paid adequately, with weekly rest, holidays and without undue deductions for employees on the groups farms

3_4_criteria: There are offers of goods and services to communities and local schools in the farm areas.

4_2_criteria: The farms in the scope do not has adequate oil and grease structures.
4_3_criteria: The farms in the scope have adequate control of the fuel used in production.
4_4_criteria: There was no area cleaning after May 2009.
4_5_criteria: Protection areas being protected according to national law. The properties have CAR (Rural Environmental Registry) where APP, legal reserve and arable area on the scope farms are delimited.

5_2_criteria: Protection areas being protected in accordance with national law, watercourses and APPs are mapped.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, o use of contour lines and soil analyzes are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the groups production units
5_4_criteria: Registered products are used and applied at the recommended dose. IPM records on farms within the scope being carried out properly.
