Name: Girassol Agrícola Ltda
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to documentation evaluation, verification of infrastructure and field visits, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety and agricultural laws are respected and complied with.
1_2_criteria: Legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land registrations and title deeds.
1_3_criteria: Aspects have been identified and continuous improvement will be monitored, showing the farms commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: Adequate working conditions, payment receipts in accordance with the activity carried out with farm employees, training for the functions, in addition to adequate benefits and evidenced the absence of discounts on payslips that are not in the legislation. No evidence of aggression or disrespect was seen in the work environments or heard during the interview with frontline workers and inspection of the propertys work structures. No children under the age of 18 were identified working on the farm.
2_2_criteria: Registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees of the production unit were presented, and are available in easy-to-understand language in the HR department for consultation of the workers. The company and its employees do not follow any union at the moment, as there is no active union in the region. Due and appropriate training has been carried out.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety issues are communicated to employees. The document Rural Work Safety, Health and Environmental Management Program (PGSSMATR) contains the safety risks and the PCMSO which describes the examinations and precautions that employees must follow. Employees with specific functions are trained. The appropriate protective equipment for each function is used correctly. Emergency procedures available and understood by employees
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization, however, there is no active union in the region.
2_5_criteria: Remunerations are compatible with legislation nationally, salary and deductions are detailed in the payslips, there were no irregular deductions. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. Hours worked are recorded using a time clock, overtime occurs within the limit permitted by legislation.
3_1_criteria: There are channels of communication and dialogue, publicized through signs on the farm.
3_2_criteria: There are no indigenous peoples and places with cultural importance in the areas of influence of the audited farm.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and grievances are checked monthly and responses are passed on to DDS for employees in general.
3_4_criteria: Job opportunities are advertised locally by employees and also by the external company Promove, which has a portal that recruits and selects employees. The farm contributes financial aid to adapt and support a shelter in the region as one of the social actions. Offers of goods and services are offered to the local population.
4_1_criteria: Evaluation carried out in a comprehensive manner, the Social and Environmental Diagnosis document and Internal Audit Reports were carried out by a multidisciplinary team from the company, covering social and environmental aspects of the farm in a comprehensive and clear manner.
4_2_criteria: Storage locations for fuel, lubricants, among others, are located in areas with waterproof floors and containment for protection in case of accidental leaks. Soil organic matter is monitored and measures are taken for improvement. In addition, the producer uses crops: millet, corn, oats and carries out everything such as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_3_criteria: Fuel recording is done in a manual on the pump and then passed through the Geatec electronic system. Information on the volume per hectare and per unit of product monitored in all activities related to soybean production can be obtained. Several mechanisms and opportunities for carbon sequestration are implemented.
4_4_criteria: There was no land conversion after 2009, according to maps, satellite images presented, CAR of the farm and field visits, which shows that the property did not convert land .
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained in accordance with federal law, evidenced by registration data and CAR data that the properties contain the amount of forest recommended in the forestry code, which is 20% for the cerrado biome, where the farm is located. There is also Environmental Diagnosis, which identifies areas that can be improved, as evidenced by checking maps, field visits and images of the farm. Hunting and fishing are not permitted.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices implemented, crop rotation practices, direct planting in straw, fertilization and correction according to technical calculation, containment areas for storing chemical products and carrying out water analysis as monitoring. Erosion prevention measures are carried out, such as contour lines and always keeping the soil covered, as well as appropriate structures used to contain chemicals. Contamination of groundwater was not verified, according to monitoring analysis reports presented. Irrigation management procedures and systems are implemented through the ICROP program that performs calculations using data entered from monitoring meteorological data and soil moisture for irrigation application. A grant of abstraction water for water use was also presented, issued by the Secretariat of Environment and Water Resources.
5_2_criteria: The watercourses and APPs are mapped. The socio-environmental diagnosis document demonstrates that the areas of APP's are preserved throughout the property. The document encompasses areas that can be improved such as the planting of trees in the APP area, evidenced by checking maps, field visits and images of the farm.
5_3_criteria: Organic matter of the monitored soil, was evidenced through an interview with the technical manager and document from the company that carries out the samples and analyzes of soil analysis data for management through graphs and implementation of precision agriculture. Practices are carried out to improve soil quality such as: Crop rotation, soil analysis with fertilization through precision agriculture, maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting. The farm uses level planting, contour lines and direct planting to prevent erosion.
5_4_criteria: The farm has a document "Procedure for Good Agricultural Practices" and there are records of pest monitoring in the standard document called "Monitoring of pests in soybean cultivation", in addition, the farm uses other control methods, in addition to chemical ones, which are: varietal, chemical, physiological and biological - BT. Pest monitoring records are carried out by the farm.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical use records contain the requested data. Properly carried out storage and disposal location, all empty agrochemical packaging is triple washed, perforated at the bottom and stored until sent to destination. The storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. The use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the unit.
5_8_criteria: Those responsible for the farm informed that the agency SIDAGO - Agrodefesa carried out the visit to the property.
5_9_criteria: Procedure "Good Agricultural Practices" and the ANDEF manual Good agricultural practices in field were available. Meteorological records are carried out. Aerial applications are not carried out.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds are purchased from reputable sources, as per verification of seed purchase invoices and terms of compliance.

Name: Agrex do Brasil S.A.
1_1_criteria: The company has legal advice, and each area has a professional responsible for verifying the applicable legislation and its implementation. The company has developed a list of applicable legislation, which is evidence of knowledge and compliance with applicable legislation through an interview, per meeting. To update legislation, the companys legal department relies on external legal updating services, companies and producer association forums. Knowledge of the legal responsibilities applicable to agricultural production and applicable legislation was demonstrated, for example: Consolidation of Labor Laws - CLT: https://www2.senado.leg.br/bdsf/bitstream/handle/id/535468/clt_e_normas_correla tas_1ed.pdf Law 12. 651, of May 25, 2012, Forest Code, - Private Native Vegetation Protection Law http://www.planalto.gov.br/ccivil_03/_ato2011- 2014/2012/lei/l12651. html Law No. 6,938, of August 31, 1981 - Provides for the National Environmental Policy, s. CONAMA NÂº1 - Provides for the basic criteria and general guidelines for the assessment of environmental impacts. CONAMA 237- Proposes the review of the procedures and criteria used in Environmental Licensing (revision of CONAMA No. 1) Federal Constitution, in its art. 225, Â§3Âº: Decree nÂº 6,514/2008 - Provides for infractions and administrative sanctions against the environment.
1_2_criteria: There is evidence of valid lease contracts for all farms within the scope of the certificate:
1_3_criteria: The improvement indicators were selected, the company establishes a baseline on the results of the 2017-2018 campaign: SOCIAL: NUMBER OF WORK ACCIDENTS (ANNUAL) ENVIRONMENTAL: WATER CONSUMPTION PER HECTARE (Liters/ha) ORGANIC: CONTENT OF MATTER (% MO/FARM) AGRICULTURAL: DIESEL CONSUMPTION (Liters/ha): DIESEL CONSUMPTION (Liters/ton)
2_1_criteria: In interviews with employees, it was found that the company does not practice or support the child labor, forced labor, discrimination and harassment. Furthermore, the company has implemented a Recruitment Policy - Recruitment and Selection Policy, POL-1011-, a code of ethics and a conduct or employee manual that establishes working conditions in the company. The agreed job and salary plans and the adjustments in the collective bargaining agreement remain in force. The company has a salary policy POL-1013 The basic amount by agreement is established and performance improvements are considered. Promotions and types of increases are established collectively or individually based on merit, promotions or performance, the criteria for approving a new salary, the admission process, hiring and transfers.
2_2_criteria: There is a POL Recruitment Policy- 1011 - which specifies procedures for recruiting employees. There are different types of contracts in place depending on the position. Applicable labor legislation and prevailing wage agreements are available. All workers receive adequate and appropriate training and understandable instructions on fundamental rights at work and health and safety, as well as any necessary recommendations or supervision. There is evidence of the implementation of the PDI - Individual Development Program, worker training records. Furthermore, upon being hired, all employees go through an awareness process in which they are informed about the conditions established in the code of ethics and recruitment.
2_3_criteria: Knowledge about health and safety was demonstrated by the workers interviewed by meet. The company offers general training, as evidenced in documents 222 - Occupational Safety, 355 and 361 - DAILY SAFETY, ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH DIALOGUE, Integration Presentation, and specific training for the NR-23 Emergency Brigade (1st aid), NR-31 Safety in the Handling and Application of Pesticides, NE-33 Work in Confined Spaces, NR-35 Work at Height. Once again, the area of occupational health and safety can be considered a strong point in the organization, and the attention and dedication of employees to this issue can be seen in the interviews. The company provides PPE - Personal Protective Equipment for all functions, as evidenced by the documents in the PPE List.
2_4_criteria: In interviews with the team, it appears that all workers enjoy freedom of association and freedom of association. right to collective bargaining. Check that workers are not prevented from interacting with external parties outside of working hours.
2_5_criteria: Interviews carried out with the companys workers show that salary deductions are not made for disciplinary reasons. Pay stubs are checked to show that workers receive a gross salary that complies with national legislation and sectoral agreements. There is a record of hours worked using a fingerprint system, both in establishments and in offices. It is clear that weekly working hours do not exceed 48 hours and, during the harvest or planting season, overtime is worked and paid in accordance with the current contract. Workers were interviewed about accommodation and food conditions, and no complaints or grievances were identified. The team is not charged for accommodation.
3_1_criteria: The company presented document 1395 - Relationship with Communities, which contains the procedures for presenting the company to the most needy communities close to the areas where Agrex operates in agricultural production, receiving grains and trading products. It also presented document 210 - Ombudsmans Office and 351 - Ombudsmans Office Form - Ombudsmans Office Form, which contains the procedures for handling reports of irregularities in matters of ethics and compliance, involving the companys business, products and services, image and assets, based on Agrexs Ethics Policy. Available channels are Intranet Communication channels are known to neighbors and local communities, as evidenced in telephone interviews.
3_2_criteria: Not applicable
3_3_criteria: Accessible reporting mechanism is evident in interviews face-to-face and telephone. Agrex presented document 210 - Ombudsman and 351 - Ombudsman Form - Ombudsman Form, which contains the procedures for handling complaints on ethics and compliance issues involving the companys business, products and services, image and assets, based on Agrex Ethics Policy. The channels are also described in document 1395 RELATIONSHIP WITH COMMUNITIES.
3_4_criteria: In interviews with employees, it was mentioned that Agrex works to train employees who can fill vacancies and, thus, offer opportunities for growth in the company , this subject being described in document 201 - Career Development. Document 13 - Employee Admission describes the procedures to be followed, where recruitment is the responsibility of the Personnel Administration department, which evaluates the form of recruitment and publicity of the vacancy in the available media, observing the legal criteria for advertising and hiring requirements. Since 2010, the company has maintained the Agrex Institute in Balsas, MaranhÃ£o. The institutes premise is to provide social assistance to the community through training actions, with the aim of facilitating and including them in the job market, in addition to supporting, stimulating and strengthening local social projects through partnerships. The Institute offers professional qualification courses and technical training with the aim of improving the communitys quality of life, through the generation of jobs and income. The courses also aim to facilitate access to culture and leisure, in addition to promoting sustainable values to promote citizenship and social inclusion. Link https://www.agrex.com.br/sustainability/social Whenever possible, the supply of products and services by local companies.
4_1_criteria: An environmental and social impact assessment of Agrex do Brasil SA, updated in 2020/2021, is evident. The evaluation is carried out by production process and by activity and location. Control/mitigation measures are established in the procedures for each activity and production process. In the Guidance item, evaluation criteria, facilities, Operational Area, including fuel tanks and structure, environmental documentation, required licenses, water analysis and monitoring, labor documentation, field operations, soil preparation, planting, spraying, are evaluated. harvesting and other cultural activities.
4_2_criteria: A remote interview was carried out via Whatsapp with the person responsible for agriculture, who stated that fire is not used in waste treatment and that this practice goes against the objective of increasing matter organic. Interviews with workers, administrators, neighbors and external third parties showed that fire and burning are not used as part of the companys production system. To combat forest fires, the company implemented the POP 1376 v 9-2-15 procedure, combating forest fires, which includes detection and communication methodology and has a trained fire brigade. Perimeter and roadside firebreaks (firebreak) are maintained. The establishments have signs and posters indicating the prohibition of the use of fire, which can be seen in the photos of the Curitiva and Santo Isidoro farms. The company presents images of waste storage tanks and documentation relating to Agrexs waste management plan. The photos show that the farms and Facilities have identified waste containers for paper, organic waste and plastics. The company presented images and photos of fuel and lubricant depots, pesticide depots and empty pesticide containers. The company implemented a Solid Waste Control Plan - PCRS, which considers the separation, compaction and recycling of waste that has economic value and can be reused. The results are recorded in the Recyclables Control spreadsheet, e.g. paper, cardboard, plastics, scrap iron/metal. Information is available for each farm. The company has income control for the sale of waste, part of the income from the program is used for improvements on the farm, in rooms, houses and common spaces for workers.
4_3_criteria: The procedure POP1371 Supply of machines and fuel receipt is implemented, and a record of each fuel load is established in the service order/supply order. The record shows consumption per farm. Compared to the previous season, there is an increase in liters, which is smaller due to lower production. The company can justify this increase based on the specific needs of the agricultural year. "The company has established an organic matter monitoring system. Analyzes are carried out every two years. A production technician is interviewed, who explains soil monitoring per farm and presents the results of organic matter monitoring per farm: monitoring is carried out by georeferenced plots.
4_4_criteria: It is evident that there was no expansion of cultivation following the elimination of native forest, for example, it appears that at Fazenda Santo Isidoro and in Curitiva there was no expansion of cultivation following of the elimination of native forest.
4_5_criteria: No conversions of natural lands, or on steep slopes and areas designated by law for native conservation and/or cultural and social protection were identified after June 3, 2016 for all Farms within scope. No complaints or complaints about land conversions or deforestation were received.
5_1_criteria: Production technicians and Agrex employees were interviewed. Images and photos of crop fields were received. The company implements appropriate agricultural practices to minimize the impact on surface and groundwater quality of chemical waste and fertilizers, for example, wastewater from sprayer washing is not discharged into waterways, management of empty containers and areas of protection. Practices such as direct sowing, systematization of plots and contour lines prevent erosion; the direction of seeding is considered to avoid erosion. Cover crops and the conservation of protected areas and water sources promote aquifer recharge. Water analyzes of surface watercourses and wells are carried out, which are a condition for granting the corresponding environmental licenses. Usage licenses are available. The laboratories used for the analyzes are accredited by ISO 17025, Acquarius ABNT NBR -ISO/IEC 17025 -CRL1317" The company identifies CONAMA - National Environmental Council - as the authority to which cases of contamination of water courses surface areas must be reported" Pivot irrigation is used at Fazenda Campos Lindos, POP procedure nÂº 1928 is in force for the use of irrigation, installation of a central pivot and consumption recording. There is also an environmental risk prevention program for the farm. Authorization for water use is available.
5_2_criteria: Maps are available with all watercourses present and riparian vegetation. For example, map of Fazenda Curitiva and Santo Isidoro There is no evidence that the vegetation watercourse has been removed on the Farms. Neighbors and local stakeholders were interviewed. Agrex's environmental director and employees who work on the company's farms were interviewed. The watercourses are included in reserve zones and under protection management.
5_3_criteria: The coordinator of agricultural processes and production is interviewed about Agrex's soil monitoring. There are records of analyzes per lot/plot. Monitoring is based on productivity maps, by lots, correlating yields with soil needs or biological qualities, for example, with nematodes, there is a lot of research on biological aspects. For example, soil analyzes are presented for all lots/plots of Faz Curitiva and Faz Santo Isidoro, reports and tables with the results are shown. Monitoring of the physical, chemical and biological conditions of the soil is carried out annually, with dynamic application. The company demonstrates knowledge of techniques to maintain soil quality and they are being implemented, for example, crop rotation, soil analysis to maintain fertility, contour lines, direct planting, controlled fertilization, soybean inoculation, cover crops . There are images of production plots systematized with contour lines, records of plots with rotation and cover crops, for example, millet in rotation with soybeans and cover crops such as millet, for example, in Curitiva and Santo Isidoro. The interviews show the use of direct planting and controlled applications. Internal roads and culverts are maintained. Native cover is maintained as protection in watercourses and in escarpment areas on the edges of the plateau.
5_4_criteria: The company has established an integrated management procedure documented in POP-1377 Pest management and control, which includes techniques such as pest monitoring and implementation of computer system with batch information and stage monitoring results through sampling, damage level and targeted applications, prevention of resistance through agrochemical rotation and crop rotation. Techniques are implemented such as the use of specific crops to control pests, for example, sunn hemp culture to control nematodes, machines are washed when they come from another region - Mato Grosso, MaranhÃ£o - before use, to prevent the entry of nematodes Monitoring is recorded in the Strider system and, if presence above the damage limit is detected, spraying orders are generated and the products to be applied are defined by production technicians. Agrochemical purchase and stock records are presented by the company. It was remotely evidenced that only original and genuine agrochemicals are stored and used. For example, grades are checked. There is evidence of a policy of responsible use of agrochemicals and targets to reduce the use of the most dangerous toxicological categories. The goals are documented in Agrexs sustainability report. The decision to use RR varieties reduces the use of insecticides.
5_5_criteria: Multi-locality purchases of agrochemicals are made centrally and then dispatched to the farms. Pesticide and warehouse inventory movements are controlled by the warehouse and the multisite member. There is evidence of agrochemical transfer notes from Agrex Balsa. There is proof of the final disposal of used agrochemical containers. Agrochemicals are transported and stored safely and all applicable safety, hygiene and environmental precautions are implemented. There is evidence of images and photos sent by the company of agricultural warehouses, containment measures implemented, emergency measures to deal with accidents (emergency shower, eyewash), danger signs at the entrance, access restricted to authorized and trained personnel only. Furthermore, the company implements safety measures in accordance with PPRA - Environmental Risk Assessment. The company implements procedure POP -1374 - Handling and storage of chemicals - for the handling and storage of chemicals.
5_6_criteria: "The company remotely sends warehouse stock lists and agrochemical application records , production technicians and farm staff are interviewed remotely. It is clear that the products included in the Stockholm and Rotterdam lists are not used. BASF Finale is being used as a substitute for Paraquat.
5_7_criteria: Not used biological control agents
5_8_criteria: If invasive species, new pests or serious outbreaks are identified, the company plans to notify EMBRAPA. No situations requiring notification have been identified.
5_9_criteria: Operational procedure - Spraying of agricultural pesticides - POP 1379, version 02, 9.02.16, indicates measures to minimize drift, the effect of atmospheric agents, precautions in case of aerial applications and communication and warning of application to neighbors. The farm's neighbors and local stakeholders were interviewed and no complaints or grievances were identified regarding these issues. Farm operators were interviewed remotely. There is evidence that control measures are implemented to prevent agrochemical drift. There is no evidence of the use of WHO Class Ia, Ib and II products within 500 m of populated areas or bodies of water. The procedure includes restricting the use of WHO class Ia, Ib and II pesticides to within 500 m of populated areas or bodies of water. Evidence that residences maintain a safety distance of at least 30 m between residences and cultivation plots is provided by satellite images.
5_10_criteria: The company implements measures to avoid interference with neighboring production systems . Good practices and procedures are implemented applications that consider drift minimization and climatic conditions for applications. Enforcement notices and communication with neighbors are maintained. Stakeholders interviewed, no complaints identified.
5_11_criteria: There are two sources of seeds, the seed produced itself and the seed purchased from external suppliers; there is evidence of invoices according to the seed itself,

Name: Amaggi Exp Imp Ltda – Grupo Parecis II
1_1_criteria: Producers stay up to date with applicable laws through internet research, WhatsApp groups with professionals in the field and newspapers on agricultural websites. Companies that trade with farms provide professionals, such as agronomists, to assist with agricultural management and verify legal compliance. The farms also receive assistance from accounting offices. The farms comply with the majority of applicable laws, but all showed non-compliance in indicator 1.1.2 due to lack of compliance in some issues, such as water use authorization, potability analysis, lack of health and safety program, lack of time off after 6 consecutive days of work, failure to pay overtime in accordance with collective agreement. NC: indicator 1.1.2 (Minor).
1_2_criteria: The properties demonstrate the right to use the land through deeds and/or lease contracts.
1_3_criteria: The socio-environmental aspects that must be improved on all farms. Based on these aspects, indicators are defined and these are aligned with the goals established per year.
2_1_criteria: There is no evidence of forced labor, slavery or their equivalents on the audited farms. Workers keep their belongings with them, there is no retention of personal documents of employees by the farms. In cases where a husband and wife work on the property, both work voluntarily. All workers are of legal age, there are no employees working as minor apprentices. The workers interviewed reported receiving friendly treatment on the farms, as well as being unaware of any discriminatory act that had occurred. Everyone reports receiving friendly treatment and being free to leave the farm after completing their workdays. Workers in the same functions receive equal remuneration.
2_2_criteria: All employees have a written employment contract with the properties, as well as having their work cards signed. Employment contracts include information such as salary, function, working hours, rights and duties of workers. At the time of integration, employees receive general instructions on health and safety, as well as receiving periodic training on health and safety that is more specific to their activities.
2_3_criteria: Workers receive training on health and safety, depending on the tasks they perform and demonstrate knowledge on the subject. The Siriema and Reunidas do Papagaio farms have health and safety programs covering the risks involved and mitigation and control measures. They also control that dangerous tasks are carried out only by trained and qualified people. The PÃ©rola farm does not have the programs developed, which led to the NC in indicator 2.3.2, and does not carry out training for dangerous tasks, leading to the NC in indicator 2.3.3. All farms provide adequate PPE. The farms have procedures for emergencies and first aid. N/C: indicator 2.3.2 (Minor), indicator 2.3.3 (Minor).
2_4_criteria: Although there is no collective agreement with local unions, it was verified through interviews that workers are free to join join organizations of your choice. Although local unions do not maintain contact with farms, their representatives are not prevented from interacting with farm employees.
2_5_criteria: The lowest wage paid on farms is the national minimum wage, as verified on payslips. There are no salary deductions of a disciplinary nature. The regular working hours are 44 hours per week and a maximum of 12 overtime hours per week (Monday to Friday). In exceptional harvest periods, some farms exceed the overtime limit, and on PÃ©rola and Reunidas do Papagaio farms the average over a 2-month period exceeded 60 hours per week, leading to a NC in indicator 2.5.4. In all audited farms there are also some cases of working hours without a day off after 6 consecutive days of work and 50% of overtime is not fully paid, being compensated in a time bank without the presence of a collective agreement, leading to to an NC in indicator 2.5.6. All farms record their journey on a time card. The right to maternity leave is provided for on all audited farms. The farms provide houses or accommodation, all in adequate conditions. The water made available is collected from an artesian well and potability analyzes are carried out, however at PÃ©rola farm the analysis does not include microbiological parameters for E. coli, leading to a NC in indicator 2.5.9. N/C: indicator 2.5.4 (Minor); indicator 2.5.6 (Minor); indicator 2.5.9 (Minor).
3_1_criteria: The available communication channels are telephone, e-mail and suggestion boxes present at the farm headquarters. Signs at the entrance to the farms identify their location and their number. telephone. Communication channels are known and allow adequate communication with local communities.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes over the right to use land on properties, nor is there evidence of the existence of traditional users of land on properties . Some farms are close to indigenous areas, but are not bordering them. The rights of such traditional users are respected by the farms.
3_3_criteria: The properties have suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters, as well as a written procedure providing for registration and treatment.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies They are preferably offered to local communities, normally through advertisements in local agencies, or through farm employees who bring recommendations. As far as possible, there is collaboration with training programs for the local community and/or participation in training offered by SENAR or equivalent entities, contributing to the formation of groups to provide training. The acquisition of inputs and services is preferably done through local companies.
4_1_criteria: A socio-environmental assessment was carried out by the group manager on all members, in a comprehensive and clear manner. From this assessment, points for improvement were identified. All members receive a copy of the assessment of their property and it is available from the manager, if requested.
4_2_criteria: No fires are practiced on the audited farms. The properties have the appropriate structures to prevent oil spills, at the gas station, mechanical workshop and machinery wash. The farms have a waste management plan, although it is not 100% implemented on all farms, but compliance with such aspects will only be applicable in the next years of certification.
4_3_criteria: The farms record fuel consumption fossils. Soil organic matter is monitored by all farms through soil analysis. Carbon sequestration is increased through crop succession, direct planting and maintenance of native vegetation present on all properties.
4_4_criteria: There were no conversions of vegetation areas on the farms audited in the period from 2008 to currently, as verified by satellite image maps.
4_5_criteria: Current satellite image maps of farms indicate native vegetation, production areas, watercourses and springs. Hunting and fishing are prohibited on the properties. All farms have more than 10% native vegetation.
5_1_criteria: There is no irrigation on the audited properties. The farms use good agricultural practices in all their processes, such as direct planting, maintenance and preservation of roads, monitoring of crops, preservation of native vegetation, among other practices. In conjunction with good practices, water quality is monitored by Amaggi, which carries out water analysis using rapid kits. There is no evidence of cases of contamination of water sources on the audited farms.
5_2_criteria: The maps with satellite images identified identify the water courses and riparian vegetation on the farms. No drainage was identified in natural wetlands on any property.
5_3_criteria: Farms apply soil improvers at a variable rate, through precision agriculture. Every year soil analyzes are carried out and Agronomists make fertilizer and fertilizer recommendations. Practices are adopted to preserve soil quality, such as cover crops and direct planting systems. The cultivation regime of the audited properties is soybeans in the harvest season and corn or cotton in the off-season, respecting the Sanitary Vacuum established in the State of Mato Grosso.
5_4_criteria: The farms have procedures on Integrated Crop Management. All pesticides used are registered for soybean cultivation, are purchased with Agricultural Prescriptions and recommended by qualified professionals.
5_5_criteria: The audited farms register agricultural pesticide applications. The pesticides are stored in specific deposits, properly locked and with a containment system in case of leaks. At the end of use, the pesticide packaging is triple washed and perforated on all audited farms. They are subsequently stored in a covered, closed and properly locked empty packaging warehouse. Farms mark recently sprayed areas. The use of agrochemicals follows professional recommendations on all properties.
5_6_criteria: Verified through application records, invoices and purchase orders, that farms do not use products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The farms no longer use Paraquat in their production processes.
5_7_criteria: From interviews it was verified that those responsible for the farms are aware of the importance of using biological control. On properties that use such products, the uses are recorded on application forms.
5_8_criteria: Owners and those responsible for the farms demonstrate knowledge regarding the appearance of new pests and invasive species and reported that they would contact MAPA, EMBRAPA or APROSOJA.
5_9_criteria: The farms have documented procedures detailing good practices in the application of pesticides.
5_10_criteria: Areas neighboring the properties are occupied with similar production systems, and there are no production systems that require care, such as organic production. No evidence of damage to neighboring areas was found on any audited farm.
5_11_criteria: On all audited farms it is possible to guarantee the legal use of the origin of the seeds, whether purchased from duly qualified resellers or seeds self-propagated on the farm itself.

Name: Produzindo Certo – Grupo Comigo
1_1_criteria: Knowledge of legal requirements applicable to the audited farms was verified. Producers receive external advice from local companies. Of the three farms audited, two had legal non-conformities, due to excessive overtime, lack of water usage authorization and implementation of health and safety programs.
1_2_criteria: The audited properties have been established in the region for quite a long time. The right to use the land was verified through registrations and a lending contract. Maps developed by the manager demonstrate that there is no presence of traditional users close to the farms.
1_3_criteria: The manager identified the aspects to be improved, based on the Socio-Environmental Diagnosis carried out. During the visits made by environmental analysts, the aspects raised and compliance with the established goals are identified, and examples were verified for the audited farms.
2_1_criteria: The audited properties only hire workers over 18 years of age. Interviews were carried out and worker records were checked. During the interviews carried out, employees reported receiving cordial treatment, as well as being unaware of any discriminatory or harassing practices occurring on the farms.
2_2_criteria: Employees at the audited properties are registered, having an Individual Employment Contract and Employee Registration, describing the main pertinent information. One of the farms audited did not have proof of training for employees. Although indicator 2.2.3 is not being met, non-compliance was not raised, as this indicator will only be charged from the second year of certification.
2_3_criteria: Properties carry out a risk assessment through PPPRA /PCMSO or PGSSMATR, except for one of the farms that has not yet carried out any of these programs. Health and safety training is carried out, medical examinations of workers, provision of PPE, inspections of work areas and Emergency Procedures are maintained. With the exception of the previously mentioned property, which does not yet have a health and safety program. In this way, non-conformities were generated in indicators 2.3.1, 2.3.2, 2.3.3, 2.3.4 and 2.3.6. In the case of indicator 2.3.5, non-compliance was not raised, as this indicator will only be charged from the second year of certification. Through inspections carried out on the property, it was found that there are vehicles available in case of accidents. Furthermore, communication on the property is done via cell phones or radios.
2_4_criteria: According to the results of the interviews and through inspections carried out on the audited farms, employees have complete freedom to join trade union organizations. Despite this, everyone is unanimous in mentioning that trade unions are not usually very active in the region.
2_5_criteria: Interviews carried out with employees and verified payment slips ensure that the salaries paid are higher than the national minimum, being paid monthly via deposit into employees accounts. Verified on payment receipts that only deductions provided for by law such as INSS and IPRF are made. According to the signed employment contracts, working hours on the audited farms are 44 hours per week. In only one of the audited properties was it found that the working hours of some employees routinely exceed 12 hours of overtime per week. Generating non-conformity in indicators 1.1.2, 2.5.3 and 2.5.4. There was one farm that had not yet implemented the recording of hours worked, resulting in non-compliance in indicator 2.5.5. Workers have access to housing and food, free of charge or with a symbolic payment. Potability analyzes are carried out, except for one of the farms that has yet to be analyzed.
3_1_criteria: The properties establish communication channels via e-mail, telephone, website and identification signs at their headquarters. Suggestion/complaint boxes are maintained on the farms. The document Operational Procedure, Communication and Complaints and Suggestions follow-up form are implemented and describe the procedure for handling complaints and the form for recording them. There were no complaints or suggestions at the time of the audit.
3_2_criteria: Verified that there are no disputes regarding land use rights on the properties. The maps developed by the manager demonstrate that there is no presence of traditional users close to the farms.
3_3_criteria: The properties maintain suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters. Employees can make complaints or grievances through the box and the community can communicate with the farm via telephone and email. Any complaints are recorded in the Complaints and Suggestions Monitoring Form document. If complaints are received, they will be analyzed and subsequently dealt with, as provided for in the Operational Procedure, Communication and Complaints Monitoring Form. At the time of the audit, there were no complaints or complaints received.
3_4_criteria: It was verified that job opportunities are advertised through referrals from current employees and other farms, or searches made directly on the audited farms. For two of the farms audited, it was not possible to identify any direct contribution to training programs for the local population. Although indicator 3.4.2 is not being met, this indicator will only be charged from the third year of certification. Farms purchase products from the region they are located in.
4_1_criteria: Farms undergo an initial assessment before joining the certification group. The RTRS Production Standard and RTRS Chain of Custody requirements for producers are assessed. The initial assessments were verified, which are developed by fully qualified environmental analysts. The group manager provides a copy of the summary of the assessment carried out.
4_2_criteria: Verified that there is no use of burning on the audited farms. The properties have fuel tanks with a containment dam and supply lane. Workshop structures with floors and machine washing lanes are maintained, with separator boxes. Used oils are stored in tanks, arranged in a separate location with a containment structure. Despite this, one of the farms received a non-conformity in indicator 4.2.2, as there was no proof of final disposal of hazardous waste. Although the properties do not comply with indicator 4.2.4, it will only be charged from the third year of certification. There is still no waste separation on the property. The farms have a documented Waste Management Plan, developed by the group manager.
4_3_criteria: One of the properties has already implemented control over the use of fossil fuels. The other two farms have not yet implemented such control, despite this, indicators 4.3.1 and 4.3.2 will only be applicable from the third year of certification. The farms monitor the organic matter content of the soil through analyzes carried out. Furthermore, practices to increase carbon sequestration were highlighted, such as direct planting, crop succession and maintenance of native vegetation.
4_4_criteria: The comparative maps developed by the group manager demonstrate that there were no openings of areas after May 2009.
4_5_criteria: The properties maintain native vegetation in their areas. Hunting and collecting protected species is prohibited on all audited farms. The group manager prepared maps of the areas and there is a procedure to monitor the fauna and flora of each property. Despite this, on one of the farms monitoring is not yet fully implemented, however indicator 4.5.2 is only applicable from the second year of certification.
5_1_criteria: The properties use good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as direct planting and maintaining soil cover. Only one of the properties audited does not have water analysis, but compliance with indicator 5.1.2 will be charged from the third year of certification. Cultivation is carried out under a rainfed regime on the three audited farms.
5_2_criteria: The properties have maps containing the location of cultivated areas delimited by plot, vegetation areas and watercourses. Verified that there is no removal of riparian areas of native vegetation on the four farms audited. There was no drainage of natural wetlands or wetland areas.
5_3_criteria: Conservationist practices such as the direct planting system and use of fertilizers are adopted in accordance with technical recommendations. In addition to the use of direct planting to prevent erosion processes, soil coverage is maintained through the planting of cover species. Cultivation regimes follow planning and respect local legislation, which prohibits the cultivation of soybeans on soybeans. Crop rotation and succession techniques are followed on farms.
5_4_criteria: The farms have a documented Integrated Crop Management plan. There is still no plan in place with targets for reducing phytosanitary products, but indicator 5.4.2 will only be charged from the second year of certification. Agronomic Recipes were verified and inspections were carried out at agrochemical deposits, in order to ensure that the products have the appropriate registrations for use in the country. Two of the three properties still do not have pest monitoring records, diseases, weeds and natural predators. However, indicator 5.4.5 will only be charged from the second year onwards.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical applications are not properly recorded on two of the three farms audited. Nonconformities were generated in indicator 5.5.1. Agrochemical storage structures are maintained on the property, which are closed, covered, locked and identified. Agrochemical preparation mixtures are made at the properties headquarters and the water from washing empty packaging is used as application mixture. There are warehouses for temporary storage of empty packaging, which are destined for local reception centers. Recently sprayed areas are marked with re-entry signs, and the use of correctives, fertilizers and agrochemicals follows technical recommendations.
5_6_criteria: Agronomic prescriptions were checked for the products used, guaranteeing their origin of purchase and registration in the Ministry of Agriculture of the country. Brazilian legislation already prohibits the trade of products belonging to the lists of the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. Application controls, purchase invoices and verified Agronomic Prescriptions, as well as inspections carried out in the properties deposits guarantee that there is no use of paraquat on the audited properties.
5_7_criteria: Producers and those responsible for the properties demonstrate knowledge about the use of biological control agents. On two of the farms audited, there is still no full record of the use of biological control. However, the corresponding indicator 5.7.2 will only be applicable from next year onwards.
5_8_criteria: The producers and managers interviewed demonstrate knowledge of the entities available in cases of outbreaks and infestations of pests and invaders.
5_9_criteria: The properties implement procedures providing best practices during applications. In two of the three properties audited, there is still no record of climatic conditions during applications, but indicator 5.9.2 will only be applicable from the third year of certification. All applications on audited properties are carried out on land using Uniport sprayers. The maps of the areas demonstrate that the minimum distances from houses and bodies of water are respected.
5_10_criteria: The owners and those responsible for the farms report through interviews that there were no cases of interference with neighboring production systems. Neighboring areas use similar cultivation systems, based on the production of soybeans and off-season corn.
5_11_criteria: The seeds used are all purchased from known sources, as demonstrated through purchase invoices. There is no production of seeds for personal use.

Name: Saag Comercial Exportadora Ltda no-GMO
1_1_criteria: The company has access to applicable legislation and is complied with. Collaborators demonstrated knowledge and relevant documents were available.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations, lease contracts and CCIR Â– INCRA.
1_3_criteria: The aspects have been identified and continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, showing the companys commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory or slave labor was found or involuntary during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and pertinent information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the agricultural unit.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that workers Salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees. For outsourced workers there are no records of hours worked available.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as the SAAG website, group manager (https://scisaag.wordpress.com/reclamacoes/), containing e-mails telephones, postal address on the roads between the community and the farms with publicity signs written Â“contact usÂ” and internally on the farms in the scope through the Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the workers point control .
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements. Places of importance are identified, maintained and preserved.
3_3_criteria: A complaints and complaints mechanism is made available, described in the groups operational procedures. The mechanism establishes a procedure for recording and handling complaints, through a complaints and grievances form, available at production units. There were no records of complaints and complaints at the time of the audit.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the production unit and internal vacancies on the farms and are publicized through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fills out the job application, I have your resume on file. Supply of products and services to the local community was carried out by Saag.
4_1_criteria: Socio-environmental assessment available, in the document called Monitoring Schedules and Programs, there are the identified points and the measures to minimize or mitigate the identified impacts. There is also a schedule for implementing the proposed actions and it has been monitored and complied with.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging appropriately. The Environmental Control Plan presented during the audit includes waste management including all areas of the property.
4_3_criteria: The unit promotes actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and monitored organic matter in the soil.
4_4_criteria: It has been shown through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling the areas of preservation and legal reserve, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and groundwater.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, however, in the Environmental Control Plan , which shows the actions proposed by the farms to adapt to the new forest code, there is a schedule for the restoration of some areas. There are no natural wetlands in the production unit
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analyses, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion control and crop rotation techniques are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: The integrated crop management plan and targets for reducing phytosanitary products were presented. List and invoices for the purchase of products were available, demonstrating that they use products that comply with Brazilian legislation.
5_5_criteria: Records of pesticide application on farms in the scope are made manually and recorded in spreadsheets, covering the indicator information. Storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: During field verification on agrochemical application fronts, retroactive application records and storage. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. There was no evidence of the use of Paraquat on farms within the scope of certification.
5_7_criteria: No evidence of the use of biological control agents was found.
5_8_criteria: There were no incidences of new pests that have not been identified , according to the records presented. "Control of New Pests and Diseases" procedure available, in the case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact the available research body.
5_9_criteria: Standard Operating Procedure - Pesticide Care - Drift was presented, addressing precautions, especially wind in agricultural pesticide applications. There is no aerial application on farms within the scope.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: Bartira Gestão Agropecuária
1_1_criteria: The organization demonstrated knowledge of the legislation and it is implemented on the sampled farms. After the audit, the group manager was informed that Fazenda Horizontina Norte is on the IBAMA Embargo List, dated 07/10/2018. The reason for the reported embargo was the absence of the LO, however it was available during the audit, dated 05/08/2018.
1_2_criteria: Land ownership was evidenced through registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: The socio-environmental aspects and impacts, as well as control measures were raised by the group manager before the audit.
2_1_criteria: No adverse working conditions were found, such as forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary during the audit process in the workplace or heard during interviews with employees.
2_2_criteria: Labor laws are adequately complied with, all workers have a registration form, contract, as well as a collective bargaining agreement, that specify their working conditions
2_3_criteria: Accident and emergency procedures are available. Workers and those responsible for the operation demonstrated knowledge about health and safety at work through verbal explanations addressing issues related to the application of agricultural pesticides, use of machinery and equipment and use of PPE. There is integration training and a code of conduct addressing these topics, which were explained to the workers.
2_4_criteria: Workers have freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining with trade unions.
2_5_criteria: The sampled farms comply with the working day in accordance with labor legislation, as well as what is established in Collective Labor Agreements with the categorys unions.
3_1_criteria: Communication channels are available internally on the farms for employees and externally via the Ombudsman Channel , via telephone and e-mail.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation has been presented and is in accordance with applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels available to employees and the community. Communication with the community is established, as Bartira Farms are known in the community and have a website available to everyone.
3_4_criteria: There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the farms, as well as at a group level.
4_1_criteria: The socio-environmental assessment of socio-environmental aspects and impacts, as well as control measures were raised by the group manager before the audit. The assessment is available upon request.
4_2_criteria: The company has a waste management plan implemented on farms, with correct disposal of waste.
4_3_criteria: Monitoring of diesel, organic matter and opportunities for Carbon sequestration is done according to the reality of the farms.
4_4_criteria: All maps of the farms participating in the multi-site group "Comparison map with satellite images (2009, 2016 and current)" were presented. The maps were compared with the RTRS map, demonstrating that the areas are adequate. Horizontina Leste Farm was opened, but it was carried out through Authorization by the Competent Environmental Agency - SEMA/MA with number 0053/2012 valid until 04/18/2013. For this opening, the study "SURVEY OF CARBON CONCENTRATION ABOVE" was presented
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained and preserved in accordance with current legislation. Hunting is not practiced on the properties.
5_1_criteria: Good Relevant agricultural practices and structures to avoid water contamination are implemented on the farms.
5_2_criteria: The watercourses and APP on the properties visited are described on maps, there was no removal of vegetation from the APP areas.
5_3_criteria: The farms have good land use management, including adequate fertilization, crop rotations, erosion control and maintenance of soil quality. Soil analyzes are carried out regularly, including the assessment of organic matter content. The analyzes are used to determine fertility and plan fertilization.
5_4_criteria: Farms use suitable products to control pests and diseases. IPM and plans to reduce the use of chemical products are being implemented.
5_5_criteria: The use, transport and storage of chemicals and empty packaging are carried out appropriately. Signs are used indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: The use of paraquat in Brazil is still permitted for soybean cultivation according to MAPA, with some exceptions such as manual applications, backpacks and/or with tractors without a closed cabin. The use of the product has also been reduced due to restrictions. A reduction plan was presented for the coming years.
5_7_criteria: There is no use of biological products on the farms visited.
5_8_criteria: Notification systems for new pests or invasive species present.
5_9_criteria: There are drift control procedures for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds purchased externally in accordance with legal requirements.

Name: Associação Clube Amigos da Terra CAT Sorriso
1_1_criteria: Farms stay up to date with applicable laws through consultancies in various sectors. The areas are registered in the CAR and agronomic prescriptions are issued by the technical managers. The four farms received non-conformities in item 1.1.2, related to working hours and payments during harvest periods, work safety, environmental licensing, accommodation structures and compliance with water potability standards.
1_2_criteria: The farms have registrations and lease contracts for all areas of their farms.
1_3_criteria: The group manager is responsible for the socio-environmental assessment of all members. Although there is a Social and Environmental Impact Assessment, the four farms received non-conformities in items 1.3.2 and 1.3.3 because they did not have defined indicators and targets for monitoring and analyzing actions related to the assessment.
2_1_criteria: As verified in interviews and farm records, employees are free to leave the property and there is no evidence of forced or slave-like labor. Only copies of employee documents are kept by the farms. Family members who live on the properties are not forced to work, and opportunities are offered. There are no children under 18 working on the farms. On one of the farms there was a non-compliance with item 2.1.4 due to the hiring of emancipated minors under 18 who carried out dangerous activities. There were no signs of discrimination during the interview reports. Employees have the same rights, benefits, opportunities and remuneration, without the presence of any type of punishment, oppression or mental or physical coercion.
2_2_criteria: Farm employees have signed employment contracts, written in the Portuguese language . At the time of hiring, employment rights are communicated to employees. Qualification training is carried out with SENAR. A farm received a non-conformity in item 2.2.3 for not showing recent occupational safety records.
2_3_criteria: There are occupational health and safety programs such as PPRA, PCMSO, PGRTR or PGSSMATR on farms. One of the farms received a non-conformity in item 2.3.2 for not carrying out all the tests described in its program. Training regarding occupational safety NRs is carried out with SENAR, however two farms received non-conformities in indicator 2.3.3 due to the lack of this training and exams. Farms provide PPE for their employees. Compliance with health and safety requirements is monitored through inspections carried out in the areas. There are emergency procedures, medical kits and vehicles available in case of accidents.
2_4_criteria: Employees are not prevented from joining local unions and are invited to attend union meetings. It was evidenced through interviews that there is no distinction in the treatment of union representatives. The Collective Labor Agreement 2019/2021, signed with the Rural Workers Union of Sorriso is highlighted.
2_5_criteria: Workers receive payments higher than the national minimum wage and salary floor for the category, when there is a collective labor agreement in force, and payment receipts demonstrate that the deductions made are only those provided for by law, such as INSS and income tax. Only on 1 farm did employees who had already been laid off receive the minimum wage established for their category. Housing and accommodation are available to employees, all of which are adequate, with running water, electricity and septic tanks. However, in only 1 of the farms audited, the water tanks are sanitized to guarantee potability, in accordance with current legislation, the other farms do not do so. On one of the farms it was evident that lockers are not provided in the accommodation. The normal working day on farms is 44 hours a week, with occasional overtime, especially during harvest times. Overtime is voluntary, as reported by workers in interviews. Hours worked are recorded on most farms, with only one property not recording it, making it impossible to highlight normal working hours, extra working hours and weekly rest, generating non-compliance in indicators 2.5.3, 2.5.4, 2.5.5 , 2.5.6. One of the farms records overtime worked, but does not pay them as determined by the collective labor agreement. Furthermore, on two of the farms audited, the weekly rest day was not respected during the harvest period, leading to non-compliance in indicator 2.5.6. Verified that the farms are aware of and comply with maternity and paternity leave requirements.
3_1_criteria: The communication channels available with the audited farms are telephone, e-mail and suggestion boxes present at the headquarters and also in the group managers office. CAT Sorriso, as manager of the group, publishes the groups members on its website and has a suggestion box and individual notebook for each farm in its office for recording complaints. Signs at the entrance to the farms identify the location and contact numbers. The communication channels are known and allow adequate communication between local communities and the properties.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes over the right to use land on the properties, as well as there is no evidence of the existence of traditional users of the properties. property lands. There are no indigenous areas close to the audited farms. The rights of such traditional users are respected by the farms.
3_3_criteria: The properties have suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters, as well as a written procedure providing for registration and treatment. In the group managers office, there is also a suggestion box available, as well as a place to archive received communications. To date, there has been no communication received.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies available on farms are preferably offered to local communities, generally through advertisements for current employees. As far as possible, there is collaboration with training programs for the local community and/or participation in training offered by SENAR-MT or equivalent entities, contributing to the formation of groups to provide training. The acquisition of goods and services is preferably done through companies in the community where the farms are located.
4_1_criteria: An assessment was carried out by the group manager on all members upon joining the group, in a comprehensive and clear manner , including all topics from the RTRS Production Standard as well as all activities carried out on the farm. Controls are carried out by the manager using Excel spreadsheets and the group manager and the producer keep copies with the summary of the socio-environmental assessment, which are available in case of requests.
4_2_criteria: No fires are practiced on the audited farms. All audited farms have a documented Waste Management Plan, prepared by the group manager, describing the main waste generated and its final destination. The properties have the appropriate structures to prevent oil spills, at the gas station, mechanical workshop and machinery wash. Non-biological waste is disposed of correctly and all residences and accommodation on the audited farms have a septic tank.
4_3_criteria: The consumption of fossil fuels is recorded and the audited farms carry out trend analysis. Soil organic matter is monitored by all farms through soil analysis. Carbon sequestration is increased through practices such as crop succession, cultivation of cover species such as sunn hemp, direct planting and maintenance of native vegetation present on all properties.
4_4_criteria: Verified through comparative maps of the years of 2009, 2016 and 2021, that there was no expansion for soybean cultivation.
4_5_criteria: All group members have maps drawn up by the group manager, indicating production areas, native vegetation and watercourses . Through comparative maps and Receipts from the Rural Environmental Registry (CAR), it was verified that the farms preserve the native vegetation existing in the area. Hunting and fishing are prohibited on all audited farms, through signposts or internal regulations. The audited farms have a properly implemented monitoring plan and monitor native vegetation and wildlife.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices are adopted on the audited properties, such as, for example, use of direct planting, crop succession, construction of contour lines and maintenance of permanent preservation and legal reserve areas. Two of the farms audited use irrigation, but one of them does not have control over the volumes captured, which generated non-compliance in indicator 5.1.1 and the other does not have a documented irrigation procedure, which generated non-compliance in indicator 5.1.4. Water quality is monitored through annual analyzes carried out in contracted external laboratories.
5_2_criteria: The farms have location maps identifying springs, rivers and bodies of water, in addition to the permanent preservation area and legal reserve. The ciliary areas are maintained. Drainage was identified in natural wetlands on no property.
5_3_criteria: Based on the results obtained in the soil analysis reports, the farms follow technical recommendations from engineers agronomists for the use of correctives and fertilizers. Practices are adopted to preserve soil quality, such as cover cropping and direct planting systems throughout the agricultural area. The cultivation regime of the audited properties are soybeans in the harvest season and corn, cotton or beans in the off-season, respecting the Health Vacuum established in the State of Mato Grosso.
5_4_criteria: There are documented plans for Integrated Pest Management on the audited farms , containing the chemical and non-chemical methods used, such as the use of biological control. However, the four farms had non-compliance in indicator 5.4.2, due to the lack of a plan to reduce phytosanitary products with clear reduction targets over time. All pesticides used on properties are registered for soybean cultivation, are purchased with Agricultural Prescriptions and recommended by qualified professionals.
5_5_criteria: The audited farms register agricultural pesticide applications. The pesticides are stored in specific deposits, properly locked and with a containment system in case of leaks. The pesticide packaging is triple washed and perforated on all audited farms and temporarily stored in the empty packaging warehouse covered, closed and properly locked. All audited farms mark newly sprayed areas with signposts.
5_6_criteria: The audited farms do not use products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions and also no longer use Paraquat in their production processes.
5_7_criteria: Three of the 4 farms audited use biological control agents. Producers and those responsible for farms are aware of the importance of using biological control. On properties that use biological control-based products, the uses are recorded together with all inputs applied to the crop.
5_8_criteria: Producers and those responsible for the audited farms demonstrate knowledge regarding the appearance of new pests and invasive species and reported that in these situations, they would contact institutional systems designed to identify and monitor new pests and invasive species, such as Embrapa or Aprosoja.
5_9_criteria: The properties have documented procedures detailing good practices in handling and application of pesticides. The four farms audited record weather conditions during applications. On audited farms that carry out aerial application, the 500 meters distance from populated areas is respected. Land applications respect at least 90 meters from populated areas and bodies of water, as determined by state legislation, except one of them does not respect this limit, which caused NC in indicator 5.9.5.
5_10_criteria: Properties neighboring Farms are occupied with similar production systems, and there are no production systems that require care, such as organic production. No audited farm found records of damage to neighboring areas.
5_11_criteria: On all audited farms it is possible to guarantee the legal use of the origin of the seeds, where they are acquired from duly qualified companies.

Name: Produzindo Certo–Grupo Castrolanda
1_1_criteria: The farm remains up to date with applicable laws through contact between the sectors and legal bodies, as well as through consultancies. Although the farm complies with legal requirements, cases of non-compliance with the Consolidation of Labor Laws were identified, exceeding the maximum limit of 2 overtime hours per day. NC 01: The limit of 2 daily overtime hours of work provided for by the Consolidation of Labor Laws is not being met.
1_2_criteria: The property only has its own areas with registrations showing the right to use the land.
1_3_criteria: The unit defined indicators to be improved, covering at least one topic from each principle of the RTRS Standard. The indicators are described in the Socio-environmental Diagnosis document. Monitoring was only carried out for some indicators. There is no evidence of monitoring for all established indicators. Although not being met, compliance with indicator 1.3.3 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards.
2_1_criteria: Employees are free to leave the farm and have adequate working conditions and home. At the farm office, only copies of employee documents are retained, obtained shortly after hiring and attached to the files. There are no children under 18 working or residing on the property. Employees with the same functions receive the same base salaries. During the interviews, employees reported not suffering corporal punishment, any coercive methods or types of abuse and intimidation.
2_2_criteria: Employees have signed employment contracts attached to their files. Labor rights, as well as appropriate forms of conduct, are communicated to employees through integration training immediately after hiring. However, there are no records demonstrating that these trainings were carried out. Despite not being fulfilled, compliance with indicator 2.2.2 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards. The farm provides vocational training to employees. Topics relating to the execution of functions, procedures and work instructions are covered.
2_3_criteria: Those responsible for the farm demonstrated knowledge and understanding of occupational health and safety issues. The farms PPRA and PCMSO are updated annually. For potentially dangerous tasks, employees undergo health monitoring examinations, as well as occupational safety training. Upon receiving the PPE, employees sign a delivery form, which describes the PPE received, as well as a liability and obligation statement. The use of PPE is checked by the occupational safety technician and in monthly 5S checks. Emergency procedures are transmitted to employees through training. The farm has first aid kits on the farms premises, as well as a vehicle available for transport.
2_4_criteria: Although the local union does not maintain frequent contact with employees, they are free to contribute or not. Although it has been verified that employees are not prevented from undertaking collective bargaining in conjunction with local unions, there are no collective agreements or conventions in force at the moment
2_5_criteria: Although there is no collective agreement or convention, the lowest wage- base paid in the unit is higher than the national minimum wage of R$1,100.00. Copies of payment receipts are retained by the unit. As verified in the payment statements, no deductions are made that are not provided for by law, such as INSS and IRRF. 44 normal working hours and 12 overtime hours per week are not exceeded. The hours worked are recorded according to the point performed by employees manually. The harvest period normally occurs between September and April. The month with the highest labor demand is March. In such periods, time records were recorded where workers did not take a day off after 6 consecutive days of work. NC 02: Workers do not take a day off for every six consecutive days of work.
3_1_criteria: The local community can contact the farm via email, available on the propertys entrance sign , or on the Cooperativa Castrolanda website. Furthermore, it has communication procedures that standardize the treatment of complaints and suggestions received from both the local community and employees.
3_2_criteria: The group manager has maps identifying the regions where there are institutional areas, constituted by the Units of Conservation of Sustainable Use and Integral Protection and Indigenous Lands. There are no indigenous areas close to the property. The nearest settlement, PA da Ranch Alegre, is 33 km from the farm and the PiraÃ­ do Sul National Forest is 14 km from the property.
3_3_criteria: Workers can make complaints and complaints via WhatsApp, complaints box or directly at the farm office. Such complaints may be made anonymously or not. Employees are aware of the mechanisms, as verified during the interviews.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised through local recommendations, and are advertised among residents of the region. Currently, the majority of farm employees are residents of the region. The majority of inputs and services are obtained from the Castro/PR region. The farm participates in social projects and donations in the city, however there are no records that show such activities. Despite not being met, compliance with indicator 3.4.2 will only be required from the second surveillance audit onwards
4_1_criteria: Properties included in the certification group undergo a social and environmental assessment before of its inclusion. The topics of the RTRS Production Standard are fully covered during the assessment, as well as all activities carried out on the farm. Although the farm has established measures to minimize the identified impacts, there is no evidence of monitoring for all of these measures. Although it is not being met, compliance with indicator 4.1.4 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards.
4_2_criteria: It was verified through maps with the history of the heat source in the areas of the farm that are not burned at the unit.
