The farm separates hazardous waste and stores it in a suitable location. Hazardous waste is sent to specialized companies. Both hazardous and non-hazardous waste are stored and disposed of, as described in the Solid Waste Management Plan Â– PGRS. The machines are washed in a washing lane, but a water and oil separator box has not yet been installed. Although not being met, compliance with indicator 4.2.3 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards.
4_3_criteria: Measurements of fuel use are carried out in the farm workshop by employees and recorded in an Excel spreadsheet. Although there is control over the use of fuels, a mechanism has not yet been established to demonstrate the analysis of consumption trends over time. Although it is not being complied with, compliance with indicator 4.3.2 will only be required from the second surveillance audit onwards. Soil organic matter is monitored through soil analysis and precision agriculture. Good agricultural practices are used to maintain the soil and cover crops are used. Permanent preservation areas are maintained on the property, increasing carbon sequestration.
4_4_criteria: The comparative maps developed by the group manager demonstrate that there were no openings of areas after May 2009.
4_5_criteria: The farm has a map of the property containing the consolidated open area, native vegetation, permanent preservation area and watercourses. The unit has the Ecosystem and Wildlife Conservation Program, which aims to identify native vegetation and wildlife, in addition to establishing measures for the conservation, protection and recovery of natural ecosystems on the farm. Hunting and fishing are prohibited on the farmâ€™s territories. The property has signs warning of the prohibition at several points
5_1_criteria: The farm does not carry out irrigation on the property. There is no water collection from rivers, only from wells for employee consumption. The unit monitors the quality of water resources, such as the underground collection well. Good agricultural practices are adopted in various situations, such as direct planting, soil cover, prevention of erosion and application of fertilizers according to the dosage recommended by experts.
5_2_criteria: Verified during visits and on maps that forests are present in the rivers. No points for removing natural vegetation were identified in riparian areas. There are no wetlands that have been drained on the property.
5_3_criteria: Soil analyzes are carried out with precision agriculture. The results and monitoring are carried out by agronomists. Several practices are applied to preserve the soil, such as direct planting, crop rotation, fertilizer dosage based on soil analysis, road maintenance and soil coverage with oats and ryegrass. There is no land with a steep slope on the farm. Erosion is controlled through contour lines, cover plants and maintenance of the propertys roads. The period of sanitary emptiness in the region occurs between 25/05 and 10/09, where there is no soybean cultivation.
5_4_criteria: They use biological pest controls to treat seeds such as Rizoliq Top and ACC Max. Also there is production of biological controls on the farm. Bedbugs and caterpillars are controlled. Although there is crop management and the use of biological pest controls, there is no documented plan where such actions are described. Furthermore, there are no targets for reducing these products over time. Although not being complied with, compliance with indicators 5.4.1 and 5.4.2 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards. Both pesticides and fertilizers are original and purchased from licensed companies, and are accompanied by invoices and agronomic prescriptions. Monitoring records of pests and natural predators are carried out and maintained. Although the technical team reports that it monitors diseases and weeds, there are no records that demonstrate such practices. Although it is not being met, compliance with indicator 5.4.5 will only be required from the first surveillance audit onwards.
5_5_criteria: Records of the use of agrochemicals are carried out through agronomic prescriptions and retained in the farm office. Agrochemical suppliers transport them to the cooperatives general warehouse. Empty agrochemical packaging is triple-washed after use, punctured and stored in a dedicated warehouse. After storage, they are taken to the Castrolanda cooperative warehouse and sent to authorized collection points. The property works with precision agriculture, technical recommendations are made by agronomists and follow the reports of soil analyzes carried out.
5_6_criteria: The farm does not use products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The land applications spreadsheet is highlighted, which contains all the agrochemicals used by the farm.
5_7_criteria: The requirements for the use of biological control agents are available in the agricultural system. Biological control agents are used on the property to combat pests. When such products are used, records similar to the use of chemical products are made and recorded.
5_8_criteria: There are no cases of new pests or diseases. The farm has communication with the ABC Foundation, which contacts the responsible organizations, such as Embrapa. In case of new pests or diseases, monitoring and communication are carried out.
5_9_criteria: Records of weather conditions and application times are made. Drift is controlled by the farm based on each product applied and the current weather conditions. Pesticides are not applied within a 30m radius of populated areas or bodies of water
5_10_criteria: There is no evidence of interference in neighboring production systems, the forms of cultivation and cultures are consolidated and similar to that of the farm, such as soybeans and corn.
5_11_criteria: The seeds are purchased from Cooperativa Castrolanda. Part of the seeds are saved by the farm. The saved seeds are only used for own production, without commercialization. The farm has authorization to produce seeds

Name: SLC Agrícola
1_1_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation that SLC AgrÃ­cola has standardized access to the legality control system for all farms in the EVALUATED EVIDENCE: group. The procedure includes the system used to identify and access legislation, regulations, documents, policies, codes and other subscribed requirements applicable to environmental and social aspects and occupational hazards of activities, products and services.
1_2_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation of lease contracts, CAR and registration certificates. EVALUATED:According to documentary evaluation, the evaluated units comply with applicable legislation.
1_3_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the report with indicators extracted for evaluation and EVALUATED:monitoring, OHS and ENVIRONMENT.
2_1_criteria: According to interviews with employees, it was stated that no form of forced, compulsory, slave, trafficked or involuntary labor is used at any stage of production. It was stated that no worker is required to leave their identity documents with other people and no part of their salary, benefits or belongings is withheld by owners or third parties. EVIDENCEAccording to the interview carried out with farm employees, they reported residing on the EVALUATED property: with their families, they reported that their spouses and/or children have the freedom to choose to work or not on the properties. Information also reported by the HR coordinators of the sampled farms. No minors were found working on the farm. For families who live on the farm and have children, a bus is available to transport children to school every day to the municipality or districts closest to the farms.
2_2_criteria: According to an interview with employees, it was stated that no form is used of forced, compulsory, slave, trafficked or involuntary labor at any stage of production. It was stated that no worker is required to leave their identity documents with other people and no part of their salary, benefits or belongings is withheld by owners or third parties. EVIDENCEAccording to the interview carried out with farm employees, they reported residing on the EVALUATED property: with their families, they reported that their spouses and/or children have the freedom to choose to work or not on the properties. Information also reported by the HR coordinators of the sampled farms. No minors were found working on the farm. For families who live on the farm and have children, a bus is available to transport the children to school daily to the municipality or districts closest to the farms. Evidenced through documentary analysis and interviews with employees that discrimination of any nature does not occur on the farm, and is not tolerated. There are channels for anonymous reporting, should this occur, and employees are aware of these channels. It was possible to demonstrate through documentary evaluation that all farm salaries follow what is established in the Salary Table matrix, with no distinction between functions. Through the evaluation of the code of conduct and interviews with employees, it was possible to demonstrate that they are not subject to corporal punishment, oppression, mental or physical coercion, physical or verbal abuse, sexual harassment or any other type of intimidation
2_3_criteria: According to documentary evaluation, it was verified that all sampled employees have signed contracts on the dates of hiring. According to documentary evaluation, outsourced workers who provide services at the property also have a formal service provision contract. Through interviews with HR employees, it was found that labor laws are detailed and employees are currently EVALUATED: from hiring to signing the employment contract, as evidenced by the duly signed document and confirmed the information in an interview with employees of the 3 sample properties. Regarding training, it is offered to employees according to the role they perform. All contractors undergo Integration training.
2_4_criteria: According to interviews carried out with employees and analysis of the MINUTES of meetings, everyone demonstrates knowledge of health and safety standards. Evidence that relevant health and safety risks are identified, treated and monitored. According to the evaluation of the documentation, I will be able to verify that tasks with potential risk are EVIDENCE carried out by people with proven training, as evidenced by training records. EVALUATED: It was demonstrated that all employees receive PPE for protection, and are instructed regarding their use, through the Health and Safety Service Order. It is clear that the company has procedures in case of possible accidents at work and the instructions are clear and understood by all employees. This information could be confirmed through interviews with employees. The company also has rescue and first aid kits available for employees.
2_5_criteria: Through interviews with managers and document analysis, it was found that the union is allowed to hold EVIDENCE meetings. EVALUATED: Evidenced through interviews with employees and meeting minutes that the farm allows the union to hold meetings with employees, and also allows all employees to attend meetings. All workers have the right to participate in collective bargaining. Workers are not prevented from interacting with external parties outside of working hours.
3_1_criteria: According to documentary assessment, payments are in accordance with legislation and agreements. Through interviews with employees, it was evident that only legal deductions or those authorized by employees are made. All legal and optional salary deductions are explained to employees. Everyone has access to payment slips in physical form, or through the EVALUATED EVIDENCE: ADM system application, which show all deductions made. Salaries are paid monthly via bank deposit. Evidenced Benefits procedure that is passed on to the employee upon hiring. Verified that the employees working hours meet the required workload in accordance with current legislation, as well as overtime complies with all requirements. All hours worked by employees are recorded via electronic timekeeping. The unit knows and respects maternity and paternity leaves. There is no remuneration for results in the property. Evidenced that all employees have access to drinking water on the farm, housing separated by sex, good infrastructure.
3_2_criteria: According to visual assessment, evidenced that the farms provide at their entrance an information sign containing identification, telephone number, websites and contact emails. The company SLC has documents in its Management system whose objective is to record the EVIDENCE of various complaints/communications received, analyze the cause and record the return of the treatment to the EVALUATED:complainant. Furthermore, as stated in the code of conduct for employees, the confidential channels that can be used to report abuse within the organization itself. All employees receive training regarding code of conduct requirements. Communication channels adequately allow communication between SLC AgrÃ­cola units and the community.
3_3_criteria: Not applicable, as there are no indigenous communities around the property or in the region
3_4_criteria: As assessed visual, it is evident that the farms provide at their entrance an informative EVIDENCE sign containing identification, telephone number, websites and contact emails. The company records and maintains files on EVALUATED:complaints received and they are addressed. Both internal and external communication/complaint demands have a processing flow until they are completed.
4_1_criteria: It was evidenced through documentary evaluation that job vacancies are advertised in EVIDENCIAemployment agencies. Evidenced through documentary evaluation that SLC AgrÃ­cola in general provides the community EVALUATED: local, possibility of training. SLC AgrÃ­cola preferably hires companies and regional service providers
4_2_criteria: It is evidenced through documentary evaluation that the company carries out a social and environmental assessment, and the assessment is carried out by qualified and trained people. The assessment is carried out comprehensively, EVIDENCEincluding all sectors of the farm and business partners. Measures to mitigate or minimize the impacts ASSESSED: identified by the assessment are taken appropriately. The company has archived the social and environmental assessment report and it was presented, which contains information about the actions and initiatives taken by SLC in relation to socio-environmental issues.
4_3_criteria: According to visual assessment of the companys production areas property, no areas with traces of fire were identified. Evidenced through visual assessment, that there are signs indicating the prohibition of use EVALUATED EVIDENCE: fire. The farms of the SLC AgrÃ­cola group have suitable places for storing fuel and also have waste deposits suitable for storing different types of materials, such as batteries, used tires, burnt oil and others materials. It was evidenced that the farms have adequate structures to contain oil spills and other pollutants. Several points were identified on the farm with material collectors separated by type (paper, plastic, metal, organic), which are subsequently sent to selective collection units for recycling. The company has a documented waste management plan.
4_4_criteria: It is clear that the company records and monitors the use of fossil fuels on all of the groups farms. There was no significant change in the companys consumption of fossil fuels. EVIDENCEThe company carries out soil analysis, including monitoring of OM in the soil. EVALUATED:According to visual assessment, the SLC group Farms have a project whose central objective is Â“To develop and execute a forest enrichment plan in internal areas of the UnitsÂ”, to help with the issue of carbon sequestration.
4_5_criteria: According to documentary assessment, the SLC areas are in compliance with the EVALUATED:soybean expansion requirements.
5_1_criteria: According to visual and documentary assessment, maps of the properties were presented, counting the legal reserve areas, Permanent Protection Areas and production areas of the property, and indication of water courses. There is a plan being implemented and monitored to ensure that native vegetation and wildlife are maintained. According to a visual assessment, it was observed that the farm has several points with signs prohibiting hunting and fishing within the property, in addition, information regarding this prohibition is also included in the Integration Training. Evidenced through documentary evaluation, that the production units have the appropriate registrations in the CAR and meet the requirement of 10% vegetation
5_2_criteria: According to the harvest planning presented, in the inter-harvest periods of commercial crops, a planting of coverage to promote the increase and maintenance of organic matter in the soil. EVIDENCE is also evidenced through documentary evaluation, the record referring to localized applications, which directs the EVALUATED: product application directly to the area where the economic damage was identified. Thus reducing machine time in the field, less product expenditure, less soil stress due to reduced machinery traffic, and still, controlling the imbalance identified in the crop. It is evident that the company has an integrated report, which includes direct planting practices, maintenance of land cover (straw), crop rotation and crop-livestock integration, selective application of pesticides, monitoring of crops and processes digitally productive, digital field monitoring and machine telemetry.
5_3_criteria: On selected properties, no use of irrigation. All watercourses were identified and EVALUATED:mapped. The company has a schedule for restoring natural vegetation.
5_4_criteria: It is clear that the company carries out soil analysis, with all necessary parameters evaluated. According to the harvest planning presented, between harvests of commercial crops, a cover crop is planted to promote the increase and maintenance of organic matter in the soil. It is evident that the company has an integrated report, which includes direct planting practices, maintenance of land cover (straw), crop rotation and crop-livestock integration, selective application of pesticides, monitoring of crops and processes digitally productive, digital field monitoring and machine telemetry
5_5_criteria: According to documentary evaluation, the Integrated Farm Crop Planning was presented. Also evidenced through documentary evaluation, the record referring to localized applications, which directs the application of the product directly to the area where the economic damage was identified. Thus reducing, EVALUATED EVIDENCE: machine time in the field, less product expenditure, less soil stress due to reduced machinery traffic, and still, controlling the imbalance identified in the crop. According to a visual assessment of the pesticide warehouses and the syrup preparation points, they are in compliance. Through documentary evaluation, it was also identified that all applications are carried out in accordance with the recommendation made by the properties agronomists. The company carries out Integrated Monitoring of Pests and Diseases.
5_6_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation that all applications are carried out in accordance with the recommendation made by the properties agronomists. According to visual observation, it was possible to visually demonstrate that the farm carries out triple washing and also renders packaging EVIDENCE unusable, which in turn is directed to a warehouse for storing empty packaging with EVALUATED: restricted access and several information signs regarding non- reusing them. Proof of return of empty packaging is evidenced through documentary evaluation. According to visual assessment, it was identified that the transport of agrochemical products occurs in properly appropriate vehicles. Storage is carried out in a suitable warehouse, duly identified.
5_7_criteria: It was demonstrated through documentary evaluation that the farms are aware and the product prohibition lists of the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions are available. The list of pesticides present on the properties is also evidenced, with no prohibited pesticides in stock. tested, six different types of microorganisms, whose application occurs in replacement of synthetic products and also combined with localized application technologies, which reduces the demand for volume of materials and water in operations. Evidence that records are kept of all use of biological control agents
5_8_criteria: Evidence from the evaluation of procedures that the production of biodefensives used on the farms, six different types of microorganisms are produced and tested, whose application replaces synthetic products and is also combined with localized application technologies, which reduces the demand for volume of materials and water in operations. Evidence that records are kept of all use of biological control agents
5_9_criteria: There is no evidence of pest outbreaks in the farm regions, however the company carries out EVALUATED:Integrated Monitoring of Pests and Diseases
5_10_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation, the record referring to localized applications, which directs the application of the product directly to the area where the economic damage was identified. Thus reducing the time EVALUATED EVIDENCE: field machinery, lower product expenditure, less soil stress due to reduced machinery traffic, and still, controlling the imbalance identified in the crop. Localized application reduces the use of herbicides on crops by up to 90%. All applications are carried out in accordance with the recommendation made by the properties agronomists. There are no populated areas or communities around the farms, within 500 m or less, that require prior warning for aerial spraying. For employees, as previously shown, there are spray communication panels, and all employees have access. The company does not use prohibited inputs.
5_11_criteria: According to documentation presented and already mentioned in previous items, the wind speed is defined and monitored, in order to prevent any type of drift, if the conditions of wind, UR, are outside the OSÂ’s specifications, applications are stopped.

Name: Fazendas Bartira
1_1_criteria: The organization demonstrated knowledge of the legislation and it is implemented on the sampled farms. After the audit, the group manager was informed that Fazenda Horizontina Norte is on the IBAMA Embargo List, dated 07/10/2018. The reason for the reported embargo was the absence of the LO, however it was available during the audit, dated 05/08/2018.
1_2_criteria: Land ownership was evidenced through registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: The socio-environmental aspects and impacts, as well as control measures were raised by the group manager before the audit.
2_1_criteria: No adverse working conditions were found, such as forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary during the audit process in the workplace or heard during interviews with employees.
2_2_criteria: Labor laws are adequately complied with, all workers have a registration form, contract, as well as a collective bargaining agreement, that specify their working conditions.
2_3_criteria: Accident and emergency procedures are available. Workers and those responsible for the operation demonstrated knowledge about health and safety at work through verbal explanations addressing issues related to the application of agricultural pesticides, use of machinery and equipment and use of PPE. There is integration training and a code of conduct addressing these topics, which were explained to the workers.
2_4_criteria: Workers have freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining with trade unions.
2_5_criteria: The sampled farms comply with the working day in accordance with labor legislation, as well as what is established in Collective Labor Agreements with the categorys unions.
3_1_criteria: Communication channels are available internally on the farms for employees and externally via the Ombudsman Channel , via telephone and e-mail.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation has been presented and is in accordance with applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels available to employees and the community. Communication with the community is established, as Bartira Farms are known in the community and have a website available to everyone.
3_4_criteria: There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the farms, as well as at a group level.
4_1_criteria: The socio-environmental assessment of socio-environmental aspects and impacts, as well as control measures were raised by the group manager before the audit. The assessment is available upon request.
4_2_criteria: The company has a waste management plan implemented on farms, with correct disposal of waste.
4_3_criteria: Monitoring of diesel, organic matter and opportunities for Carbon sequestration is done according to the reality of the farms.
4_4_criteria: All maps of the farms participating in the multi-site group "Comparison map with satellite images (2009, 2016 and current)" were presented. The maps were compared with the RTRS map, demonstrating that the areas are adequate. Horizontina Leste Farm was opened, but it was carried out through Authorization by the Competent Environmental Agency - SEMA/MA with number 0053/2012 valid until 04/18/2013. For this opening, the study "SURVEY OF CARBON CONCENTRATION ABOVE" was presented
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained and preserved in accordance with current legislation. Hunting is not practiced on the properties.
5_1_criteria: Good Relevant agricultural practices and structures to avoid water contamination are implemented on the farms.
5_2_criteria: The watercourses and APP on the properties visited are described on maps, there was no removal of vegetation from the APP areas.
5_3_criteria: The farms have good land use management, including adequate fertilization, crop rotations, erosion control and maintenance of soil quality. Soil analyzes are carried out regularly, including the assessment of organic matter content. The analyzes are used to determine fertility and plan fertilization.
5_4_criteria: Farms use suitable products to control pests and diseases. IPM and plans to reduce the use of chemical products are being implemented.
5_5_criteria: The use, transport and storage of chemicals and empty packaging are carried out appropriately. Signs are used indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: The use of paraquat in Brazil is still permitted for soybean cultivation according to MAPA, with some exceptions such as manual applications, backpacks and/or with tractors without a closed cabin. The use of the product has also been reduced due to restrictions. A reduction plan was presented for the coming years.
5_7_criteria: There is no use of biological products on the farms visited.
5_8_criteria: Notification systems for new pests or invasive species present.
5_9_criteria: There are drift control procedures for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds purchased externally in accordance with legal requirements.

Name: Fazendas Bartira – non-GMO
1_1_criteria: The organization demonstrated knowledge of the legislation and it is implemented on the sampled farms. After the audit, the group manager was informed that Fazenda Horizontina Norte is on the IBAMA Embargo List, dated 07/10/2018. The reason for the reported embargo was the absence of the LO, however it was available during the audit, dated 05/08/2018.
1_2_criteria: Land ownership was evidenced through registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: The socio-environmental aspects and impacts, as well as control measures were raised by the group manager before the audit.
2_1_criteria: No adverse working conditions were found, such as forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary during the audit process in the workplace or heard during interviews with employees.
2_2_criteria: Labor laws are adequately complied with, all workers have a registration form, contract, as well as a collective bargaining agreement, that specify their working conditions.
2_3_criteria: Accident and emergency procedures are available. Workers and those responsible for the operation demonstrated knowledge about health and safety at work through verbal explanations addressing issues related to the application of agricultural pesticides, use of machinery and equipment and use of PPE. There is integration training and a code of conduct addressing these topics, which were explained to the workers.

4_1_criteria: The socio-environmental assessment of socio-environmental aspects and impacts, as well as control measures were raised by the group manager before the audit. The assessment is available upon request.

5_3_criteria: The farms have good land use management, including adequate fertilization, crop rotations, erosion control and maintenance of soil quality. Soil analyzes are carried out regularly, including the assessment of organic matter content. The analyzes are used to determine fertility and plan fertilization.

Name: Aliança da Terra - Grupo IV
1_1_criteria: The farms are advised by external companies on topics such as health and safety, labor and environmental legislation, keeping up to date with applicable legal requirements. Those responsible for properties are aware of the laws applicable to the Standard. However, two farms had non-conformities in indicator 1.1.2. The non-conformities were due to excessive daily overtime and the lack of control over the volumes of water used through artesian wells and dam catchments.
1_2_criteria: The properties audited demonstrate the right to use land through of area registrations and lease contracts.
1_3_criteria: Improvement points are identified through the Socio-environmental Diagnoses developed by AlianÃ§a da Terra. After the Diagnosis, the owners sign the CAS (Socio-Environmental Adequacy Commitment), committing to improve the identified points.
2_1_criteria: There is no evidence of forced labor, slavery or their equivalents on the audited farms. Verified that there is no retention of personal documents or any workers assets by the employer. There is no work obligation imposed on spouses or children of employees and there are no children under the age of 15 working on the properties. In the case of family members of employees working on the property, there is no imposition by the farm. Employees report that they are unaware of any episode of discrimination of any kind. Salary schemes are defined according to the role and experience of employees. Employees are free to look for another job if they wish and report receiving cordial treatment.
2_2_criteria: Contracts and employee work cards are signed during their admission, describing salaries, working hours, rights and duties. Employees receive integration, covering topics such as health and safety and internal farm standards. The health and safety training programs provided to employees include specific requirements in the activities they carry out.
2_3_criteria: During interviews, workers knowledge and understanding of issues related to health and safety were verified. , producers or those responsible for farms. The audited farms have PPRA, PCMSO or similar programs, containing health and safety risks, as well as measures to mitigate and control them. However, two properties received a non-compliance in indicator 2.3.2, due to their health risk monitoring being in disagreement with the programs. Records of employee training programs and correct provision of PPE were presented during the audit. Health and safety policies, including the use of PPE and possible sanctions for non-compliance, are imposed through DDS and monitored during inspections conducted by occupational health and safety advisors or by the managers or owners themselves. Safety procedures, emergency plans and visible signs are maintained, containing useful telephone numbers in cases of accidents and emergencies. Some audited farms have a risk map, in places visible to all workers. There are also first aid kits and vehicles available on the properties for use in cases of emergencies.
2_4_criteria: Through interviews, it was demonstrated that employees are free to join unions, with no impediment to the right to negotiate collective imposed by the employer. However, there was no Collective Agreement or Convention in force on the farms audited.
2_5_criteria: The salary floors on the farms are higher than the national minimum. There are no payments for production, everyone receives monthly salaries. Verified through payment receipts that in some cases, there are symbolic charges for housing, in addition to legal discounts. The working hours on the audited farms are duly recorded, with the exception of one farm, where it was not possible to show the total hours worked during exceptional periods, generating a non-conformity in indicator 2.5.4. Totals worked are limited to 8 hours per day, with a maximum of two overtime hours, except on one of the farms, where the cook works more than two overtime hours per day, resulting in the non-compliance described in 1.1. Employees receive time off at least every six days worked, except on a farm, where it was found that during the harvest, employees work more than six days in a row, without a day of rest, generating non-conformity in indicator 2.5.6. Verified that farms are aware of and comply with maternity and paternity leave requirements. Employees who live on the properties receive housing in good condition, with running water and electricity. The accommodations are also in good condition, with beds, closets, fans, windows and adequate sanitary conditions. The farms have a canteen where meals are provided to employees. Despite water potability analyzes being carried out, only one of the farms carries out analyzes in an external laboratory, at an adequate frequency and demonstrates potability results in compliance with the Parameters of the Ministry of Health. All the other four farms received non-compliance in the indicator 2.5.9, for not evaluating the potability of water intended for human consumption through an external laboratory.
3_1_criteria: The properties maintain identification signs at the entrance and suggestion boxes at their headquarters. Communications can be made in person on farms, in offices in cities or even by telephone. Verified that the communication channels are known and allow adequate communication with local communities.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes over the right to use land in the audited properties. Verified through land use right documents, and maps identifying settlements, indigenous and quilombola areas close to the properties.
3_3_criteria: The mechanisms for complaints and grievances are known to the communities, who can express themselves in person or by telephone . The audited farms have suggestion boxes at their headquarters, as well as a written procedure providing for registration and processing. However, two audited farms, belonging to the same owner, received non-conformities in indicators 3.3.2 and 3.3.3, due to complaints not being fully registered.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are preferably offered to communities local, normally through advertisements on the Internet or by employees themselves. Suppliers of goods and services are local. Normally, properties participate in training programs for the local community offered by SENAR or equivalent entities, contributing to the formation of groups.
4_1_criteria: The group manager develops a socio-environmental assessment of each member through its monitoring and socio-environmental and sustainability assessment. Aspects related to the environmental, labor and work safety areas are raised in a comprehensive and clear manner. Next, the Socio-Environmental Diagnoses of the farms are developed. On an annual basis, farms are monitored and evaluated. Members receive copies of the assessments of their properties and, if necessary, the manager makes extra copies available.
4_2_criteria: Verified through maps of heat sources and interviews that fires are not carried out on farms. Waste is segregated and there is final disposal/destination. Except in the case of one farm, where current proof of used oil collection was not available. Structures are maintained to prevent spills, such as dikes around fuel tanks, lanes for washing machines and structures for storing used oil. Recyclable materials are sent to municipal landfills or sold, when possible. Waste management is covered by a Management Plan prepared by AlianÃ§a da Terra.
4_3_criteria: The audited properties control the use of fossil fuels during soybean cultivation, with monitoring. However, on one of the audited farms, it was not possible to demonstrate the amount of fossil fuel used in soybean cultivation, as well as to state whether there was an increase or not, resulting in non-compliance in indicators 4.3.1 and 4.3.2. All farms monitor the organic matter content through soil analyzes carried out annually. Practices are adopted to contribute to the increase in soil carbon sequestration, such as direct planting, cultivation of cover species, preservation and maintenance of native vegetation and permanent preservation areas.
4_4_criteria: There were no expansions for cultivation of soybeans after May 2009. Maps of properties were verified with comparisons of areas in 2009, 2016 (when applicable) and 2021, describing the dynamics of land use and coverage.
4_5_criteria: Maps of farms are maintained indicating watercourses, areas of native vegetation and production areas. The audited properties prohibit any hunting activities, with prohibition signs installed on the properties being checked. The fauna and flora on the farms are monitored through the RTRS Reports developed by AlianÃ§a da Terra.
5_1_criteria: The properties use good practices such as precision agriculture, direct planting, crop succession, use of agrochemicals in compliance with technical recommendations and maintenance of permanent preservation areas and legal reserve. On properties that use irrigation systems, the climatic conditions and water demand of the crop are respected. However, on one of the farms it was not possible to demonstrate the monitoring of captured volumes, generating non-conformity in indicators 1.1.2/5.1.1.
5_2_criteria: The group manager prepares location maps identifying all courses of water, including the situation of the riparian vegetation on the farms. On all audited farms, riparian vegetation is preserved or in an advanced state of regeneration. Drainage of natural wetland areas was observed on no farm.
5_3_criteria: Good soil conservation practices are adopted, such as direct planting and maintenance of residual straw from the harvest of cover species. Corrective agents and fertilizers are applied in accordance with technical recommendations and soil analysis results. On farms, practices such as contour lines and maintenance of native vegetation are used, facilitating the infiltration of water into the soil and controlling erosion. The properties respect the periods of sanitary emptiness in the states of GoiÃ¡s and Minas Gerais
5_4_criteria: Documented MIC plans are maintained on the audited farms, with chemical and non-chemical control methods, as well as foreseeing the reduction of potentially harmful products . Integrated crop management is carried out on properties. The agrochemicals used are registered for soybean cultivation and are purchased with their Agronomic Prescriptions. Agrochemical applications follow the results of field monitoring, with written records being maintained in spreadsheets or electronically through proprietary systems.
5_5_criteria: Controls of products purchased are maintained through their acquisition invoices and applicable stock controls . During applications, details are recorded on manual or electronic forms. The properties have closed agrochemical deposits, with signs, covered and with structures to contain spills. Only one property does not yet have a spill prevention structure. Furthermore, proof of return of empty packaging was not available, generating a non-conformity in indicator 5.5.2. At the time of application, empty packaging is washed and returned to the empty packaging deposits, which are closed, covered and locked. They are then returned to the reception centers, according to the receipts presented. All audited farms follow technical recommendations and soil analysis results when applying correctives and fertilizers.
5_6_criteria: Verified through application records and list of products used that farms do not use products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. There is no evidence of the use of Paraquat on the audited properties.
5_7_criteria: Those responsible for the farms demonstrate knowledge and commitment to the use of biological control. Records of the use of biological products by the properties were verified.
5_8_criteria: Owners and those responsible for the audited farms inform that in the case of outbreaks or incidence of new pests, entities such as MAPA, Embrapa, Coopercitrus or Aprosoja GoiÃ¡s would be contacted.
5_9_criteria: The manager provides procedures containing good practices in the application of pesticides adopted in agricultural management. On properties where aerial applications are used, more than 500 meters away from residences, communities and water bodies are normally respected. However, in two properties it was found that products belonging to WHO class II are used, at distances less than 500 meters from homes and bodies of water, resulting in non-conformities in indicator 5.9.4.
5_10_criteria: In the surroundings of the audited properties there are only similar production systems, using conservation systems and good agricultural practices, and there are no more sensitive production systems, such as organic production. No signs of damage caused to neighboring systems were observed.
5_11_criteria: The audited properties guarantee the legal use of seeds, either through purchase receipts or through declared self-propagated seeds.

Name: Fazenda Agrícola Dourado S.A.
1_1_criteria: The company follows and has access to applicable legislation, demonstrated by employees and relevant documents. Action plans are currently followed within an established deadline to fully comply with legislation and good business practices.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as property registrations.
1_3_criteria: The indicators selected for continuous monitoring and improvement are in accordance with the RTRS requirements. Continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, showing the companys commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor was found during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and pertinent information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the agricultural unit.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that workers Salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees.
3_1_criteria: Communication exists with the community, with signs and information containing emails telephones, postal addresses on the roads between the community and the farms with written advertising signs Â“contact us Â” and internally on the farm through Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the worker point control, cafeteria, accommodation, etc.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the area evaluated. Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: A complaints, complaints and grievances mechanism is made available, which establishes a procedure for recording and handling complaints, through a complaints and grievances form, available in the production units, knowledge about this mechanism is given to all interested parties.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the production unit and internal vacancies on the farms and advertised through the employees themselves in the local community, Supply of products and services to the local community, in However, there is no collaboration with training programs aimed at the local population to date.
4_1_criteria: Initial social and environmental assessment was carried out before the first certification audit. The immediate items for the first year are being met.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging is carried out appropriately. The practice of recycling and reuse in the production unit such as selective waste collection, separation by type of material and correct disposal of waste to third parties in the local community. The disposal of contaminated waste is being carried out appropriately.
4_3_criteria: The unit promotes actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and organic matter in the soil is monitored, in addition to techniques such as crop rotation and direct planning.
4_4_criteria: Evidenced through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation .
4_5_criteria: There are maps on the farm identifying the watercourses. However, to date there is no plan being implemented and monitored to ensure that native vegetation and wildlife are maintained.
5_1_criteria: Areas of environmental interest are respected and conserved by the farm administration. Hunting and fishing are also prohibited.
5_2_criteria: Monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption is carried out through water analysis, where soil contamination is verified, in addition to good practices preventive measures such as handling, storing and disposing of waste originating on farms, in order to avoid contamination of surface and underground water.
5_3_criteria: Practices to improve soil quality are used: crop rotation, soil analysis with balanced fertilization and maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting, on the farm.
5_4_criteria: There is no documented and implemented MIC plan addressing the use of prevention and other biological, non-chemical or chemical controls selects.
5_5_criteria: Pesticide application records are made manually and subsequently recorded in the system, however, meteorological conditions during the application of agrochemicals are not being recorded. Storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: During field verification at the front of agrochemical application, retroactive application records and storage. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found.
5_7_criteria: No evidence of the use of biological control agents was found.
5_8_criteria: In case of incidences of new pests or invasive species the company will contact available research bodies.
5_9_criteria: There are documented procedures that specify good agricultural practices, however, meteorological conditions during spraying operations are not being recorded.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: Amaggi Commodities EU RED
1_1_criteria: The producer demonstrated knowledge of applicable laws and remains up to date with external advice from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with the laws was verified.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through the registrations of the farm areas.
1_3_criteria: The group manager carried out a socio-environmental assessment of the farm before itself be included in the group, and from this the aspects to be improved were identified and deadlines for implementation were defined. Improvements are monitored in annual internal audits.
2_1_criteria: Through interviews with permanent and temporary employees, it was evidenced that there is no evidence of forced, imposed, forced, trafficked or involuntary labor on the farm. Employees reported that they are free to leave the property after hours, as well as terminate the employment relationship if they wish. There is no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on the farm are not required to work on the property. There are no children under 15 working on the farm. There is a Minor Apprentice employee in the role of administrative assistant. Through interviews with employees, it was evident that there was no evidence of discrimination of any kind. The company has different levels for the same functions, with each employee placed in a level according to their level of education. There is also a differentiation by length of service. There is no differentiation between workers of the same level or length of service. Training, benefits and promotion opportunities are provided equally among employees. There is also no evidence of punishment, coercion or aggression of any kind.
2_2_criteria: All workers are registered. There is an Employment Contract binding the company to the employees, with all relevant information, in writing. Employment contracts include all relevant information and, in addition, workers are informed of working conditions at the time of hiring, as verified in an interview with permanent and temporary employees.
2_3_criteria: Workers demonstrated knowledge and understanding of issues related to health and safety in interviews. Workers health is monitored through periodic medical examinations. There is health and safety training, including specific training on standards NR 6, NR 11, NR 12, NR 20, NR 23, NR 33, NR 35, as well as other training in the area of occupational health and safety and other relevant training. Those responsible for potentially dangerous tasks are properly trained, such as pesticide application, carried out by qualified staff. Health and safety risks are identified and procedures are in place to control them. The Masutti Group has a complete SESMT and has an Occupational Safety Technician and occupational nurse stationed in each unit, and has documentation relevant to occupational health and safety (PGSSTR and LTCAT). The farm provides PPE and the supply is duly recorded using specific forms. The company has a complete and structured SESMT department, with an occupational safety technician and occupational nurse in each unit, responsible for applying and carrying out all surveys relevant to worker safety requirements. The company is implementing the PAE (Emergency Plan) procedure in case of accidents and emergencies. It currently has an Emergency Plan for Responding to Accidents at Work, which is available in announcements at various points on the property. The property has an outpatient clinic, an ambulance and a 24-hour nurse.
2_4_criteria: Through interviews with permanent and temporary employees, it was evidenced that there is complete freedom to join trade union organizations, with some interviewees confirming that they are union members, while others reveal that they did not participate. Terminations of employment contracts are approved by the unions.
2_5_criteria: The minimum remuneration paid on the farm is above the national minimum wage. Verified proof of payment demonstrates that only deductions provided for by law are applied, such as INSS, union contributions and food and health plan deductions, duly agreed between the parties. The working day is 44 hours per week, with occasional overtime, especially during harvest times, which does not exceed 10 hours per week. Hours worked are recorded on a biometric time clock. Workers reported that overtime is voluntary and duly paid, as evidenced by payment slips. Verified through interviews, that workers receive at least one day off for every six days worked. The farm complies with the law in the case of maternity leave. Checked records of a worker on maternity leave at the time of the audit. Housing for farm employees is adequate and has adequate sanitary conditions. Access to drinking water is guaranteed by farms. There are drinking fountains located in several locations. The property has a cafeteria, guided by a nutritionist, serving the 3 main meals of the day to all employees.
3_1_criteria: Sign verified at the entrance to the property containing the telephone contact details. The Masutti Group maintains a page on a social network, as well as having a telephone number available in the regions telephone guides and on the internet. The communication channels are public knowledge.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes regarding land use rights on the property, as well as there are no adjacent indigenous peoples, nor are there permanent conservation areas, nor schools or any areas of high cultural value close to the farm.
3_3_criteria: There are signs distributed on the property displaying their telephone numbers so that complaints can be made directly. There are also suggestion/complaint boxes in various locations on the property. The farm has the document Procedure for Receiving and Handling Complaints, which determines all procedures in case of receiving complaints. There is also a form to fill out, the Complaint Registration and Handling Form document, which deals with all issues pertinent to complaints and complaints.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised through SINE, on the company wall and internal referrals, always looking for workers in the region. The property participates in events and field days. Those responsible participate in lectures and training from the Rural Union, SENAR and companies in the region, as verified in certificates and reports from those responsible. The property purchases products and services from companies in the region.
4_1_criteria: The farm underwent a socio-environmental assessment before being included in the group. A Socio-Environmental Diagnosis was carried out by AlianÃ§a da Terra, which has qualified personnel for such an assessment. The diagnosis is comprehensive and transparent, covering impacts related to the farm
4_2_criteria: The propertys waste management is governed by the Fazenda Saudades/PaixÃ£o Waste Management Plan. Used batteries are returned in exchange for new ones. Old tires are separated and later collected on the property. The collection of used lubricating oils is carried out by the company Lwart Lubrificantes. Lamps and batteries are stored in a box provided in the propertys workshop and later collected. The houses have septic tanks. Organic waste is buried in a suitable location. A non-conformity was identified in item 4.2.3 as used lubricating oils are stored in suspended tanks without a containment basin. Despite this, the fuel tanks have a containment dam and a fueling lane with a floor, channels and containment box. The machine washing area has a cement floor, gutters and separation box. Oil changes are carried out in a location with a floor, channels and containment box. Recycling is carried out whenever possible. Plastic waste is collected by the company Amazonekos, as well as cans and drums.
4_3_criteria: The use of fossil fuels is recorded when the machines are filled. No increases in fuel use were recorded in the last harvest. The soil matter content is monitored through soil analysis. Soil carbon is increased through practices such as: maintaining straw as ground cover
4_4_criteria: No area expansion was made, as evidenced by satellite image maps comparing the propertys areas in 2008 and 2017.
4_5_criteria: The property map indicates native vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Annual internal audits are carried out to monitor native vegetation. Verified that the farm is restoring degraded areas. The property prohibits any hunting activity within it. Checked warning signs present in the areas. Extractive practices such as collecting native wood or other natural products are also prohibited. The farm has over 10% native vegetation area.
5_1_criteria: The farm adopts good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as: adopting the direct seeding system; straw management for soil cover; use of correctors and fertilizers in accordance with technical recommendations; maintenance of APP and legal reserve areas. A non-compliance was identified in indicator 5.1.2 as analyzes are not carried out to monitor water quality. The farm does not use irrigation.
5_2_criteria: The farm identifies the location of watercourses on the map, as well as the status of riparian vegetation. The farm has an area of natural vegetation in the process of regeneration and measures are being taken to recover other degraded areas.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality monitoring is done through soil analysis. Soil quality is preserved through the adoption of practices such as: adoption of the direct planting system; maintenance of straw as soil cover; use of fertilizers and correctives in accordance with technical recommendations; maintenance of APP and legal reserve areas. Erosive processes are prevented through the construction of contour lines, adoption of the direct planting system and maintenance of soil cover. The farm carries out succession of crops. There is no cultivation of soybeans on soybeans, the sanitary void period is respected.
5_4_criteria: The farm has a MIC Â– Integrated Crop Management plan, addressing the use of preventive and control methods that cause less environmental impact . The farm envisages the reduction of potentially harmful agrochemicals in a documented plan. The farm only uses agrochemicals permitted for soybean cultivation and in the dosages prescribed by those responsible, as evidenced in the deposits and records of agrochemical use. A non-conformity was identified in indicator 5.4.5 due to no monitoring records of pests, diseases, weeds and natural enemies.
5_5_criteria: The companys planning sector carries out product purchases. Service orders are opened for the application of pesticides by the technical team in accordance with field monitoring, where the product, quantity, dose, area, plot, weather conditions and team responsible for execution are recorded. Empty packaging is washed at the time of application and then stored in the warehouse. The deposit is covered, closed, locked and marked, but it does not have channels or a containment box, which led to non-compliance in indicator 5.5.2. Empty packaging is delivered to a local receiving center. Pesticides are delivered to the farm by the multinationals that sell them. The place for storing pesticides is covered, locked, closed, marked, has aeration and the packaging is arranged on wooden pallets, but there are no channels or containment box, which led to non-conformity in item 5.5.3. There is an area for preparing pesticides, equipped with a small temporary pesticide deposit, flooring and an ozonizer for equipment decontamination. The preparation of syrup is done using specific equipment for this purpose. Next to the pesticide deposit there is an emergency shower. Used PPE is decontaminated in a laundry dedicated to this purpose. Areas treated with pesticides are demarcated with signposts. Recommendations for the use of improvers and fertilizers are made by agronomists based on the results of soil analyses.
5_6_criteria: The farm does not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The herbicide Paraquat is used, but it is already planned to gradually reduce its use by 2020.
5_7_criteria: Verified that there is knowledge about the use of biological control agents. There is an intention to use biological nematicides and control agents for defoliating pests, but they have not yet been used.
5_8_criteria: If an outbreak of new pests occurs, farms turn to institutions such as INDEA, MAPA or FundaÃ§Ã£o MT.
5_9_criteria: Measures implemented by the farm to prevent drift include adjusting application equipment, monitoring weather conditions during applications, and maintaining zones free from pesticide application. Aerial applications are carried out at least 1,200 meters from homes and bodies of water. Likewise, the closest populations are notified before applications. Land applications of pesticides respect a minimum distance of 150 meters from homes.
5_10_criteria: The production system adopted by farms is similar to neighboring systems. There are no adjacent areas with sensitive crops, such as organic or conventional agriculture. There are no cases of damage caused by drift to neighboring areas originating from the farm.
5_11_criteria: The farm acquires seeds from legally known sources and also produces seeds, both for its own use and for commercialization. Own seed production is duly approved by APROSMAT, as a way of complying with the intellectual properties of such materials.

Organization: Fundação de Apoio à Pesquisa do Corredor de Exportação Norte ?Irineu Alcides Bays
Name: FAPCEN I
1_1_criteria: The farms have access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of legislation and relevant documents were available. During the audit, it was found that the applicable laws are being complied with.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and have been demonstrated in documents such as land ownership registrations, Rural Amebiental Registry - CAR of properties and /or lease contracts.
1_3_criteria: The aspects were identified and continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, showing the companys commitment to meeting all the criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard. a spreadsheet "Risk Assessment and Environmental Aspect and Impact Spreadsheet" was presented with the identification of all social and environmental aspects and impacts, inside and outside the farm and shows the controls and procedures carried out. During internal audits, indicators are evaluated in parallel.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor was found during the audit process in the work environments or heard during interviews with employees of the audited farms . Relevant payments and benefits.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and relevant information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units. Risks relating to health and safety issues have been identified.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to the presence of the union on the farm.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. It was evidenced through interviews that workers on maternity leave have the right to return to their jobs under the same terms and conditions in force before the leave, without any type of discrimination or rejection due to the situation. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as website containing emails telephones, postal address on farm roads with advertising signs written Â“contact usÂ” and via FAPCEN and internally on the scope farms through Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the workers point control.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements. Places of importance are identified, maintained and preserved.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels are available and accessible. Complaints and complaints received are checked and responded to. There were no records of complaints and complaints at the time of the audit.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the farms and vacancies are advertised through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fill out the job application, I have your resume on file. There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the scope farms, carried out by the farms and by the Fapcen office.
4_1_criteria: The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified for each farm within the certification scope. Studies are available upon request.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and pesticide packaging appropriately. There is an Environmental Management Plan presented during the audit that covers waste management including all areas of the property.
4_3_criteria: The farms promote actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and monitored organic matter in the soil.
4_4_criteria: After checking maps and satellite images extracted from Google Earth of the areas of the sampled farms, it was possible to identify that there were no new soybean planting areas, these being within the indicator requirements.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling preservation and legal reserve areas, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater , drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and underground waters.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, Fapcen presented detailed maps of all farms with indication of riparian vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farms' CAR.
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analyses, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion and rotation control techniques of crops are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: Farms use suitable products to control pests and diseases. IPMs and chemical use reduction plans are implemented.
5_5_criteria: Storage and transport of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: Retroactive application records, invoices for purchase and storage of products were checked. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of Paraquat on farms within the scope of certification was not evidenced.
5_7_criteria: There is the use of biological control agents on the groups farms. The applications of biological control agents at an experimental level follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Responsible.
5_8_criteria: Presented methodology designed to identify and monitor new pests and introduced invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. There were no incidences of new pests that were not identified, according to the records presented.
5_9_criteria: Drift control procedures were presented for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water, as well as other precautions in application of pesticides.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.
