Name: Cataratas do Iguaçu Produtos Orgânicos Ltda - Gebana Brasil
1_1_criteria: The farms have access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of the legislation and relevant documents were available. During the audit, the documentation relevant to family farming was verified, the infrastructure was checked, interviews with those responsible for the farms and agronomic and environmental issues were observed. Knowledge of applicable laws was demonstrated. Documents demonstrating land ownership, registrations, certificates, list of products used, good agricultural practices, internal training, seed purchase invoices and terms of compliance, input invoice for the purchase of inputs, environmental licenses, rural environmental registration were verified. (CAR), grants, potability analysis, among other documents.
1_2_criteria: Documents such as registrations of the audited farms, and in cases of settlements, the term of commitment, DAP and registration of the property with registration were presented.
1_3_criteria: The document called "Gebana Diagnosis - Socio-Environmental Analysis" and it was possible to verify that the assessment was carried out, however the points for improvement were not defined.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor during the audit process in work environments. There is no hiring of employees on the audited farms. It is family farming. According to information obtained in the interviews, the spouses have other work activities outside the farm and their children attend school.
2_2_criteria: Training, training and guidance on health and safety are provided to the owners through the group manager.
2_3_criteria: Producers demonstrated knowledge of health and safety issues, potentially dangerous activities are carried out only by qualified people, appropriate clothing and equipment were provided to producers by Gebana, however, the risks relating to the issues health and safety issues were not identified/mapped.
2_4_criteria: All farms audited are family farms, no employees are hired.
2_5_criteria: There are no workers hired. However, the water potability analyzes carried out by Gebana do not have a conclusive report in accordance with the Ministry of Health Ordinance.
3_1_criteria: On the farms visited, there are suggestions and complaints boxes available (managed by Gebana) and communication channels were publicized (website (https://blog.gebana.com.br/ouvidoria-Gebana-brasil) containing emails, telephones and postal addresses. and telephone) to the community. On the roads between the community and the farms with advertising signs written Â“talk to usÂ” and internally on the scope farms through Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”.
3_2_criteria: In the audit carried out, no dispute was detected relating to land use. Land ownership documents were presented as registrations and, in cases of settlements, the term of commitment, DAP and registration of the property with registration. There are no indigenous people near the farms. On all audited farms, Legal Reserve and/or Permanent Preservation areas are identified and protected. There are signs prohibiting hunting in these areas.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels are available and accessible. Complaints and complaints received are checked and responded to. There were no complaints or complaints recorded at the time of the audit.
3_4_criteria: Gebana, the group manager, organizes field days aimed at producers and the local community, offering, among other things, courses, technical support, etc.
4_1_criteria: Social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified for each farm in the certification scope. The studies are available upon request.
4_2_criteria: The Waste Management Plan was presented during the audit and it was found that the plan covers waste management including all areas of the property. On the audited farms, initiatives were highlighted to separate recyclable waste and sales notes or donations of this waste were presented.
4_3_criteria: The farms promote actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out in accordance with soil analyzes and organic matter in the soil was monitored.
4_4_criteria: There was no incorporation of new planting areas after May 2009. Checks of maps and satellite images extracted from Google Earth of the farm areas in the scope, it was possible to identify that no there were new soybean planting areas on the farms visited, which were within the indicators requirements.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage the wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling preservation and legal reserve areas, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good practices agricultural (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and underground water.
5_2_criteria: On maps and field visits, riparian vegetation was not removed. There are no humid areas on the farms visited.
5_3_criteria: The farms visited adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analysis, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. During visits to the production areas, it was possible to identify that erosion control techniques are applied appropriately.
5_4_criteria: The Integrated Crop Management Plan was presented by the farms, prepared by Gebana, which serves as a basis for carrying out the field inspections and better control methodology for farms in scope. The farms have organic certification.
5_5_criteria: There is no use of agrochemical products. Proof of disposal of empty packaging of organic products was presented to receiving companies in the region duly licensed to receive this waste. The correct handling and storage of them in a restricted and identified location was also verified. The use of fertilizers and all applications follow professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: The use of Carbofuram and Paraquat was not evidenced on farms within the scope of certification. No evidence of the use of these products was found, during the visit to the properties, list of products used by the company and application controls.
5_7_criteria: Only biological control agent is used, information on the use of biological control was available.
5_8_criteria: There were no incidences of new pests that have not been identified, according to the records presented. The Producers Field Notebook was checked, which records and monitors pests or species and does not include the incidence of new pests.
5_9_criteria: The lists and certificates of the courses held on the farms were presented, providing guidance on the application and monitoring meteorological conditions during application. It was also found that the procedures are implemented and recorded.
5_10_criteria: Neighboring areas have the same production system as evidenced in field visits, however, there are procedures to avoid interference with the production systems of neighboring areas. Guidelines are constantly given to employees, weather conditions are respected and no interference has been identified in neighboring productions and there are green barriers that separate them from neighboring crops.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: AgroSB Agropecuária S.A.
1_1_criteria: Employees demonstrated knowledge of applicable legislation. During the audit, documents in employee folders were checked, verification of infrastructure, land ownership, list of pesticides used and dosages applied, agronomic prescriptions, good agricultural practices, employee training (NRs), employment contracts, employee records , time card, pay slips, medical exams, payments and discounts, collective work agreement, environmental licenses, rural environmental registry (CAR), grants, potability analysis, among other documents.
1_2_criteria: The registrations of the areas of audited farm were presented and it was found that they have possession of the land. All cultivated areas are owned areas.
1_3_criteria: At the time of the audit, the social, environmental and agricultural aspects of the operation (on and off the farm) that should be improved were not identified. As a correction to the NC, the company presented the document "SOCIO-ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT FOR AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION RTRS", in which the social, environmental and agricultural aspects of the operation that must be improved and monitored were identified.
2_1_criteria: Normal working conditions, No form of forced labor was identified and no worker is required to leave their documents unless permitted by law. There was no evidence of anyone under 18 years of age hired by the company, working in production and/or in dangerous conditions during the field assessment, HR documentation and interviews with employees on the work fronts. Payments in accordance with the activity carried out with employees on the work fronts, in addition to benefits relating to health, food, housing, among others, described in payslips and contractual documentation.
2_2_criteria: All workers have a contract that specifies their working conditions, as well as service providers as evidenced on the farm during the audit. A registration form, employment contract and payslips were presented. All documents are available in language that is easy for workers to understand. They do not have a Collective Agreement.
2_3_criteria: Employees and managers were interviewed and everyone was able to explain the risks and prevention measures for their safety at work. Training records and complementary exams are carried out for functions that present potential risk. There are mechanisms to verify compliance with security requirements. The farm has an occupational nurse available, an occupational doctor, people trained in first aid with means of communication available to deal with an emergency situation, as well as signs with emergency telephone numbers displayed at service stations.
2_4_criteria: Employees interviewed reported that there were no restrictions on establishing or joining organizations, such as unions. No worker is active in an organization. It was identified that there is no type of discrimination or action that prevents or hinders the actions of organizations. The farm tried to implement/develop the collective agreement, however, there is no active union in the region. Employees receive guidance on the union and the collective agreement and are not prevented from joining.
2_5_criteria: There is a record of employee payments on pay slips. There is no evidence of payment of wages lower than the national minimum. Pay stubs describe wages paid and wage deductions. There are only deductions for taxes, food and health. For benefits there is an authorization, informing employees and also requesting their permission for the applicable deduction. The weekly working hours exceed 48 hours when counted with overtime, but within the daily limit. Workers on maternity leave have the right to return to their jobs under the same terms and conditions in force before the leave, without any type of discrimination or rejection due to the situation. Employees receive drinking water and adequate food.
3_1_criteria: The Agro Santa BÃ¡rbara Code of Ethics manual was highlighted, which has the confidential channel by telephone at 0800-750-5528 and the email canalconfidencial.agrosb@ audit.com.br . Publicized during integration with employees, on posters on bulletin boards and at the farm entrance and in meetings with employees and the community.
3_2_criteria: No cases were found of local land users giving up their rights. There was no evidence of actions involving indigenous peoples in the vicinity of the farm, nor in interviews with employees and issues related to cultural importance.
3_3_criteria: Complaints/complaints received are verified and responded to. The complaints and complaints channel is managed by a third-party company, which manages complaints.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from nearby communities, with the SINE (National Employment System) as the main means of dissemination. and local vacancies, using bulletin boards and "word of mouth" among employees. There are several programs, including training aimed at local schools, local agriculture, among others. With environmental, agronomic and training themes for the local population. Opportunities for offers of service goods are disclosed to local communities.
4_1_criteria: During the audit, a social and environmental assessment was not presented. As a correction to the NC, the company presented the document "SOCIO-ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT FOR AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION RTRS", in which the social, environmental and agricultural aspects of the operation that must be improved and monitored were identified.
4_2_criteria: Not evidenced during observation in field burning of crop residues, vegetation and waste. The farm uses techniques to take advantage of the waste generated, such as direct planting and crop rotation, it also uses composting and manages solid waste appropriately, according to the documentation presented. The waste storage and disposal location was adequate.
4_3_criteria: The consumption of fossil fuels over time and the volume per hectare is recorded in the system, there was a reduction in the consumption of the fuel used. Soil organic matter levels are monitored through annual soil analyses, and direct planting practices are also used, which promote the maintenance of organic matter in the soil. Opportunities to increase carbon sequestration during the visit to production sites were highlighted, such as the conservation of native areas in legal reserve areas, as well as APP areas (all farms visited have 100% of the APP areas preserved, according to information from managers and map checks) remaining isolated forests and reforestation, in addition to using techniques such as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_4_criteria: Through satellite images, it was evidenced that there was no opening of an area in the year 2009
4_5_criteria: A production map was presented, with all the native vegetation present, the water courses and the production areas, the farms CAR was also presented, the farm has more than 10% native vegetation. Hunting is not practiced on the property.
5_1_criteria: No evidence of water contamination was observed during the field assessment on the farm visited. Evidenced monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption through analysis. There is no irrigation on the production unit.
5_2_criteria: There are no permanent preservation areas to be recovered on the farm. The farm complies with the forestry code to comply with the CAR. It was also evidenced through visits to properties and satellite images that there is conversion of existing areas of environmental interest, riparian areas are isolated, identified and protected.
5_3_criteria: Adequate techniques are used to improve soil quality, such as crop rotation, soil analyzes including the organic matter content of the soil, according to an analysis spreadsheet carried out in Excel for the 2019/2020 harvest, with balanced fertilization and maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting
5_4_criteria: The Integrated Pest Control Plan is implemented in the production areas that addresses the use of prevention and other biological, non-chemical or select chemical controls, as well as a record of pest monitoring in order to justify or not a application, according to level of economic damage. The plan aims at the controlled and necessary use of agricultural pesticides, in addition to the use of the GMO variety and, as a consequence, the reduction in the applied volume of phytosanitary products. There is a restriction on the use of prohibited products. Agricultural pesticide applications follow the Agricultural Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Farm manager. Application records and work orders were checked. All application follows the agronomic and manufacturers recommendation for its application.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical application records were presented through the Service Order document. Empty packaging of agricultural pesticides is washed and discarded correctly, after triple washing they are delivered to companies duly accredited for this purpose. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. Evidenced in the farms harvest plan, which defines agricultural planning, fertilization recommendations follow recommendations from Agricultural Engineers. according to soil analyzes of the areas.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The active ingredient Paraquat is used in soybean growing areas, through verification of application records, products stored in the pesticide deposit and interviews with the person responsible for agricultural recommendations. It is worth mentioning that in Brazil the use is permitted until 2020.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents at an experimental level follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Eng. Agr. Responsible for the farm.
5_8_criteria: Presented methodology designed to identify and monitor new pests and introduced invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. There were no incidences of new pests that are not identified, however, there are procedures designed to identify and monitor new introduced pests and invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests.
5_9_criteria: Records were presented on the use of agrochemicals that include the products purchased and applied, identification of the area applied, name of the operator, equipment, and weather conditions during application. There is no aerial application on the farm and there are no production areas within a 30 meter radius of populated areas and bodies of water
5_10_criteria: No evidence of interference in the production systems of neighboring areas during the visit to the property and through interviews with employees responsible for carrying out work, such as applying pesticides.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

As a correction to the NC, the company presented the document "SOCIO-ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT FOR AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION RTRS", in which the social, environmental and agricultural aspects of the operation that must be improved and monitored were identified.
2_1_criteria: Normal working conditions, No form of forced labor was identified and no worker is required to leave their documents unless permitted by law. There was no evidence of anyone under 18 years of age hired by the company, working in production and/or in dangerous conditions during the field assessment, HR documentation and interviews with employees on the work fronts. Payments in accordance with the activity carried out with employees on the work fronts, in addition to benefits relating to health, food, housing, among others, described in payslips and contractual documentation.
2_2_criteria: All workers have a contract that specifies their working conditions, as well as service providers as evidenced on the farm during the audit. A registration form, employment contract and payslips were presented. All documents are available in language that is easy for workers to understand. They do not have a Collective Agreement.
2_3_criteria: Employees and managers were interviewed and everyone was able to explain the risks and prevention measures for their safety at work. Training records and complementary exams are carried out for functions that present potential risk. There are mechanisms to verify compliance with security requirements. The farm has an occupational nurse available, an occupational doctor, people trained in first aid with means of communication available to deal with an emergency situation, as well as signs with emergency telephone numbers displayed at service stations.
2_4_criteria: Employees interviewed reported that there were no restrictions on establishing or joining organizations, such as unions. No worker is active in an organization. It was identified that there is no type of discrimination or action that prevents or hinders the actions of organizations. The farm tried to implement/develop the collective agreement, however, there is no active union in the region. Employees receive guidance on the union and the collective agreement and are not prevented from joining.
2_5_criteria: There is a record of employee payments on pay slips. There is no evidence of payment of wages lower than the national minimum. Pay stubs describe wages paid and wage deductions. There are only deductions for taxes, food and health. For benefits there is an authorization, informing employees and also requesting their permission for the applicable deduction. The weekly working hours exceed 48 hours when counted with overtime, but within the daily limit. Workers on maternity leave have the right to return to their jobs under the same terms and conditions in force before the leave, without any type of discrimination or rejection due to the situation. Employees receive drinking water and adequate food.
3_1_criteria: The Agro Santa BÃ¡rbara Code of Ethics manual was highlighted, which has the confidential channel by telephone at 0800-750-5528 and the email canalconfidencial.agrosb@ audit.com.br . Publicized during integration with employees, on posters on bulletin boards and at the farm entrance and in meetings with employees and the community.
3_2_criteria: No cases were found of local land users giving up their rights. There was no evidence of actions involving indigenous peoples in the vicinity of the farm, nor in interviews with employees and issues related to cultural importance.
3_3_criteria: Complaints/complaints received are verified and responded to. The complaints and complaints channel is managed by a third-party company, which manages complaints.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from nearby communities, with the SINE (National Employment System) as the main means of dissemination. and local vacancies, using bulletin boards and "word of mouth" among employees. There are several programs, including training aimed at local schools, local agriculture, among others. With environmental, agronomic and training themes for the local population. Opportunities for offers of service goods are disclosed to local communities.
4_1_criteria: During the audit, a social and environmental assessment was not presented. As a correction to the NC, the company presented the document "SOCIO-ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT FOR AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION RTRS", in which the social, environmental and agricultural aspects of the operation that must be improved and monitored were identified.
4_2_criteria: Not evidenced during observation in field burning of crop residues, vegetation and waste. The farm uses techniques to take advantage of the waste generated, such as direct planting and crop rotation, it also uses composting and manages solid waste appropriately, according to the documentation presented. The waste storage and disposal location was adequate.
4_3_criteria: The consumption of fossil fuels over time and the volume per hectare is recorded in the system, there was a reduction in the consumption of the fuel used. Soil organic matter levels are monitored through annual soil analyses, and direct planting practices are also used, which promote the maintenance of organic matter in the soil. Opportunities to increase carbon sequestration during the visit to production sites were highlighted, such as the conservation of native areas in legal reserve areas, as well as APP areas (all farms visited have 100% of the APP areas preserved, according to information from managers and map checks) remaining isolated forests and reforestation, in addition to using techniques such as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_4_criteria: Through satellite images, it was evidenced that there was no opening of an area in the year 2009
4_5_criteria: A production map was presented, with all the native vegetation present, the water courses and the production areas, the farms CAR was also presented, the farm has more than 10% native vegetation. Hunting is not practiced on the property.
5_1_criteria: No evidence of water contamination was observed during the field assessment on the farm visited. Evidenced monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption through analysis. There is no irrigation in the production unit.
5_2_criteria: There are no permanent preservation areas to be recovered on the farm. The farm complies with the forestry code to comply with the CAR. It was also evidenced through visits to properties and satellite images that there is conversion of existing areas of environmental interest, riparian areas are isolated, identified and protected.
5_3_criteria: Appropriate techniques are used to improve soil quality, such as crop rotation, soil analysis including the organic matter content of the soil, according to an analysis spreadsheet carried out in Excel for the 2019/2020 harvest, with balanced fertilization and maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting.
5_4_criteria: The Integrated Pest Control Plan is implemented in the production areas that addresses the use of prevention and other biological, non-chemical or select chemical controls, as well as a record of pest monitoring in order to justify or not one application, according to level of economic damage. The plan aims at the controlled and necessary use of agricultural pesticides, in addition to the use of the GMO variety and, as a consequence, the reduction in the applied volume of phytosanitary products. There is a restriction on the use of prohibited products. Agricultural pesticide applications follow the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Farm manager. Application records and work orders were checked. All application follows the agronomic and manufacturers recommendation for its application.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical application records were presented through the Service Order document. Empty packaging of agricultural pesticides is washed and discarded correctly, after triple washing they are delivered to companies duly accredited for this purpose. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. Evidenced in the farms harvest plan, which defines agricultural planning, fertilization recommendations follow recommendations from Agricultural Engineers. according to soil analyzes of the areas.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The active ingredient Paraquat is used in soybean growing areas, through verification of application records, products stored in the pesticide deposit and interviews with the person responsible for agricultural recommendations. It is worth mentioning that in Brazil the use is permitted until 2020.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents at an experimental level follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Eng. Agr. Responsible for the farm.
5_8_criteria: Presented methodology designed to identify and monitor new pests and introduced invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. There were no incidences of new pests that are not identified, however, there are procedures designed to identify and monitor new introduced pests and invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests.
5_9_criteria: Records were presented on the use of agrochemicals that include the products purchased and applied, identification of the area applied, name of the operator, equipment, and weather conditions during application. There is no aerial application on the farm and there are no production areas within a 30 meter radius of populated areas and bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: No evidence of interference in the production systems of neighboring areas during the visit to the property and through interviews with employees responsible for carrying out work, such as applying agricultural pesticides.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: Agrex do Brasil S.A.
1_1_criteria: The company has legal advice, in addition to each area having a responsible professional who verifies applicable legislation and its implementation. Knowledge and compliance with applicable legislation is evidenced through an interview. For the updating of legislation, the companys legal area relies on external legal updating services, companies and forums of producer associations. It highlights the knowledge of legal responsibilities applicable to agricultural production and applicable legislation, for example: Labor Laws, CLT Forest Code, Law 12651, 25.05.2012 Â– Regulatory Standards, Environmental Licenses issued by SEMA for farms located in the state of Tocantins and MaranhÃ£o, Protection of fauna, Law 5197/67, Waste Law 12.305/2010, Norma Regulatoria 31 - NR31"updated 2014 and regulated by ordinance 3214 of June 8, 1978.
1_2_criteria: There is documentary evidence of land use rights. Current lease contracts with Agrex do Brasil SA and the titles of all farms included in the scope were verified.
1_3_criteria: The indicators established by the company and validated by the environmental impact assessment are monitored, and the following are identified Social Number of work accidents (annual): Environmental Water consumption per hectare (liters/ha): Organic matter content (% mo/Farm): Diesel consumption agricultural (liters/ha): Diesel consumption (liters/ton): The baseline is established based on the results of the 2017-2018 campaign In the production area, a campaign closing meeting - harvest closure - is held in that the results are analyzed and improvement actions are planned. Production coordinator interviewed. For example, the analysis of diesel consumption by the Treasury and the results report are shown.
2_1_criteria: Interviews with the team verified that the company does not practice or support child labor, forced labor, discrimination and harassment. Furthermore, the company has implemented a Recruitment Policy - Recruitment and Selection Policy, POL-1011-, a code of ethics and a conduct or employee manual that establishes working conditions in the company. The agreed job and salary plans and the adjustments in the collective bargaining agreement remain in force. The company has a salary policy POL-1013, which describes the job structure and salary range in the case of junior, senior and full positions. The salary floor is established. The base value per agreement is established and performance improvements are considered. Establishes promotions and types of increases collectively, or individually based on merit, promotions or performance, the criteria for approving a new salary, the admission process, hiring and transfers.
2_2_criteria: There is a POL Recruitment Policy- 1011 - which specifies procedures for recruiting employees. There are different types of contracts depending on the position. Applicable labor legislation, the Consolidation of Labor Laws and current salary agreements are available. Adequate and appropriate training and understandable instructions on fundamental rights at work and health and safety, as well as any necessary recommendations or supervision, are provided to all workers. There is evidence of the implementation of the PDI - Individual Development Program, worker training records. Furthermore, upon admission, all employees go through an awareness process in which they are informed about the conditions established in the code of ethics and recruitment.
2_3_criteria: Management in the area of health and safety, for all workers and employees, is a strong point of Agrex do Brasils management system. The risks of each activity were established in the PPRA - Environmental Risk Prevention Program. Training has been established to ensure that risky tasks are carried out by trained personnel. In addition, health checks are carried out annually on staff upon admission. Procedures on the safe use of agrochemicals and machinery established by Agrex and information provided by ANDEF (National Plant Defense Association) are also available on each farm. There is also a PCMSO medical and occupational health control program for each farm, as well as elements for first aid management. First aid kits There is evidence of PPE delivery records. A system of warnings and sanctions was defined. The fire brigade is working
2_4_criteria: Staff interviews verify that all workers enjoy freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining. It is verified that workers are not prevented from interacting with external parties outside of working hours.
2_5_criteria: Pay slips are checked to show that workers receive a gross salary that complies with national legislation and sectoral agreements. Interviews with the companys workers show that salary deductions are not made for disciplinary reasons; deductions are considered to be specified in the contract, for example in the case of unjustified absence. There is a record of hours worked using a fingerprint system, both in establishments and in offices. There is evidence that weekly working hours do not exceed 48 hours and, during the harvest or planting season, overtime is worked and paid in accordance with the current contract. Workers were interviewed about accommodation and food conditions, and no complaints or grievances were identified. Employees are not charged for accommodation.
3_1_criteria: The company has communication and dialogue channels, a telephone number 0800 6483018, e-mail: Ouviria@agrex.com.br, as established in POP1395 - Relationship with community. There is also a mailbox in the entrance hall of the companys offices, in the Central Administration and on the farms, where there is a complaints form. The mailbox is padlocked and can be opened by management. The company held meetings with neighbors, suppliers and employees to publicize communication and dialogue channels. Posters were posted in establishments indicating the means of communication.
3_2_criteria: Not applicable. No disputed land use rights were identified. All farms in scope have established use rights and lease agreements in place. The company carries out a prior analysis of the rights of use of each farm and does not lease properties with ownership conflicts or boundary disputes. No sites of cultural importance were identified on farms within the scope. The social and environmental impact assessment does not identify places of cultural interest for local communities or indigenous peoples.
3_3_criteria: Communication and dialogue channels are also considered mechanisms for community complaints and grievances. At the companys offices, a complaints box was installed in the entrance hall, identified with a sign, where there is a form to make complaints. The complaint and date, reason for complaint, company response and date of response are recorded. A link to employee complaints is also available on the companys website. In the case of community complaints made on the farm, they are registered by the farm manager and communicated via email to company management. Handling complaints is the responsibility of the human resources, people management and occupational safety manager. The measures to be taken in the event of a complaint are defined in internal procedures. HR management receives the complaint, analyzes it and presents it to management, and is the person responsible for implementing solutions. However, no complaints were received as of the date of the audit.
3_4_criteria: Job opportunities are advertised on the company website, employee word of mouth, Facebook, Instagram and the job search website www.vagas.com.br. There is evidence of partnerships with schools and training programs in the Balsas community, such as the Agrex Institute. The company also implemented a program for interns who participate in the SENAC - MA learning program. The company established its supplier policy - POL 0165 - Supplier Policy and services in general - which establishes the conditions, legal obligations and Agrexs commitment to its suppliers. It is verified that the suppliers are from the region.
4_1_criteria: It has an updated socio-environmental assessment, established in the Guide; assessment criteria, facilities, Operational Area including fuel tanks and structure, environmental documentation, required permits, water analysis and monitoring, labor documentation, field operations, soil preparation, planting, spraying, harvesting and other cultural activities are evaluated The assessment was conducted by an Environmental Agricultural Engineer, trained in the requirements of Standards 3.0 and 3.1, responsible for the certification system for 3 years. The assessment was carried out in a comprehensive and transparent manner, covering all production, infrastructure and administration activities of the company related to agricultural production. Compliance with procedures and mitigation measures established in internal audits and through selected improvement indicators is monitored. A summary of the environmental and social impact assessment is available upon request from the Balsa offices, in format printed
4_2_criteria: The waste management and recycling program is a strong point of Agrexs management system. In interviews with employees and neighbors, it was verified that the burning of crop residues, waste or any other resource is not permitted. Signs were placed at the entrance to the farm indicating that burning is prohibited. To combat forest fires, the company has implemented the POP 1376 procedure to combat forest fires and has a trained firefighting brigade. During the visit to the farms, there was no evidence of fires. The company has implemented the POP - 1373 operational procedure for waste management, which includes the classification, segregation and final disposal of waste that cannot be recycled. On all farms audited, there was evidence of identified waste containers available in workplaces such as kitchens, storerooms, homes, warehouses and offices. Fuel storage sites are equipped with safety and spill containment measures, a site has been designated for the storage of solid waste until final disposal, empty pesticide containers are stored in a specific area with restricted access, which Allows containment of spills. A record of the weighing control of material removed from each farm is verified. Furthermore, a PCRS Solid Waste Control Plan was implemented, which considers the separation, compaction and recycling of waste that has economic value and can be reused. The results are recorded in the Recyclables Control spreadsheet.
4_3_criteria: As part of the improvement indicators, the total direct use of fossil fuels over time is recorded, and its volume per hectare and per unit of product is monitored for all activities related to soybean production. The company has established an organic matter monitoring system. Analyzes are carried out every two years. Based on the results, techniques are implemented to mitigate negative trends, for example, adjusted fertilizer application, limestone application to correct pH, P application in the seed row, cultivation of cover crops. Native vegetation and legal reserve areas are protected and conserved, in accordance with the procedure POP-1394 - Maintenance of the Legal Reserve, which establishes the different types of conservation areas and preservation and maintenance measures. Reforestation with eucalyptus is carried out.
4_4_criteria: By comparing the satellite images of 22-07-2008 issued by the website www.dgr.inpe.br/COSR and the current image, it appears that there was no expansion of cultivation following the elimination of native forest, for example, at Fazenda UniÃ£o; from the image of 15.07.2008, emitted by the landsat 5 satellite and its comparison with the satellite image emitted by the landsat 8 satellite - Maccari Meio Ambiente e Georereferencing, it appears that at Fazenda Batavo there was no expansion of cultivation following the elimination of the native forest. Using satellite images from 15.07.08, 17.09.08 emitted by the landsat 5 satellite, and the current image emitted by the landsat 8 satellite, it can be seen that there was no expansion of cultivation after May 2009 at Fazenda Campos Lindos. There is no conversion of land where there is an unresolved use claim by traditional users in dispute.
4_5_criteria: There is evidence of farm maps that identify the areas of native vegetation - Legal Reserve and APP and the courses of' water present on farms are identified. See 5.2.1. POP 1394 - Maintenance of the Legal Reserve was implemented, where the different types of conservation areas and preservation and maintenance measures are established, and the areas are identified on the ground and in mapping. There are forest firefighting teams in areas of native forests and legal reserves. In interviews with neighbors, they recognize the companys care for natural areas. "WEEE species in the region are identified according to the IUCN list. IUCN It is evident from remote interviews with technicians and staff, as well as farm neighbors, that hunting rare, threatened or endangered species does not is allowed on the property. At the entrance to the Farms, signs prohibiting hunting are verified through photos." All Farms have at least 10% of their surface as a protected area. Campos Lindos has 24.4% of the reserve area and Batavo 73%.
5_1_criteria: Production technicians and Agrex employees were interviewed. Images and photos of crop fields were received. The company implements appropriate agricultural practices to minimize the impact on surface and groundwater quality of chemical waste and fertilizers, for example, wastewater from sprayer washing is not discharged into waterways, management of empty containers and areas of protection. Practices such as direct sowing, systematization of plots and contour lines prevent erosion; the direction of seeding is considered to avoid erosion. Cover crops and the conservation of protected areas and water sources encourage aquifer recharge. Water analyzes of surface watercourses and wells are carried out, which are a condition for granting the corresponding environmental licenses. Usage licenses are available. For example, the results of the water analysis program are evident on all of the companys farms, with records for the years 2019 and 2020. The laboratories used for the analyzes have ISO 17025 accreditation. Acquarius ABNT NBR -ISO/IEC 17025 - CRL1317" The company identifies CONAMA - National Environmental Council - as the authority to which cases of contamination of surface watercourses must be reported" Pivot irrigation is used at Fazenda Campos Lindos, there is a SOP procedure no. 1928 for irrigation use, central pivot installation and consumption recording. There is also an environmental risk prevention program for the farm. Authorization for water use is available.
5_2_criteria: Maps are available with all water courses present and riparian vegetation. For example, the map of Fazenda Campos Lindos. Faz Botavo There is no evidence that riparian vegetation has been removed on the Farms. Neighbors and local stakeholders were interviewed. Agrexs environmental director and employees working on the companys farms were interviewed. The watercourses are included in reserve zones and under protection management. "Agrex do Brasil SA presents a sworn statement and commitment to comply with the indicator, as established by RTRS for Covid 19 documentary audits. It is evident that all native vegetation is maintained, according to the 2008 Landsat images presented by the company. There is no evidence that the natural wetlands have been drained.".
5_3_criteria: "The coordinator of agricultural processes and production is interviewed regarding Agrexs soil monitoring. is based on productivity maps, by batches, correlating yields with soil needs or biological qualities, production technicians and farm managers were interviewed. The company demonstrates knowledge of techniques to maintain soil quality and they are being implemented, e.g. , crop rotation, soil analysis to maintain fertility, contour lines, direct planting, controlled fertilization, soybean inoculation, cover crops". Internal roads and culverts are maintained. And the native cover is maintained as protection in the water courses and in the escarpment sectors on the limits of the plateau Systematization of lots and contour lines at Faz Campos beautiful, maintained with harrowing, photos of the production lots are audited without evidence of erosion " There is evidence of production records per batch from Campos lindas and Batavo. There is evidence that crop rotation is implemented. For example: rotation of soybeans and corn, or cover crop and second-crop corn is used .
5_4_criteria: The company has established an Integrated Management procedure documented in POP-1377 Pest Management and Control, which includes techniques such as pest monitoring and implementation of the Strider system with information per batch and monitoring results per stage per means of sampling, level of damage and targeted applications, prevention of resistance through agrochemical rotation and crop rotation A policy for the responsible use of agrochemicals and objectives to reduce the use of the most dangerous toxicological categories has been implemented. The objectives are documented in Agrexs sustainability report. Agrochemical purchase records and inventory records are presented by the company. It was remotely evidenced that only original and genuine agrochemicals are stored and used. "The use and application of agrochemicals follows the recommendations of production technicians. The rotation of active ingredients is carried out to avoid resistance, the climatic conditions of application are considered to guarantee effectiveness and avoid drift. Application is carried out through a service order issued by the companys technician. The history of applications and problems encountered is identified by batch, for example, at Fazenda Campos and Batavo there are records from 2019-2020.
5_5_criteria: There is evidence of documented records of the use of agrochemicals, in accordance with the requirements of this standard. Proof of the final disposal of used agrochemical containers is provided. The company implements the POP-1374 procedure - Chemical handling and storage - for the handling and storage of chemicals. All applicable safety, hygiene and environmental precautions are highlighted, as well as compliance with the requirements established in NR31 and Law 9974/00 and Decree 4074/02. The transport has the safety signage required by law.
5_6_criteria: The company sends warehouse stock lists and agrochemical application records remotely, and production technicians and farm employees are interviewed remotely. It is clear that the products included in the Stockholm and Rotterdam lists are not used. Agrex do Brasil SA presents a sworn statement and commitment to comply with the indicator, as established by the RTRS for Covid 19 document audits. POP procedure nÂº 2503 - Reduction in the use of Paraquat - is highlighted, with the aim of reducing the use of this active ingredient in drying the soybean plantation. Reduction targets are set for 2020. The company continues to test alternatives and research new alternative products. BASF Finale is being used as a replacement for Paraquat.
5_7_criteria: NA. No biological control agents are used.
5_8_criteria: If invasive species, new pests or serious outbreaks are identified, the company plans to notify EMBRAPA. No situations requiring notification were identified.
5_9_criteria: The operational procedure - Spraying of agricultural pesticides - POP 1379, see 02, 9.02.16, indicates measures to minimize drift, the effect of atmospheric agents, precautions in case of aerial applications and communication and warning of application to neighbors. Neighbors of the farms were interviewed. No complaints or grievances were identified regarding these issues. Farm operators were interviewed remotely. It is clear that control measures are implemented to prevent agrochemical drift. Workers and collaborators from the Campos Lindos and Batavo farms were interviewed remotely.
5_10_criteria: The company implements measures to avoid interference with neighboring production systems. Good practices and application procedures are implemented that consider minimizing drift and climatic conditions for applications. Enforcement notices and communication with neighbors are maintained. Neighbors were interviewed and did not report interference problems.
5_11_criteria: There are three sources of seeds: the seed produced at Faz Santo Isidoro itself, the soybean seed produced by Agrex is also used and the seed is purchased from suppliers external. Planting orders and purchase records and seed origin are available.

Organization: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação
Name: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação LTDA Grupo I
1_1_criteria: The farms have access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of legislation and relevant documents were available. The audited farms also have external consultancy (Cerquality) that assists with occupational safety, health and environmental issues. Currently, actions are carried out within an established deadline to fully comply with legislation and good business practices.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land ownership registrations and contracts of lease.
1_3_criteria: Continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, defined indicators and monitoring, showing the groups commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard. according to the assessment required in 4.1.1.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor was found during the audit process in the work environments or heard during interviews with employees of the audited farms.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and relevant information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the agricultural unit.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that workers Salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees, as verified in the photographic records presented and in the interviews carried out.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as website containing emails telephones, postal address on farm roads with signs of written disclosure Â“talk to usÂ” containing Cerqualitys telephone number and website and internally on the farms in scope through Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the workers time control and/or bulletin boards on the farm.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. The documentation of ownership of the property, such as registration and lease agreement, has been presented and is in accordance with the applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: A mechanism for complaints, suggestions and grievances is made available, which establishes a procedure for recording and handling complaints, through a complaints and complaints form, available at the production units, information about this mechanism is made available to all interested parties.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the farms and vacancies are advertised through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fills out the job application, I have their resume on file. There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the scope farms, carried out by the farms and monitored by Cerquality.
4_1_criteria: The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified for each farm within the certification scope. Studies are available upon request.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging appropriately. There is an Environmental Management Plan presented during the audit that covers waste management including all areas of the property.
4_3_criteria: The farms promote actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and monitored organic matter in the soil.
4_4_criteria: It has been shown through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling the areas of preservation and legal reserve, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and groundwater."
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, Cerquality presented detailed maps of all farms with indication of riparian vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farms CAR.
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analyses, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion and rotation control techniques of crops are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: Farms use suitable products to control pests and diseases. IPMs and chemical use reduction plans are implemented.
5_5_criteria: Storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. Pesticide application records are made manually and subsequently recorded in the system.
5_6_criteria: The retroactive application records, invoices for purchase and storage of products.No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of Paraquat was not evidenced on farms within the scope of certification.
5_7_criteria: There is the use of biological control agents on the groups farms.
5_8_criteria: Methodology presented to identify and monitor new pests and introduced invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. There were no incidences of new pests that were not identified, according to the records presented.
5_9_criteria: Drift control procedures were presented for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water, as well as other precautions in application of pesticides.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources, as evidenced in the seed purchase invoices presented in the audit.

Organization: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação
Name: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação LTDA Grupo I
