The audited farms also have external consultancy (Cerquality) that assists with occupational safety, health and environmental issues. Currently, actions are carried out within an established deadline to fully comply with legislation and good business practices.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land ownership registrations and contracts of lease.
1_3_criteria: Continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, defined indicators and monitoring, showing the groups commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard. according to the assessment required in 4.1.1.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor was found during the audit process in the work environments or heard during interviews with employees of the audited farms.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and relevant information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the agricultural unit.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that workers Salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees, as verified in the photographic records presented and in the interviews carried out.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as website containing emails telephones, postal address on farm roads with signs of written disclosure Â“talk to usÂ” containing Cerqualitys telephone number and website and internally on the farms in scope through Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the workers time control and/or bulletin boards on the farm.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. The documentation of ownership of the property, such as registration and lease agreement, has been presented and is in accordance with the applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: A mechanism for complaints, suggestions and grievances is made available, which establishes a procedure for recording and handling complaints, through a complaints and complaints form, available at the production units, information about this mechanism is made available to all interested parties.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the farms and vacancies are advertised through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fills out the job application, I have their resume on file. There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the scope farms, carried out by the farms and monitored by Cerquality.
4_1_criteria: The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified for each farm within the certification scope. Studies are available upon request.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging appropriately. There is an Environmental Management Plan presented during the audit that covers waste management including all areas of the property.
4_3_criteria: The farms promote actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and monitored organic matter in the soil.
4_4_criteria: It has been shown through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling the areas of preservation and legal reserve, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and groundwater."
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, Cerquality presented detailed maps of all farms with indication of riparian vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farms' CAR.
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analyses, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion and rotation control techniques of crops are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: Farms use suitable products to control pests and diseases. IPMs and chemical use reduction plans are implemented.
5_5_criteria: Storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. Pesticide application records are made manually and subsequently recorded in the system.
5_6_criteria: The retroactive application records, invoices for purchase and storage of products.No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of Paraquat was not evidenced on farms within the scope of certification.
5_7_criteria: There is the use of biological control agents on the groups farms.
5_8_criteria: Methodology presented to identify and monitor new pests and introduced invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. There were no incidences of new pests that were not identified, according to the records presented.
5_9_criteria: Drift control procedures were presented for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water, as well as other precautions in application of pesticides.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources, as evidenced in the seed purchase invoices presented in the audit.

Name: Fazenda Nossa Senhora Aparecida
1_1_criteria: Applicable legislation is being partially complied with, evidenced through field visits, documentation evaluation and interviews with employees that labor, environmental, health and safety and agricultural laws are respected in almost their entirety.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: The Socio-Environmental Diagnosis document sets out the points analyzed and included for improvement. The schedules with the points and actions are included.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other involuntary work was found during the audit process in the work environments or heard during the interviews with the employees in the groups production units.
2_2_criteria: The registration forms, employment contracts and pay slips for employees in the production unit were available in easy-to-understand language in the HR department for workers to consult.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety information is documented and transmitted to employees during Onboarding or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations in the groups production units
2_4_criteria: The absence of an impediment to freedom of association is demonstrated and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment of their presence in the groups production units.
2_5_criteria: Salary paid adequately, with weekly rest, vacations and without undue deductions for employees on the groups farms
3_1_criteria: There is a communication and dialogue channel.
3_2_criteria: Absence of traditional users of the lands and disputes over the right to use them.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and grievances are checked monthly and the responses are passed on to DDS for employees in general.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised internally and local collaboration programs are being carried out.
4_1_criteria: Socio-environmental assessment was developed by a multidisciplinary team and measures to minimize impacts are defined.
4_2_criteria: There is a Waste Management plan which describes the actions that the property takes in relation to waste generated on the property.
4_3_criteria: The farm does not controls the fuel used in production. Soil organic matter monitored and improvement measures implemented.
4_4_criteria: Compliance with the deforestation policy of the standard met by the farm. There was no land conversion after 2009.
4_5_criteria: The properties contain the amount of forest recommended in the forestry code, which is 20%. The farms legal reserve is allocated in another location, but in the same region
5_1_criteria: Good practices are carried out daily, protecting soil and water from contamination.
5_2_criteria: Protection areas being protected as per national law.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, the use of contour lines and soil analyzes are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the units production units.
5_4_criteria: Registered products are used and applied at the recommended dose. IPM records on the farm being carried out properly.
5_5_criteria: Product storage location is adequate. There is a lack of data for a complete product application record. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas and the use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the units of production. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the unit.
5_8_criteria: In case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact SIDAGO - Agrodefesa, which is an agricultural defense institution in the state of GoiÃ¡s.
5_9_criteria: Applications are carried out at an optimal distance from populated areas and protected areas.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system as the unit. The minimum distance for application is respected.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through purchase from well-known companies that issue proof of origin

Name: Louis Dreyfus Company - LDC Sorriso
1_1_criteria: Producers demonstrate knowledge of applicable laws and remain up to date through external consultancy from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with applicable laws was verified in most of the farms audited, such as Receipt of the Rural Environmental Registry, Well Grant, among others. Only one of the farms presented non-compliance in item 1.1.2 due to the occurrence of excessive overtime.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through duly registered registrations and lease contracts on all audited farms .
1_3_criteria: The manager did not carry out a social, environmental and agricultural assessment of the groups members, which generated non-compliance in the four farms audited in indicator 1.3.2. Indicators 1.3.1 and 1.3.3 are also not being met, however compliance with them will only be required from the second year of certification onwards.
2_1_criteria: None of the audited farms found signs of forced labor, tax, forced, trafficked or involuntary, with no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on farms are not forced to work and when they did work, it was found that they were given an opportunity. There are no children under 15 working on the farms. All hired employees are over 18 years old. Children residing on audited farms attend school. Interviews and information collected demonstrate that there is no discrimination of any kind and all workers receive equal treatment.
2_2_criteria: All employees on the audited farms are registered, having an Individual Employment Contract and Employee Registration, describing the main information relevant. Two audited farms did not provide evidence of providing specific training in occupational health and safety to employees. Despite indicator 2.2.3 not being met, these farms did not receive non-compliance, as this indicator will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
2_3_criteria: all audited farms have PPRA/ PCMSO or PGSSMATR, where health and safety risks are identified, as well as mitigation and control measures. Owners of audited farms, as well as employees, demonstrate knowledge of occupational health and safety issues, such as carrying out the required medical examinations. In addition, the audited farms have a First Aid and Emergency Procedures document, with the aim of establishing actions to be taken in response to environmental or occupational health and safety emergencies, as well as the associated environmental impacts. There are emergency signs and first aid kits on all audited farms. Three of the audited farms received non-compliance in indicator 2.3.3, due to the employees who perform potentially dangerous tasks not having the training or qualifications to perform them. Furthermore, one of the audited farms does not provide Personal Protective Equipment to employees, generating a non-conformity in indicator 2.3.4
2_4_criteria: According to reports obtained through interviews and on-site viewing at the four audited farms, the Employees have complete freedom to join trade unions. Three of the four audited farms follow Collective Labor Convention 2017/19, MTE Registration number: MT000731/2017.
2_5_criteria: Verified from interviews, information collected and documents verified on the audited farms that the wages paid are higher than the national minimum, being paid monthly via deposit into employees accounts. Verified proof of payment demonstrates that only deductions provided for by law such as INSS and IPRF are made. The working hours on the audited farms are 44 hours per week, with overtime being compensated or paid in two periods of the year, as stated in the Collective Agreement (for the three farms that follow the Convention). For farms that do not follow the established Convention, overtime is paid alongside their monthly salaries. Two farms audited record the hours worked and overtime and the other two do not register the employer. Despite not complying with indicator 2.5.5, compliance with it will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards. An audited farm received a non-compliance in indicator 2.5.4, as excessive overtime was evidenced. There were no cases of pregnant women on the farms, however, those responsible are aware of the applicable law. Verified that the residences and accommodation for employees on the audited farms are adequate and have satisfactory sanitary conditions.
3_1_criteria: The farms have e-mail and telephone numbers and an identification plate at their headquarters. In addition, a suggestion/complaint box is kept on each farm. The Complaint/Suggestion Procedure document and Complaint/Suggestion Form are implemented and describe the procedure for handling complaints and the form for recording them. There were no complaints or suggestions at the time of the audit.
3_2_criteria: Verified that there are no cases of disputes regarding the rights to use the properties lands, as well as there is no evidence of the existence of traditional users of the properties lands.
3_3_criteria: The farms have suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters. Employees can make complaints or grievances through the box and the community can communicate with the farm via telephone and email. Any complaints are recorded in the Complaint/Suggestion Form document. If complaints are received, they will be analyzed and subsequently dealt with, as provided for in the Complaint/Suggestion Procedure. At the time of the audit, there were no complaints or complaints received.
3_4_criteria: Verified that job opportunities are filled through referrals from current employees and other farms, or searches made directly on the audited farms. One farm reported that it does not provide any type of assistance to local communities. Although indicator 3.4.2 is not being met, this indicator will only be charged from the third year of certification. Farms purchase products from the region they are located in.
4_1_criteria: All audited farms receive non-compliance in indicators 4.1.1; 4.1.2; 4.1.3; 4.1.4; 4.1.5, as a social, environmental and agricultural assessment was not carried out on them.
4_2_criteria: Verified that no fires are carried out on any of the audited farms. Most of the waste is properly disposed of by the farms, however three farms audited had non-compliance in indicator 4.2.2 due to the following situations: not having correct disposal of contaminated waste and incorrect storage of tires. A farm does not have selective collection bins, and the waste collected is taken to the citys municipal landfill. Despite not complying with indicator 4.2.4, this item will only be charged from the third year of certification. All farms have a documented Waste Management Plan, developed by the group manager.
4_3_criteria: The majority of audited farms record the use of fossil fuels, however on one farm it was not possible to identify the use for crop cultivation. soy. Even though indicator 4.3.1 and 4.3.2 are not in compliance, both will be required from the third year of certification. They monitor the organic matter content by carrying out soil analyses. Furthermore, properties adopt practices that contribute to increasing soil carbon sequestration, such as: adopting direct planting systems, cultivating soil cover species, maintaining native vegetation and planting eucalyptus for use in the dryer.
4_4_criteria: Land Use and Comparative Maps were developed by LDC, presenting satellite images of property areas in 2009, 2016 and 2019. The 2009 images were generated with the Landsat 5 TM, Collection 1 Tier 2 satellite TOA Reflectance, 30 meter resolution. The 2016 and 2019 images were generated with the Sentinel-2 MSI satellite: MultiSpectral Instrument, Level-1C, 10 meter resolution. It was verified that there was no opening of vegetation areas after 2009 on the farms.
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation has been maintained on all farms. Hunting and collecting protected species is prohibited on all audited farms. The manager developed the document Plan to Guarantee the Preservation of Native Vegetation and Wildlife on the Farm, but no monitoring has been carried out to date. Although indicator 4.5.2 is not being met, this item will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
5_1_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies , such as, for example, the practice of direct planting and the maintenance of soil cover through the planting of brachiaria. A farm does not have a Grant of Right to Use Groundwater, referring to the artesian well. Although indicator 5.1.1 is not being met, this indicator will only be charged from the second year of certification. On all audited farms, analyzes are carried out to monitor water quality, however, two of the analyzes presented conflicting results. Despite not meeting the requirements in indicator 5.1.2, compliance will be charged from the third year of certification. Two farms audited, use an irrigation system for soybeans, having all applicable legal documentation.
5_2_criteria: The farms have complete maps with the location of cultivated areas delimited by plot, vegetation areas and watercourses. Verified that there is no removal of riparian areas of native vegetation on the four farms audited; and there are no natural wetlands or wetland areas.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality is preserved on all audited farms through the adoption of practices such as the adoption of the direct planting system and the use of fertilizers in accordance with technical recommendations. The agricultural areas have flat relief. Direct planting is adopted on the four properties, as well as maintaining soil cover through the planting of cover species. Planning is carried out to define planting areas, following crop rotation and succession techniques on all farms.
5_4_criteria: The four farms do not have a documented Integrated Crop Management plan. Although indicator 5.4.1 is not being met, it will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards. At group level, the manager developed the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a plan to reduce potentially harmful phytosanitary products over time. As verified on the four farms, only original and genuine agrochemicals are used that meet local registration requirements for soybean cultivation. An audited farm does not have a documented record regarding crop monitoring. Although indicator 5.4.5 is not being met, it will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
5_5_criteria: Verified that the four properties audited do not have records of dosers and applicators, equipment used and weather conditions during application. Although these items are not being complied with, compliance with them will be charged from the next year of certification onwards, and records of meteorological conditions will be charged from the third year of certification. Empty packaging is punctured and triple-washed on the farms and stored in an empty packaging warehouse. All audited farms have a pesticide deposit in their own location, separate from other structures and identified, where pesticides are stored in accordance with legislation.
5_6_criteria: The farms do not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm Conventions and Rotterdam. Two audited farms were non-compliant in indicator 5.6.2, due to there not being a program to progressively reduce the use of Paraquat over time.
5_7_criteria: In three audited properties, products for biological control are used, in compliance with legislation. The farm that does not use it demonstrated knowledge about its use.
5_8_criteria: It was verified that if an outbreak of new pests occurred, the audited farms would inform EMBRAPA and Agrodefesa.
5_9_criteria: The farms follow the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a reduction plan and measures to avoid drift in agrochemical applications. The four farms do not record weather conditions at the time of application. Despite not compressing item 5.9.2, it will only be charged from the third year of certification onwards. No aerial applications are carried out in cultural management for soybean cultivation on the audited farms. There is no application of pesticides near populated areas or watercourses.
5_10_criteria: Neighboring areas have the same type of production, cultivation and management used in the audited properties.V
5_11_criteria: Verified that The seeds acquired by the farms are from legally known sources, with the respective terms of seed compliance. None of the farms produce their own seeds.

Name: Fazenda Uirapuru
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to the evaluation of documentation at the farm office, verification of infrastructure and field visits, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety laws and agricultural rights are respected and fulfilled.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land registrations and title deeds.
1_3_criteria: The aspects were identified and improvement continuous will be monitored, showing the farms commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: Adequate working conditions, payment receipts in accordance with the activity carried out with farm employees, training for functions, in addition to adequate benefits and evidence of the absence of discounts on payslips that are not in the legislation. No evidence of aggression or disrespect was seen on site, or heard during the interview with workers on the propertys work fronts and work structures. No children under the age of 18 were identified working on the farm.
2_2_criteria: Registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees of the production unit were presented, and were available in easy-to-understand language at the accounting office. The company and its employees do not follow any union at the moment, as there is no active union in the region. Due and appropriate training has been carried out.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety issues are communicated to employees. The document Rural Work Safety, Health and Environmental Management Program (PGSSMATR) contains the safety risks and the PCMSO which describes the examinations and precautions that employees must follow. Employees with specific functions are trained. The appropriate protective equipment for each function is used correctly. Emergency procedures available and understood by employees
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization, however, there is no active union in the region.
2_5_criteria: Remunerations are compatible with legislation nationally, salary and deductions are detailed in the payslips, there were no irregular deductions. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. Hours worked are being recorded and overtime occurs within the limit permitted by legislation.
3_1_criteria: There are channels of communication and dialogue, publicized through signs on the farm.
3_2_criteria: There are no indigenous peoples and places with cultural importance in the areas of influence of the audited farm.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and grievances are checked monthly and responses are passed on to DDS for employees in general. At the entrance to the farm there are signs (GSM Ombudsman) with telephone numbers available for community contact and complaints.
3_4_criteria: Job opportunities are advertised locally by employees and also by the external company Promove, which has a portal that recruits and selects employees. The farm contributes financial aid to adapt a municipal school in the region and social actions through the cooperative. Offers of goods and services are offered
4_1_criteria: Evaluation carried out in a comprehensive manner, through the report presented, carried out by the environmental and safety department of the GSM group, where points for improvements were identified, covering social and environmental points of the farm in a comprehensive and clear manner
4_2_criteria: Storage locations for fuel, lubricants, among others, are located in areas with waterproof floors and containment for protection in case of accidental leaks. Soil organic matter is monitored and measures are taken for improvement, in addition the producer uses crops: millet, corn, wheat, oats and carries out everything such as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_3_criteria: Fuel recording is done manually at the pump and then passed on to the Administrative Manager. Information on the volume per hectare and per unit of product monitored in all activities related to soybean production can be obtained. Several mechanisms and opportunities for carbon sequestration are implemented.
4_4_criteria: As of May 2009, there has been no cleaning or conversion of areas included in Category 1 of maps 3 and there has been no land conversion after 2016, it was presented report with satellite images that demonstrates a comparison between the years 2016 and 2020 and shows that there was no area conversion after 2016.
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained in accordance with federal law, evidenced through the data from registrations and data in the CAR that the properties contain the amount of forest recommended in the forestry code, which is 20% for the Atlantic forest biome, where the farm is located. There is also an Environmental Diagnosis carried out by the cooperative, which excludes areas that are APP areas, evidenced during the verification of maps, field visits and images of the farm. Hunting and fishing are not permitted.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices implemented, crop rotation practices, direct planting in straw, fertilization and correction according to technical calculation, containment areas for storing chemical products and carrying out water analysis as monitoring. Erosion prevention measures are carried out, such as contour lines and always keeping the soil covered, as well as appropriate structures used to contain chemicals. Contamination of groundwater was not verified, according to monitoring analysis reports presented. Irrigation management procedures and systems are implemented through the ICROP program that performs calculations using data entered from monitoring meteorological data and soil moisture for irrigation application. A grant of abstraction water for irrigation, issued by the Secretariat of Environment and Water Resources, was also presented.
5_2_criteria: The watercourses and APPs are mapped. The socio-environmental diagnosis document demonstrates that the APP areas are being recovered throughout the property through natural regeneration. There is also an Environmental Diagnosis carried out by the cooperative, which includes APP areas, evidenced by checking maps, field visits and images of the farm.
5_3_criteria: The organic matter of the monitored soil, was evidenced through an interview with the technical manager and document from the company that carries out the samples and analyzes of soil analysis data for management through graphs and implementation of precision agriculture. Practices are carried out to improve soil quality such as: Crop rotation, soil analysis with fertilization through precision agriculture, maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting. The farm uses level planting, contour lines and direct planting to prevent erosion.
5_4_criteria: The farm has a document "Procedure for Good Agricultural Practices and Integrated Crop Management" and there are records of pest monitoring in the document standard called "Monitoring of pests in soybean cultivation", in addition, the farm uses other control methods, in addition to chemical ones, which are: varietal, chemical, physiological and biological - BT. Pest monitoring records are carried out by the farm.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical use records contain the requested data. Properly carried out storage and disposal location, all empty agrochemical packaging is triple washed, perforated at the bottom and stored until sent to destination. The storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. The use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the farm.
5_8_criteria: The owners of the farm informed that the agency SIDAGO - Agrodefesa carries out a visit to the property.
5_9_criteria: Procedure "Good Agricultural Practices" and the ANDEF manual Good agricultural practices in field were available. Meteorological records are carried out. Aerial applications are not carried out.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds are purchased from reputable sources, as per verification of seed purchase invoices and terms of compliance.

Organization: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação
Name: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação LTDA. Grupo III
1_1_criteria: The farms have access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of legislation and relevant documents were available. The audited farms also have external consultancy (Cerquality) that assists with occupational safety, health and environmental issues. Currently, actions are carried out within an established deadline to fully comply with legislation and good business practices.

5_7_criteria: There is the use of biological control agents on the groups farms on an experimental basis.
5_8_criteria: Methodology presented to identify and monitor new introduced pests and invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. There were no incidences of new pests that were not identified, according to the records presented.
5_9_criteria: Drift control procedures were presented for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water, as well as other precautions in application of pesticides.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: GGF - Agro LTDA
1_1_criteria: The applicable legislation is being complied with, evidenced through a field visit (audit 2019), documentation evaluation and interviews with employees that labor, environmental, health and safety and agricultural laws are respected in almost all cases totality. Remote audit 2020. The information presented during the audit demonstrates that the auditee is knowledgeable about the applicable legal requirements. The company has a legal department that provides input on applicable legislation, as well as those responsible for each area in the company.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds
1_3_criteria: In the document Survey of Environmental and Agricultural Social Aspects and Monitoring Plan to ensure that native vegetation and wildlife are maintained, the points analyzed and the proposed control and mitigation actions are set out, as well as the assessment of their effectiveness . A monitoring protocol was created for different environmental, social and agricultural aspects to see how they evolve over the years. Document created and monitoring protocol (SOCIAL RISK MITIGATION - TURNOVER - Training hours per employee; ENVIRONMENTAL RISK MITIGATION - Collection of contaminated material; AGRICULTURAL RISK MITIGATION - Organic matter).
2_1_criteria: No evidence found of forced, compulsory, slave, trafficking or other involuntary labor during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees in the groups production units. (2020) A declaration was signed to meet some criteria for being a remote audit. There are no children under 18 working on the farms visited in the previous campaign and corroborated during this remote audit through interviews. Payments and benefits appropriate to the legislation and the positions held.
2_2_criteria: The registration forms, employment contracts and payslips relating to employees of the production unit were available in easy-to-understand language in the HR department for consultation by workers. Documents relating to labor aspects available to all workers. Evidence that work and safety standards are passed on to workers was found.
2_3_criteria: Information on health and safety is documented and is transmitted to employees during Integration or during training, and all records were evidenced. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each role and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations. Also an analysis of health and safety risks present. Have a safety technician recommended by law, who talks to people weekly.
2_4_criteria: There is no impediment to freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment regarding their presence on the farm, membership being at the expense of the employee.
2_5_criteria: Salary paid adequately compatible with national legislation and collective agreements. Have weekly rest, vacations and no undue deductions from employees. There are no irregular and/or disciplinary deductions. There is a supply of water with potability standards in accordance with current legislation, as well as structures and food. The working day complies with what is established by the CLT. Extra working hours per worker are voluntary, communicated and paid.
3_1_criteria: Communication with the community is established, since the GGF Group is known in the community and the media meets the demand, as well as signs available outside the farm, with communication channels. GGF also publishes a magazine with all the social, productive activities and safety instructions carried out in the field.
3_2_criteria: The company has an identification of production areas that does not identify the presence of indigenous peoples close to the farm, as well as places of cultural, ecological, economic or religious importance, environments protected by law.
3_3_criteria: Complaints can be made through different channels: (ouvidoria@ggfbrasil.com / by tel (65) 3549-1429, being also available internally through signs in the production unit and through suggestion boxes and externally on signs at the farm entrance and on vehicles, which circulate throughout neighboring communities. These complaints or information go to the legal department of the GGF Group , which filters the sectors and people responsible for the matter to which they are forwarded, to provide a response to what is happening along with an action plan for the tickets that have been opened. All demands received are checked and responded to.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised internally and local collaboration programs are being carried out by the company GGF. Employment opportunity publicized for local communities. Farms prioritize the hiring of local labor, influencing consumption in nearby communities, in addition to donations.
4_1_criteria: The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were comprehensively identified for the farm included in the scope of certification . (2020) they create a spreadsheet with the risks associated with production.
4_2_criteria: There is a Waste Management plan which describes the actions that the property takes in relation to the waste generated. There is no burning of crop residues, vegetation and waste. (This is all prohibited) Everything was evidenced during the 2019 audit. During the current 2020 audit, it was evidenced by images and videos, and by the signing of a self-declaration of compliance.
4_3_criteria: The farm controls the fuel spent in production through electronic system. The monitoring carried out allows us to assess when there is an increase in the intensity of fossil fuel use. Soil organic matter monitored and improvement measures implemented. GGF a Identified opportunities to increase carbon sequestration.
4_4_criteria: Compliance with the deforestation policy of the standard met by the farm. There was no land conversion after 2009. There is no evidence of area conversions before June 3, 2016.
4_5_criteria: Environmental areas follow what is established by the Brazilian Forest Code and are described in the CAR. Pau da OnÃ§a Farm has a map available. The farm has more than 10% native vegetation. (They have 24% vegetation) and another part 57% native vegetation.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices are carried out daily, protecting soil and water from contamination. No evidence of water contamination observed. They have a Guerino Protocol - Well Water Grants
5_2_criteria: The areas of interest are being protected according to the Brazilian forestry code. Natural wetlands in the production unit intact.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, the use of contour lines and soil analyzes are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the production units. unit production.
5_4_criteria: Registered products are used and applied at the recommended dose. An integrated harvest management plan called - GGF Biological Protocol - and MIP was created to verify the limits of the economic year for pests to reduce the number of applications
5_5_criteria: Product storage location is suitable. Product application record is complete. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas and the use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the production units. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the unit.
5_8_criteria: In case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact MAPA and FundaÃ§Ã£o Matogrosso. Communication is mandatory in Brazil.
5_9_criteria: Applications are carried out at the correct distance from populated areas and protected areas. There are no production areas within 30 meters of populated areas and bodies of water. An integrated crop management plan called - GGF Biological Protocol was created, they also have a Drift Reduction protocol.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of unit production system. The minimum distance for application is respected.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through purchase from well-known companies that issue proof of origin and through own production with RENASEM.

Name: SLC Agricola S.A. - EU RED
1_1_criteria: The coordinators of both properties demonstrated great knowledge of the laws applicable to the Standard, that is, labor, environmental, health and safety at work legislation. The SLC Group is advised by a company that provides updated information on the legislation relevant to the certification protocols present on the multi-site. During the audit it was possible to demonstrate compliance with the legislation, through the evaluation of documents such as the Rural Environmental Registry (CAR), Environmental Licensing, Water Use Grants, Return of Empty Packaging, Disposal of Hazardous Waste, NR 31, Labor Legislation among others applicable to the standard.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through the documentary evaluation of the records of registrations and lease agreements for SLC Group properties. The documents presented are in accordance with the legislation.
1_3_criteria: In accordance with the RTRS Standard Internal Control System Manual rev. 02, item 7.5.1 Â– Internal audit, SLC AgrÃ­cola periodically carries out internal audits on its Internal Control System Â– RTRS Standard with the aim of providing information to management on the status of the System and determining whether it complies with planned, whether it has been properly implemented and is being maintained, whether it is effective in meeting the Policy, company objectives and relevant RTRS Standard. Internal audit report evidenced, based on RTRS indicators, thus covering social, environmental and agricultural aspects of the operation. Monitoring of indicators determined by the group for monitoring is evidenced, and they are applied in the environmental, social and health and safety spheres.
2_1_criteria: According to visual verification, and through interviews with employees, there is no evidence of forced labor , taxed, forced, trafficked or otherwise involuntary, nor from employee documentation retained with employers, nor from employees wives being required to work on the property, there are no workers under the age of 18 on the property. All workers have the opportunity for promotion within the multi-site. According to visual verification and through interviews, there is no evidence of corporal punishment, coercion and physical or mental aggression, physical or verbal abuse, sexual harassment or any other type of intimidation of workers.
2_2_criteria: Evidenced through documental assessment of employees at both properties, that all employees have a written contract in clear language. Evidenced through documentary evaluation and through interviews in both properties that all employees receive training due and appropriate to the functions they perform
2_3_criteria: Evidenced through interviews with employees in the role of PPE Sanitizer, Storekeeper and Preparer de Calda, all demonstrate knowledge and understanding of health and safety issues.
2_4_criteria: There is no evidence of actions that prevent workers from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as impediments to the presence of the same in the groups production units. The municipalitys union was visited during the public consultation where the person responsible reported not having received labor complaints against the audited properties.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that the wages paid at the property are consistent with what is established in the union agreement and In the collective agreement, if there are no salary differences between employees of the same category in the groups production units, there are no salary deductions for disciplinary purposes as assessed in the payroll.
3_1_criteria: Visually and documented the communication channels of both Farms.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users were identified, and no disputes over land use were identified on the evaluated properties. The documentation of ownership of the property, such as registration and deeds, were presented and are in accordance with the applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: Complaint and complaints mechanism implemented and accessible to the local community, with due treatment and feedback to complainants.
3_4_criteria: The majority of employees are from the regions where the farms are located, when it is necessary to hire new employees, it is usually done through recommendation from active employees, and they are always people from the regional community. Evidenced the groups collaboration with training programs open to the population and opportunities to supply goods according to contracted budgets and services.
4_1_criteria: Evidenced that there is no implementation of new structures on the farm.
4_2_criteria: Evidenced At various points on the properties, waste separation is practiced, using bins classified as: metal, glass, plastic and paper. Adequate storage and disposal of waste, observed battery return receipt for all properties and used oil collection record, observed containment barriers around fuel storage and supply points, no fires were evident in any part of the property , neither from crop residues or leftovers, nor with the aim of suppressing vegetation, which was confirmed through interviews with field employees and the responsible agronomists.
4_3_criteria: The SLC Group records, plans and monitors through of a computerized system for all fuel consumption, activities related to soybean production, those responsible for monitoring this information are the coordinators. Control of this information is carried out through a computerized system. A comparison of 2014 and 2015 per hectare was presented. The property also monitors the organic matter content of the soil with the aim of always maintaining the best content in the soil, for this purpose it uses agricultural practices that provide the best results.
4_4_criteria: There was no agricultural expansion within the farms after 2009, evidenced through satellite photos and production maps in the groups production units.
4_5_criteria: Maps were analyzed showing the boundaries of the farms with mapping of native vegetation. Through interviews with employees of the properties and signs indicating that hunting is prohibited, we highlighted the prohibition of these practices on the properties.
5_1_criteria: The property carries out water monitoring through chemical analysis of the water, and no evidence was identified of localized contamination of surface or underground water, if any localized contamination occurs, local authorities will be notified. In both properties, erosion control measures were also evidenced, such as direct planting, high soil coverage, avoiding surface runoff and leaching of chemical residues into the water table.
5_2_criteria: The properties maintain File the mapping of areas, where it is possible to identify watercourses and riparian vegetation. Compliance can also be verified during field visits. There were no areas where riparian vegetation was removed. It was clear from a field visit that there are no natural wetlands being drained.
5_3_criteria: The properties carry out chemical analysis of the soil annually to determine fertility levels and recommendations for fertilizing. In addition, the property uses direct planting and crop rotation techniques, maintaining straw to guarantee organic matter in the soil. Plants at level to avoid surface erosion.
5_4_criteria: The SLC group has a management plan, documented through the Â“Grain Quality ManualÂ”. Evidenced in the documented Â“Reduction Plan in the use of OrganophosphatesÂ”, approved in March 2015, applicable to all properties of the group. The standard procedure for both properties is that after the field technicians return with the monitoring results, the decision is made to recommend application. Monitoring and application records are evidenced.
5_5_criteria: All pesticide applications are carried out after monitoring the crop and with the recommendation of the agronomist responsible for the farm. Weather conditions are monitored and recorded at the time of application, to prevent drift into neighboring areas. Visually checked, in all areas where pesticide applications were carried out, indicative signs, signaling the treated area and the period of re-entry into the crop. Visually evidence that pesticide packaging is stored, washed and disposed of appropriately. For both properties, the sheds for storing pesticides were visually highlighted, they comply with all legislation.
5_6_criteria: There are no products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions, verified through analysis of farm stock reports Pamplona and Planalto, which contains all the products in stock on the property, also evidenced in an on-site visit
5_7_criteria: There is no use of biological control agents.
5_8_criteria: Through an interview with agronomist engineers from both properties and also from checking the crop monitoring records, it was possible to verify that so far the identified pests are included in the MIP. There was no incidence of new pests or outbreaks of existing pests.
5_9_criteria: Evidenced through interviews with agronomists from Pamplona Farm and Planalto Farm and through analysis of documents that, for the application of pesticides, application conditions, wind speed, temperature, relative humidity, ideal pH of the mixture are considered/analyzed. Both properties have a climate monitoring station.
5_10_criteria: According to documentary verification and information from engineers. Agronomists of the properties, when it is necessary to apply pesticides, in the documents Requisition/Application Planning Agricultural Pesticides and OS Â– Service Order there are guidelines to avoid interference in neighboring areas.
5_11_criteria: According to document verification and interview with eng. Agronomist of the property, when it is necessary to purchase seeds, they are acquired with the terms of seed compliance, to verify the origin and quality of the seed, observing the producers registration in Renasem. the group also produces its own seed, having verified due registration with Renasem.

1_3_criteria: A social and environmental assessment of the properties was not prepared.

Name: Fazenda Verde Agropastoril Jotabasso Ltda
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to the evaluation of documentation at the farm office, verification of infrastructure and field visits, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety laws and agricultural rights are respected and fulfilled.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land registrations and title deeds.
1_3_criteria: The aspects were identified and improvement continuous will be monitored, showing the farms commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: Adequate working conditions, payment receipts in accordance with the activity carried out with farm employees, training for functions, in addition to adequate benefits and evidence of the absence of discounts on payslips that are not in the legislation. No evidence of aggression or disrespect was seen on site, or heard during the interview with workers on the propertys work fronts and work structures. No children under the age of 18 were identified working on the farm.
2_2_criteria: Registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees of the production unit were presented, and are available in easy-to-understand language at the central office located in RondonÃ³polis . The company and its employees have a registered collective bargaining agreement. Due and appropriate training has been carried out.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety issues are communicated to employees. The document Rural Work Safety, Health and Environmental Management Program (PGSSMATR) contains the safety risks and the PCMSO which describes the examinations and precautions that employees must follow. Employees with specific functions are trained. The appropriate protective equipment for each function is used correctly. Emergency procedures are established in the Collective Agreement. Potentially dangerous tasks are only carried out by qualified people. It has LTCAT - Technical Report on Environmental Working Conditions.
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization. All workers have the right to collective bargaining.
2_5_criteria: Remuneration is compatible with national legislation, payslips detail salaries and deductions, no irregular deductions were found. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. Hours worked are recorded using a time clock, overtime occurs within the limit permitted by legislation.
3_1_criteria: There are channels of communication and dialogue, disclosed through the code of conduct of ethics and professional conduct. Access channels available are able to receive external and internal complaints about violations of the companys code of conduct. On the available telephone channels, the call is received from a toll-free line for the complainant through the number Brazil 0.800.891.4636 and USA 1.800.921.2240. Contact is also possible by email: etica.jotabasso@resguarda.com
3_2_criteria: There are no indigenous peoples and places with cultural importance in the areas of influence of the audited farm.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and complaints are verified by the committee as soon as they are received. Complaints, suggestions and negotiations are archived. The company has a website where it is possible for the local community to obtain the contact number of the units and also send messages (https://www.jotabasso.com.br/contato/)
3_4_criteria: Opportunities for employment are advertised locally by employees. The companys HR email contact is available on the companys website (https://www.jotabasso.com.br/contato/). The farm collaborates with training programs, providing space on the farm for training to be carried out to employees and the local community.
4_1_criteria: Evaluation carried out in a comprehensive manner, through the report presented, carried out by the environmental and safety department of the Jatabassos group, where points for improvements were identified, covering social and environmental aspects of the farm in a comprehensive and clear manner.
4_2_criteria: Storage locations for fuel, lubricants, among others, are located in areas with waterproof floors and containment for protection in case of accidental leaks. Soil organic matter is monitored and measures are taken for improvement, in addition the producer uses crops: millet, corn, wheat, oats and carries out everything such as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_3_criteria: Fuel recording is done manually at the pump and then passed on to the Administrative Manager. Information on the volume per hectare and per unit of product monitored in all activities related to soybean production can be obtained. Several mechanisms and opportunities for carbon sequestration are implemented.
4_4_criteria: As of May 2009, there has been no cleaning or conversion of areas included in Category 1 of maps 3 and there has been no land conversion after 2016, it was presented report with satellite images that demonstrates a comparison between the years 2016 and 2020 and shows that there was no area conversion after 2016.
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained in accordance with federal law, evidenced through the data from registrations and data in the CAR that the properties contain the amount of forest recommended in the forestry code, which is 20% for the Atlantic forest biome, where the farm is located. There is also an environmental survey carried out by the sustainability department, which excludes areas that are APP areas, evidenced during the verification of maps, field visits and images of the farm. Hunting and fishing are not permitted.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices implemented, crop rotation practices, direct planting in straw, fertilization and correction according to technical calculation, containment areas for storing chemical products and carrying out water analysis as monitoring. Erosion prevention measures are carried out, such as contour lines and always keeping the soil covered, as well as appropriate structures used to contain chemicals. Contamination of groundwater was not verified, according to monitoring analysis reports presented. A grant of abstraction water for irrigation, issued by the Secretariat of Environment and Water Resources, was also presented.
5_2_criteria: The watercourses and APPs are mapped. The socio-environmental diagnosis document demonstrates that the APP areas are being recovered throughout the property through natural regeneration. There is also an environmental survey carried out by the sustainability department, which includes APP areas, evidenced by checking maps, field visits and images of the farm.
5_3_criteria: The matter soil organic matter monitored, was evidenced through an interview with the technical manager and document from the company that carries out the samples and analyzes of soil analysis data for management through graphs and implementation of precision agriculture. Practices are carried out to improve soil quality such as: Crop rotation, soil analysis with fertilization through precision agriculture, maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting. The farm uses level planting, contour lines and direct planting to prevent erosion.
5_4_criteria: The farm has a document "Procedure for Good Agricultural Practices" and there are records of pest monitoring in the standard document called "Monitoring of pests in soybean cultivation", in addition, the farm uses other control methods, in addition to chemical ones, which are: varietal, chemical, physiological and biological. Pest monitoring records are carried out by the farm.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical use records contain the requested data. Properly carried out storage and disposal site, all empty agrochemical packaging is triple washed, perforated at the bottom and stored until sent to destination. The storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. The use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions. Paraquat and carbofuran are not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Eng. Agr. Responsible for the farm.
5_8_criteria: The owners of the farm informed that the agency SIDAGO - Agrodefesa carries out a visit to the property.
5_9_criteria: Procedure "Good Agricultural Practices" and the ANDEF manual Good agricultural practices in field were available. Meteorological records are carried out. Aerial applications are not carried out.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds are purchased from reputable sources, as per transfer invoices and internal use of seeds, terms of compliance and registration with Renascem.

Name: Girassol Agrícola Ltda

4_2_criteria: Storage locations for fuel, lubricants, among others, are located in areas with waterproof floors and containment for protection in case of accidental leaks. Name: Grupo Hervalense
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to the evaluation of documentation at the groups office, verification of structures on the farms, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety and agricultural laws are respected and fulfilled. The company has a legal department that provides input on applicable legislation.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land registrations and title deeds.
1_3_criteria: It was a plan has been carried out to identify the aspects as requested by this item, these being social, environmental and agricultural aspects of the operation (on and off the farm) that must be improved.
2_1_criteria: Adequate working conditions, payment receipts according to the activity carried out with farm employees, training for the functions, in addition to adequate benefits and evidence of the absence of discounts on pay slips that are not in the legislation. No evidence of aggression or disrespect was seen in the work environments, or heard during the interview with workers on the propertys work fronts and work structures. No children under the age of 18 were identified working on the farm.
2_2_criteria: Registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees of the production unit were presented, and are available in easy-to-understand language in the HR department for consultation of the workers. The company and its employees do not follow any union at the moment, as there is no active union in the region. Due and appropriate training has been carried out.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety issues are communicated to employees. The document Rural Work Safety, Health and Environmental Management Program (PGSSMATR) contains the safety risks and describes the examinations and precautions that employees must follow, the risks relating to health and safety issues have been identified. Employees with specific functions are trained. Appropriate protective equipment for each role is provided. Emergency procedures available and understood by employees.
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization, however, there is no active union in the region.
2_5_criteria: Remunerations are compatible with the national legislation, salary and deductions are detailed in the payslips, there were no irregular deductions. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. The hours worked are recorded using a time clock, it was identified that the normal working day exceeds 48 hours per week, as well as overtime exceeds 12 hours per week, at Fazendas Hervalense and Lagoa do Cervo.
3_1_criteria: There are communication and dialogue channels, publicized through signs on the farms.
3_2_criteria: There are no indigenous peoples and places with cultural importance in the areas of influence of the audited farms.
3_3_criteria: Communication channels These are suggestion boxes available internally at the properties and externally through signs with the telephone number, email address Ouviria@hervalesnse@gmail.com, and mailing address. Suggestions and complaints received are handled in a timely manner and documentary evidence is maintained. Interviews were carried out with farm employees, verifying the correct functioning of the grievance and complaints mechanism.
3_4_criteria: Opportunities relating to job offers are offered to the local population through word of mouth among employees and are announced on the SINE. The group collaborates with training programs aimed at the local community, by making the site available on the Hervalense property and employees from other properties can participate.
4_1_criteria: A plan was drawn up to identify and assess social and environmental risks
4_2_criteria: Actions to minimize impacts are being taken, such as reuse and recycling of materials, through selective collection and all hazardous waste in the groups production units are stored appropriately for environmentally correct disposal.
4_3_criteria: Fuel registration is in accordance with the agricultural activities carried out. The use of fertilizer is done according to soil analyses, where organic matter is also monitored. Areas of environmental interest are maintained and preserved in the groups production units.
4_4_criteria: Through maps and satellite photos, it was verified that the soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of areas considered as AAVC.
4_5_criteria: Areas of environmental interest are respected and conserved by the administration of the groups production units. Native vegetation on the farm is above 20%, in accordance with federal legislation with the New Forest Code.
5_1_criteria: Monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption is done through water analysis , presented during the audit and contamination of soil and water in the groups production units is verified.
5_2_criteria: Permanent Preservation Areas are defined on maps of the groups production units, with no evidence that the vegetation was removed or altered.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation and soil analysis are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the groups production units.
5_4_criteria: The monitoring record of pests and weeds found in the areas is done through a visit report, present in the agrarian cooperatives field notebook. Control snows are established in accordance with the EMBRAPA SOJA methodology.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical applications contain information such as purchased products, applied dose, installments, application dates and weather conditions. Storage follows the recommendations of NR 31.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the groups production units.
5_7_criteria: Biological agents are used in the groups production units.
5_8_criteria: To identify and monitor new invasive species and pests in the area, the group has a described procedure, citing research institutions such as Embrapa and Universities.
5_9_criteria: The conditions Atmospheric conditions such as wind, humidity and temperature before application are recorded in the pesticide application forms in the groups production units.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the production units of the group.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds are from reliable sources, according to the purchase invoices and Terms of Compliance presented.
