Name: CRESOL - Estrada de Ferro
1_1_criteria: The properties receive consultancy from accounting firms for the management of applicable legislation, as well as agricultural and environmental consultancy companies, and consultancy from Cresol itself. On each farm there is a folder made by Cresol, which contains various documents related to relevant guidelines and legislation. Cresol has its own technical teams, such as legal, accounting and technical teams in different areas of knowledge and provides support to members.
1_2_criteria: Property areas are duly registered through certificates, court decisions and contracts of lease.
1_3_criteria: All farms had non-conformities in this criterion, as it is related to indicator 4.1.1 on social and environmental impact assessment, which was also non-compliant in all farms. NC: 1.3.2 - There is no social and environmental assessment carried out, as well as identification of aspects to be improved.
2_1_criteria: Two of the audited farms do not have employees. In neither of the other two is there evidence of forced labor, forced labor, trafficking or involuntary labor in any way. There are no minors working on the audited farms. No evidence of discrimination of any kind was identified, nor was any evidence of punishment, coercion and aggression of any kind. On one of the farms, it was not possible to provide proof of return of the work card to the employee, despite there being no evidence of retention. NC: 2.1.2 - There is no declaration proving the return of CTPS.
2_2_criteria: On one of the farms that has workers, there are no employment contracts signed with them. On both farms that have workers, adequate and appropriate training in occupational health and safety is not carried out. The indicators of this criterion are not immediately compliant and will be verified in the next surveillance audit.
2_3_criteria: In general, owners and workers demonstrate knowledge of health and safety issues and the use of PPE. However, health and safety risks have not been identified and there are no procedures implemented to control them on farms. The farms do not have a documented health and safety program (PPRA/PCMSO, etc.) and there are no emergency procedures in place. Farms have access to first aid. On one of the farms audited, there was no evidence of training for the employee responsible for applying pesticides. PPE is available for employees, but no delivery records have been identified. NC: 2.3.3 - There is no evidence that the pesticide applicator has participated in training for this purpose. 2.3.4 - There is no record of delivery of PPE.
2_4_criteria: Through interviews with employees, it was evidenced that they are not prevented from interacting with external parties and have complete freedom to participate in collective negotiations, if any . Unions approve terminations of employment contracts.
2_5_criteria: Workers receive wages above or equal to the national minimum, proven by payslips and interviews. No worker receives payments based on results, everyone is salaried. No salary deductions are made, other than those provided for by law, such as INSS and union contributions. The farms have housing and/or accommodation for employees, and they are in good condition, including sanitary conditions. The farms do not charge any fees for housing. The normal working day on farms is 44 hours per week, and overtime is normally only worked during the harvest period. However, there is no way to prove that excessive hours are not worked as farms do not record working hours per worker. NC: 2.5.3 and 2.5.4 - There is no control over hours worked and overtime, and overtime must only be carried out for limited periods.
3_1_criteria: The audited farms are well known in local communities, and the farms publish their contact numbers.
3_2_criteria: No cases of disputes with traditional users regarding land use rights were identified. No permanent conservation areas or areas of high cultural value were identified near the farms. There are also no adjacent indigenous peoples.
3_3_criteria: There is a communication channel at group manager level, next to Cresol Estrada de Ferro in the city of Orizona/GO, but there is no mechanism for complaints and grievances within the farms. NC: 3.3.1 - There is no obvious mechanism for complaints and grievances on the property.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies on farms are advertised by word of mouth, and through referrals, always looking for workers in the region. Properties participate in events and field days. The owners participate in lectures and training by the Rural Union and SENAR in the region.
4_1_criteria: One of the audited farms participates in an Internship Program at an agricultural school in the municipality. The owners seek to purchase products and hire services from companies in the region, as evidenced in invoices.
4_2_criteria: The farms did not carry out a social and environmental assessment. Only one of the farms carried out an environmental assessment through an Environmental Management Plan. NC 4.1.1/4.1.2/4.1.3/4.1.5 - There is no social and environmental assessment carried out, as well as identification of the social, environmental and agricultural aspects that should be improved.
4_3_criteria: None of the audited farms burn on the property. Only one of the farms audited did not show non-compliance regarding the storage and disposal of hazardous waste such as fuel, burnt oil, batteries and light bulbs. Other waste is managed correctly. Farms in the municipality of SilvÃ¢nia separate and deliver recyclable waste to a recycling company, while farms in Orizona separate waste and deliver it to the municipal landfill. NC: 4.2.2 - Burnt oil stored incorrectly. There is no dedicated place to dispose of batteries and light bulbs. / Fuel tank not in accordance with technical standards
4_4_criteria: The farms do not record the total and direct use of fossil fuel, however this indicator is in compliance with the 3rd year. Most farms work with precision agriculture and all carry out complete soil analysis, including organic matter content. Contributing to increased carbon sequestration, Cresol has a partnership in which it makes seedlings available to producers who need to restore native forests. All properties planted native species in some areas for plant replacement. Two of the audited farms use solar energy to supply energy to irrigation pivots. Another farm has a project to implement a biodigester on the property.
4_5_criteria: All the farms reported that the area was opened before 2009, but in none of them it was possible to provide documentary evidence. NC: 4.4.1 - There are no maps delimiting areas of native vegetation, production areas and watercourses, as well as proving the non-conversion into cultivation areas and comparing with RTRS maps.
5_1_criteria: Only One of the farms has a map showing native vegetation, production areas and water courses. One of the farms has an Environmental Management Plan that guarantees the monitoring of vegetation and wildlife. There is no type of forestry extraction, hunting or collection of protected species on the properties. All farms have a CAR where the registered legal reserve areas are described, all with 19% or more native vegetation. NC: 4.5.1 - There are no maps indicating areas of native vegetation, production areas and water courses.
5_2_criteria: The properties use different techniques that define good agricultural practices, such as: direct planting, planting on level curves with terracing, in addition to pipes on the roadsides to store rainwater. On farms that carry out irrigation, water use is controlled according to the water demand required for each crop at a given stage, following technical recommendations. No wastewater is released into watercourses. Only one of the farms audited monitors and mitigates the quality of water resources, but this indicator is in compliance with the 3rd year. Most farms carry out water analysis.
5_3_criteria: Only one of the farms has a map identifying watercourses and native vegetation. The farms preserve the riparian forest and humid areas. NC: 5.2.1 - There are no maps indicating areas of native vegetation, production areas and watercourses.
5_4_criteria: The farms carry out annual soil analyzes, always after the safrinha harvest, for application purposes corrections and soil liming. Some farms use precision agriculture. Various techniques to preserve soil quality are practiced, such as: direct planting, level planting, terraced areas, crop rotation, in addition to maintaining permanent cover vegetation.
5_5_criteria: The farm owners demonstrate knowledge and already apply practices related to MIC, but on most farms there is no specific MIC plan documented and implemented. However, this indicator is not immediately compliant and will be verified in the next surveillance audit. The farms also do not have a specific plan that contains targets for reducing phytosanitary products, an indicator that will also be verified in the next surveillance audit. In all properties only use original and genuine agrochemical products that meet local registration requirements, as verified in invoices and application forms. Agrochemical applications are made in accordance with technical recommendations.
5_6_criteria: Farms record agrochemical applications. Producers have booklets with guidance on the practice of triple washing and demonstrate knowledge about this process. All farms showed non-compliance regarding the storage of empty agrochemical packaging. The storage of agrochemicals was also a non-compliant item on all audited farms, however this indicator is not immediately compliant and will be verified in the next surveillance audit. Farms install signs in sprayed areas informing about re-entry periods. Fertilizer applications are made according to technical recommendations based on soil analysis. NC: 5.5.2 - There is no deposit of empty packaging, nor is there a certificate demonstrating the return of empty packaging. / The empty packaging deposit does not comply with technical standards and is being used to store other materials. / Empty packaging is being stored in big bags in the yard and the empty packaging deposit is being used to store other materials.
5_7_criteria: Products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions are not used on the audited farms. The use of Paraquat is being abolished respecting the date of June/2017.
5_8_criteria: Two of the audited farms use biological control agents for soil and caterpillars, but only one of them keeps records of their use. However, this indicator is not immediately compliant.
5_9_criteria: The State of GoiÃ¡s has an agency called Agro Defesa that monitors and inspects properties for the purpose of controlling invasive species.
5_10_criteria: None of the farms audited have documented procedures that specify agricultural practices related to the application of agrochemicals. However, this indicator is not immediately compliant. No aerial application of agrochemicals is carried out on any of the audited farms. The areas of land application of agrochemicals are adjacent to other crops, with no residences closer than 30 m. Likewise, the watercourses are protected by APP areas.
5_11_criteria: The soybean seeds used by the farms are acquired from legally known quality sources. There is no cultivation or use of own-produced seeds.

Name: Fazenda Pau Furado
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to documentation evaluation, on-site verification, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety and agricultural laws are respected and complied with.

Emergency procedures available and understood by employees, it was identified that the risks relating to the supply of flammable liquids are covered in the PPRA and periodic exams (Rural Worker/Driver) were carried out and updated and the ASOs were updated with all the exams described in the PCMSO for some functions that previously did not have such specifications (Farm Manager and Rural Worker/Driver).
2_4_criteria: Workers are free to join any organization, however, there is no active union in the region.
2_5_criteria: The remuneration is compatible with national legislation, the pay slips detail the salary and deductions, there were no irregular deductions. Leaves such as vacations, illnesses, leaves, among others are respected. Hours worked are recorded using a time clock, overtime occurs within the limit permitted by legislation.
3_1_criteria: annuals of communication and dialogue, publicized through signs on the farm.
3_2_criteria: There are no indigenous peoples and places with cultural importance in the areas of influence of the audited farm.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and grievances are checked monthly and responses are passed on to DDS for employees in general. At the entrance to the farm there are signs with telephone numbers available for community contact and complaints.
3_4_criteria: Job opportunities are advertised locally by employees and also by the external company Promove, which has a portal that recruits and selects employees. employees. The farm contributes financial aid to adapt a municipal school in the region and social actions through the cooperative. Offers of goods and services are offered.
4_1_criteria: Evaluation carried out in a comprehensive manner, through the report presented, carried out by the environmental department of Cooperativa FrÃ­sia, where points of improvement were identified, covering social and environmental points of the farm. comprehensive and clear manner.
4_2_criteria: Storage locations for fuel, lubricants, among others, are located in areas with waterproof floors and containment for protection in case of accidental leaks. Soil organic matter is monitored and measures are taken for improvement, in addition the producer uses crops: millet, corn, wheat, oats and carries out everything such as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_3_criteria: Fuel recording is done manually at the pump and then passed on to the Administrative Manager. Information on the volume per hectare and per unit of product monitored in all activities related to soybean production can be obtained. Several mechanisms and opportunities for carbon sequestration are implemented.
4_4_criteria: As of May 2009, there has been no cleaning or conversion of areas included in Category 1 of maps 3 and there has been no land conversion after 2016, it was presented report with satellite images that demonstrates a comparison between the years 2016 and 2020 and shows that there was no area conversion after 04/2016
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained in accordance with federal law, evidenced by
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices implemented, crop rotation practices, direct planting in straw, fertilization and correction according to technical calculation, containment areas for storing chemical products and carrying out water analyzes as monitoring. Erosion prevention measures are carried out, such as contour lines and always keeping the soil covered, as well as appropriate structures used to contain chemicals. Contamination of groundwater was not verified, according to monitoring analysis reports presented. Irrigation management procedures and systems are implemented through the ICROP program that performs calculations using data entered from monitoring meteorological data and soil moisture for irrigation application. A grant of abstraction water for irrigation, issued by the Secretariat of Environment and Water Resources, was also presented.
5_2_criteria: The watercourses and APPs are mapped. The socio-environmental diagnosis document demonstrates that the APP areas are being recovered throughout the property through natural regeneration. There is also an Environmental Diagnosis carried out by the cooperative, which includes APP areas, evidenced by checking maps, field visits and images of the farm.
5_3_criteria: The organic matter of the monitored soil, was evidenced through an interview with the technical manager and document from the company that carries out the samples and analyzes of soil analysis data for management through graphs and implementation of precision agriculture. Practices are carried out to improve soil quality such as: Crop rotation, soil analysis with fertilization through precision agriculture, maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting. The farm uses level planting, contour lines and direct planting to prevent erosion.
5_4_criteria: The farm has a document "Procedure for Good Agricultural Practices and Integrated Crop Management" and there are records of pest monitoring in the document standard called "Monitoring of pests in soybean cultivation", in addition, the farm uses other control methods, in addition to chemical ones, which are: varietal, chemical, physiological and biological - BT. Pest monitoring records are carried out by the farm.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical use records contain the requested data. Properly carried out storage and disposal location, all empty agrochemical packaging is triple washed, perforated at the bottom and stored until sent to destination. The storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. The use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the farm.
5_8_criteria: The owners of the farm informed that the agency SIDAGO - Agrodefesa carries out a visit to the property.
5_9_criteria: Procedure "Good Agricultural Practices" and the ANDEF manual Good agricultural practices in field were available. Meteorological records are carried out. Aerial applications are not carried out.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds are purchased from reputable sources, as per verification of seed purchase invoices and terms of compliance.

Name: Bom Jesus Agropecuaria Ltda
1_1_criteria: Evidenced that the applicable legislation is being complied with, according to the evaluation of documentation, verification of photos and videos, interviews with employees and farm managers, that labor, environmental health and safety and agricultural laws are respected and complied with .
1_2_criteria: Legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land registrations and title deeds.
1_3_criteria: Aspects have been identified and continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, showing the farms commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard. The Socio-Environmental Assessment contains the points analyzed and the proposed control and mitigation actions, as well as the assessment of their effectiveness.
2_1_criteria: Adequate working conditions, payment receipts in accordance with the activity carried out with employees of the farm, training for the functions, in addition to adequate benefits and evidenced the absence of discounts on pay slips that are not in the legislation. No evidence of aggression or disrespect was seen in the work environments with the videos presented, or heard during the interview with workers on the propertys work fronts and work structures. No children under the age of 18 were identified working on the farms.
2_2_criteria: All workers have a contract that specifies their working conditions, as do service providers, evident in the grain harvesting and transportation sector and the cafeteria. Registration forms, employment contract, pay slips, union collective agreement and code of conduct. All documents are available in language that is easy for workers to understand. Integration training, attendance list, course certificates, and interviews with employees on the work fronts, it was possible to verify knowledge of health and safety standards at work.
2_3_criteria: The workers and those responsible for the operation demonstrated knowledge on health and safety at work through integration training, receive a copy of the integration manual, code of conduct and DDS included. The PPRA and PCMSO were presented addressing the risks and measures to mitigate and control them. Training was carried out for functions that present potential risk. The company has a system of warnings and sanctions for workers who do not comply with the requirements. The company has a Code of Conduct and Integration Manual, which is available to all employees at the time of integration. The farms have emergency procedures, with work instructions and signs with telephones and radio extensions for contacting rescue entities, people trained in first aid, first aid kits and stretchers and vehicles available.
2_4_criteria: No any type of prohibition regarding the employees right to join an organization of their choice was evidenced. Such affiliation is at the discretion of the employee, who, if they choose to pay, will do so spontaneously and directly to the categorys union. The company has a collective union agreement, but does not oblige anyone to join. Workers have the right to integrate with available external parties.
2_5_criteria: Employees payment records on payslips were available. There is no evidence of payment of wages lower than the national minimum or defined in a union collective agreement, according to sampled pay slips. Pay stubs describe wages paid and wage deductions. There are only deductions for taxes, health and dental insurance. For benefits there is an authorization, informing employees and also requesting their permission for the appropriate deduction. Normal working hours do not exceed 48 hours per week, and overtime does not exceed 12 hours per week. Extra working hours per worker are voluntary, communicated and paid, following the DSR. The houses and accommodation are in good condition and provide all basic living conditions. There are water potability reports, carried out every six months in the independent external laboratory. There is no charge for food and housing
3_1_criteria: Communication with the community is established, since Grupo Bom Jesus is known in the community and they have a website available to everyone, as well as signs available outside the farm, with the communication channels.
3_2_criteria: Absence of traditional land users and disputes over the right to use them.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and grievances are constantly verified by the internal team through the ombudsman channel and line of conduct.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised internally and local collaboration programs are being carried out.
4_1_criteria: Socio-environmental assessment was developed by a multidisciplinary team and measures to minimize impacts are defined.
4_2_criteria: Actions to minimize impacts are being taken, such as reuse and recycling of materials, through selective collection and all hazardous waste in the groups production units are stored appropriately, for environmentally correct disposal .
4_3_criteria: Control of diesel oil consumption was presented, the use of fuel increases only during planting and harvesting, being within the established limits for culture and direct planting techniques, precision agriculture and agricultural planning are also used that reduces the number of activities. Soil organic matter levels are monitored through annual soil analyzes and production maps, according to the Excel sample table for the 2019/2020 harvest, in addition to using direct planting practices that promote the maintenance of organic matter in the soil. Opportunities to increase carbon sequestration were highlighted during the audit, such as the conservation of native areas in legal reserve areas, as well as APP areas, remaining isolated forests and reforestation, in addition to using techniques such as direct planting and crop rotation.
4_4_criteria: There are no planting areas outside the requirements of indicator 4.4.1, it was evidenced through maps and overlay of satellite images that soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of areas considered as AAVC.
4_5_criteria: Hunting is not practiced on the property. Native vegetation on the farm is above 10%, in accordance with federal legislation with the New Forest Code of 2012. The company is based on the CAR to monitor and adapt the environmental areas of interest in accordance with current legislation, which can be evidenced by the implementation of PRAD's on farms, in order to correct the correct environmental area surrounding the APPs.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices are carried out daily, protecting soil and water from contamination. Evidenced through erosion control practices such as direct planting, contour lines, location for correct storage of fertilizers, agricultural pesticides, other contaminating residues from vehicle washers, and groundwater analyzes to monitor water used for human consumption. No evidence of water contamination was observed during the audit due to any agricultural process. Procedures were presented to identify social and environmental aspects and impacts, with mitigation and control measures such as monitoring groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption through analysis, within the potability standards of water for human consumption. There is no irrigation in the production unit
5_2_criteria: Mapping of watercourses identified. Evidenced through maps and satellite images that there is conservation of existing areas of environmental interest, with no removal, but the company is based on the CAR to monitor and adapt the environmental areas of interest in accordance with current legislation, which can be evidenced by the implementation of PRAD's on farms, in order to correct the correct environmental area surrounding the APPs.
5_3_criteria: They are used appropriate techniques to improve soil quality. Actions to control erosion such as direct planting, promoting the maintenance of plant residues on the soil, which helps to avoid surface runoff, promoting the infiltration of rainwater and the use of machines with tires and treadmills, are highlighted through maps and interviews. wide, which reduces the compaction area, better distributing the force exerted by the surface in contact with the ground. Crop rotation is a recommended agricultural practice carried out every year for each new harvest, where crops such as corn, soybeans, cotton, brachiaria, millet and sunn hemp rotate with soybeans, due to several factors, one of the main ones being the breaking of the cycle. pests and diseases, providing better conditions for crop development. This process is part of the companys harvest plan.
5_4_criteria: There is a plan for integrated crop management (MIC) documented and implemented. During the audit, only original products registered for soybean cultivation were evidenced in the pesticide application reports, product purchase invoices and also in storage. Agricultural pesticide applications follow the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Responsible for the production unit. All products are purchased with agronomic prescriptions. A rotation of active ingredients and selective products for pest control is carried out and a mixing order is followed, in accordance with current legislation.
5_5_criteria: Product storage location is adequate. Product application record is complete. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas and the use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: There is no use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam conventions. Paraquat was not used in the last harvest (2019/2020). The list of products used, purchase invoices and application orders was presented.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Eng. Agr. Responsible for the unit. There is the use of biological products on the farm.
5_8_criteria: In case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact MAPA and FundaÃ§Ã£o MT.
5_9_criteria: Applications are carried out remotely of populated areas and protection areas.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: Aliança da Terra Gestora - Grupo IV
1_1_criteria: The groups production and management units demonstrated knowledge of the legislation applicable to their core activity during the audit.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds
1_3_criteria: The group manager together with the production units are implementing corrective actions arising from internal audits for continuous improvement, thus showing the companys commitment and evolution in meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other involuntary work was found during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees in the groups production units .
2_2_criteria: Own workers or third parties receive training and relevant information about each function to be performed and the rights and duties of both parties are defined in the employment contracts and code of conduct in the groups production units.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety information is documented and transmitted to employees during Onboarding or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations in the groups production units
2_4_criteria: There is no evidence that prevents workers from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment of their presence in the groups production units.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that the salaries paid in the company are higher than the salary national minimum, with no salary differences between employees of the same category in the groups production units.
3_1_criteria: Communication channels are available internally through suggestion boxes in the production units and externally on the website and publicity on boards available at the entrance to the production units, made by the Group Manager.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. The property ownership documentation such as registration and deed were presented and are in accordance with the legal requirements applicable in the groups production units.
3_3_criteria: Complaint mechanisms are available internally through suggestion boxes in the production units. production and externally on the website and publicity on signs available at the entrance of the production units, made by the Group Manager.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are opened in local cities verbally for the groups production units.
4_1_criteria: There was no major construction impact observed during this initial audit at the groups production units
4_2_criteria: The group manager is standardizing adaptation measures to minimize pollution such as reuse and recycling of materials , through selective collection and all petroleum derivatives in the groups production units.
4_3_criteria: The groups units record fuel in general. Fertilization is carried out according to soil analyses, where organic matter is also monitored. Areas of environmental interest are maintained and preserved in the groups production units.
4_4_criteria: There was no agricultural expansion within the farms after 2009, evidenced through satellite images in the groups production units.
4_5_criteria: Areas of environmental interest are respected and conserved by the administration of the groups production units.
5_1_criteria: The production units do not release wastewater or residential water into natural watercourses. Evidenced through erosion control practices such as direct planting, containment and impermeable areas where there is chemical product management and groundwater analysis to monitor water used for human consumption and agricultural processes.
5_2_criteria: Preservation Areas Permanent are defined on maps of the groups production units, with no evidence that vegetation was removed or altered.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, the use of contour lines and analysis of soil are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the groups production units.
5_4_criteria: Pest monitoring is carried out to determine the application of pesticides, only when necessary, in addition to using direct planting, fertilization green and crop rotation which are also practices used to reduce pest infestation in the groups production units, through the MIC.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical applications contain information such as products purchased, dose applied, plots, and application dates, requiring improvement. The storage, collection and disposal of empty packaging is being carried out at the groups production units.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found at the groups production units.
5_7_criteria: The use of traditional biological agents on a small scale can be done in the groups production units.
5_8_criteria: To identify and monitor new invasive species and pests in the area, the applicant maintains verbal contact with resellers and group manager, who have contacts with research institutes such as Embrapa.
5_9_criteria: Atmospheric conditions such as wind, humidity and temperature before application are partially recorded in the groups production units.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the groups production units.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through purchase from well-known companies that issue proof of origin in the production units of the group.

Name: Associacao Clube Amigos da Terra -CAT Sorriso
1_1_criteria: Producers demonstrate knowledge of applicable laws and stay up to date through external advice from companies and qualified technical professionals. Compliance with laws was verified on the audited farms, such as, for example, Rural Environmental Registry; health and safety training; employees receive the minimum salary established for the category and enjoy 30 days of paid vacation, among others.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through registrations and lease contracts on all farms audited.
1_3_criteria: The group manager carried out socio-environmental assessments of the farms before they were included in the group, from which improvements to be implemented were identified. Improvements are monitored in annual internal audits.
2_1_criteria: None of the audited farms found signs of forced, imposed, forced, trafficked or involuntary labor. There is no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on farms are not obliged to work on the properties and when they did work, it was verified that they were given an opportunity. There are no children under 15 working on the farms. All hired employees are over 18 years old. Through interviews with employees, it was evident that there is no evidence of discrimination. Verified through payment slips, there is no salary distinction for operators performing the same functions. When there is a salary difference, it is due to greater experience in the role. Training, benefits and promotion opportunities are provided equally among employees. There is also no evidence of punishment, coercion or aggression of any kind on the audited farms
2_2_criteria: All employees on the audited farms are registered. The farms have Employment Contracts or notes in the employees CTPS, describing all pertinent information. Workers receive instructions on how to carry out their activities at the time of hiring. The four audited farms have health and safety advice and the contracted company instructs employees on safe work issues, as well as carrying out inspections to verify the implementation of the guidelines.
2_3_criteria: All audited farms have PPRA/PCMSO or PGSSMATR, where health and safety risks are identified, as well as mitigation and control measures. In interviews, workers demonstrated knowledge and understanding of issues related to health and safety. The health of workers is monitored through medical examinations upon admission, periodically and upon dismissal. Dangerous tasks are only carried out by qualified and trained personnel. Farms provide and register Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) for employees. The use of PPE and compliance with safety requirements by workers is supervised by health and safety consultancy companies. Verified that in case of non-compliance, warnings are applied. Farms have procedures in place for accidents and emergencies that are visible to workers. All farms have first aid kits and vehicles available for transportation of any sick or injured workers.
2_4_criteria: In all audited farms, it was verified through interviews that workers are free to join professional associations of their own. choose and participate in collective agreement negotiations. All farms audited follow the 2019/2021 Collective Labor Agreement, signed between the Rural Workers Union of Sorriso and the Rural Union of Sorriso. The majority of employees did not opt for union contributions, due to the lack of action by trade unions, according to reports obtained in interviews.
2_5_criteria: On all farms audited, salaries paid or indirectly have at least equal remuneration. by respecting the minimum wage established at the rate provided for in national legislation and sectoral agreements. Collective Labor Agreement. Verified payment slips demonstrate that only deductions provided for by law or symbolic amounts for meals and housing are applied to farm employee payments. Salaries are paid monthly and payment receipts are filed by the farms. The working day on farms is 44 hours per week, with occasional overtime, especially during harvest times, which does not exceed 12 hours per week. Hours worked are recorded on most audited farms. Only one farm does not record the hours worked and overtime, which led to non-compliance in indicator 2.5.3; 2.5.4; 2.5.5. In interviews, workers on all farms reported that overtime is voluntary. Overtime worked is paid or deducted via time bank. Only on one of the farms audited were there cases of workers on maternity leave. Employers demonstrate that they are aware of their right to it. Verified that the residences and accommodation for farm employees are adequate, with energy, septic tank and water. The water used for human consumption is drinkable, and potability analyzes are carried out on all audited farms.
3_1_criteria: Communication channels with farms include telephone, e-mail and suggestion boxes available at headquarters and at the group managers office. The properties have signs at the entrances, informing the telephone numbers of the farms or the group manager. Verified through interviews that the communication channels are known and allow adequate communication between producers and local communities.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes regarding the rights to use the properties lands, as well as there is no evidence of existence of traditional users of the properties lands.
3_3_criteria: The farms have suggestion/complaint boxes at the headquarters and in the group managers office. Any complaints are recorded by the manager in an individual notebook for each member of the group. If complaints are received, they will be analyzed and subsequently dealt with, as provided for in the Group Management Procedures, prepared by the manager. To date, there have been no complaints or complaints received.
3_4_criteria: Verified that job opportunities are filled through referrals from current employees, publicity from Sindicato Rural de Sorriso The group manager collaborates with the training of the population local, promoting lectures and technical visits in the region where the farms are located. In addition, the owners of the audited farms, whenever possible, contribute to festivities at the local church, APAE (Association of Parents and Friends of the Exceptional) of Sorriso or make the property headquarters available for training and field days.
4_1_criteria: The farms have a Socio-Environmental Diagnosis developed by the manager, which is based on national legislation and RTRS Principles
4_2_criteria: Verified that no fires are carried out on any of the audited farms. Most of the waste is properly disposed of by the farms, however non-conformities were identified in one of the farms audited in indicator 4.2.4, as the farm buries biological waste. Non-compliance was also identified in item 4.2.3 on one of the audited farms, due to the lack of adequate structure to prevent fossil fuel spills and a supply lane with an adequate effluent treatment system.
4_3_criteria: The audited farms record the use of fossil fuels and monitor the organic matter content by carrying out soil analyses. The properties adopt practices that contribute to increasing soil carbon sequestration, such as: adopting direct planting systems, cultivating soil cover species, maintaining native vegetation and planting eucalyptus. All farms have a documented Solid Waste Management Plan, developed by the group manager, detailing all areas and waste generated on the farm, and subsequent destination.
4_4_criteria: In none of the audited farms were recent area openings made , as verified by satellite images comparing the areas in 2008 and 2019.
4_5_criteria: Property maps indicate native vegetation, production areas and watercourses. From the comparative maps of areas in 2008 and 2019, it is possible to identify that native vegetation has been maintained on all properties. The properties prohibit hunting activities, and there is no extraction of wood or any other native product. All audited farms have above 10% native vegetation.
5_1_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as, for example, use of correctives and fertilizers only in accordance with the technical recommendations; cultivation of species for cover; adoption of the direct planting system; construction of contour lines in slope areas. Analyzes are carried out on all audited farms to monitor water quality. Only one of the audited farms uses irrigation and follows the procedure regarding the application of best practices and compliance with legislation.
5_2_criteria: The farms identify on maps the location of watercourses, as well as the status of riparian vegetation. Verified on site and through maps of the farms that are maintained permanent preservation areas duly isolated and preserved.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality monitoring is carried out through annual analyzes carried out in the laboratory. Soil quality is preserved on all audited farms through the adoption of practices such as the adoption of a direct planting system and the use of fertilizers in accordance with the needs of the area and technical recommendations. In sloped areas, the verified farms build contour lines as a way of minimizing erosion processes. Farms carry out succession of crops. There is no cultivation of soybeans on soybeans, the sanitary void period of the state in which the farms are located is respected.
5_4_criteria: The farms have a MIC Â– Integrated Crop Management plan, prepared by the manager where the use of preventive and control methods that cause less environmental impact. The farm owners demonstrated science in using products classified with lower toxicity and, whenever possible, rotate active ingredients. The document Plan for the Reduction and Use of Phytosanitary Products, prepared by CAT Sorriso at group level, describes the good practices carried out on farms. Non-compliance was identified in indicator 5.4.5 on two of the farms audited, due to the lack of monitoring records for insect pests, diseases, weeds and natural enemies. Verified that the farms only use agrochemicals permitted for soybean cultivation and in the dosages prescribed by those responsible, as evidenced in the deposits and records of agrochemical use.
5_5_criteria: All audited farms record the use of pesticides, however, on the four farms audited, the records do not include all required items such as the names of the dosers/applicators, the identification of the application equipment used, nor the weather conditions during applications, which led to non-conformities in indicator 5.5.1. On all farms, empty packaging is washed at the time of application and delivered to reception centers. Most farms have an empty packaging deposit in compliance, however three farms audited had non-compliance in indicator 5.5.2, due to the deposit not being locked with a padlock and having an opening that allows animals access. One of the farms audited had a non-conformity in indicator 5.5.3, due to the pesticide deposit not having a containment system for possible spills. Another farm audited also had non-compliance in this same item, however, due to the warehouse having openings that allow access to animals. On all audited farms, areas treated with pesticides are demarcated with signposts. Recommendations for the use of corrective agents and fertilizers are made by agronomists.
5_6_criteria: The farms do not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. One of the audited farms still uses Paraquat and does not have any documented plan to gradually reduce its use by 2020, which generated non-conformity in indicator 5.6.2.
5_7_criteria: Not all audited farms use biological control agents, but demonstrate knowledge about their use.
5_8_criteria: If an outbreak of new pests occurs, the audited farms reported that they resort to institutions such as EMBRAPA, APROSOJA-MT, INDEA and the Sindicato Rural DE Sorriso .
5_9_criteria: Measures implemented by farms to prevent drift include monitoring weather conditions during applications, only carrying them out under appropriate conditions, in addition to the use of correctly calibrated spraying equipment, as provided for in the MIC document\ x96 Integrated Crop Management, prepared by the group manager. One of the farms presented non-compliance in item 5.9.2 for not recording the observed climatic conditions.
5_10_criteria: The production systems adopted by the farms are similar to the neighboring systems. There is no history of damage to neighboring areas caused by drift from the audited properties.
5_11_criteria: None of the farms produce their own seeds. They all acquire from legally known sources, as verified in purchase invoices.

Name: Fazenda Agrícola Dourado S.A
1_1_criteria: The company follows and has access to applicable legislation, demonstrated by employees and relevant documents. Action plans are currently followed within an established deadline to fully comply with legislation and good business practices.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as property registrations.
1_3_criteria: The indicators selected for continuous monitoring and improvement are in accordance with the RTRS requirements. Continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, showing the companys commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor was found during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and pertinent information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the agricultural unit.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that workers Salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees.
3_1_criteria: Communication exists with the community, with signs and information containing emails telephones, postal addresses on the roads between the community and the farms with written advertising signs Â“contact us Â” and internally on the farm through Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the worker point control, cafeteria, accommodation, etc.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the area evaluated. Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: A complaints, complaints and grievances mechanism is made available, which establishes a procedure for recording and handling complaints, through a complaints and grievances form, available in the production units, knowledge about this mechanism is given to all interested parties.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the production unit and internal vacancies on the farms and advertised through the employees themselves in the local community, Supply of products and services to the local community, in However, there is no collaboration with training programs aimed at the local population to date.
4_1_criteria: Initial social and environmental assessment was carried out before the first certification audit. The immediate items for the first year are being met.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging is carried out appropriately. The practice of recycling and reuse in the production unit such as selective waste collection, separation by type of material and correct disposal of waste to third parties in the local community. The disposal of contaminated waste is being carried out appropriately.
4_3_criteria: The unit promotes actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and organic matter in the soil is monitored, in addition to techniques such as crop rotation and direct planning.
4_4_criteria: Evidenced through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation .
4_5_criteria: There are maps on the farm identifying the watercourses. However, to date there is no plan being implemented and monitored to ensure that native vegetation and wildlife are maintained.
5_1_criteria: Areas of environmental interest are respected and conserved by the farm administration. Hunting and fishing are also prohibited.
5_2_criteria: Monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption is carried out through water analysis, where soil contamination is verified, in addition to good practices preventive measures such as handling, storing and disposing of waste originating on farms, in order to avoid contamination of surface and underground water.
5_3_criteria: Practices to improve soil quality are used: crop rotation, soil analysis with balanced fertilization and maintenance of crop residues on the soil surface through direct planting, on the farm.
5_4_criteria: There is no documented and implemented MIC plan addressing the use of prevention and other biological, non-chemical or chemical controls selects.
5_5_criteria: Pesticide application records are made manually and subsequently recorded in the system, however, meteorological conditions during the application of agrochemicals are not being recorded. Storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: During field verification at the front of agrochemical application, retroactive application records and storage. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found.
5_7_criteria: No evidence of the use of biological control agents was found.
5_8_criteria: In case of incidences of new pests or invasive species the company will contact available research bodies.
5_9_criteria: There are documented procedures that specify good agricultural practices, however, meteorological conditions during spraying operations are not being recorded.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Organization: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação
Name: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação LTDA. Grupo III
1_1_criteria: The farms have access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of legislation and relevant documents were available.
