1_3_criteria: Continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, defined indicators and monitoring, showing the groups commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard. according to the assessment required in 4.1.1.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor was found during the audit process in the work environments or heard during interviews with employees of the audited farms.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and relevant information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the agricultural unit.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that workers Salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as website containing emails, telephones, postal address on farm roads with advertising signs written Â“contact usÂ” containing telephone number and the Cerquality website and internally on the scope farms through the Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the worker point control.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area . The documentation of ownership of the property, such as registration and lease agreement, has been presented and is in accordance with the applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: A mechanism for complaints, suggestions and grievances is made available, which establishes a procedure for recording and handling complaints, through a complaints and complaints form, available at the production units, information about this mechanism is made available to all interested parties.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the farms and vacancies are advertised through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fills out the job application, having their CV archived. There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the scope farms, carried out by the farms and monitored by Cerquality.
4_1_criteria: The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified for each farm within the certification scope. Studies are available upon request.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging appropriately. There is an Environmental Management Plan presented during the audit that covers waste management including all areas of the property.
4_3_criteria: The farms promote actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and monitored organic matter in the soil.
4_4_criteria: It has been shown through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling the areas of preservation and legal reserve, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and groundwater."
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, Cerquality presented detailed maps of all farms with indication of riparian vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farms' CAR.
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analyses, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion and rotation control techniques of crops are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: Farms use suitable products to control pests and diseases. IPMs (Integrated Pest Management) and plans to reduce the use of chemical products are implemented.
5_5_criteria: Storage and transport of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas. Pesticide application records are made manually and subsequently recorded in the system.
5_6_criteria: Retroactive application records, invoices for purchase and storage of products were checked. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of Paraquat on farms within the scope of certification was not evidenced
5_7_criteria: There is the use of biological control agents on the groups farms on an experimental basis.
5_8_criteria: Methodology presented to identify and monitor introduced new pests and invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. There were no incidences of new pests that were not identified, according to the records presented.
5_9_criteria: Drift control procedures were presented for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water, as well as other precautions in application of pesticides.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: Agricola Xingu S.A
1_1_criteria: According to the interview, with those responsible for the SGI and Insurance sectors, Innovation and Development Coordination, and Human Resources Coordination - HR), all demonstrated knowledge and updating of current applicable legislation. AgrÃ­cola and environmental. The HSE sector is responsible for monitoring and following up on communications regarding changes to legislation. During the audit, it was possible to demonstrate compliance with legislation, through the evaluation of documents such as Rural Environmental Registration (CAR), Environmental Licensing, Water Use Grants, Return of Empty Packaging, Disposal of Hazardous Waste, NR 31, Labor Legislation, among others. applicable to the standard. The right to use the land was evidenced through the documentary evaluation of the Certificates of Entire Content issued by the General Property Registry Office
1_2_criteria: of the Bahia Property and Mortgage Registry Office. The land use documents are presented in accordance with legislation
1_3_criteria: According to the documentary evaluation of PROC-XG-SSMA-010 - SOCIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT PROCEDURE, the indicators to be improved and monitored: 1st EMISSIONS OF CO2: ton. /CO2; CRITERIA 1.3 - There is ELECTRICAL ENERGY CONSUMPTION: kWh; continuous improvement with WATER CONSUMPTION: m3; in relation to requirements SOLID WASTE GENERATION: Kg; of this standard RELATIONSHIP PLAN WITH NEIGHBOR COMMUNITY: %. For each indicator, documents were evaluated that prove the monitoring and evaluation of continuous improvement.
2_1_criteria: According to visual verification, and through interviews with employees, there is no evidence of forced, imposed, forced, trafficked labor or in any other involuntary manner, nor from employee documentation retained with employers, nor from employees wives being required to work on the property, there are no workers under the age of 18 on the property. All workers have the opportunity for promotion within the group. According to visual verification and through interviews, there is no evidence of corporal punishment, coercion and physical or mental aggression, physical or verbal abuse, sexual harassment or any other type of intimidation of workers.
2_2_criteria: Evidenced through of documentary evaluation of employees and outsourced workers, which all have a written contract in clear language. It is evidenced through documentary evaluation and through interviews that all employees and outsourced workers receive training due and appropriate to the functions they perform.
2_3_criteria: According to the interview carried out with employees, everyone demonstrates knowledge of health and safety standards. Several DDS and training records were highlighted, reinforcing the mandatory use of PPE: MANDATORY USE OF PPE IN THE DEFENSIVE WAREHOUSE; USE OF WASHABLE MASKS; PREVENTION AGAINST CORONA VIRUS, SIGNAGE AT THE POINT AND IN THE CANTINA, SOCIAL DISTANCING AND SCREENING OF THIRD PARTIES; XINGU CODE OF CONDUCT; HAND PROTECTION; IMPORTANCE OF LIFE AND USE OF EPIS; USE OF MASKS, USE OF SEAT BELT AND SAFETY MEASURES WITH VEHICLES; USE OF PPE AND CORRECT HANDLING OF PPE. Evidenced Health and Safety Service Order, containing safety instructions for carrying out activities, as well as informing the necessary PPE, duly signed by the employee.
2_4_criteria: Evidenced through an interview with employees that the farm allows the union holds meetings with employees, and also allows all employees to attend meetings. This information is also included in the Code of Conduct.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that the wages paid at the property are consistent with what is established in the union agreement and collective agreement, with no salary differences between employees of the same category in the production units of the group, there are no salary deductions for disciplinary purposes as assessed in the payroll.
3_1_criteria: Visually and documentedly evidenced, the communication channels are available internally with employees and externally with third parties and stakeholders.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users were identified, and no disputes over land use were identified on the assessed property. The property ownership documentation such as registration and deed were presented and are in accordance with the applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and complaints mechanism implemented and accessible to local community complaints and grievances, with due treatment and feedback to the complainants.
3_4_criteria: The majority of employees are from the regions where the farm is located. According to a consultation carried out with the stakeholder, he reported that whenever there is an opportunity for vacancies for the AgrÃ­cola Xingu farm, the HR sector informs him and authorizes him to publicize it to interested parties in the municipality and region. Evidence of the groups collaboration with training programs open to the population and opportunities for local companies to supply goods and services according to budgets and contracts presented.
4_1_criteria: According to documentary evaluation, PROC-XG-SSMA-010 is evidenced - SOCIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT PROCEDURE, where the impacts are assessed: CO2 EMISSIONS; ELECTRIC POWER CONSUMPTION; WATER CONSUMPTION; GENERATION OF SOLID WASTE and RELATIONSHIP PLAN WITH THE NEIGHBOR COMMUNITY. CRITERIA 4.1 - Social and environmental impacts on and off site have been assessed and appropriate measures have been taken to minimize and mitigate any negative impacts. Also highlighted is the SOCIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT SUMMARY REPORT, which contains the results of monitoring indicators from 2018 to date, the goals established for 2020.
4_2_criteria: According to visual assessment during the visit to the property, they were not Areas with remnants of fires were identified, and throughout the farm there are signs prohibiting fires. The property has a machine and vehicle supply center CRITERION 4.2 - Pollution is equipped with fuel tanks in compliance with the minimized standard and technical waste, containment dike and supply ramp with production channels containment, separation boxes and decantation. They have a responsible control center. waste disposal, where all recyclable and hazardous waste is stored, for subsequent correct disposal. Sewage is dumped into a septic tank. AgrÃ­cola where Fuel, Lubricant and Maintenance of all agricultural operations on the farm are monitored, including planting, spraying, soil preparation, harvesting, per hectare. Evidenced through the GATEC system is the record of the volume carried out. The Farm works with precision agriculture and carries out soil analyzes to monitor the organic matter content in the soil. The farm is reforesting 132 hectares with 55 thousand seedlings of native species, in addition, there is an area on the farm intended for the propagation of seedlings that will be planted in areas of the farm that are unused for agricultural activities.
4_3_criteria: According to an interview with the Innovation and Development Coordinator - Production, crop planning is carried out using the Operations Planning Worksheet, which monitors fuel, lubricants and maintenance for all the farm's agricultural operations, including planting, spraying, soil preparation and harvesting, by hectare. Evidenced through the GATEC system is the record of the volume carried out. The farm works with precision agriculture and carries out soil analysis to monitor the content of organic matter in the soil. The farm is reforesting 132 hectares with 55,000 seedlings of native species, and there is also an area on the farm for propagating seedlings that will be planted in areas of the farm that are disused for agricultural activities.
4_4_criteria: According to the comparison of the propertys production areas on the RTRS maps of priority areas with the Google Earth timeline, it was possible to CRITERION 4.4 - Expansion to verify that the areas identified as priorities were already open since soybean cultivation is in 2009, thus being in compliance with the RTRS standard. According to the responsible documentary evaluation through overlapping the areas of the farm registrations that will be certified with the RTRS maps, it was found that there was no opening of the registration area to be certified after 2016.
4_5_criteria: According to the documentary evaluation, a map of the property was presented, counting the legal reserve areas, Permanent Protection Areas and the mapping of the propertys watercourses. To ensure that native vegetation and wildlife are maintained, the ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAM Â– BA UNITS - DEPARTMENT OF SAFETY, HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT - PROC-XG- SSMA-006 was created. The property prohibits any type of forestry extraction, hunting or collection of protected species, highlighted by several points with signs prohibiting hunting and fishing within the property. : Environmental Crime. Total preserved area 33,722.1 hectares.
5_1_criteria: The property uses several techniques that define good agricultural practices and that promote the conservation of water resources, such as crop rotation, with soybeans placed in the field, shortly after the removal of cotton, thus reducing the application of fertilizers and soil correction. Pest control is carried out using biological products and natural predators. During the visit, contour lines and terraces were identified to prevent surface runoff. The farm also carries out meteorological monitoring, in order to avoid applications when rain is forecast. The areas of the property auditee does not have irrigation.
5_2_criteria: According to documentary and visual evaluation, through kml file (Google Earth) and the map of the property, counting the legal reserve areas, Permanent Protection Areas and the mapping of water courses of the property, during a visit to the farm areas, it was identified that natural humid areas are preserved and are not drained.
5_3_criteria: AgrÃ­cola Xingu carries out monitoring through a specialized technical company, where the traceability of collections of soil samples and based on the samples, physical, chemical and biological fertility maps are prepared, subsequently a study is carried out with fertility and productivity maps and an intelligent recommendation is made based on the needs of the crop, application at 100% rate variable precision agriculture. According to a visual assessment during a visit to the propertys areas, it was identified that the farm uses terraces and contour lines to avoid surface erosion, in addition to having good straw on the soil, level planting and other conservation management practices.
5_4_criteria: Through an interview with the Property Manager and also through documentary evaluation of the application orders, it was possible to identify that biological pest control is carried out, there is also bedbug control with natural predators. ? 5 documents that make up the Xingu agricultural MIC were presented, namely: ? Harvest Procedure-PROC-XG-PROD-004-v2 ? Grain Storage Procedure-PROC-XG-PROD-008-v3? Soil Management Procedure-PROC-XG-PROD-001-v3 ? Planting Procedure-PROC-XG-PROD-002-v3 ? Cultural Treatments Procedure-PROC-XG-PROD-003-v3.
5_5_criteria: According to a visual assessment during a visit to the pesticide warehouse and the syrup preparation points, it was identified that all products are in their packaging original and with labels properly attached. It is evident that when preparing the application solution, the operator performs the triple wash and also renders the packaging unusable, which in turn is directed to a warehouse for storing empty packaging with restricted access and several information signs regarding not reusing them. Through documentary evaluation, it was also identified that all applications are carried out in accordance with the recommendation made by the properties agronomists, through the opening of work orders. Empty packaging deposits comply with technical standards, and empty packaging is returned to the Agricultural Inputs Trade Association of Correntina-BA. The transport of agrochemical products takes place in appropriately adapted vehicles, these being in the bodies of F4000 pickup trucks for preparation at support points, or in a truck duly adapted for preparing syrup. The farm uses signs to inform about the application of agrochemicals and re-entry periods, in addition to this, on the margins of the applied plots, there is a red flag identification with a skull print, thus marking the areas whose re-entry is prohibited without the appropriate use of PPE. .
5_6_criteria: Evidenced through documentary evaluation that the farm is aware of and has available the product prohibition lists of the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. of The use of products derived from Paraquat is being abolished, according to documentary evaluation, the procedures for returning Paraquat stocks are in progress with the supplier.
5_7_criteria: According to an interview with the property manager the control of monitored and controlled pests is also carried out with biological products and natural predators.
5_8_criteria: According to documentary evaluation, the farm has the Soybean Disease Identification Manuals and Pocket Guide, as well as other integrated pest management guides , and they are considered to carry out monitoring in the crop, as well as in determining solution measures, as also observed in the MIP monitoring sheets.
5_9_criteria: Evidenced through evaluation of climate monitoring systems that CRITERIA 5.9 - Measures The property has several implemented measures, referring to the appropriate minimization of drift and climate control with several monitoring stations. implemented to prevent the drift of agrochemicals. Document: PROC-XG-PROD-003 - Cultural Treatment Procedure, the conditions that must be respected in all applications, for neighboring areas. including guidance on reducing drift.
5_10_criteria: According to an interview with the responsible agronomist, wind speed is monitored in real time, there are other parameters that are monitored to increase the effectiveness of applications and reduce drift.
5_11_criteria: According to documentary verification and an interview with the propertys agronomist, the acquisition of seeds is acquired with the terms of seed compliance, to verify the origin and quality, observing the producers registration in Renasem. Xingu AgrÃ­cola does not have seed production fields for its own use.

Name: Grupo Reinhofer
1_1_criteria: The groups production and management units demonstrated knowledge
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in 1.2 documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: Aspects and environmental impacts were identified. The corrective actions arising from internal audits show the companys continuous improvement, commitment and evolution in relation to the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: Practices of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other involuntary work were not found during the audit process, as well as in work environments or heard during interviews with employees in the groups production units.
2_2_criteria: Training and work instructions are available for each function to be performed and the rights and Duties of both parties are defined in the employment contracts and code of conduct at the groups production units.
2_3_criteria: Information on health and safety is documented and transmitted to employees during Integration or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations in the groups production units.
2_4_criteria: There is no evidence that prevents workers to have freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment of their presence in the groups production units.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that the salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees of the same category in the groups production units. Adequate housing is provided by the company to employees.
3_1_criteria: Communication channels are available internally through suggestion boxes in the production units and externally on the website and publicity via signs available at the entrance to the production units, made by the Group Manager.
3_2_criteria: Presence of quilombola heirs in an area neighboring the groups Campo Bonito Farm. The farm is in the licensing phase with the ParanÃ¡ environmental agency (IAP) to implement a Hydroelectric Plant on the river that divides the land. No conflict has been observed over the use of water resources and nothing has been built to date. Both sides are in the negotiation phase to approve the project and release the LO for the activity.
3_3_criteria: The company has a procedure for Communication and Complaints in the Group Management Manual. The communication channels are suggestion boxes available internally on the properties and externally through signs on company trucks such as the Reinhofer groups telephone and website, where there is another communication channel, in addition to telephone directories available in communities close to the farms. Interviews were carried out with farm employees, confirming the correct functioning of the grievance mechanism.
3_4_criteria: Collaboration with the training program implemented and job vacancies are opened on the companys website and local vacancies are advertised" word of mouth" among employees.
4_1_criteria: A socio-environmental assessment was carried out and shows mitigation and control measures for processes related to soybean production.
4_2_criteria: Actions to minimize pollution are being done as reuse and recycling of materials, through selective collection and all hazardous waste in the groups production units.
4_3_criteria: Fuel registration is in accordance with the agricultural activities carried out. The use of fertilizer is done according to soil analyses, where organic matter is also monitored. Areas of environmental interest are maintained and preserved in the groups production units.
4_4_criteria: Through maps and satellite photos, it was verified that the soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of areas considered as AAVC.
4_5_criteria: Areas of environmental interest are respected and conserved by the administration of the groups production units. Native vegetation on the farm is above 20%, in accordance with federal legislation with the New Forest Code of 2012.
5_1_criteria: Monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption is done through analyzes of water, where soil contamination is verified in the groups production units.
5_2_criteria: Permanent Preservation Areas are defined on maps of the groups production units, with no evidence that vegetation has been removed, nor changed.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation and soil analysis are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the groups production units.
5_4_criteria: The record monitoring of pests and weeds found in the areas is done through a visit report, present in the agrarian cooperatives field notebook. Control levels are established in accordance with the EMBRAPA SOJA methodology.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical applications contain information such as purchased products, applied dose, installments, application dates and climatic conditions. Storage follows the recommendations of NR 31.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the groups production units.
5_7_criteria: No biological agents are used in the groups production units.
5_8_criteria: To identify and monitor new invasive species and pests in the area, the group has a described procedure, citing research institutions such as Embrapa and Universities.
5_9_criteria: The Atmospheric conditions such as wind, humidity and temperature before application are recorded in the pesticide application forms in the groups production units.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the production units. group production.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds is through the cooperative, in which the group cooperates, where the groups production units are producing in accordance with RENASEM.

Name: Agrex do Brasil S.A.
1_1_criteria: The company has legal advice, in addition to each area having a responsible professional who verifies applicable legislation and its implementation. Knowledge and compliance with applicable legislation is evidenced through an interview. For the updating of legislation, the companys legal area relies on external legal updating services, companies and forums of producer associations. It highlights the knowledge of legal responsibilities applicable to agricultural production and applicable legislation, for example: Labor Laws, CLT Forest Code, Law 12651, 25.05.2012 Â– Regulatory Standards, Environmental Licenses issued by SEMA for farms located in the state of Tocantins and MaranhÃ£o, Protection of fauna, Law 5197/67, Waste Law 12.305/2010, Norma Regulatoria 31 - NR31"updated 2014 and regulated by ordinance 3214 of June 8, 1978.

The basic value is established by agreement and improvements are considered based on performance. If promotions and types of increases are established collectively, or individually based on merit, promotions or performance, criteria for approving a new salary, admission process, hiring and transfers.
2_2_criteria: Stay maintained implemented a POL- 1011 hiring policy - specifies procedures for hiring personnel. It deals with different types of contracts according to the work position. 2_3_criteria: Management in the area of health and safety, for all workers and employees, is a strength of the Agrex management system in Brazil. The risks of each activity have been established in the PPRA - Environmental Risk Prevention Program. Capabilities have been established to ensure that risky tasks are carried out by trained personnel. In addition to admission, personal health checks are carried out annually. Procedures on the safe use of agrochemicals, machinery established by Agrex, and additional information provided by ANDEF (National Association of Vegetable Defense) are also available on each Farm. In addition to the PCMS, the medical and occupational health control program for the Treasury is available, as well as elements for the management of first aid. Botiquines PPE delivery records are evident. A system of warnings and sanctions has been defined. A fire brigade is available
2_4_criteria: In interviews with personnel it is verified that all workers enjoy freedom from association and the right to collective bargaining. it is verified that workers are not prevented from interacting with external parties during working hours
2_5_criteria: We have verified work receipts that allow us to show that workers are paid a gross salary that complies with legislation national and sectoral agreements. In interviews with employees of the company it is clear that deductions from salaries are not applied for disciplinary reasons, deductions that are specified in the contract are considered, for example in the case of unjustified absence. A record of hours worked is available via a huella system, both in establishments and in workshops. It is clear that weekly working hours do not exceed 48 hours, and during the harvest season the plantation works overtime which is paid according to the current agreement. If we interviewed workers about housing and food conditions, they didnt identify themselves and complain about what they said. Personnel are not charged per villa
3_1_criteria: The company accounts with communication and dialogue channels, if a communication telephone number is established, 0800 6483018, email: Ouviria@agrex.com.br, if it is established on POP1395 - Relationship with the community. The RRHH management receives the complaint, carries out the analysis and presents it to the management, and is the person responsible for implementing the solutions. However, until the audit closes no complaints are received.

4_1_criteria: It is reported with an updated social and environmental assessment, established in Orientation; evaluation criteria, installations, Operational Area, including fuel deposits and structure, environmental documentation, required licenses, water analysis and water monitoring, labor documentation, field operations, soil preparation, planting, spraying, harvesting and other cultural activities The evaluation was carried out by Ing. Agricultural Ambiental, trained in the requirements of Standard 3.0 and 3.1, 3 years in charge of the certification system. Contact JanaÃ­na Monti Silveira
4_2_criteria: In interviews with employees and neighbors, it is verified that the burning of crop residues is not permitted, using any other resource. A sign has been placed on the farm entrance indicating a ban on burning. To combat forest fires, the company implements the POP 1376 procedure, combating forest fires and relies on a capable combat brigade. During the tour of the farms, no signs of burns were evident. The company has implemented the POP - 1373 operational procedure for waste management that includes waste classification, segregation and final disposal of those that cannot be recycled. In all the farms audited, identified waste containers were available at work sites, such as kitchens, warehouses, houses, warehouses and workshops. The sites for storing fuel have safety measures available and to contain spills, a site has been designated for the storage of solid waste until its final disposal, the empty pesticide containers are stored in a specific sector, with restricted access, which allows spills to be contained . A control record of the weighing of material removed from each farm is verified. Furthermore, a PCRS Solid Waste Control Plan has been implemented, which considers the separation, compaction and recycling of waste that has an economic value and can be reused. As part of the improvement indicators, the total direct use of fossil fuels is recorded over a period of time, and its volume is monitored per hectarea and per unit of product for all activities related to soybean production. The company has established an organic material monitoring system. Analysis is carried out each year. In terms of results, techniques are implemented to mitigate negative trends, for example, adjusted application of fertilizers is carried out, lime is applied to correct pH, P is applied along the line, cover crops are carried out, and areas are protected and conserved of native vegetation and legal reserve, according to the procedure POP-1394 - Maintenance of the Legal reserve, from which different types of conservation areas and preservation and maintenance measures are established. Forestry is being carried out with Eucaliptus.
4_3_criteria: As part of the improvement indicators, the total direct use of fossil fuels over a period of time is recorded, and their volume per hectare and per unit of product is monitored for all activities related to soybean production. The company has established an organic matter monitoring system. Analyses are carried out every two years. Based on the results, techniques are implemented to mitigate negative trends, such as adjusted fertilizer application, application of limestone to correct pH, P is applied on the planting line, cover crops are grown. The areas of native vegetation and legal reserves are protected and conserved according to procedure POP-1394 - Mantencão da reserva Legal, which establishes the different types of conservation areas and the preservation and maintenance measures. Eucalyptus afforestation is carried out.

It is verified in interviews with personnel that the hunt for rare species, endangered or in danger inside the property. When entering Farms, there is a hunting prohibition sign. Practices such as direct construction, systematization of lots and contour lines to prevent erosion, consider the direction of construction to avoid erosion. Results of the water analysis program are evident on all the companys farms, records are evident. There is no evidence of direct contamination from agricultural production activities. see 5.1.2. It makes Santo Isidoro with water intakes, streams and native forests. Water courses are included in reserve and low protection management zones. Wetlands are identified in Fazenda UniÃ£o, but it is evident that in the drained area it is included in the reserve surface, there are channels for carrying excess water in Fazenda UniÃ£o along with roads and optimizing the drainage of the lagoons and natural wetlands present there. building. It is clear that all native vegetation is maintained, according to the Landsat images from 2008 that were presented by the company. It is not evident that natural wetlands have been drained
5_3_criteria: Records of soil, fertility and organic matter analysis are evident. Interviews with technicians and managers The company demonstrates knowledge of techniques to maintain the quality of the soil and the same things are being implemented, for example, whether crop rotation is carried out, soil analysis is carried out to maintain fertility, level curves are created, direct planting. Controlled fertilization, Soy inoculation, cover crops. Systematized production lots with level curves, rotation with cover crops, direct planting and controlled applications are evident. The maintenance of roads and alcantarillas is carried out. Records of production per batch are evident, it is verified that crop rotation is implemented.
5_4_criteria: The company has established an integrated management procedure documented in POP-1377 Management and pest control that includes techniques such as pest monitoring and implementation of the Strider system with information per batch and monitoring results per stage through sampling, damage level and targeted applications, resistance prevention through pesticide rotation and crop rotation. Techniques such as the use of specific crops to control pests are implemented, e.g.: cultivation of Crotalaria sp to control nematodes, machines are washed when they come from another region - Mato Grosso, Maranhao - before use, to avoid the entry of nematodes . Monitors register. A policy for the responsible use of agrochemicals and objectives for reducing the use of the most dangerous toxicological categories are being implemented. The objectives are documented in the Agrex sustainability report. The decision to use RR varieties reduces the use of insecticides. If genuine products are used, the use and application of agrochemicals follows the recommendations of production technicians, and application recommendations and dosages carried out by Ing. AgrÃ³nomo de la Fazenda. Rotations of active ingredients are carried out to avoid resistance, climatic conditions of application are considered to guarantee effectiveness and avoid drifts. The application is carried out through a work order generated by the companys technician
5_5_criteria: Documented records of the use of agrochemicals are evident, in accordance with the requirements of this standard. The purchases of agrochemicals by the multisite are carried out centrally and are dispatched to the Farms. Pesticide movements and deposit stocks are controlled by deposit and by member of the multisite. Agrochemical transfer notes from Agrex Balsa are evident. The management of used containers is implemented, Proof of Return of packaging empty of agrochemicals, Training records for service providers and Agrex workers in packaging management are evident. vacancies and safe management of phytosanitary products, for example, Â“Entrainment on agrochemical application technology and treatment of used agrochemical containersÂ” The transport and storage of agrochemicals is carried out safely and all applicable safety precautions are implemented, hygiene and environmental. Furthermore, the company has carried out and implemented safety measures in accordance with PPRA-Environmental Risk Assessment. The company implements the procedure POP -1374 - Handling and storage of chemical products - for the handling and storage of chemical products. All applicable safety, hygiene and environmental precautions are implemented, and compliance with the requirements established in NR31 and Law 9974/00 and Decree 4074/02. Transport has the safety warning required by legislation. The procedure "Spraying of pesticides" - POP 1379 is implemented, which establishes in item 7.9 the identification of the treated area, which must be identified through a card with the Treated Area label, the fertilizers are used according to the recommendations of the technicians of the Farms and manufacturer information. Usage requirements arise from soil analysis carried out
5_6_criteria: Interviews with technicians and workers, Audit of stock lists and application records, It is evident that no products included in the Stockholm and Rotterdam list are employed . Pesticide deposits were audited remotely using images and photos provided by the company. The procedure POP NÂ° 2503 V01 of 2-3-18 - Reducing the use of Paraquat - is highlighted, with the aim of reducing the use of this active ingredient during the drying of the soybean plantation. Reduction objectives of 50% for 2019 and 50% for 2020 are being established. The use of Diquat for drying is being tested. The company continues to test alternatives and investigate new alternative products
5_7_criteria: NA. No biological control agents are used.
5_8_criteria: In the event that invasive species, new plagues or severe outbreaks are identified, the company must provide communication to EMBRAPA. No situations have been identified that require notification.
5_9_criteria: There are documented procedures that specify suitable agricultural practices, for example, the operational procedure is clearly implemented - Agricultural pesticide spraying - POP 1379, V 02, indicating measures to minimize drift, effect of atmospheric agents, precautions in case of aerial applications and communication and warning of application to vehicles. Particularly in the case of aerial applications, it is established that it must not be carried out less than 500 m from any third party building, and it must not be carried out less than 500 m from bodies of water, it must be communicated to vehicles if applicable. There is no evidence of employment of class Ia, Ib and II products from the WHO within 500 m of populated areas or water bodies
5_10_criteria: The company implements measures to prevent interference with local production systems. Good practices are implemented in applications and procedures that consider the minimization of drift and meteorological conditions for applications. Application notices and communications with others are maintained. They were interviewed by those who said they would not have any interference problems.
5_11_criteria: It has three seed sources, its own seed produced in Faz Santo Isidoro, it also employs soybean seed produced by Agrex and seed is purchased from external suppliers Planting orders and records of seed purchases and seed origin are evident, for example: - In Faz Chapada Alta; in Faz Curitiba, from campaign 18/19 and from Faz Santo Isidoro, tax invoice is evident

Name: SAAG Comercial Exportadora Ltda. non-GMO
1_1_criteria: The company has access to applicable legislation and is complied with. Collaborators demonstrated knowledge and relevant documents were available.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations, lease contracts and CCIR Â– INCRA.
1_3_criteria: The aspects have been identified and continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, showing the companys commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory or slave labor was found or involuntary during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and pertinent information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the agricultural unit.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that workers Salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees. For outsourced workers there are no records of hours worked available.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as the SAAG website, group manager (https://scisaag.wordpress.com/reclamacoes/), containing e-mails telephones, postal address on the roads between the community and the farms with publicity signs written Â“contact usÂ” and internally on the farms in the scope through the Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the workers point control .
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements. Places of importance are identified, maintained and preserved.
3_3_criteria: A complaints and complaints mechanism is made available, described in the groups operational procedures. The mechanism establishes a procedure for recording and handling complaints, through a complaints and grievances form, available at production units. There were no records of complaints and complaints at the time of the audit.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the production unit and internal vacancies on the farms and are publicized through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fills out the job application, I have your resume on file. Supply of products and services to the local community was carried out by Saag.
4_1_criteria: Socio-environmental assessment available, in the document called Monitoring Schedules and Programs, there are the identified points and the measures to minimize or mitigate the identified impacts. There is also a schedule for implementing the proposed actions and it has been monitored and complied with.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging appropriately. The Environmental Control Plan presented during the audit includes waste management including all areas of the property.
4_3_criteria: The unit promotes actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and monitored organic matter in the soil.
4_4_criteria: It has been shown through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling the areas of preservation and legal reserve, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and groundwater.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, however, in the Environmental Control Plan , which shows the actions proposed by the farms to adapt to the new forest code, there is a schedule for the restoration of some areas. There are no natural wetlands in the production unit
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analyses, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion control and crop rotation techniques are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: The integrated crop management plan and targets for reducing phytosanitary products were presented. List and invoices for the purchase of products were available, demonstrating that they use products that comply with Brazilian legislation.
5_5_criteria: Records of pesticide application on farms in the scope are made manually and recorded in spreadsheets, covering the indicator information. Storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: During field verification on agrochemical application fronts, retroactive application records and storage. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. There was no evidence of the use of Paraquat on farms within the scope of certification.
5_7_criteria: No evidence of the use of biological control agents was found.
5_8_criteria: There were no incidences of new pests that have not been identified , according to the records presented. "Control of New Pests and Diseases" procedure available, in the case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact the available research body.
5_9_criteria: Standard Operating Procedure - Pesticide Care - Drift was presented, addressing precautions, especially wind in agricultural pesticide applications. There is no aerial application on farms within the scope.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: Amaggi Commodities EU RED
1_1_criteria: The producer demonstrated knowledge of applicable laws and remains up to date with external advice from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with the laws was verified.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through the registrations of the farm areas.
1_3_criteria: The group manager carried out a socio-environmental assessment of the farm before itself be included in the group, and from this the aspects to be improved were identified and deadlines for implementation were defined. Improvements are monitored in annual internal audits.
2_1_criteria: Through interviews with permanent and temporary employees, it was evidenced that there is no evidence of forced, imposed, forced, trafficked or involuntary labor on the farm. Employees reported that they are free to leave the property after hours, as well as terminate the employment relationship if they wish. There is no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on the farm are not required to work on the property. There are no children under 15 working on the farm. There is a Minor Apprentice employee in the role of administrative assistant. Through interviews with employees, it was evident that there was no evidence of discrimination of any kind. The company has different levels for the same functions, with each employee placed in a level according to their level of education. There is also a differentiation by length of service. There is no differentiation between workers of the same level or length of service. Training, benefits and promotion opportunities are provided equally among employees. There is also no evidence of punishment, coercion or aggression of any kind.
2_2_criteria: All workers are registered. There is an Employment Contract binding the company to the employees, with all relevant information, in writing. Employment contracts include all relevant information and, in addition, workers are informed of working conditions at the time of hiring, as verified in an interview with permanent and temporary employees.
2_3_criteria: Workers demonstrated knowledge and understanding of issues related to health and safety in interviews. Workers health is monitored through periodic medical examinations. There is health and safety training, including specific training on standards NR 6, NR 11, NR 12, NR 20, NR 23, NR 33, NR 35, as well as other training in the area of occupational health and safety and other relevant training. Those responsible for potentially dangerous tasks are properly trained, such as pesticide application, carried out by qualified staff. Health and safety risks are identified and procedures are in place to control them. The Masutti Group has a complete SESMT and has an Occupational Safety Technician and occupational nurse stationed in each unit, and has documentation relevant to occupational health and safety (PGSSTR and LTCAT). The farm provides PPE and the supply is duly recorded using specific forms. The company has a complete and structured SESMT department, with an occupational safety technician and occupational nurse in each unit, responsible for applying and carrying out all surveys relevant to worker safety requirements. The company is implementing the PAE (Emergency Plan) procedure in case of accidents and emergencies. It currently has an Emergency Plan for Responding to Accidents at Work, which is available in announcements at various points on the property. The property has an outpatient clinic, an ambulance and a 24-hour nurse.
2_4_criteria: Through interviews with permanent and temporary employees, it was evidenced that there is complete freedom to join trade union organizations, with some interviewees confirming that they are union members, while others reveal that they did not participate. Terminations of employment contracts are approved by the unions.
2_5_criteria: The minimum remuneration paid on the farm is above the national minimum wage. Verified proof of payment demonstrates that only deductions provided for by law are applied, such as INSS, union contributions and food and health plan deductions, duly agreed between the parties. The working day is 44 hours per week, with occasional overtime, especially during harvest times, which does not exceed 10 hours per week. Hours worked are recorded on a biometric time clock. Workers reported that overtime is voluntary and duly paid, as evidenced by payment slips. Verified through interviews, that workers receive at least one day off for every six days worked. The farm complies with the law in the case of maternity leave. Checked records of a worker on maternity leave at the time of the audit. Housing for farm employees is adequate and has adequate sanitary conditions. Access to drinking water is guaranteed by farms. There are drinking fountains located in several locations. The property has a cafeteria, guided by a nutritionist, serving the 3 main meals of the day to all employees.
3_1_criteria: Sign verified at the entrance to the property containing the telephone contact details. The Masutti Group maintains a page on a social network, as well as having a telephone number available in the regions telephone guides and on the internet. The communication channels are public knowledge.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes regarding land use rights on the property, as well as there are no adjacent indigenous peoples, nor are there permanent conservation areas, nor schools or any areas of high cultural value close to the farm.
3_3_criteria: There are signs distributed on the property displaying their telephone numbers so that complaints can be made directly. There are also suggestion/complaint boxes in various locations on the property. The farm has the document Procedure for Receiving and Handling Complaints, which determines all procedures in case of receiving complaints. There is also a form to fill out, document Registration and Complaint Handling Form, which deals with all issues pertinent to complaints and complaints
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised through SINE, on the company wall and internal referrals, always looking for workers in the region. The property participates in events and field days. Those responsible participate in lectures and training from the Rural Union, SENAR and companies in the region, as verified in certificates and reports from those responsible. The property purchases products and services from companies in the region.
4_1_criteria: The farm underwent a socio-environmental assessment before being included in the group. A Socio-Environmental Diagnosis was carried out by AlianÃ§a da Terra, which has qualified personnel for such an assessment. The diagnosis is comprehensive and transparent, considering impacts related to the farm.
4_2_criteria: The propertys waste management is governed by the Fazenda Saudades/PaixÃ£o Waste Management Plan. Used batteries are returned in exchange for new ones. Old tires are separated and later collected on the property. The collection of used lubricating oils is carried out by the company Lwart Lubrificantes. Lamps and batteries are stored in a box provided in the propertys workshop and later collected. The houses have septic tanks. Organic waste is buried in a suitable location. A non-conformity was identified in item 4.2.3 as used lubricating oils are stored in suspended tanks without a containment basin. Despite this, the fuel tanks have a containment dam and a fueling lane with a floor, channels and containment box. The machine washing area has a cement floor, gutters and separation box. Oil changes are carried out in a location with a floor, channels and containment box. Recycling is carried out whenever possible. Plastic waste is collected by the company Amazonekos, as well as cans and drums.
4_3_criteria: The use of fossil fuels is recorded when the machines are filled. No increases in fuel use were recorded in the last harvest. The soil matter content is monitored through soil analysis. Soil carbon is increased through practices such as: maintaining straw as ground cover
4_4_criteria: No area expansion was made, as evidenced by satellite image maps comparing the propertys areas in 2008 and 2017.
4_5_criteria: The property map indicates native vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Annual internal audits are carried out to monitor native vegetation. Verified that the farm is restoring degraded areas. The property prohibits any hunting activity within it. Checked warning signs present in the areas. Extractive practices such as collecting native wood or other natural products are also prohibited. The farm has over 10% native vegetation area.
5_1_criteria: The farm adopts good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as: adopting the direct seeding system; straw management for soil cover; use of correctors and fertilizers in accordance with technical recommendations; maintenance of APP and legal reserve areas. A non-compliance was identified in indicator 5.1.2 as analyzes are not carried out to monitor water quality. The farm does not use irrigation.
5_2_criteria: The farm identifies the location of watercourses on the map, as well as the status of riparian vegetation. The farm has an area of natural vegetation in the process of regeneration and measures are being taken to recover other degraded areas.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality monitoring is done through soil analysis. Soil quality is preserved through the adoption of practices such as: adoption of the direct planting system; maintenance of straw as soil cover; use of fertilizers and correctives in accordance with technical recommendations; maintenance of APP and legal reserve areas. Erosive processes are prevented through the construction of contour lines, adoption of the direct planting system and maintenance of soil cover. The farm carries out succession of crops. There is no cultivation of soybeans on soybeans, the sanitary void period is respected.
5_4_criteria: The farm has a MIC Â– Integrated Crop Management plan, addressing the use of preventive and control methods that cause less environmental impact . The farm envisages the reduction of potentially harmful agrochemicals in a documented plan. The farm only uses agrochemicals permitted for soybean cultivation and in the dosages prescribed by those responsible, as evidenced in the deposits and records of agrochemical use. A non-conformity was identified in indicator 5.4.5 due to no monitoring records of pests, diseases, weeds and natural enemies.
5_5_criteria: The companys planning sector carries out product purchases. Service orders are opened for the application of pesticides by the technical team in accordance with field monitoring, where the product, quantity, dose, area, plot, weather conditions and team responsible for execution are recorded. Empty packaging is washed at the time of application and then stored in the warehouse. The deposit is covered, closed, locked and marked, but it does not have channels or a containment box, which led to non-compliance in indicator 5.5.2. Empty packaging is delivered to a local receiving center. Pesticides are delivered to the farm by the multinationals that sell them. The place for storing pesticides is covered, locked, closed, marked, has aeration and the packaging is arranged on wooden pallets, but there are no channels or containment box, which led to non-conformity in item 5.5.3. There is an area for preparing pesticides, equipped with a small temporary pesticide deposit, flooring and an ozonizer for equipment decontamination. The preparation of syrup is done using specific equipment for this purpose. Next to the pesticide deposit there is an emergency shower. Used PPE is decontaminated in a laundry dedicated to this purpose. Areas treated with pesticides are demarcated with signposts. Recommendations for the use of improvers and fertilizers are made by agronomists based on the results of soil analyses.
5_6_criteria: The farm does not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The herbicide Paraquat is used, but it is already planned to gradually reduce its use by 2020.
5_7_criteria: Verified that there is knowledge about the use of biological control agents. There is an intention to use biological nematicides and control agents for defoliating pests, but they have not yet been used.
5_8_criteria: If an outbreak of new pests occurs, farms turn to institutions such as INDEA, MAPA or FundaÃ§Ã£o MT.
5_9_criteria: Measures implemented by the farm to prevent drift include adjusting application equipment, monitoring weather conditions during applications, and maintaining zones free from pesticide application. Aerial applications are carried out at least 1,200 meters from homes and bodies of water. Likewise, the closest populations are notified before applications. Land applications of pesticides respect a minimum distance of 150 meters from homes.
5_10_criteria: The production system adopted by farms is similar to neighboring systems. There are no adjacent areas with sensitive crops, such as organic or conventional agriculture. There are no cases of damage caused by drift to neighboring areas originating from the farm.
5_11_criteria: The farm acquires seeds from legally known sources and also produces seeds, both for its own use and for commercialization. Own seed production is duly approved by APROSMAT, as a way of complying with the intellectual properties of such materials.

Organization: Fundação de Apoio à Pesquisa do Corredor de Exportação Norte ?Irineu Alcides Bays
Name: FAPCEN III
1_1_criteria: The farms have access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of legislation and relevant documents were available.
1_2_criteria: Legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as land ownership registrations.
1_3_criteria: The aspects were identified and continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, showing the companys commitment to meeting all the criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: Not found evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees of the audited farms.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and pertinent information about each function to be executed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units. All supply points (fuel stations) lack a grounding point for trucks that unload flammable products.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well such as the impediment to their presence on farms.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as website containing emails telephones, postal address on farm roads with advertising signs written Â“contact usÂ” and via FAPCEN and internally on the scope farms through Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the workers point control.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements. Places of importance are identified, maintained and preserved.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels are available and accessible. Complaints and complaints received are checked and responded to. There were no records of complaints and complaints at the time of the audit.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the farms and vacancies are advertised through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fill out the job application, I have your resume on file. There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the scope farms, carried out by the farms and by the Fapcen office.
4_1_criteria: The social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified for each farm within the certification scope. Studies are available upon request.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and pesticide packaging appropriately. There is an Environmental Management Plan presented during the audit that covers waste management including all areas of the property.
4_3_criteria: The farms promote actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and monitored organic matter in the soil.
4_4_criteria: On the Rainha da Serra and Grajau CÃ©res farm it was identified that there was conversion of areas after 2009, on the Granja CÃ©res farm the conversion was located in the biomass (carbon) layer, where it was presented the study that shows that the carbon concentration is less than 88 tons. The Rainha da Serra farm was converted within the permitted period and is not located in a red area on the RTRS map. At Fazenda Carolina do Norte, the "SYNTHETIC REPORT ON LEAF AREA INDEX" was presented. In this study, it was presented that there was no conversion after 2009. however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation. During the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling preservation and legal reserve areas, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
4_5_criteria: The farms audited have more than 10% of their area covered by native vegetation, but all of them take steps to encourage wildlife and protect and restore native vegetation. During the audit, it was possible to identify signs marking the preservation and legal reserve areas, as well as the ban on hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve quality of surface and underground waters.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, FAPCEN presented detailed maps of all farms with indication of riparian vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Such information can also be obtained from the farms' CAR.
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analyses, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion and rotation control techniques of crops are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: Farms use suitable products to control pests and diseases. IPMs and chemical use reduction plans are implemented.
5_5_criteria: Storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: Retroactive application records, invoices for purchase and storage of products were checked. None evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. The use of Paraquat was not evidenced on the farms visited within the scope of certification.
5_7_criteria: There is the use of biological control agents on the groups farms.
5_8_criteria: Presented methodology designed to identify and monitor new pests and introduced invasive species, or large outbreaks of existing pests. There were no incidences of new pests that were not identified, according to the records presented.
5_9_criteria: Drift control procedures were presented for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water, as well as other precautions in application of pesticides.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Organization: Fundação de Apoio à Pesquisa do Corredor de Exportação Norte ?Irineu Alcides Bays
Name: FAPCEN
1_1_criteria: Knowledge of applicable legislation was demonstrated by the manager and group members.
1_2_criteria: Legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: The groups management together with the production units are implementing corrective actions arising from internal audits and diagnoses for continuous improvement, thus showing the companys commitment and evolution in meeting all the criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other involuntary work was found during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees in the groups production units.
2_2_criteria: Own workers or third parties receive training and relevant information about each function to be performed and the rights and duties of both parties are defined in the employment contracts and code of conduct in the groups production units.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety information is documented and transmitted to employees during Onboarding or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and there is an available communication channel and means of transport for emergency situations in the groups production units.
2_4_criteria: There is no evidence that prevents workers from have freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment of their presence in the groups production units.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that the salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees of the same category in the groups production units.
3_1_criteria: Communication channel not available to the community.
3_2_criteria: Absences of traditional land users and disputes were found in the areas evaluated. Documentation of ownership of the property, such as registration and deed, was presented and is in accordance with the legal requirements applicable to the groups production units.
3_3_criteria: Communication channel not available to the community, not allowing verification of receipt of complaints and complaints and handling them.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are opened in local cities verbally for the groups production units.
4_1_criteria: Absence of major impact construction observed during this initial audit at the groups production units.
4_2_criteria: Inadequate storage and disposal of waste.
4_3_criteria: Fuel recording is carried out in a general manner. Fertilization is carried out according to soil analyses, where organic matter is also monitored. Areas of environmental interest are maintained and preserved in the groups production units.
4_4_criteria: No agricultural expansion was found within the farms after 2009, evidenced through satellite images in the groups production units.
4_5_criteria: Areas of environmental interest are respected and conserved by the administration of the groups production units.
5_1_criteria: The monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption is done through water analysis, where it is soil contamination was verified in the groups production units.
5_2_criteria: Environmental Areas are defined on maps of the groups production units, with no evidence that vegetation was removed or altered.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, the use of contour lines and soil analyzes are used to improve soil quality and control erosion in the groups production units.
5_4_criteria: Monitoring of pests is done to determine the application of pesticides, only when necessary, in addition to using direct planting, green manure and crop rotation, which are also practices used to reduce pest infestation in the groups production units.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical applications contain information such as purchased products, applied dose, installments, and application dates, requiring improvement. The storage, collection and disposal of empty packaging is being carried out at the groups production units.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found at the groups production units.
5_7_criteria: The use of traditional biological agents on a small scale can be carried out in the groups production units.
5_8_criteria: To identify and monitor new invasive species and pests in the area, the group maintains verbal contact with research institutes such as Embrapa.
5_9_criteria: Atmospheric conditions such as wind, humidity and temperature before application are partially recorded in the groups production units.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the groups production units.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through purchase from well-known companies that issue proof of origin or in the groups own production units, with the plan made in agreement with RENASEM.

Name: Fazendas Bartira
1_1_criteria: The organization demonstrated knowledge of the legislation and it is implemented on the sampled farms. After the audit, the group manager was informed that Fazenda Horizontina Norte is on the IBAMA Embargo List, dated 07/10/2018. The reason for the reported embargo was the absence of the LO, however it was available during the audit, dated 05/08/2018.
1_2_criteria: Land ownership was evidenced through registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: The socio-environmental aspects and impacts, as well as control measures were raised by the group manager before the audit.
2_1_criteria: No adverse working conditions were found, such as forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary during the audit process in the workplace or heard during interviews with employees.
2_2_criteria: Labor laws are adequately complied with, all workers have a registration form, contract, as well as a collective bargaining agreement, that specify their working conditions.
2_3_criteria: Accident and emergency procedures are available. Workers and those responsible for the operation demonstrated knowledge about health and safety at work through verbal explanations addressing issues related to the application of agricultural pesticides, use of machinery and equipment and use of PPE. There is integration training and a code of conduct addressing these topics, which were explained to the workers.
2_4_criteria: Workers have freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining with trade unions.
2_5_criteria: The sampled farms comply with the working day in accordance with labor legislation, as well as what is established in Collective Labor Agreements with the categorys unions.
3_1_criteria: Communication channels are available internally on the farms for employees and externally via the Ombudsman Channel , via telephone and email.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation has been presented and is in accordance with applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels available to employees and the community. Communication with the community is established, as Bartira Farms are known in the community and have a website available to everyone.
3_4_criteria: There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the farms, as well as at a group level.
4_1_criteria: The socio-environmental assessment of socio-environmental aspects and impacts, as well as control measures were raised by the group manager before the audit. The assessment is available upon request.
4_2_criteria: The company has a waste management plan implemented on farms, with correct disposal of waste.
4_3_criteria: Monitoring of diesel, organic matter and opportunities for Carbon sequestration is done according to the reality of the farms.
4_4_criteria: All maps of the farms participating in the multi-site group "Comparison map with satellite images (2009, 2016 and current)" were presented. The maps were compared with the RTRS map, demonstrating that the areas are adequate. Horizontina Leste Farm was opened, but it was carried out through Authorization by the Competent Environmental Agency - SEMA/MA with number 0053/2012 valid until 04/18/2013. For this opening, the study "CARBON CONCENTRATION SURVEY" was presented
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained and preserved in accordance with current legislation. Hunting is not practiced on the properties.
5_1_criteria: Good practices agricultural and relevant structures to avoid water contamination are implemented on the farms.
5_2_criteria: The watercourses and APP on the properties visited are described on maps, there was no removal of vegetation from the APP areas.
5_3_criteria: The farms have good land use management, including adequate fertilization, crop rotations, erosion control and maintenance of soil quality. Soil analyzes are carried out regularly, including the assessment of organic matter content. The analyzes are used to determine fertility and plan fertilization.
5_4_criteria: Farms use suitable products to control pests and diseases. IPM and plans to reduce the use of chemical products are being implemented.
5_5_criteria: The use, transportation and storage of chemicals and empty packaging are done appropriately. Signs are used indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: The use of paraquat in Brazil is still permitted for soybean cultivation according to MAPA, with some exceptions such as manual applications, backpacks and/or with tractors without a closed cabin. The use of the product has also been reduced due to restrictions. A reduction plan was presented for the coming years.
5_7_criteria: There is no use of biological products on the farms visited.
5_8_criteria: Notification systems for new pests or invasive species present.
5_9_criteria: There are drift control procedures for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds purchased externally in accordance with legal requirements.
