Name: Louis Dreyfus Company – LDC Sorriso
1_1_criteria: Producers demonstrate knowledge of applicable laws and remain up to date through external consultancy from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with applicable laws was verified in most of the farms audited, such as Receipt of the Rural Environmental Registry, Well Grant, among others. Only one of the farms presented non-compliance in item 1.1.2 due to the occurrence of excessive overtime.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through duly registered registrations and lease contracts on all audited farms .
1_3_criteria: The manager did not carry out a social, environmental and agricultural assessment of the groups members, which generated non-compliance in the four farms audited in indicator 1.3.2. Indicators 1.3.1 and 1.3.3 are also not being met, however compliance with them will only be required from the second year of certification onwards
2_1_criteria: None of the audited farms found signs of forced labor, imposed , forced, trafficked or involuntary, and there is also no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on farms are not forced to work and when they did work, it was found that they were given an opportunity. There are no children under 15 working on the farms. All hired employees are over 18 years old. Children residing on audited farms attend school. Interviews and information collected demonstrate that there is no discrimination of any kind and all workers receive equal treatment.
2_2_criteria: All employees on the audited farms are registered, having an Individual Employment Contract and Employee Registration, describing the main information relevant. Two audited farms did not provide evidence of providing specific training in occupational health and safety to employees. Despite indicator 2.2.3 not being met, these farms did not receive non-compliance, as this indicator will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
2_3_criteria: All farms audited have PPRA/ PCMSO or PGSSMATR, where health and safety risks are identified, as well as mitigation and control measures. Owners of audited farms, as well as employees, demonstrate knowledge of occupational health and safety issues, such as carrying out the required medical examinations. In addition, the audited farms have a First Aid and Emergency Procedures document, with the aim of establishing actions to be taken in response to environmental or occupational health and safety emergencies, as well as the associated environmental impacts. There are emergency signs and first aid kits on all audited farms. Three of the audited farms received non-compliance in indicator 2.3.3, due to the employees who perform potentially dangerous tasks not having the training or qualifications to perform them. Furthermore, one of the audited farms does not provide Personal Protective Equipment to employees, generating a non-compliance in indicator 2.3.4.
2_4_criteria: According to reports obtained through interviews and on-site viewing on the four audited farms, Employees have complete freedom to join trade unions. Three of the four audited farms follow Collective Labor Convention 2017/19, MTE Registration number: MT000731/2017.
2_5_criteria: Verified from interviews, information collected and documents verified on the audited farms that the wages paid are higher than the national minimum, being paid monthly via deposit into employees accounts. Verified proof of payment demonstrates that only deductions provided for by law such as INSS and IPRF are made. The working hours on the audited farms are 44 hours per week, with overtime being compensated or paid in two periods of the year, as stated in the Collective Agreement (for the three farms that follow the Convention). For farms that do not follow the established Convention, overtime is paid alongside their monthly salaries. Two farms audited record the hours worked and overtime and the other two do not register the employer. Despite not complying with indicator 2.5.5, compliance with it will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards. An audited farm received a non-compliance in indicator 2.5.4, as excessive overtime was evidenced. There were no cases of pregnant women on the farms, however, those responsible are aware of the applicable law. Verified that the residences and accommodation for employees on the audited farms are adequate and have satisfactory sanitary conditions.
3_1_criteria: The farms have e-mail and telephone numbers and an identification plate at their headquarters. In addition, a suggestion/complaint box is kept on each farm. The Complaint/Suggestion Procedure document and Complaint/Suggestion Form are implemented and describe the procedure for handling complaints and the form for recording them. There were no complaints or suggestions at the time of the audit.
3_2_criteria: Verified that there are no cases of disputes regarding the rights to use the properties lands, as well as there is no evidence of the existence of traditional users of the properties lands.
3_3_criteria: The farms have suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters. Employees can make complaints or grievances through the box and the community can communicate with the farm via telephone and email. Any complaints are recorded in the Complaint/Suggestion Form document. If complaints are received, they will be analyzed and subsequently dealt with, as provided for in the Complaint/Suggestion Procedure. At the time of the audit, there were no complaints or complaints received.
3_4_criteria: Verified that job opportunities are filled through referrals from current employees and other farms, or searches made directly on the audited farms. One farm reported that it does not provide any type of assistance to local communities. Although indicator 3.4.2 is not being met, this indicator will only be charged from the third year of certification. Farms purchase products from the region they are located in.
4_1_criteria: All audited farms receive non-compliance in indicators 4.1.1; 4.1.2; 4.1.3; 4.1.4; 4.1.5, as a social, environmental and agricultural assessment was not carried out on them.
4_2_criteria: Verified that no fires are carried out on any of the audited farms. Most of the waste is properly disposed of by the farms, however three farms audited had non-compliance in indicator 4.2.2 due to the following situations: not having correct disposal of contaminated waste and incorrect storage of tires. A farm does not have selective collection bins, and the waste collected is taken to the citys municipal landfill. Despite not complying with indicator 4.2.4, this item will only be charged from the third year of certification. All farms have a documented Waste Management Plan, developed by the group manager.
4_3_criteria: The majority of audited farms record the use of fossil fuels, however on one farm it was not possible to identify the use for crop cultivation. soy. Even though indicator 4.3.1 and 4.3.2 are not in compliance, both will be required from the third year of certification. They monitor the organic matter content by carrying out soil analyses. Furthermore, properties adopt practices that contribute to increasing soil carbon sequestration, such as: adopting direct planting systems, cultivating soil cover species, maintaining native vegetation and planting eucalyptus for use in the dryer.
4_4_criteria: Land Use and Comparative Maps were developed by LDC, presenting satellite images of property areas in 2009, 2016 and 2019. The 2009 images were generated with the Landsat 5 TM, Collection 1 Tier 2 satellite TOA Reflectance, 30 meter resolution. The images from 2016 and 2019 were generated with the Sentinel-2 MSI satellite: MultiSpectral Instrument, Level-1C, 10 meter resolution. It was verified that there was no opening of vegetation areas after 2009 on the farms.
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation has been maintained on all farms. Hunting and collecting protected species is prohibited on all audited farms. The manager developed the document Plan to Guarantee the Preservation of Native Vegetation and Wildlife on the Farm, but no monitoring has been carried out to date. Although indicator 4.5.2 is not being met, this item will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
5_1_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies , such as, for example, the practice of direct planting and the maintenance of soil cover through the planting of brachiaria. A farm does not have a Grant of Right to Use Groundwater, referring to the artesian well. Although indicator 5.1.1 is not being met, this indicator will only be charged from the second year of certification. On all audited farms, analyzes are carried out to monitor water quality, however, two of the analyzes presented conflicting results. Despite not meeting the requirements in indicator 5.1.2, compliance will be charged from the third year of certification. Two farms audited, use an irrigation system for soybeans, having all applicable legal documentation.
5_2_criteria: The farms have complete maps with the location of cultivated areas delimited by plot, vegetation areas and watercourses. Verified that there is no removal of riparian areas of native vegetation on the four farms audited; and there are no natural wetlands or wetland areas.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality is preserved on all audited farms through the adoption of practices such as the adoption of the direct planting system and the use of fertilizers in accordance with technical recommendations. The agricultural areas have flat relief. Direct planting is adopted on the four properties, as well as maintaining soil cover through the planting of cover species. Planning is carried out to define planting areas, following crop rotation and succession techniques on all farms.
5_4_criteria: The four farms do not have a documented Integrated Crop Management plan. Although indicator 5.4.1 is not being met, it will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards. The manager developed, at group level, the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a product reduction plan potentially harmful phytosanitary chemicals over time. As verified on the four farms, only original and genuine agrochemicals are used that meet local registration requirements for soybean cultivation. An audited farm does not have a documented record regarding crop monitoring. Although indicator 5.4.5 is not being met, it will only be charged from the second year of certification onwards.
5_5_criteria: Verified that the four properties audited do not have records of dosers and applicators, equipment used and weather conditions during application. Although these items are not being complied with, compliance with them will be charged from the next year of certification onwards, and records of meteorological conditions will be charged from the third year of certification. Empty packaging is punctured and triple-washed on the farms and stored in an empty packaging warehouse. All audited farms have a pesticide deposit in their own location, separate from other structures and identified, where pesticides are stored in accordance with legislation
5_6_criteria: The farms do not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions . Two audited farms had non-compliance in indicator 5.6.2, due to there not being a program to progressively reduce the use of Paraquat over time
5_7_criteria: In three audited properties, products for biological control are used, in compliance with the legislation. The farm that does not use it demonstrated knowledge about its use.
5_8_criteria: It was verified that if an outbreak of new pests occurred, the audited farms would inform EMBRAPA and Agrodefesa.
5_9_criteria: The farms follow the document Use and Application of Pesticides and Fertilizers, which contains a reduction plan and measures to avoid drift in agrochemical applications. The four farms do not record weather conditions at the time of application. Despite not compressing item 5.9.2, it will only be charged from the third year of certification onwards. No aerial applications are carried out in cultural management for soybean cultivation on the audited farms. There is no application of pesticides near populated areas or watercourses.
5_10_criteria: Neighboring areas have the same type of production, cultivation and management used in the audited properties.
5_11_criteria: It was verified that the Seeds acquired by farms are from legally known sources, with respective seed compliance terms. None of the farms produce their own seeds.

Name: Agrex do Brasil S.A.
1_1_criteria: The company has legal advice, and each area has a professional responsible for verifying the applicable legislation and its implementation. Knowledge of and compliance with applicable legislation is demonstrated through interviews. To update legislation, the companys legal department relies on external legal updating services, companies and producer association forums. Knowledge of the legal responsibilities applicable to agricultural production and applicable legislation was demonstrated, for example: Labor Laws, CLT Forest Code, Law 12651, 25.05. 2012 - Regulatory Standards, Environmental Licenses issued by SEMA for farms located in the states of Tocantins and MaranhÃ£o, Wildlife Protection, Law 5197/67, Waste Law 12.305/2010, Regulatory Standard 31 - NR31 "updated in 2014 and regulated by ordinance 3214 of June 8, 1978.
1_2_criteria: There is documentary evidence of land use rights. The current leases and titles of all farms included in the scope have been verified.
1_3_criteria: The indicators established by the company and validated by the environmental impact assessment are monitored, and the following are identified Social Number of work accidents (annual): Environmental Water consumption per hectare (liters/ha): Organic matter content (% mo/Farm): Agricultural Diesel consumption (liters/ha): Diesel consumption (liters/ton): As the company is starting a new certification cycle, a new baseline is established based on the results of the 2017-2018 campaign In the production area, A campaign closing meeting is held - harvest closing - in which the results are analyzed and improvement actions planned. Production coordinator interviewed. For example, the analysis of diesel consumption by the Treasury and the results report are shown.
2_1_criteria: Interviews with the team verified that the company does not practice or support child labor, forced labor, discrimination and harassment. Furthermore, the company has implemented a Recruitment Policy - Recruitment and Selection Policy, POL-1011-, a code of ethics and a conduct or employee manual that establishes working conditions in the company. The agreed job and salary plans and the adjustments in the collective bargaining agreement remain in force. The company has a salary policy POL-1013, which describes the job structure and salary range in the case of junior, senior and full positions. The salary floor is established. The base value per agreement is established and performance improvements are considered. Promotions and types of increases are established collectively, or individually based on merit, promotion or performance, the criteria for approving a new salary, the admission process, hiring and transfers. The creation or change of a position through a committee, which evaluates the conditions of the position.
2_2_criteria: There is a POL-1011 Recruitment Policy - which specifies the procedures for recruiting employees. There are different types of contracts depending on the position. Applicable labor legislation, the Consolidation of Labor Laws and current salary agreements are available. Adequate and appropriate training and understandable instructions on fundamental rights at work and health and safety, as well as any necessary recommendations or supervision, are provided to all workers. There is evidence of the implementation of the PDI - Individual Development Program, worker training records. Furthermore, upon admission, all employees go through an awareness process in which they are informed about the conditions established in the code of ethics and recruitment.
2_3_criteria: The risks of each activity were established in the PPRA - Safety Program Environmental Risk Prevention. Training has been established to ensure that risky tasks are carried out by trained personnel. In addition, staff health checks are carried out annually upon admission. Procedures on the safe use of agrochemicals and machinery established by Agrex and information provided by ANDEF (AsociaciÃ³n Nacional de Defensa Vegetal) are also available on each farm. There is also a PCMSO medical and occupational health control program for each farm, as well as elements for first aid management. First aid kits There is evidence of PPE delivery records. A system of warnings and sanctions has been defined.
2_4_criteria: Interviews with staff verify that all workers enjoy freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining. Check that workers are not prevented from interacting with external parties outside of working hours.
2_5_criteria: Pay slips are checked to show that workers receive a gross salary that complies with national legislation and sectoral agreements. Interviews with the companys workers show that salary deductions are not made for disciplinary reasons; deductions are considered to be specified in the contract, for example in the case of unjustified absence. There is a record of hours worked using a fingerprint system, both in establishments and in offices. There is evidence that weekly working hours do not exceed 48 hours and, during the harvest or planting season, overtime is worked and paid in accordance with the current contract. Workers homes were audited at Fazendas UniÃ£o. In Campo Lindo and Batavo, it is clear that they have basic services, drinking water and safe facilities. Workers were interviewed about housing and food conditions, and no complaints or grievances were identified. Employees are not charged for accommodation
3_1_criteria: The company has communication and dialogue channels, a telephone number 0800 6483018, e-mail: Ouviria@agrex.com.br, as established in POP1395 - Relationship with the community . There is also a mailbox in the entrance hall of the companys offices, in the Central Administration and on the farms, where there is a complaints form. The mailbox is padlocked and can be opened by management. The company held meetings with neighbors, suppliers and public officials to publicize communication and dialogue channels. Signs were placed in establishments indicating the means of communication.
3_2_criteria: Not applicable. No disputed land use rights were identified. All farms in scope have established use rights and lease agreements in place. The company carries out a prior analysis of the rights of use of each farm and does not lease properties with ownership conflicts or boundary disputes. No sites of cultural importance were identified on farms within the scope. The social and environmental impact assessment does not identify places of cultural interest for local communities or indigenous peoples.
3_3_criteria: Communication and dialogue channels are also considered mechanisms for community complaints and grievances. At the companys offices, a complaints box was installed in the entrance hall, identified with a sign, where there is a form to make complaints. The complaint and date, reason for complaint, company response and date of response are recorded. A link to employee complaints is also available on the companys website. In the case of community complaints made on the farm, they are registered by the farm manager and communicated via email to company management. Handling complaints is the responsibility of the human resources, people management and occupational safety manager. The measures to be taken in the event of a complaint are defined in internal procedures. HR management receives the complaint, analyzes it and presents it to management, and is the person responsible for implementing solutions. However, no complaints were received as of the date of the audit.
3_4_criteria: Job opportunities are advertised on the company website, employee word of mouth, Facebook, Instagram and the job search website www.vagas.com.br. There are partnerships with schools and training programs in the Balsas community, such as the Agrex Institute. The company also implemented a program for interns who participate in the SENAC - MA learning program. The company established its supplier policy - POL 0165 - Supplier Policy for supplies and services in general - which establishes the conditions, legal obligations and Agrexs commitment to its suppliers. It is checked whether the suppliers are from the region. At Fazenda UniÃ£o, employees come from local communities. At Fazenda UniÃ£o, those hired for the harvest are from the local community of Apinage and SÃ£o Pedro, the workers are interviewed; at Faz Batavo, the employees are from the village, for example, the administrative manager.
4_1_criteria: It has an updated socio-environmental assessment, which establishes, in Guidance, assessment criteria, facilities, Operational Area, including fuel tanks and structure, environmental documentation, required licenses, water analysis and monitoring, labor documentation, field operations, soil preparation, planting, spraying, harvesting and other cultural activities. The assessment was conducted by an Environmental Agricultural Engineer, trained in the requirements of Standards 3.0 and 3.1, responsible for the certification system for 3 years. The assessment was carried out in a comprehensive and transparent manner, covering all production activities, infrastructure and company administration related to agricultural production. Compliance with procedures and mitigation measures established in internal audits and through selected improvement indicators is monitored. A summary of the environmental and social impact assessment is available upon request from the Balsa offices in printed format. Contact JanaÃ­na Monti Silveira
4_2_criteria: In interviews with employees and neighbors, it was verified that the burning of crop residues, garbage or any other resource is not permitted. Signs were placed at the entrance to the farm indicating that burning is prohibited. To combat forest fires, the company has implemented the POP 1376 procedure to combat forest fires and has a trained firefighting brigade. During the visit to the farms, there was no evidence of fires. The company has implemented the POP - 1373 operational procedure for waste management, which includes the classification, segregation and final disposal of waste that cannot be recycled. On all farms audited, there was evidence of identified waste containers available in workplaces such as kitchens, storerooms, homes, warehouses and offices. Fuel storage sites are equipped with safety and spill containment measures, a site has been designated for the storage of solid waste until final disposal, empty pesticide containers are stored in a specific area with restricted access, which Allows containment of spills. Furthermore, a PCRS Solid Waste Control Plan was implemented, which considers the separation, compaction and recycling of waste that has economic value and can be reused. The results are recorded in the Recyclable Materials Control spreadsheet
4_3_criteria: As part of the improvement indicators, the total direct use of fossil fuels over time is recorded, and its volume per hectare and per unit of product is monitored for all activities related to soybean production. The company has established an organic matter monitoring system. Analyzes are carried out every two years. Based on the results, techniques are implemented to mitigate negative trends, for example, adjusted fertilizer application, limestone application to correct pH, P application in the seed row, cultivation of cover crops. Native vegetation and legal reserve areas are protected and conserved, in accordance with the procedure POP-1394 - Maintenance of the Legal Reserve, which establishes the different types of conservation areas and preservation and maintenance measures. Reforestation with eucalyptus is carried out.
4_4_criteria: By comparing the satellite images of 22-07-2008 issued by the website www.dgr.inpe.br/COSR and the current image, it appears that there was no expansion of cultivation following the elimination of native forest, for example, at Fazenda UniÃ£o; from the image of 15.07.2008, emitted by the landsat 5 satellite and its comparison with the satellite image emitted by the landsat 8 satellite - Maccari Meio Ambiente e Georereferencing, it appears that at Fazenda Batavo there was no expansion of cultivation following the elimination of the native forest. Using satellite images from 15.07.08, 17.09.08 emitted by the landsat 5 satellite, and the current image emitted by the landsat 8 satellite, it can be seen that there was no expansion of cultivation after May 2009 at Fazenda Campos Lindos. There is no conversion of land where there is an unresolved use claim by traditional users in dispute.
4_5_criteria: POP 1394- Maintenance of the Legal Reserve, which establishes the different types of conservation areas and preservation and maintenance, is evident in the areas identified in the field and on cartography, with no evidence of deforestation or conversion in the conservation areas visited. It is clear from interviews with employees that hunting rare, threatened or endangered species is not permitted within the property. At the entrance to the Farms, signs prohibiting hunting were seen. Training was given to employees on the prohibition of predatory hunting in the Farm areas. Of a total of 25,750 ha, 23,801 ha of reserves were identified. All Farms have at least 10% of the surface as a protected area.
5_1_criteria: The company has implemented appropriate agricultural practices to minimize the impact on the quality of surface and groundwater with chemical residues and fertilizers, e.g. Residuals from sprayer washing are not discharged into waterways, management of empty containers and buffer areas. Practices such as direct seeding, plot systematization and contour lines prevent erosion; direction of seeding is considered to prevent erosion. Cover crops and conservation of buffer areas and water sources encourage aquifer recharge. Water wells are monitored. Water analyzes of surface water courses and wells are carried out, which are a condition for granting corresponding environmental licenses. Use licenses are available. There is evidence of the results of the water analysis program on all company farms, and records are available. There is no evidence of direct contamination from agricultural production activities. see 5.1.2. The company identifies CONAMA - National Environmental Council - as the authority to which cases of contamination of surface water courses must be reported. Pivot irrigation is used at Fazenda Santo Isidoro, and there is a POP procedure nÂº 1928 for the use of irrigation, installation of a central pivot and consumption recording. There is also an environmental risk prevention program for the Farm. Water use authorization NÂ° 27/2013, 26/2013, NÂ° 08/2013 (under renewal), in Faz UniÃ£o there are no irrigation systems.
5_2_criteria: There are maps available with all water courses water present and riparian vegetation. For example, the map of Fazenda Campos Lindos. Santo Isidoro with water intakes, stream and native forest. At Fazenda UniÃ£o, an unnamed stream was identified and, on the border close to the legal reserve, the San Valerio river. There is no evidence that riparian vegetation has been removed on the audited Farms. The watercourses are included in reserve zones and under protective management. Wetlands are identified at Fazenda UniÃ£o, but there is evidence that they are not drained and are included in the reserve area. There are channels for conveying excess rainfall in Faz UniÃ£o alongside the roads and they optimize drainage for the lagoons and natural wetlands present on the property. The maintenance of all native vegetation is evident, according to Landsat images from 2008 presented by the company.
5_3_criteria: Soil, fertility and organic matter analysis records are recorded. Technicians and managers are interviewed and production batches are audited. The company demonstrates knowledge of techniques to maintain soil quality and these techniques are being implemented, for example, crop rotation, soil analysis to maintain fertility, contour lines, direct planting. Controlled fertilization, soy inoculation, cover crops. There is evidence of systematized production plots with contour lines, rotation with cover crops, direct planting and controlled applications. No signs of erosion were observed on the farms visited. Roads and culverts are maintained. There is evidence of systematization of lots and contour lines at Faz Campos Lindos, maintained with harrowing, production lots are audited and there is no evidence of soil erosion. There is evidence of batch production records and it appears that crop rotation is implemented.
5_4_criteria: The company has established an integrated management procedure documented in POP-1377 Pest management and control, which includes techniques such as Pest monitoring and implementation of the Strider system with batch information and stage monitoring results through sampling, damage level and targeted applications, resistance prevention through agrochemical rotation and crop rotation. Techniques such as the use of specific crops for pest control are implemented, for example, Crotalaria sp for nematode control, machines are washed when they come from another region - Mato Grosso, MaranhÃ£o - before use, to prevent the entry of nematodes. Monitoring is recorded. There is evidence of a policy of responsible use of agrochemicals and targets to reduce the use of the most dangerous toxicological categories. The objectives are documented in Agrexs sustainability report. The decision to use RR varieties reduces the use of insecticides. Genuine products are used, the pesticide deposit at Faz UniÃ£o is audited, all pesticides are original and genuine. The use and application of pesticides follows the recommendations of production technicians, for example, at Fazenda UniÃ£o, applications and application and dosage recommendations are made by the Farm Agronomist. At Faz Batavo, recommendations are made by a consultant. Rotations of active ingredients are carried out to avoid resistance, the climatic conditions of application are considered to guarantee effectiveness and avoid drifts. The application is carried out through a work order issued by the companys technician.
5_5_criteria: There is evidence of documented records of the use of agrochemicals, in accordance with the requirements of this standard. Purchases of agrochemicals through the multisite are made centrally and then dispatched to the Farms. Pesticide and warehouse stock movements are controlled by the warehouse and the multisite member. There is evidence of agrochemical transfer notes from Agrex Balsa. The management of used containers is highlighted, the receipt of returns of empty agrochemical packaging, AREIA - Association of Agricultural Input Resellers of Porto Nacional and the central region of receiving empty packaging in Silvanopolis. Tocantins -; receipt No. 342 from Agrex do Brasil - Faz UniÃ£o dated 10-5-18. During the audit, empty packaging deposits were audited at Faz Campos Lindos, Faz Batavo and Faz UniÃ£o, and there is evidence of adequate treatment with triple washing and perforation of used packaging stored in the deposits. There is evidence of training records for Agrex service providers and workers in handling empty packaging and safe handling of phytosanitary products, for example, "Training in agrochemical application technology and treatment of used agrochemical packaging". The warehouses of the audited farms were inspected, they all have means of spill containment, emergency measures to deal with accidents (emergency shower, eyewash), danger signs at the entrance, access restricted to authorized and trained personnel only. Furthermore, the company carried out and implemented safety measures in accordance with the PPRA - Environmental Risk Assessment. The company implements procedure SOP -1374 - Handling and storage of chemical products - for the handling and storage of chemical products. All applicable safety, hygiene and environmental precautions and compliance with the requirements established in NR31 and Law 9974/00 and Decree 4074/02 are highlighted. The transport has the safety signs required by law. There is evidence of the implementation of the procedure "Pulverization of pesticides" - POP 1379, which establishes in item 7. 9 the identification of the treated area, which must be identified by a sign with the legend Treated Area, highlighted in Faz UniÃ£o; Sprayed Lot safety signs and re-entry period are displayed; In Faz Campos Lindos and Faz Batavo, identification plates are displayed in the pesticide deposits, which are used to identify the sprayed lots. Fertilizers are used in accordance with the recommendations of the Farm technicians and information from the manufacturer. The requirements for use arise from the soil analyzes carried out.
5_6_criteria: The warehouses, stock list and application records are checked for non-use of products included in the Stockholm and Rotterdam lists. Pesticide warehouses at Faz UniÃ£o and agrochemical application records were audited. At Faz Campos Lindos, pesticide deposits and agrochemical application records were audited. Pesticide deposits on Faz Batavo plots and pesticide application records were audited. " POP procedure No. 2503 V01 of 2-3-18 - Reduction in the use of Paraquat was highlighted, with the aim of reducing the use of this active ingredient in drying soybean plantations. Reduction targets of 50% were established by 2019 and 50% by 2020. The use of Diquat for dehydration is being tested. The company continues to test alternatives and research new alternative products.
5_7_criteria: NA. No biological control agents are used.
5_8_criteria: If invasive species, new pests or serious outbreaks are identified, the company plans to notify EMBRAPA. No situations requiring notification have been identified.
5_9_criteria: There are documented procedures that specify good agricultural practices, for example, there is evidence of that the operational procedure - Spraying of agricultural pesticides - POP 1379, V 02, was implemented, indicating measures to minimize drift, the effect of atmospheric agents, precautions in case of aerial applications and communication and warning of application to neighbors. Particularly in the case of aerial applications, it is established that they must not be carried out less than 500 m from any own or third party building, and must not be applied closer than 500 m from bodies of water, and neighbors must be notified , if applicable. No aerial application was carried out on the farms visited. There is no evidence that WHO Class Ia, Ib and II products are being used within 500 m of populated areas or bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: The company implements measures to prevent interference with production neighbors. Good application practices and procedures are implemented that consider minimizing drift and weather conditions for applications. Application notices and communication with neighbors are maintained. Neighbors were interviewed and reported no interference issues.
5_11_criteria: There are three sources of seeds: the seed produced at Faz Santo Isidoro itself, the soybean seed produced by Agrex at the Lagoa da Confusao/TO multiplication unit is also used, and the seed is purchased from external suppliers. There is evidence of planting orders and records of seed purchases and origins,

Name: GGF - Guerino Ferrarin e Outros
1_1_criteria: The units partially comply with applicable laws. The production units reuse empty agrochemical packaging and there is no adequate signage of locations demonstrating electrical risk in accordance with NR 10.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: A social and environmental assessment of the properties was not prepared.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other involuntary labor was found during the audit process in the work environments or heard during interviews with employees at the groups production units.

2_3_criteria: Information on health and safety is documented and transmitted for employees during Integration or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations in the groups production units
2_4_criteria: The absence of an impediment to freedom of association is demonstrated and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the groups production units

4_2_criteria: The farms in the scope does not have adequate oil and grease structures.
4_3_criteria: The farms in the scope have adequate control of the fuel used in production.
4_4_criteria: There was no area cleaning after May 2009.
4_5_criteria: Protection areas being protected according to national law. The properties have CAR (Rural Environmental Registry) where APP, legal reserve and arable area on the scope farms are delimited.

5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, o use of contour lines and soil analyzes are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the groups production units

5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the production units of the group.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the unit.
5_8_criteria: In case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact Embrapa and FundaÃ§Ã£o MT, which are nationally recognized research institutions and partners of the production units.
5_9_criteria: Applications are carried out at more restrictive distances than the standard for populated areas and protection areas. There are no records of climatic conditions.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the groups production units.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through the purchase of well-known companies that issue proof of origin

5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the production units of the group.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the unit.
5_8_criteria: In case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact Embrapa and FundaÃ§Ã£o MT, which are nationally recognized research institutions and partners of the production units.
5_9_criteria: Applications are carried out at more restrictive distances than the standard for populated areas and protection areas. There are no records of climatic conditions.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the groups production units.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through the purchase of well-known companies that issue proof of origin

Name: SLC Agricola SA
1_1_criteria: The coordinators of both properties demonstrated great knowledge of the laws applicable to the Standard, that is, labor, environmental, health and safety at work legislation. The SLC Group is advised by a company that provides updated information on the legislation relevant to the certification protocols present on the multi-site. During the audit it was possible to demonstrate compliance with the legislation, through the evaluation of documents such as the Rural Environmental Registry (CAR), Environmental Licensing, Water Use Grants, Return of Empty Packaging, Disposal of Hazardous Waste, NR 31, Labor Legislation among others applicable to the standard.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through the documentary evaluation of the records of registrations and lease agreements for SLC Group properties. The documents presented are in accordance with the legislation.
1_3_criteria: In accordance with the RTRS Standard Internal Control System Manual rev. 02, item 7.5.1 Â– Internal audit, SLC AgrÃ­cola periodically carries out internal audits on its Internal Control System Â– RTRS Standard with the aim of providing information to management on the status of the System and determining whether it complies with planned, whether it has been properly implemented and is being maintained, whether it is effective in meeting the Policy, company objectives and relevant RTRS Standard. Internal audit report evidenced, based on RTRS indicators, thus covering social, environmental and agricultural aspects of the operation. Monitoring of indicators determined by the group for monitoring is evidenced, and they are applied in the environmental, social and health and safety spheres.
2_1_criteria: According to visual verification, and through interviews with employees, there is no evidence of forced labor , taxed, forced, trafficked or otherwise involuntary, nor from employee documentation retained with employers, nor from employees wives being required to work on the property, there are no workers under the age of 18 on the property. All workers have the opportunity for promotion within the multi-site. According to visual verification and through interviews, there is no evidence of corporal punishment, coercion and physical or mental aggression, physical or verbal abuse, sexual harassment or any other type of intimidation of workers.
2_2_criteria: Evidenced through documental assessment of employees at both properties, that all employees have a written contract in clear language. Evidenced through documentary evaluation and through interviews in both properties that all employees receive training due and appropriate to the functions they perform.
2_3_criteria: Evidenced through interviews with employees in the role of PPE Sanitizer, Warehouse and Calda preparer, all demonstrate knowledge and understanding of health and safety issues.
2_4_criteria: There is no evidence of actions that prevent workers from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as impediments to their presence in the groupâ€™s production units. The municipalitys union was visited during the public consultation where the person responsible reported not having received labor complaints against the audited properties.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that the wages paid at the property are consistent with what is established in the union agreement and In the collective agreement, if there are no salary differences between employees of the same category in the groups production units, there are no salary deductions for disciplinary purposes as assessed in the payroll.
3_1_criteria: Visually and documented the communication channels of both Farms.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users were identified, and no disputes over land use were identified on the evaluated properties. The property ownership documentation such as registration and deed were presented and are in accordance with the applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: Complaint and grievance mechanism implemented and accessible to the local community, with due treatment and feedback to complainants.
3_4_criteria: The majority of employees are from the regions where the farms are located, when it is necessary to hire new employees, it is usually done through recommendation from active employees, and they are always people from the regional community. Evidenced the groups collaboration with training programs open to the population and opportunities to supply goods according to contracted budgets and services.
4_1_criteria: Evidenced that there is no implementation of new structures on the farm.
4_2_criteria: Evidenced At various points on the properties, waste separation is practiced, using bins classified as: metal, glass, plastic and paper. Adequate storage and disposal of waste, observed battery return receipt for all properties and used oil collection record, observed containment barriers around fuel storage and supply points, no fires were evident in any part of the property , neither from crop residues or leftovers, nor with the aim of suppressing vegetation, which was confirmed through interviews with field employees and the responsible agronomists.
4_3_criteria: The SLC Group records, plans and monitors through of a computerized system for all fuel consumption, activities related to soybean production, those responsible for monitoring this information are the coordinators. Control of this information is carried out through a computerized system. A comparison of 2014 and 2015 per hectare was presented. The property also monitors the organic matter content of the soil with the aim of always maintaining the best content in the soil, for this purpose it uses agricultural practices that provide the best results.
4_4_criteria: There was no agricultural expansion within the farms after 2009, evidenced through satellite photos and production maps in the groups production units.
4_5_criteria: Maps were analyzed showing the boundaries of the farms with mapping of native vegetation. Through interviews with employees of the properties and signs indicating that hunting is prohibited, we highlighted the prohibition of these practices on the properties.
5_1_criteria: The property carries out water monitoring through chemical analysis of the water, and no evidence was identified of localized contamination of surface or underground water, if any localized contamination occurs, local authorities will be notified. In both properties, erosion control measures were also evidenced, such as direct planting, high soil coverage, avoiding surface runoff and leaching of chemical residues into the water table.
5_2_criteria: The properties maintain File the mapping of areas, where it is possible to identify watercourses and riparian vegetation. Compliance can also be verified during field visits. There were no areas where riparian vegetation was removed. It was clear from a field visit that there are no natural wetlands being drained.
5_3_criteria: The properties carry out chemical analysis of the soil annually to determine fertility levels and recommendations for fertilizing. In addition, the property uses direct planting and crop rotation techniques, maintaining straw to guarantee organic matter in the soil. Plants at level to avoid surface erosion.
5_4_criteria: The SLC group has a management plan, documented through the Â“Grain Quality ManualÂ”. Evidenced in the documented Â“Reduction Plan in the use of OrganophosphatesÂ”, approved in March 2015, applicable to all properties of the group. The standard procedure for both properties is that after the field technicians return with the monitoring results, the decision is made to recommend application. Monitoring and application records are evidenced.
5_5_criteria: All pesticide applications are carried out after monitoring the crop and with the recommendation of the agronomist responsible for the farm. Weather conditions are monitored and recorded at the time of application, to prevent drift into neighboring areas. Visually checked, in all areas where pesticide applications were carried out, indicative signs, signaling the treated area and the period of re-entry into the crop. Visually evidence that pesticide packaging is stored, washed and disposed of appropriately. For both properties, the sheds for storing pesticides were visually highlighted, they comply with all legislation.
5_6_criteria: There are no products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions, verified through analysis of farm stock reports Pamplona and Planalto, which contains all the products in stock on the property, also evidenced in an on-site visit
5_7_criteria: There is no use of biological control agents.
5_8_criteria: Through an interview with agronomist engineers from both properties and also from checking the crop monitoring records, it was possible to verify that so far the identified pests are included in the MIP. There was no incidence of new pests or outbreaks of existing pests.
5_9_criteria: Evidenced through interviews with agronomists from Pamplona Farm and Planalto Farm and through analysis of documents that, for the application of pesticides, application conditions, wind speed, temperature, relative humidity, ideal pH of the mixture are considered/analyzed. Both properties have a climate monitoring station.
5_10_criteria: According to documentary verification and information from engineers. Agronomists of the properties, when it is necessary to apply pesticides, in the documents Requisition/Application Planning Agricultural Pesticides and OS Â– Service Order there are guidelines to avoid interference in neighboring areas.
5_11_criteria: According to document verification and interview with eng. Agronomist of the property, when it is necessary to purchase seeds, they are acquired with the terms of seed compliance, to verify the origin and quality of the seed, observing the producers registration in Renasem. the group also produces its own seed, having verified due registration with Renasem.

Name: Saag Comercial Exportadora Ltda
1_1_criteria: The company has access to applicable legislation and is complied with. Collaborators demonstrated knowledge and relevant documents were available.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations, lease contracts and CCIR Â– INCRA.
1_3_criteria: The aspects have been identified and continuous improvement is being carried out through action plans, showing the companys commitment to meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory or slave labor was found or involuntary during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees.
2_2_criteria: Own workers receive training and pertinent information about each function to be performed. Indirectly hired workers are instructed on compliance with the labor rights and duties of both parties, where the service provider undertakes to train its employees and provide PPE to perform the work.
2_3_criteria: Information about health and security are documented and are transmitted to employees during Onboarding and during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and an action plan is available for emergency situations in production units.
2_4_criteria: Workers are not prevented from having freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment to their presence in the agricultural unit.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that workers Salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees in the same category. Adequate housing provided by the company to employees. For outsourced workers there are no records of hours worked available.
3_1_criteria: Communication occurs through communication channels such as the SAAG website, group manager (https://scisaag.wordpress.com/reclamacoes/), containing e-mails telephones, postal address on the roads between the community and the farms with publicity signs written Â“contact usÂ” and internally on the farms in the scope through the Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”, available near the workers point control .
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation such as registration and lease agreements were presented and are in accordance with applicable legal requirements. Places of importance are identified, maintained and preserved.
3_3_criteria: A complaints and complaints mechanism is made available, described in the groups operational procedures. The mechanism establishes a procedure for recording and handling complaints, through a complaints and grievances form, available at production units. There were no records of complaints and complaints at the time of the audit.
3_4_criteria: The hired workers come from communities close to the production unit and internal vacancies on the farms and are publicized through the employees themselves in the local community, where the interested party comes to the company and fills out the job application, I have your resume on file. Supply of products and services to the local community was carried out by Saag.
4_1_criteria: Socio-environmental assessment available, in the document called Monitoring Schedules and Programs, there are the identified points and the measures to minimize or mitigate the identified impacts. There is also a schedule for implementing the proposed actions and it has been monitored and complied with.
4_2_criteria: Storage of waste such as lubricants, batteries, tires and agricultural pesticide packaging appropriately. The Environmental Control Plan presented during the audit includes waste management including all areas of the property.
4_3_criteria: The unit promotes actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out according to soil analyzes and monitored organic matter in the soil.
4_4_criteria: It has been shown through maps and satellite photos that soybean areas were already used for agriculture before May 2009, with no conversion of native forests and areas with regenerated vegetation.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling the areas of preservation and legal reserve, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good agricultural practices (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and groundwater.
5_2_criteria: The vegetation of riparian forests was not removed, however, in the Environmental Control Plan , which shows the actions proposed by the farms to adapt to the new forest code, there is a schedule for the restoration of some areas. There are no natural wetlands in the production unit
5_3_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analyses, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. Erosion control and crop rotation techniques are implemented appropriately.
5_4_criteria: The integrated crop management plan and targets for reducing phytosanitary products were presented. List and invoices for the purchase of products were available, demonstrating that they use products that comply with Brazilian legislation.
5_5_criteria: Records of pesticide application on farms in the scope are made manually and recorded in spreadsheets, covering the indicator information. Storage and transportation of agrochemicals and dangerous substances within legal requirements. There are signs with product information and re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: During field verification on agrochemical application fronts, retroactive application records and storage. No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found. There was no evidence of the use of Paraquat on farms within the scope of certification.
5_7_criteria: No evidence of the use of biological control agents was found.
5_8_criteria: There were no incidences of new pests that have not been identified , according to the records presented. "Control of New Pests and Diseases" procedure available, in the case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact the available research body.
5_9_criteria: Standard Operating Procedure - Pesticide Care - Drift was presented, addressing precautions, especially wind in agricultural pesticide applications. There is no aerial application on farms within the scope.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas use the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: Fazendas Bartira
1_1_criteria: The organization demonstrated knowledge of the legislation and it is implemented on the sampled farms. After the audit, the group manager was informed that Fazenda Horizontina Norte is on the IBAMA Embargo List, dated 07/10/2018. The reason for the reported embargo was the absence of the LO, however it was available during the audit, dated 05/08/2018.
1_2_criteria: Land ownership was evidenced through registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: The socio-environmental aspects and impacts, as well as control measures were raised by the group manager before the audit.
2_1_criteria: No adverse working conditions were found, such as forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary during the audit process in the workplace or heard during interviews with employees.
2_2_criteria: Labor laws are adequately complied with, all workers have a registration form, contract, as well as a collective bargaining agreement, that specify their working conditions.
2_3_criteria: Accident and emergency procedures are available. Workers and those responsible for the operation demonstrated knowledge about health and safety at work through verbal explanations addressing issues related to the application of agricultural pesticides, use of machinery and equipment and use of PPE. There is integration training and a code of conduct addressing these topics, which were explained to the workers.
2_4_criteria: Workers have freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining with trade unions.
2_5_criteria: The sampled farms comply with the working day in accordance with labor legislation, as well as what is established in Collective Labor Agreements with the categorys unions.
3_1_criteria: Communication channels are available internally on the farms for employees and externally via the Ombudsman Channel , via telephone and email.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. Property ownership documentation has been presented and is in accordance with applicable legal requirements.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels available to employees and the community. Communication with the community is established, as Bartira Farms are known in the community and have a website available to everyone.
3_4_criteria: There are actions that encourage the development of communities close to the farms, as well as at a group level.
4_1_criteria: The socio-environmental assessment of socio-environmental aspects and impacts, as well as control measures were raised by the group manager before the audit. The assessment is available upon request.
4_2_criteria: The company has a waste management plan implemented on farms, with correct disposal of waste.
4_3_criteria: Monitoring of diesel, organic matter and opportunities for Carbon sequestration is done according to the reality of the farms.
4_4_criteria: All maps of the farms participating in the multi-site group "Comparison map with satellite images (2009, 2016 and current)" were presented. The maps were compared with the RTRS map, demonstrating that the areas are adequate. Horizontina Leste Farm was opened, but it was carried out through Authorization by the Competent Environmental Agency - SEMA/MA with number 0053/2012 valid until 04/18/2013. For this opening, the study "SURVEY" was presented
4_5_criteria: Native vegetation is maintained and preserved in accordance with current legislation. Hunting is not practiced on the properties.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices and relevant structures to avoid water contamination are implemented on the farms.
5_2_criteria: The watercourses and APP on the properties visited are described on maps, there was no removal of vegetation from the APP areas.
5_3_criteria: The farms have good land use management, including adequate fertilization, crop rotations, erosion control and maintenance of soil quality. Soil analyzes are carried out regularly, including the assessment of organic matter content. The analyzes are used to determine the fertility and plan fertilization.
5_4_criteria: Farms use suitable products to control pests and diseases. IPM and plans to reduce the use of chemical products are being implemented.
5_5_criteria: The use, transport and storage of chemicals and empty packaging are carried out properly. Signs are used indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas.
5_6_criteria: The use of paraquat in Brazil is still permitted for soybean cultivation according to MAPA, with some exceptions such as manual applications, backpacks and/or with tractors without a closed cabin. The use of the product has also been reduced due to restrictions. A reduction plan was presented for the coming years.
5_7_criteria: There is no use of biological products on the farms visited.
5_8_criteria: Notification systems for new pests or invasive species present.
5_9_criteria: There are drift control procedures for the use of agrochemicals near populated areas or bodies of water.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system.
5_11_criteria: Seeds purchased externally in accordance with legal requirements.
