5_8_criteria: To identify and monitor new invasive species and pests in the area, the group maintains verbal contact with research institutes such as Embrapa.
5_9_criteria: Atmospheric conditions such as wind, humidity and temperature before application are partially recorded in the groups production units.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the groups production units.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through purchase from well-known companies that issue proof of origin or in the groups own production units, with the plan made in agreement with RENASEM.

Name: CRESOL -  Estrada de Ferro
1_1_criteria: The properties receive consultancy from accounting firms for the management of applicable legislation, as well as agricultural and environmental consultancy companies, and consultancy from Cresol itself. On each farm there is a folder made by Cresol, which contains various documents related to relevant guidelines and legislation. Cresol has its own technical teams, such as legal, accounting and technical teams in different areas of knowledge and provides support to members.
1_2_criteria: Property areas are duly registered through certificates, court decisions and contracts of lease.
1_3_criteria: All farms had non-conformities in this criterion, as it is related to indicator 4.1.1 on social and environmental impact assessment, which was also non-compliant in all farms. NC: 1.3.2 - There is no social and environmental assessment carried out, as well as identification of aspects to be improved.
2_1_criteria: Two of the audited farms do not have employees. In neither of the other two is there evidence of forced labor, forced labor, trafficking or involuntary labor in any way. There are no minors working on the audited farms. No evidence of discrimination of any kind was identified, nor was any evidence of punishment, coercion and aggression of any kind. On one of the farms, it was not possible to provide proof of return of the work card to the employee, despite there being no evidence of retention. NC: 2.1.2 - There is no declaration proving the return of CTPS.
2_2_criteria: On one of the farms that has workers, there are no employment contracts signed with them. On both farms that have workers, adequate and appropriate training in occupational health and safety is not carried out. The indicators of this criterion are not immediately compliant and will be verified in the next surveillance audit.
2_3_criteria: In general, owners and workers demonstrate knowledge of health and safety issues and the use of PPE. However, health and safety risks have not been identified and there are no procedures implemented to control them on farms. The farms do not have a documented health and safety program (PPRA/PCMSO, etc.) and there are no emergency procedures in place. Farms have access to first aid. On one of the farms audited, there was no evidence of training for the employee responsible for applying pesticides. PPE is available for employees, but no delivery records have been identified. NC: 2.3.3 - There is no evidence that the pesticide applicator has participated in training for this purpose. 2.3.4 - There is no record of delivery of PPE.
2_4_criteria: Through interviews with employees, it was evidenced that they are not prevented from interacting with external parties and have complete freedom to participate in collective negotiations, if any . Unions approve terminations of employment contracts.
2_5_criteria: Workers receive wages above or equal to the national minimum, proven by payslips and interviews. No worker receives payments based on results, everyone is salaried. No salary deductions are made, other than those provided for by law, such as INSS and union contributions. The farms have housing and/or accommodation for employees, and they are in good condition, including sanitary conditions. The farms do not charge any fees for housing. The normal working day on farms is 44 hours per week, and overtime is normally only worked during the harvest period. However, there is no way to prove that excessive hours are not worked as farms do not record working hours per worker. NC: 2.5.3 and 2.5.4 - There is no control over hours worked and overtime, and overtime must only be carried out for limited periods.
3_1_criteria: The audited farms are well known in local communities, and the farms publish their contact numbers.
3_2_criteria: No cases of disputes with traditional users regarding land use rights were identified. No permanent conservation areas or areas of high cultural value were identified near the farms. There are also no adjacent indigenous peoples.
3_3_criteria: There is a communication channel at group manager level, next to Cresol Estrada de Ferro in the city of Orizona/GO, but there is no mechanism for complaints and grievances within the farms. NC: 3.3.1 - There is no obvious mechanism for complaints and grievances on the property.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies on farms are advertised by word of mouth, and through referrals, always looking for workers in the region. Properties participate in events and field days. The owners participate in lectures and training by the Rural Union and SENAR in the region.
4_1_criteria: One of the audited farms participates in an Internship Program at an agricultural school in the municipality. The owners seek to purchase products and hire services from companies in the region, as evidenced in invoices.
4_2_criteria: The farms did not carry out a social and environmental assessment. Only one of the farms carried out an environmental assessment through an Environmental Management Plan. NC 4.1.1/4.1.2/4.1.3/4.1.5 - There is no social and environmental assessment carried out, as well as identification of the social, environmental and agricultural aspects that should be improved.
4_3_criteria: None of the audited farms burn on the property. Only one of the farms audited did not show non-compliance regarding the storage and disposal of hazardous waste such as fuel, burnt oil, batteries and light bulbs. Other waste is managed correctly. Farms in the municipality of SilvÃ¢nia separate and deliver recyclable waste to a recycling company, while farms in Orizona separate waste and deliver it to the municipal landfill. NC: 4.2.2 - Burnt oil stored incorrectly. There is no dedicated place to dispose of batteries and light bulbs. / Fuel tank not in accordance with technical standards
4_4_criteria: The farms do not record the total and direct use of fossil fuel, however this indicator is in compliance with the 3rd year. Most farms work with precision agriculture and all carry out complete soil analysis, including organic matter content. Contributing to increased carbon sequestration, Cresol has a partnership in which it makes seedlings available to producers who need to restore native forests. All properties planted native species in some areas for plant replacement. Two of the audited farms use solar energy to supply energy to irrigation pivots. Another farm has a project to implement a biodigester on the property.
4_5_criteria: All the farms reported that the area was opened before 2009, but in none of them it was possible to provide documentary evidence. NC: 4.4.1 - There are no maps delimiting areas of native vegetation, production areas and watercourses, as well as proving the non-conversion into cultivation areas and comparing with RTRS maps.
5_1_criteria: Only One of the farms has a map showing native vegetation, production areas and water courses. One of the farms has an Environmental Management Plan that guarantees the monitoring of vegetation and wildlife. There is no type of forestry extraction, hunting or collection of protected species on the properties. All farms have a CAR where the registered legal reserve areas are described, all with 19% or more native vegetation. NC: 4.5.1 - There are no maps indicating areas of native vegetation, production areas and water courses.
5_2_criteria: The properties use different techniques that define good agricultural practices, such as: direct planting, planting on level curves with terracing, in addition to pipes on the roadsides to store rainwater. On farms that carry out irrigation, water use is controlled according to the water demand required for each crop at a given stage, following technical recommendations. No wastewater is released into watercourses. Only one of the farms audited monitors and mitigates the quality of water resources, but this indicator is in compliance with the 3rd year. Most farms carry out water analysis.
5_3_criteria: Only one of the farms has a map identifying watercourses and native vegetation. The farms preserve the riparian forest and humid areas. NC: 5.2.1 - There are no maps indicating areas of native vegetation, production areas and watercourses.
5_4_criteria: The farms carry out annual soil analyzes, always after the safrinha harvest, for application purposes corrections and soil liming. Some farms use precision agriculture. Various techniques to preserve soil quality are practiced, such as: direct planting, level planting, terraced areas, crop rotation, in addition to maintaining permanent cover vegetation.
5_5_criteria: The farm owners demonstrate knowledge and already apply practices related to MIC, but on most farms there is no specific MIC plan documented and implemented. However, this indicator is not immediately compliant and will be verified in the next surveillance audit. The farms also do not have a specific plan that contains targets for reducing phytosanitary products, an indicator that will also be verified in the next surveillance audit. In all properties only use original and genuine agrochemical products that meet local registration requirements, as verified in invoices and application forms. Agrochemical applications are made in accordance with technical recommendations.
5_6_criteria: Farms record agrochemical applications. Producers have booklets with guidance on the practice of triple washing and demonstrate knowledge about this process. All farms showed non-compliance regarding the storage of empty agrochemical packaging. The storage of agrochemicals was also a non-compliant item on all audited farms, however this indicator is not immediately compliant and will be verified in the next surveillance audit. Farms install signs in sprayed areas informing about re-entry periods. Fertilizer applications are made according to technical recommendations based on soil analysis. NC: 5.5.2 - There is no deposit of empty packaging, nor is there a certificate demonstrating the return of empty packaging. / The empty packaging deposit does not comply with technical standards and is being used to store other materials. / Empty packaging is being stored in big bags in the yard and the empty packaging deposit is being used to store other materials.
5_7_criteria: Products listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions are not used on the audited farms. The use of Paraquat is being abolished respecting the date of June/2017.
5_8_criteria: Two of the audited farms use biological control agents for soil and caterpillars, but only one of them keeps records of their use. However, this indicator is not immediately compliant.
5_9_criteria: The State of GoiÃ¡s has an agency called Agro Defesa that monitors and inspects properties for the purpose of controlling invasive species.
5_10_criteria: None of the farms audited have documented procedures that specify agricultural practices related to the application of agrochemicals. However, this indicator is not immediately compliant. No aerial application of agrochemicals is carried out on any of the audited farms. The areas for terrestrial application of agrochemicals are adjacent to other crops, with no residences closer than 30 m. Likewise, the watercourses are protected by APP areas.
5_11_criteria: The soybean seeds used by the farms are acquired from legally known quality sources. There is no cultivation or use of own-produced seeds.

Organization: Cerquality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação
Name: CerQuality Consultoria em Sustentabilidade e Certificação Ltda Grupo III
1_1_criteria: The groups production and management units demonstrated knowledge of the legislation applicable to their core activity during the audit.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: The group manager together with the production units are implementing corrective actions arising from internal audits for continuous improvement, thus showing the companys commitment and evolution in meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other involuntary work was found during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees in the production units of the group.
2_2_criteria: Own workers or third parties receive training and relevant information about each function to be performed and the rights and duties of both parties are defined in the employment contracts and code of conduct in the groups production units.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety information is documented and transmitted to employees during Onboarding or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations in the groups production units
2_4_criteria: There is no evidence that prevents workers from have freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment of their presence in the groups production units.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that the salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees of the same category in the groups production units.
3_1_criteria: Communication channels are available internally through suggestion boxes in the production units and externally on the website and publicity via signs available at the entrance to the production units, made by the Group Manager.
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the assessed area. The property ownership documentation such as registration and deed were presented and are in accordance with the legal requirements applicable in the groups production units.
3_3_criteria: The complaints mechanisms are available internally through suggestion boxes in the production units. production and externally on the website and publicity on signs available at the entrance of the production units, carried out by the Group Manager.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are opened in local cities verbally for the groups production units.
4_1_criteria: There was no major impact construction observed during this initial audit at the groups production units.
4_2_criteria: The group manager is standardizing adaptation measures to minimize pollution such as reuse and recycling of materials, through selective collection and all petroleum derivatives in the groups production units.
4_3_criteria: The groups units record fuel in general. Fertilization is carried out according to soil analyses, where organic matter is also monitored. Areas of environmental interest are maintained and preserved in the groups production units.
4_4_criteria: There was no agricultural expansion within the farms after 2009, evidenced through satellite images in the groups production units.
4_5_criteria: Areas of environmental interest are respected and conserved by the administration of the groups production units.
5_1_criteria: Monitoring of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption is carried out, through water analysis, where it is soil contamination was verified in the groups production units.
5_2_criteria: Permanent Preservation Areas are defined on maps of the groups production units, with no evidence that vegetation was removed or altered.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, the use of contour lines and soil analyzes are carried out to improve soil quality and control erosion in the groups production units.
5_4_criteria: Ãˆ Pest monitoring is carried out to determine the application of pesticides, only when necessary, in addition to using direct planting, green manure and crop rotation, which are also practices used to reduce pest infestation in the groups production units, through the MIC.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical applications contain information such as purchased products, applied dose, installments, and application dates, requiring improvement. The storage, collection and disposal of empty packaging is being carried out at the groups production units.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found at the groups production units.
5_7_criteria: The use of traditional biological agents on a small scale can be carried out in the groups production units.
5_8_criteria: Procedure for Control of New Pests and Diseases is not presented.
5_9_criteria: The Atmospheric conditions such as wind, humidity and temperature before application are partially recorded in the groups production units.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the groups production units.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through purchase from well-known companies that issue proof of origin in the groups production units.

Name: Cataratas do Iguacu Produtos Organicos Ltda - Gebana Brasil
1_1_criteria: The farms have access to applicable legislation and they are complied with. Employees demonstrated knowledge of the legislation and relevant documents were available. During the audit, the documentation relevant to family farming was verified, the infrastructure was checked, interviews with those responsible for the farms and agronomic and environmental issues were observed. Knowledge of applicable laws was demonstrated. Documents demonstrating land ownership, registrations, certificates, list of products used, good agricultural practices, internal training, seed purchase invoices and terms of compliance, input invoice for the purchase of inputs, environmental licenses, rural environmental registration were verified. (CAR), grants, potability analysis, among other documents.
1_2_criteria: Documents such as registrations of the audited farms, and in cases of settlements, the term of commitment, DAP and registration of the property with registration were presented.
1_3_criteria: The document called "Gebana Diagnosis - Socio-Environmental Analysis" and it was possible to verify that the assessment was carried out, however the points for improvement were not defined.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave or involuntary labor during the audit process in work environments. There is no hiring of employees on the audited farms. It is family farming. According to information obtained in the interviews, the spouses have other work activities outside the farm and their children attend school.
2_2_criteria: Training, training and guidance on health and safety are provided to the owners through the group manager.
2_3_criteria: Producers demonstrated knowledge of health and safety issues, potentially dangerous activities are carried out only by qualified people, appropriate clothing and equipment were provided to producers by Gebana, however, the risks relating to the issues health and safety issues were not identified/mapped.
2_4_criteria: All farms audited are family farms, no employees are hired.
2_5_criteria: There are no workers hired. However, the water potability analyzes carried out by Gebana do not have a conclusive report in accordance with the Ministry of Health Ordinance.
3_1_criteria: On the farms visited, there are suggestions and complaints boxes available (managed by Gebana) and communication channels were publicized (website (https://blog.gebana.com.br/ouvidoria-Gebana-brasil) containing emails, telephones and postal addresses. and telephone) to the community. On the roads between the community and the farms with advertising signs written Â“talk to usÂ” and internally on the scope farms through Â“suggestion and complaint boxÂ”.
3_2_criteria: In the audit carried out, no dispute was detected relating to land use. Land ownership documents were presented as registrations and, in cases of settlements, the term of commitment, DAP and registration of the property with registration. There are no indigenous people near the farms. On all audited farms, Legal Reserve and/or Permanent Preservation areas are identified and protected. There are signs prohibiting hunting in these areas.
3_3_criteria: Complaint channels are available and accessible. Complaints and complaints received are checked and responded to. There were no complaints or complaints recorded at the time of the audit.
3_4_criteria: Gebana, the group manager, organizes field days aimed at producers and the local community, offering, among other things, courses, technical support, etc.
4_1_criteria: Social, environmental and agricultural aspects were identified for each farm in the certification scope. The studies are available upon request.
4_2_criteria: The Waste Management Plan was presented during the audit and it was found that the plan covers waste management including all areas of the property. On the audited farms, initiatives were highlighted to separate recyclable waste and sales notes or donations of this waste were presented.
4_3_criteria: The farms promote actions such as fuel registration, fertilization, which is carried out in accordance with soil analyzes and organic matter in the soil was monitored.
4_4_criteria: There was no incorporation of new planting areas after May 2009. Checks of maps and satellite images extracted from Google Earth of the farm areas in the scope, it was possible to identify that no there were new soybean planting areas on the farms visited, which were within the indicators requirements.
4_5_criteria: The audited farms have more than 10% of the area of native vegetation, however, they all carry out actions to encourage the wildlife, protect and restore native vegetation, during the audit it was possible to identify signs signaling preservation and legal reserve areas, as well as the prohibition of hunting in these areas.
5_1_criteria: The audited farms demonstrate good practices agricultural (erosion control, direct planting, terraces to contain rainwater, drainage channels, adequate application of pesticides and fertilizers, etc.) that help recharge the aquifer and improve the quality of surface and underground water.
5_2_criteria: On maps and field visits, riparian vegetation was not removed. There are no humid areas on the farms visited.
5_3_criteria: The farms visited adopt good agricultural practices, carry out soil analysis, checking the qualities and deficiencies of the soil and correcting them when necessary. During visits to the production areas, it was possible to identify that erosion control techniques are applied appropriately.
5_4_criteria: The Integrated Crop Management Plan was presented by the farms, prepared by Gebana, which serves as a basis for carrying out the field inspections and better control methodology for farms in scope. The farms have organic certification.
5_5_criteria: There is no use of agrochemical products. Proof of disposal of empty packaging of organic products was presented to receiving companies in the region duly licensed to receive this waste. The correct handling and storage of them in a restricted and identified location was also verified. The use of fertilizers and all applications follow professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: The use of Carbofuram and Paraquat was not evidenced on farms within the scope of certification. No evidence of the use of these products was found, during the visit to the properties, list of products used by the company and application controls.
5_7_criteria: Only biological control agent is used, information on the use of biological control was available.
5_8_criteria: There were no incidences of new pests that have not been identified, according to the records presented. The Producers Field Notebook was checked, which records and monitors pests or species and does not include the incidence of new pests.
5_9_criteria: The lists and certificates of the courses held on the farms were presented, providing guidance on the application and monitoring meteorological conditions during application. It was also found that the procedures are implemented and recorded.
5_10_criteria: Neighboring areas have the same production system as evidenced in field visits, however, there are procedures to avoid interference with the production systems of neighboring areas. Guidelines are constantly given to employees, weather conditions are respected and no interference has been identified in neighboring productions and there are green barriers that separate them from neighboring crops.
5_11_criteria: The seeds purchased come from legally known sources.

Name: Bom Jesus Agropecuaria LTDA Fazenda Mirandopolis
1_1_criteria: Applicable legislation is being complied with, evidenced through field visits, documentation evaluation and interviews with employees that labor, environmental, health and safety and agricultural laws are respected in almost their entirety
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: In the Socio-Environmental Assessment, the points analyzed and the proposed control and mitigation actions are laid out, as well as the assessment of its effectiveness.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other involuntary work was found during the audit process in the work environments or heard during interviews with employees in the production units of the group.
2_2_criteria: The registration form, employment contract and payslips for employees at the production unit were available in easy-to-understand language in the HR department for workers to consult.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety information is documented and transmitted to employees during Onboarding or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each role and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations.
2_4_criteria: There is no impediment to freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, thus such as the impediment to their presence in the groups production units, with membership being at the expense of the employee.
2_5_criteria: Salary paid appropriately, with weekly rest, vacations and without undue deductions for employees on the groups farms. The records of working hours per worker are meeting legal requirements.
3_1_criteria: Communication with the community is established, since Grupo Bom Jesus is known in the community and has a website available to everyone, as well as signs available on the outside of the farm, with communication channels.
3_2_criteria: Absence of traditional users of the lands and disputes over the right to use them.
3_3_criteria: Complaints and grievances are constantly verified by the internal team through the ombudsman channel and line of conduct
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised internally and local collaboration programs are being carried out.
4_1_criteria: Socio-environmental assessment was developed by a multidisciplinary team and measures to minimize impacts are defined.
4_2_criteria: There is a Waste Management plan which describes the actions that the property takes in relation to the waste generated
4_3_criteria: The farm controls the fuel spent on production through an electronic system. Soil organic matter monitored and improvement measures implemented.
4_4_criteria: Compliance with the deforestation policy of the standard met by the farm. There was no land conversion after 2009.
4_5_criteria: Environmental areas follow what is established by the Brazilian Forest Code and are described in the CAR.
5_1_criteria: Good agricultural practices are carried out daily, protecting the soil and water from contamination.
5_2_criteria: The areas of interest are being protected in accordance with the Brazilian forest code.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, the use of contour lines and soil analyzes are carried out to improve soil quality and erosion control in the units production units.
5_4_criteria: Registered products are used and applied at the recommended dose, as well as carrying out IPM on the farm.
5_5_criteria: Location storage of products is adequate. Product application record is complete. There are signs indicating the application of products and the re-entry period for recently sprayed areas and the use of fertilizers follows professional recommendations.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found in the units of production. Paraquat is not used.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Agr. Eng. Responsible for the unit.
5_8_criteria: In case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact MAPA and FundaÃ§Ã£o MT.
5_9_criteria: Applications are carried out at the correct distance from populated areas and protection areas.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system as the unit. The minimum distance for application is respected.
5_11_criteria: The origin of the seeds can be through purchase from well-known companies that issue proof of origin and through own production with RENASEM.

Name: Associação Amigos da Terra II 2019
1_1_criteria: Producers demonstrate knowledge of applicable laws and stay up to date through external advice from companies and qualified technical professionals. Compliance with laws was verified on the audited farms, such as, for example, Rural Environmental Registry; health and safety training; employees receive the minimum salary established for the category and enjoy 30 days of paid vacation, among others.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through registrations and lease contracts on all farms audited.
1_3_criteria: The group manager carried out socio-environmental assessments of the farms before they were included in the group, from which improvements to be implemented were identified. Improvements are monitored in annual internal audits.
2_1_criteria: None of the audited farms found signs of forced, imposed, forced, trafficked or involuntary labor. There is no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on farms are not obliged to work on the properties and when they did work, it was verified that they were given an opportunity. There are no children under 15 working on the farms. All hired employees are over 18 years old. Through interviews with employees, it was evident that there is no evidence of discrimination. Verified through payment slips, that there is no salary distinction for operators performing the same functions. When there is a salary difference, it is due to greater experience in the role. Training, benefits and promotion opportunities are provided equally among employees. There is also no evidence of punishment, coercion or aggression of any kind on the audited farms.
2_2_criteria: All employees on the audited farms are registered. The farms have Employment Contracts or notes in the employees CTPS, describing all pertinent information. Workers receive instructions on how to carry out their activities at the time of hiring. The four audited farms have health and safety advice and the contracted company instructs employees on safe work issues, as well as carrying out inspections to verify the implementation of the guidelines.
2_3_criteria: All audited farms have PPRA/PCMSO or PGSSMATR, where health and safety risks are identified, as well as mitigation and control measures. In interviews, workers demonstrated knowledge and understanding of issues related to health and safety. The health of workers is monitored through medical examinations upon admission, periodically and upon dismissal. Dangerous tasks are only carried out by qualified and trained personnel. Farms provide and register Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) for employees. The use of PPE and compliance with safety requirements by workers is supervised by health and safety consultancy companies. Verified that in case of non-compliance, warnings are applied. Farms have procedures in place for accidents and emergencies that are visible to workers. All farms have first aid kits and vehicles available for transportation of any sick or injured workers.
2_4_criteria: In all audited farms, it was verified through interviews that workers are free to join professional associations of their own. choose and participate in collective agreement negotiations. All farms audited follow the 2019/2021 Collective Labor Agreement, signed between the Rural Workers Union of Sorriso and the Rural Union of Sorriso. The majority of employees did not opt for union contributions, due to the lack of action by trade unions, according to reports obtained in interviews.
2_5_criteria: On all farms audited, the wages paid respect the minimum wage established by the Collective Labor Agreement . Verified payment slips demonstrate that only deductions provided for by law or symbolic amounts for meals and housing are applied to farm employee payments. Salaries are paid monthly and payment receipts are filed by the farms. The working day on farms is 44 hours per week, with occasional overtime, especially during harvest times, which does not exceed 12 hours per week. Hours worked are recorded on most audited farms. Only one farm does not record the hours worked and overtime, which led to non-compliance in indicator 2.5.3; 2.5.4; 2.5.5. In interviews, workers on all farms reported that overtime is voluntary. Overtime worked is paid or deducted via time bank. Only on one of the farms audited were there cases of workers taking maternity leave. Employers demonstrate that they are aware of their right to maternity leave. Verified that the residences and accommodation for farm employees are adequate, with energy, septic tank and water. The water used for human consumption is drinkable, and potability analyzes are carried out on all audited farms.
3_1_criteria: Communication channels with farms include telephone, e-mail and suggestion boxes available at headquarters and at the group managers office. The properties have signs at the entrances, informing the telephone numbers of the farms or the group manager. Verified through interviews that the communication channels are known and allow adequate communication between producers and local communities.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes regarding the rights to use the properties lands, as well as there is no evidence of existence of traditional users of the properties lands.
3_3_criteria: The farms have suggestion/complaint boxes at the headquarters and in the group managers office. Any complaints are recorded by the manager in an individual notebook for each member of the group. If complaints are received, they will be analyzed and subsequently dealt with, as provided for in the Group Management Procedures, prepared by the manager. To date, there have been no complaints or complaints received.
3_4_criteria: Verified that job opportunities are filled through referrals from current employees, publicity from Sindicato Rural de Sorriso The group manager collaborates with the training of the population local, promoting lectures, technical visits in the region where the farms are located. In addition, the owners of the audited farms, whenever possible, contribute to festivities at the local church, APAE (Association of Parents and Friends of the Exceptional) of Sorriso or provide the headquarters of the properties for training and field days.
4_1_criteria: The farms have a Socio-Environmental Diagnosis developed by the manager, which is based on national legislation and RTRS Principles.
4_2_criteria: Verified that no fires are carried out on none of the farms audited. Most of the waste is properly disposed of by the farms, however non-conformities were identified in one of the farms audited in indicator 4.2.4, as the farm buries biological waste. Non-compliance was also identified in item 4.2.3 on one of the audited farms, due to the lack of adequate structure to prevent fossil fuel spills and a supply lane with an adequate effluent treatment system.
4_3_criteria: The audited farms record the use of fossil fuels and monitor the organic matter content by carrying out soil analyses. The properties adopt practices that contribute to increasing soil carbon sequestration, such as: adopting direct planting systems, cultivating soil cover species, maintaining native vegetation and planting eucalyptus. All farms have a documented Solid Waste Management Plan, developed by the group manager, detailing all areas and waste generated on the farm, and subsequent destination.
4_4_criteria: In none of the audited farms were recent area openings made , as verified by satellite images comparing the areas in 2008 and 2019. The property maps indicate the native vegetation, production areas and watercourses. From the comparative maps of areas in 2008 and 2019, it is possible to identify that native vegetation has been maintained on all properties. The properties prohibit hunting activities, and there is no extraction of wood or any other native product. All audited farms have above 10% native vegetation.
4_5_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as, for example, use of correctives and fertilizers only in accordance with the technical recommendations; cultivation of species for cover; adoption of the direct planting system; construction of contour lines in slope areas. Analyzes are carried out on all audited farms to monitor water quality. Only one of the audited farms uses irrigation and follows the procedure regarding the application of best practices and compliance with legislation.
5_1_criteria: The property maps indicate native vegetation, production areas and watercourses. From the comparative maps of areas in 2008 and 2019, it is possible to identify that native vegetation has been maintained on all properties. The properties prohibit hunting activities, and no logging is carried out or any other native product. All audited farms have over 10% native vegetation.
5_2_criteria: The farms identify the location of watercourses on maps, as well as the status of riparian vegetation. Verified on site and through farm maps that permanent preservation areas are kept properly isolated and preserved.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality monitoring is carried out through annual analyzes carried out in the laboratory. Soil quality is preserved on all audited farms through the adoption of practices such as the adoption of a direct planting system and the use of fertilizers in accordance with the needs of the area and technical recommendations. In sloped areas, the verified farms build contour lines as a way of minimizing erosion processes. Farms carry out succession of crops. There is no cultivation of soybeans on soybeans, the sanitary void period of the state in which the farms are located is respected.
5_4_criteria: The farms have a MIC Â– Integrated Crop Management plan, prepared by the manager where the use of preventive and control methods that cause less environmental impact. The farm owners demonstrated science in using products classified with lower toxicity and, whenever possible, rotate active ingredients. The document Plan for the Reduction and Use of Phytosanitary Products, prepared by CAT Sorriso at group level, describes the good practices carried out on farms. Non-compliance was identified in indicator 5.4.5 on two of the farms audited, due to the lack of monitoring records for insect pests, diseases, weeds and natural enemies. Verified that the farms only use agrochemicals permitted for soybean cultivation and in the dosages prescribed by those responsible, as evidenced in the deposits and records of agrochemical use.
5_5_criteria: All audited farms record the use of pesticides, however, on the four farms audited, the records do not include all required items such as the names of the dosers/applicators, the identification of the application equipment used, nor the weather conditions during applications, which led to non-conformities in indicator 5.5.1. On all farms, empty packaging is washed at the time of application and delivered to reception centers. Most farms have an empty packaging deposit in compliance, however three farms audited had non-compliance in indicator 5.5.2, due to the deposit not being locked with a padlock and having an opening that allows animals access. One of the farms audited had a non-conformity in indicator 5.5.3, due to the pesticide deposit not having a containment system for possible spills. Another farm audited also had non-compliance in this same item, however, due to the warehouse having openings that allow access to animals. On all audited farms, areas treated with pesticides are demarcated with signposts. Recommendations for the use of corrective agents and fertilizers are made by agronomists.
5_6_criteria: The farms do not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. One of the audited farms still uses Paraquat and does not have any documented plan to gradually reduce its use by 2020, which generated non-conformity in indicator 5.6.2.
5_7_criteria: Not all audited farms use biological control agents, but demonstrate knowledge about their use.
5_8_criteria: If an outbreak of new pests occurs, the audited farms reported that they resort to institutions such as EMBRAPA, APROSOJA-MT, INDEA and the Sindicato Rural DE Sorriso .
5_9_criteria: Measures implemented by farms to prevent drift include monitoring weather conditions during applications, only carrying them out under appropriate conditions, in addition to the use of correctly calibrated spraying equipment, as provided for in the MIC document\ x96 Integrated Crop Management, prepared by the group manager. One of the farms presented non-compliance in item 5.9.2 for not recording the observed climatic conditions.
5_10_criteria: The production systems adopted by the farms are similar to the neighboring systems. There is no history of damage to neighboring areas caused by drift from the audited properties.
5_11_criteria: None of the farms produce their own seeds. They all acquire from legally known sources, as verified in purchase invoices.

Name: Amaggi EU RED 2
1_1_criteria: The groups production and management units demonstrated knowledge of and compliance with the legislation applicable to their activity during the audit.
1_2_criteria: The legal rights to use land are defined and demonstrated in documents such as registrations and deeds.
1_3_criteria: The group manager together with the production units are implementing corrective actions arising from internal audits for continuous improvement, thus showing the companys commitment and evolution in meeting all criteria and indicators of the RTRS standard.
2_1_criteria: No evidence of forced, compulsory, slave labor, trafficking or other involuntary work was found during the audit process in work environments or heard during interviews with employees in the production units of the group.
2_2_criteria: All workers have a contract that specifies their working conditions, as do service providers. Occupational health and safety training is carried out with workers.
2_3_criteria: Health and safety information is documented and transmitted to employees during Onboarding or during training. Protective equipment is provided according to the risk identified for each function and there are available communication channels and means of transport for emergency situations in the groups production units.
2_4_criteria: There is no evidence that prevents workers to have freedom of association and rights to collective bargaining, as well as the impediment of their presence in the groups production units.
2_5_criteria: Salary remuneration records demonstrate that the salaries paid in the company are higher than the national minimum wage, with no salary differences between employees of the same category in the groups production units.
3_1_criteria: The channels allow adequate communication with the communities. Interviews were carried out with farm employees and community representatives, verifying knowledge of the communication channels present. Disclosure occurs internally through integration and murals and externally through signs placed close to roads and highways in the farm guardhouses
3_2_criteria: No traditional land users and disputes were found in the evaluated area. Property ownership documentation such as registration and deed were presented and are in accordance with the legal requirements applicable to the groups production units. Members of indigenous tribes near the Tanguro farm attend the municipal school located within the farm, as well as in interviews with employees. There were also no complaints on the companys communication channels and on specific websites such as Ibama about interference in relation to the topic.
3_3_criteria: Communication channels are available on the internet through "Fale Conosco", telephones with the hotline number (0800-647-0004) and email (comite.etica@amaggi.com.br) and suggestion box for employees.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are open in local cities and through SINE for the production units in scope.
4_1_criteria: A socio-environmental assessment was carried out and shows mitigation and control measures for processes related to soybean production.
4_2_criteria: Adequacy measures to minimize the pollution are being done as reuse and recycling of materials, through selective collection and all hazardous waste in the groups production units.
4_3_criteria: The groups units record fuel according to the agricultural activities carried out, there was no significant increase in consumption. The use of fertilizer is done according to soil analyses, where organic matter is also monitored. Areas of environmental interest are maintained and preserved in the groups production units.
4_4_criteria: There was no agricultural expansion within the farms after 2009, evidenced through satellite images in the groups production units. At the Tanguro farm, an area containing commercial rubber tree plantations was removed.
4_5_criteria: Areas of environmental interest are respected and conserved by the administration of the production units.
5_1_criteria: Monitoring is carried out of groundwater used in agricultural processes and for human consumption, through water analysis, where soil contamination is verified in the groups production units.
5_2_criteria: Permanent Preservation Areas are defined in unit maps of production within the certification scope, there was no evidence that vegetation was removed or altered.
5_3_criteria: Techniques such as direct planting, crop rotation, the use of contour lines and soil analyzes are carried out to improve soil quality and erosion control in the groups production units.
5_4_criteria: Pest monitoring is carried out to determine the application of pesticides, only when necessary, in addition to using direct planting, green manure and crop rotation which are also practices used to reduce pest infestation in the groups production units, through the MIC.
5_5_criteria: Agrochemical applications contain information such as purchased products, applied dose, plots, application dates and weather conditions . The storage, collection and disposal of empty packaging is being carried out at the groups production units.
5_6_criteria: No evidence of the use of agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions was found at the groups production units. There is no evidence of the use of the active ingredient Paraquat in soybean cultivation areas.
5_7_criteria: Applications of biological control agents at an experimental level follow the same as agricultural pesticides, following the Agronomic Technical Recommendations issued for each application by Eng. Agr. Responsible for the unit.
5_8_criteria: Verbally explained that in case of incidences of new pests or invasive species, the company will contact the Mato Grosso Foundation, which is a nationally recognized research institution and partner of the production unit. There are also folders for checking new pests such as pigweed, which if found will be informed to the foundation, as it is a new pest.
5_9_criteria: Atmospheric conditions such as wind, humidity and temperature before application, are recorded in the pesticide application forms in the groups production units.
5_10_criteria: All neighboring areas have the same type of production system in the groups production units.
5_11_criteria: A The origin of the seeds can be through purchase from well-known companies that issue proof of origin and in the groups production units, where the areas have RENASEM.

Name: Amaggi Commodities
1_1_criteria: Producers demonstrate knowledge of applicable laws and stay up to date by relying on external advice from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with laws was verified in most of the farms audited. Only one of the farms presented non-compliance in item 1.1.2 due to the following items: lack of training for pesticide applicator
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through registrations and lease contracts.
1_3_criteria: The group manager carried out socio-environmental assessments of the farms before they were included in the group, from which improvements to be implemented were identified. Improvements are monitored in annual internal audits. Only one of the audited farms presented non-conformities in items 1.3.1, 1.3.2 and 1.3.3, due to the lack of initial socio-environmental assessment.
2_1_criteria: In none of the audited farms is there evidence of forced labor, imposed , forced, trafficked or involuntary. There is no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on farms are not required to work on the properties. There are no children under 15 working on the properties. Through interviews with employees, it was evident that there was no evidence of discrimination of any kind. Verified through employee payment slips, that there is no salary distinction for operators performing the same functions. Training, benefits and promotion opportunities are provided equally among employees. There is also no evidence of punishment, coercion or aggression of any kind on the audited farms.
2_2_criteria: All workers are registered. The farms have Employment Contracts with employees, describing all pertinent information. Workers receive instructions on how to carry out their activities safely at the time of hiring or through integration training.
2_3_criteria: All farms have a PPRA/PCMSO or PGSSMATR, where health and safety risks are identified , as well as measures for mitigation and control. Workers demonstrated in interviews their knowledge and understanding of issues related to health and safety. Workers health is monitored through periodic medical examinations. On most of the farms audited, dangerous tasks are carried out only by qualified and trained personnel, with the exception of one of the farms where the pesticide applicator did not have training to carry out the activity, as determined by NR31. Farms provide PPE to their workers and delivery is recorded by most farms. Only one of the farms audited did not record the supply of PPE, which led to non-compliance in item 2.3.4. The use of PPE and compliance with safety requirements by workers is supervised and in case of non-compliance, Warning Notices are applied. Most farms have procedures in place for accidents and emergencies, and they are visible to workers. However, on one of the audited farms, it was verified through an interview that the procedures to be followed in case of accidents and emergencies are not clearly understood by all workers, which led to non-compliance in indicator 2.3.6. All farms have first aid kits and vehicles available for transportation of any sick or injured workers.
2_4_criteria: On all farms it was verified through interviews that workers are free to join professional associations of their choice and participate in collective agreement negotiations, despite none of the farms audited having collective agreements with unions. Terminations of employment contracts are approved by the unions.
2_5_criteria: On all farms audited, wages paid respect the national minimum wage. Verified payment receipts demonstrate that only deductions provided for by law are applied to farm employee payments, such as INSS and income tax. Salaries are paid by the fifth working day of the month and payment receipts are filed by the farms. The working day on farms is 44 hours per week, with occasional overtime, especially during harvest times, which does not exceed 10 hours per week. The hours worked are recorded on a time card on all farms, however, on one of the audited farms it was found that the hours worked on Sundays and holidays by some workers were not included in the time cards, just as on another farm it was found that overtime were not registered, which led to non-compliance in indicator 2.5.5 on both farms. Workers on all farms reported that overtime is voluntary. On most farms, overtime is paid, but as on one of the farms no records were kept, it was also not possible to verify whether they were paid appropriately, which led to non-compliance in indicator 2.5.6. On one of the farms it was also found that in some periods the cook worked more than six consecutive days without a day of rest, which led to non-compliance in indicator 2.5.6. On none of the farms audited were there any cases of workers taking maternity leave, but employers demonstrate that they are aware of their right to maternity leave. Housing for farm employees is adequate and has adequate sanitary conditions. Access to drinking water is guaranteed by the farms.
3_1_criteria: Communication channels with the farms include telephone, email and suggestion boxes available at their headquarters. The properties have signs at the entrances, informing the telephone numbers of the farms or producers. Verified through interviews that the communication channels are known and allow adequate communication between producers and local communities.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes regarding the rights to use the properties lands, as well as there is no evidence of existence of traditional users of the properties lands.
3_3_criteria: The farms have suggestion/complaint boxes at their headquarters, and any complaints are recorded on a form on most farms. Only on one of the audited farms was it not possible to demonstrate that complaints/complaints would be registered, which led to non-compliance in indicators 3.3.2 and 3.3.3. Also on another farm, the commitment to dealing with any complaints or grievances received in an appropriate and timely manner was not clear, leading to non-compliance in indicator 3.3.3.
3_4_criteria: Employment opportunities on the farms are always offered preferably to the local community, being publicized internally or on the municipalitys SINE. Some of the farms audited provide facilities and machinery for SENAR to carry out training. Only on two of the farms audited is there no collaboration with training programs aimed at the local population, which led to non-conformities in indicator 3.4.2.
4_1_criteria: The farms have a Socio-Environmental Diagnosis developed by the manager. Only one of the audited farms, which was recently included in the group, does not have the diagnosis, which led to non-compliance in items 4.1.1, 4.1.2, 4.1.3, 4.1.4 and 4.1.5.
4_2_criteria: No fires are carried out on any of the audited farms. Most of the waste is properly disposed of by the farms, however non-conformities were identified in two of the farms audited. Non-conformities in item 4.2.2 were identified due to used oil being used to maintain fences on one of the properties; fluorescent lamps are not separated into two properties; batteries are buried alongside common trash on one of the properties. Non-conformities were also identified in item 4.2.4 as the two farms bury non-biological waste on the properties. On one of the farms there is no suitable lane for washing machines, which led to non-compliance in indicator 4.2.3. On another farm, a non-compliance with indicator 4.2.5 was identified as there was no documented Waste Management Plan. All farms have a fuel tank with containment dam, channels and separator boxes. The properties houses have septic tanks.
4_3_criteria: Only one of the audited farms does not record the use of fossil fuels, leading to non-compliance in indicator 4.3.1. All farms monitor the organic matter content by carrying out soil analyses. Properties adopt practices that contribute to increasing soil carbon sequestration, such as: adoption of crop-livestock integration systems, cultivation of soil cover species, direct planting and maintenance of native vegetation.
4_4_criteria: In none of the audited farms were recent area openings made. All were made before 2008, as verified by satellite images comparing the areas in 2008 and 2017.
4_5_criteria: The property maps indicate native vegetation, production areas and watercourses. An Ecosystem and Wildlife Conservation Program is being implemented on all farms. From the comparative maps of areas in 2008 and 2017, it is possible to identify that native vegetation has been maintained on all properties. Properties prohibit hunting activities, and it is not timber or any other native product is extracted. All audited farms have above 10% native vegetation.
5_1_criteria: The farms adopt good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as: use of correctives and fertilizers only in accordance with the technical recommendations; cultivation of species for mulching, such as millet, sunn hemp and brachiaria; adoption of the direct planting system; construction of contour lines in slope areas. In four of the farms audited, no analyzes are carried out to monitor water quality, which led to non-conformities in indicator 5.1.2. None of the farms audited use irrigation.
5_2_criteria: The farms identify on maps the location of watercourses, as well as the status of riparian vegetation. Farms that have degraded APP are implementing a Degraded Area Recovery Plan.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality monitoring is done through visual analyzes and analyzes carried out in the laboratory. Soil quality is preserved through the adoption of practices such as: adoption of the direct planting system; use of fertilizers and correctives in accordance with technical recommendations; cultivation of species for mulching, such as millet and sunn hemp. In sloping areas, farms build contour lines as a way to minimize erosion processes. Farms carry out succession of crops. There is no cultivation of soybeans on soybeans, the sanitary void period of the state in which the farms are located is respected.
5_4_criteria: The farms have a MIC Â– Integrated Crop Management plan, addressing the use of preventive methods and control that cause less environmental impact. Farms provide for the reduction of potentially harmful agrochemicals in a documented plan. Non-conformities were identified in indicator 5.4.5 on four of the farms audited, due to the lack of monitoring records for insect pests, diseases, weeds and natural enemies. The farms only use agrochemicals permitted for soybean cultivation and in the dosages prescribed by the technicians responsible, as evidenced in the deposits and records of agrochemical use.
5_5_criteria: All audited farms record the use of pesticides, however in On two farms the records do not include the names of the dosers/applicators, the identification of the application equipment used, nor the weather conditions during applications, which led to non-conformities in indicator 5.5.1. On all farms, empty packaging is washed at the time of application and delivered to reception centers. Most farms have empty packaging storage in accordance with regulations, closed, locked, fenced with mesh and covered. However, one of the farms did not have a warehouse and the empty packaging was stored in big bags until delivery to the receiving units, which led to non-compliance in indicator 5.5.2. All farms have agrochemical deposits and most are in compliance with standards, covered, closed, locked, signposted, with floors, emergency showers and eyewash stations. However, on one of the farms audited, the deposit does not have channels or a containment box. On the same farm, contaminated PPE is washed in the accommodation laundry by the employees themselves. Both situations led to non-compliance in indicator 5.5.3. On all audited farms, areas treated with pesticides are demarcated with signposts. Recommendations for the use of improvers and fertilizers are made by agronomists based on the results of soil analyses.
5_6_criteria: The farms do not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. Some farms still use Paraquat, but it is already planned to gradually reduce its use by 2020, and it is no longer being purchased.
5_7_criteria: Not all farms use biological control agents, but they demonstrate knowledge about use of the same.
5_8_criteria: If an outbreak of new pests occurs, farms resort to institutions such as EMBRAPA, FAMATO, INDEA and the Rural Union.
5_9_criteria: Measures implemented by farms to prevent drift include monitoring weather conditions during applications, only carrying them out under suitable conditions, in addition to the use of correctly calibrated spraying equipment. Critical areas such as water bodies and residential areas are also observed. One of the farms presented non-compliance in item 5.9.2 for not recording the observed climatic conditions. On another farm, it was found that land applications of pesticides are carried out at distances less than 30 meters from residences, which led to non-conformity in indicator 5.9.5.
5_10_criteria: The production systems adopted by the farms are similar to neighbor systems. None of the farms have sensitive crops close to them, such as organic farming or Non-GMO soybeans. There is no history of damage to neighboring areas caused by drift from the audited properties.
5_11_criteria: None of the farms produce their own seeds. They all acquire from legally known sources, as verified in purchase invoices.

Name: Amaggi Commodities EU RED
1_1_criteria: The producer demonstrated knowledge of applicable laws and remains up to date with external advice from companies and technical professionals. Compliance with the laws was verified.
1_2_criteria: The right to use the land was evidenced through the registrations of the farm areas.
1_3_criteria: The group manager carried out a socio-environmental assessment of the farm before itself be included in the group, and from this the aspects to be improved were identified and deadlines for implementation were defined. Improvements are monitored in annual internal audits.
2_1_criteria: Through interviews with permanent and temporary employees, it was evidenced that there is no evidence of forced, imposed, forced, trafficked or involuntary labor on the farm. Employees reported that they are free to leave the property after hours, as well as terminate the employment relationship if they wish. There is no retention of documents, salaries or employee benefits. Family members of employees who live on the farm are not required to work on the property. There are no children under 15 working on the farm. There is a Minor Apprentice employee in the role of administrative assistant. Through interviews with employees, it was evident that there was no evidence of discrimination of any kind. The company has different levels for the same functions, with each employee placed in a level according to their level of education. There is also a differentiation by length of service. There is no differentiation between workers of the same level or length of service. Training, benefits and promotion opportunities are provided equally among employees. There is also no evidence of punishment, coercion or aggression of any kind.
2_2_criteria: All workers are registered. There is an Employment Contract binding the company to the employees, with all pertinent information, in writing. Employment contracts include all relevant information and, in addition, workers are informed of working conditions at the time of hiring, as verified in interviews with permanent and temporary employees.
2_3_criteria: Workers demonstrated in interviews the knowledge and understanding of issues related to health and safety. Workers health is monitored through periodic medical examinations. There is health and safety training, including specific training on standards NR 6, NR 11, NR 12, NR 20, NR 23, NR 33, NR 35, as well as other training in the area of occupational health and safety and other relevant training. Those responsible for potentially dangerous tasks are properly trained, such as pesticide application, carried out by qualified staff. Health and safety risks are identified and procedures are in place to control them. The Masutti Group has a complete SESMT and has an Occupational Safety Technician and occupational nurse stationed in each unit, and has documentation relevant to occupational health and safety (PGSSTR and LTCAT). The farm provides PPE and the supply is duly recorded using specific forms. The company has a complete and structured SESMT department, with an occupational safety technician and occupational nurse in each unit, responsible for applying and carrying out all surveys relevant to worker safety requirements. The company is implementing the PAE (Emergency Plan) procedure in case of accidents and emergencies. It currently has an Emergency Plan for Responding to Accidents at Work, which is available in announcements at various points on the property. The property has an outpatient clinic, an ambulance and a 24-hour nurse.
2_4_criteria: Through interviews with permanent and temporary employees, it was evidenced that there is complete freedom to join trade union organizations, with some interviewees confirming that they are union members, while others reveal that they did not participate. Terminations of employment contracts are approved by the unions.
2_5_criteria: The minimum remuneration paid on the farm is above the national minimum wage. Verified proof of payment demonstrates that only deductions provided for by law are applied, such as INSS, union contributions and food and health plan deductions, duly agreed between the parties. The working day is 44 hours per week, with occasional overtime, especially during harvest times, which does not exceed 10 hours per week. Hours worked are recorded on a biometric time clock. Workers reported that overtime is voluntary and duly paid, as evidenced by payment slips. Verified through interviews, that workers receive at least one day off for every six days worked. The farm complies with the law in the case of maternity leave. Checked records of a worker on maternity leave at the time of the audit. Housing for farm employees is adequate and has adequate sanitary conditions. Access to drinking water is guaranteed by farms. There are drinking fountains located in several locations. The property has a cafeteria, guided by a nutritionist, serving the 3 main meals of the day to all employees.
3_1_criteria: Sign verified at the entrance to the property containing the telephone contact details. The Masutti Group maintains a page on a social network, as well as having a telephone number available in the regions telephone guides and on the internet. The communication channels are public knowledge.
3_2_criteria: There are no cases of disputes regarding land use rights on the property, as well as there are no adjacent indigenous peoples, nor are there permanent conservation areas, nor schools or any areas of high cultural value close to the farm.
3_3_criteria: There are signs distributed on the property displaying their telephone numbers so that complaints can be made directly. There are also suggestion/complaint boxes in various locations on the property. The farm has the document Procedure for Receiving and Handling Complaints, which determines all procedures in case of receiving complaints. There is also a form to fill out, the Complaint Registration and Handling Form document, which deals with all issues pertinent to complaints and complaints.
3_4_criteria: Job vacancies are advertised through SINE, on the company wall and internal referrals, always looking for workers in the region. The property participates in events and field days. Those responsible participate in lectures and training by the Rural Union, SENAR and companies in the region, as verified in certificates and reports from those responsible. The property purchases products and services from companies in the region.
4_1_criteria: The farm underwent an assessment socio-environmental status before being included in the group. A Socio-Environmental Diagnosis was carried out by AlianÃ§a da Terra, which has qualified personnel for such an assessment. The diagnosis is comprehensive and transparent, considering impacts related to the farm.
4_2_criteria: The propertys waste management is governed by the Fazenda Saudades/PaixÃ£o Waste Management Plan. Used batteries are returned in exchange for new ones. Old tires are separated and later collected on the property. The collection of used lubricating oils is carried out by the company Lwart Lubrificantes. Lamps and batteries are stored in a box provided in the propertys workshop and later collected. The houses have septic tanks. Organic waste is buried in a suitable location. A non-conformity was identified in item 4.2.3 as used lubricating oils are stored in suspended tanks without a containment basin. Despite this, the fuel tanks have a containment dam and a fueling lane with a floor, channels and containment box. The machine washing area has a cement floor, gutters and separation box. Oil changes are carried out in a location with a floor, channels and containment box. Recycling is carried out whenever possible. Plastic waste is collected by the company Amazonekos, as well as cans and drums.
4_3_criteria: The use of fossil fuels is recorded when the machines are filled. No increases in fuel use were recorded in the last harvest. The soil matter content is monitored through soil analysis. Soil carbon is increased through practices such as: maintaining straw as ground cover
4_4_criteria: No area expansion was made, as evidenced by satellite image maps comparing the propertys areas in 2008 and 2017.
4_5_criteria: The property map indicates native vegetation, production areas and watercourses. Annual internal audits are carried out to monitor native vegetation. Verified that the farm is restoring degraded areas. The property prohibits any hunting activity within it. Checked warning signs present in the areas. Extractive practices such as collecting native wood or other natural products are also prohibited. The farm has over 10% native vegetation area.
5_1_criteria: The farm adopts good agricultural practices that prevent damage to water bodies, such as: adopting the direct seeding system; straw management for soil cover; use of correctors and fertilizers in accordance with technical recommendations; maintenance of APP and legal reserve areas. A non-compliance was identified in indicator 5.1.2 as analyzes are not carried out to monitor water quality. The farm does not use irrigation.
5_2_criteria: The farm identifies the location of watercourses on the map, as well as the status of riparian vegetation. The farm has an area of natural vegetation in the process of regeneration and measures are being taken to recover other degraded areas.
5_3_criteria: Soil quality monitoring is done through soil analysis. Soil quality is preserved through the adoption of practices such as: adoption of the direct planting system; maintenance of straw as soil cover; use of fertilizers and correctives in accordance with technical recommendations; maintenance of APP and legal reserve areas. Erosive processes are prevented through the construction of contour lines, adoption of the direct planting system and maintenance of soil cover. The farm carries out succession of crops. There is no cultivation of soybeans on soybeans, the sanitary void period is respected.
5_4_criteria: The farm has a MIC Â– Integrated Crop Management plan, addressing the use of preventive and control methods that cause less environmental impact . The farm envisages the reduction of potentially harmful agrochemicals in a documented plan. The farm only uses agrochemicals permitted for soybean cultivation and in the dosages prescribed by those responsible, as evidenced in the deposits and records of agrochemical use. A non-conformity was identified in indicator 5.4.5 due to no monitoring records of pests, diseases, weeds and natural enemies.
5_5_criteria: The companys planning sector carries out product purchases. Service orders are opened for the application of pesticides by the technical team in accordance with field monitoring, where the product, quantity, dose, area, plot, weather conditions and team responsible for execution are recorded. Empty packaging is washed at the time of application and then stored in the warehouse. The deposit is covered, closed, locked and marked, but it does not have channels or a containment box, which led to non-compliance in indicator 5.5.2. Empty packaging is delivered to a local receiving center. Pesticides are delivered to the farm by the multinationals that sell them. The place for storing pesticides is covered, locked, closed, marked, has aeration and the packaging is arranged on wooden pallets, but there are no channels or containment box, which led to non-conformity in item 5.5.3. There is an area for preparing pesticides, equipped with a small temporary pesticide deposit, flooring and an ozonizer for equipment decontamination. The preparation of syrup is done using specific equipment for this purpose. Next to the pesticide deposit there is an emergency shower. Used PPE is decontaminated in a laundry dedicated to this purpose. Areas treated with pesticides are demarcated with signposts. Recommendations for the use of improvers and fertilizers are made by agronomists based on the results of soil analyses.
5_6_criteria: The farm does not use any agrochemicals listed in the Stockholm and Rotterdam Conventions. The herbicide Paraquat is used, but it is already planned to gradually reduce its use by 2020.
5_7_criteria: Verified that there is knowledge about the use of biological control agents. There is an intention to use biological nematicides and control agents for defoliating pests, but they have not yet been used.
5_8_criteria: If an outbreak of new pests occurs, farms turn to institutions such as INDEA, MAPA or FundaÃ§Ã£o MT.
5_9_criteria: Measures implemented by the farm to prevent drift include adjusting application equipment, monitoring weather conditions during applications, and maintaining zones free from pesticide application. Aerial applications are carried out at least 1,200 meters from homes and bodies of water. Likewise, the closest populations are notified before applications. Land applications of pesticides respect a minimum distance of 150 meters from homes.
5_10_criteria: The production system adopted by farms is similar to neighboring systems. There are no adjacent areas with sensitive crops, such as organic or conventional agriculture. There are no cases of damage caused by drift to neighboring areas originating from the farm.
5_11_criteria: The farm acquires seeds from legally known sources and also produces seeds, both for its own use and for commercialization. Own seed production is duly approved by APROSMAT, as a way of complying with the intellectual properties of such materials.
